reviews.review_text: Very expensive, many lines, they charge for the locker every 40 minutes, I really don't recommend it
I think it's more economical to cut off the express service. In Singapore, where time is money
Enjoy various rides and shows here. Souvenirs here are relatively expensive.
Fun! Prices are expensive and queues are long!
Second time to Universal SG and for the price it is NOT worth the amount paid for the two hour waits for each ride, overpriced merchandise and food so won't be returning.

They don't tell you, that the initial price for a whole day is 76 SGE, but it makes no sense at all, because if you are there the first time, you'll get at most 2 attraction whole day. Bery crowdy and you cannot buy the express ticket separately afterwards, so you have to wait at least 90 mins for an attraction, which you dont know if it is worth it. The ticket with express pass is a must and costs 119 SGD. We bought 4 tickets for 300 SGD and was worth nothing because we managed 2 attractions and one stunt show. We were exhausted by the hot and humid weather, lot of people and this was the worst invested money here in Singapore.
Overrated. If you've not been to a universal ever then go, or else save your money and skip this place.
Food is too expensive. You should try to ride sci parts and mummy that's all and take a picture all parts of universal studio
Admission is too expensive
Its nice to see and have fun, but there are a lot of people on holidays, but the prices are a bit high.
Pretty good but the meal are very expensive..
Fun amusement park but very expensive.
Fun rides, but overprice drinks and snacks, as usual.
nice place for a day out but a bit expensive for 1 day pass
The place is very beautiful, and the ticket price per person is approximately 70 Singapore dollars. There are also some live shows. I recommend it to families.
Outdated theme park, waste of time. Singapore is just a boring city
Just expensive and not exiting enough for the money paid.
I advise everyone visiting Singapore to go to universal studios ... the only problem the ticket is quite expensive!
Not worth the ticket price, So crowded
But very Expensive entry tickets
It's small. The price is as expected from Singapore. Everything is expensive. The inside is ok. I guess people come here because there isn't much to see in Singapore itself.
Nice place, but expensive, not enough time to play all the games, wee took 2h for rola Costa:-( And didn't play the other games. But we enjoyed the place were very nice.
Good day out but everything is so expensive!
Food was bit expensive otherwise the rides and experience was amazing :)
Expensive, very expensive. To visit it once is fine.

a great one time experience. even if u r solo travelller there are many people from universal studio who Will help u click photos. its 76 dollar sgd per person in whoch u have 5 sgd dollar coupon for food
Love this place, but expensive , but i loved to came again
Very nice place for entertainment and for spending time with family . It is expensive but and time consuming but awesome
Merch is overpriced but, still an amazing experience
Fantastic place to visit, but very very costly
There is no attraction, there is no loss if you dont go!

The entrance fee is about 45,000 won per person if purchased in advance through Korean social media. However, same-day express costs 120 shingles per person. We almost have to budget 40-50 for the two of us. It was early October and it was so hot that I was dying, so not only was I sweating, but the smell of other people's sweat on the safety bars of the ride was painful. There's nothing really fun about the ride, but it's fun to watch and see the characters. But the price you have to pay for that much fun is too much.
Not the most wild experience. As expected at the expensive end.

Amazing place but hold onto your wallets 13spd for 2 waters 4 dollars for a locker they dont mention any of this beforehand The restaurant food was awful and very expensive we ate in far far away and we wish we had been hahaha But some good rides much of the rest were for very young children big groups of tourists who dont like queueing pushing and jostling so we had better days
I always thought Universal Studios was huge, but it turns out it doesnt take long to go around it. Fast pass tickets are very expensive and not really worth it.

Solid theme park. Not amazing by US standards, and relatively expensive, but considering there is nothing similar anywhere even remotely close (HK is the closest place with something better), it is a very good option.
Ok... but a lot of gift shops
It was nice but too expensive entrance fee.
The ticket price is higher if you go early in the morning.
Interesting place. Need food variety and more toilets. Take cash if you want to buy street food.

Went for Halloween Horror Nights event here. Amazing atmosphere, very entertaining attractions. Have really good and thrilling rollercoasters here which I enjoy very much. Only downside about this place is the prices for its food and drinks are quite expensive.

It's really exciting even though the entry ticket is expensive, hehe. It's really fun. Yes, if you just want to be iconic, you can take photos at Universal Studio outside for free and snack on the best popcorn in the world for only 4 dollars. Haha
Very good place..not so costly compare to the location and fun..so many fun rides. Good food..cable car..And many more...
Great rides. Food and parking are expensive though

A very impressive entertainment venue. The roller coaster is challenging, the animations are good. The place is well maintained, there are lots of free drinking water taps, there are several halal restaurants inside Universal Studios. There is a place of worship too. but in my opinion it is too expensive for Indonesian citizens to enjoy entertainment like that by paying - one million, it's not worth it.
Not a lot of rides, extra we paid to jump cubes not worth it
Small in comparison to others. Too expensive to pay for so little being offered
Interesting attractions for children, overpriced fast foods...
Plenty of thrills, but food options are too expensive. Drinking fountains are available throughout, so that's a plus.
Good for,people who want to spend a quite a huge dollars just to see some action happening in front of them
A pretty good entertainment venue in Singapore. Can be used for children and adults. Entrance fee is around IDR 700 thousand. If you come here you have to play all day
Very nice place with good things to do. Expect to spend at least 100 singa dlar.
Love all the rides there and the food even though they are a bit on the pricier side. Overall great experience.

There are many other interesting locations in this place, for example the Hollywood Walk of Fame (you definitely know this one, right?), then there is also a miniature New York city where the sky changes like the real city of Now York, isn't that great? In terms of price, Universal Studio Singapore entrance tickets are actually quite affordable, around USG 68, but there are often promotions, especially when approaching long holidays.

We went to USS for the Halloween Horror Nights and it was simply splendid! I really loved the attractions and it was really an experience. Still, the queues were really long and the food and drinks were really pricey. Due to the amount of people there, it was really hot and stuffy and we didn't manage to go to all the haunted houses. The place was also pretty dark and hard to see. Still, I loved the haunted house itself and NAFA 3D students designed the sets good job I loved it!!!
Whenever you are in Singapore, don't spare it.It's a worthy deal

Way too expensive. I've been to Disney in Florida and it's better organised for waiting time for rides. Food selection is awful some of us actually eat healthy food but this is not catered for here. 35 dollars for a photo is extortion drop your prices and more people will purchase them.

It's not a shame to pay so much to come here with my husband. The experience will not be replaced, because there is nothing like this in my city. Ha ha ha. Huhuhu I want to go to the USS again, bro. It takes about 6-8 hours to spend here until satisfied.

At that time I went to Singapore and my grandmother also forced me to regret it, but at that time I went to USS, it was a really nice place, I stayed at the Festival Hotel, so if I wanted to go to Universal Studios, Singapore, it was close but the fare was expensive.
Very hot and crowded, food very expensive inside
Very nice place, but u cannot carry outside food . Inside food is too expensive and is not good especially near Egypt hotel name Oasis spice is worst.
Good place but too expensive. Could have stuff for lower prices
Many fun and interesting rides but the ticket might just be a bit too expensive. But there are many things to eat around the theme park.

The park is much simpler than the same park in California. However, the prices in this park are quite high. 76 Singapore dollars per adult (56usd). But to enter with such a ticket is tantamount to throwing away money. It is simply necessary to take a Fast Pass to visit the attractions without queuing, which costs another 80 spd (60usd). Otherwise, you will stand in line for an hour in the heat for each attraction, even if it is a weekday. It is advisable to be light, because you cannot even take your phone with you to many attractions. In some places there are free storage lockers for a short time, but many are paid. Food and souvenirs are much more expensive than in other places. But this place is certainly very beautiful and worth a visit.

A fun place to spend money, filled with many rides that can make you spend money without realizing it because it makes your adrenaline and emotions torn apart by temporary hallucinations that will produce feelings of regret when it all ends. A place that makes a large contribution to Singapore's tax income so it has abundant finances. By coming here you will get valuable experience about how nice it would be to have more money. Therefore, work harder so you can feel like you are rich here.
Loads of fun and thrill rides but food is a little on the expensive side.
Awesome value for money adventure must visit

This is a very good place to play. The entrance fee is about SGD 60-80 for students. There are also discounts. You can also choose to buy half-year tickets. It is suitable for babies who often come to play. If you like roller coasters, I highly recommend you to play. However, it is not as exciting as foreign ones. The excitement level is also four stars. Different festivals will also have different decorations.

If you are traveling to Singapore, it wouldn't be complete if you didn't visit Universal Studios, where the rides are very complete and of international class. With an entrance ticket price of IDR 750,000/person, you can enjoy all the rides for free.
Make sure you sneak in foods, the place amazing, but foods and drinks are very costly

Worth the money paid. However food is very expenses well like any other theme park! Thank god to the multiple entry we were able gwt in as soon as it opens , take a break to the hotel for daughters nap then go back till it close..upon closing there was fireworks show . BEAUTIFUL !

Completely rip off place for kids. They charged full prize according to age but my son just turned 4 and is a little short for his age so most of the rides he was not permitted . At least I think to be fair, kids who are smaller than their age should have concession.
For those who have been to the one in Orlando, it feels like its not worth it... a lot of things are repeated and everything is old and outdated.
Way over crowed ... over an hour for most rides... food inside is also the biggest price gouge ever... drinks or water starts at 5 dollars
Food and drink are too expensive

Keren tapi ngantrinya bisa 60 menit an di setiap wahana, dont forget to bring umbrella, so hot, avoid dehydration and buy too expensive price of mineral water per 500 ml is about 4 dollar SG, it means about 45rb rupiahs.. Hahahaha
It's pretty and good, but the food isn't very good and it's expensive.
Interesting Christmas decor but things can get a little pricey inside

Very nice place. Prices are rather high meeting the average price level of Singapore. There is a lot to see and many possibilities to spend your time there. You can get there either by foot or by shuttle train.
Good rides, expensive food.

food is really overpriced and birds flew into the restaurants which is really unhygienic. they even stole people's food. toilet cleanliness was average. nonetheless, all of the rides were pretty fun. might visit it more if there were more rides. would recommend it.

Nice park with very good rides. Full day fun at this park. Cons are the price which is highly lverpriced at SGD 78 for 1 day in which the crowd won't let you enjoy all the rides. The waiting is too much for each ride.
Better to try on the weekdays, so you can enjoy all the games. On the weekend you should take a deep breath for 120mnt for queque
Everything is available here, the important thing is that your wallet has to be strong hahaha
Try to visit early, on weekdays and don't forget to drink plenty of water, a bit pricey though!

Went with my 4 year old daughter. She loved the 3 large roller coasters. Not much else to do in way of rides for older kids. No drops or rides like dream works in Australia to excite him! He did enjoy the climbing wall. Lines were long 2 hour wait for Jurassic Park rapids so didnt bother. Canopy flyer also long and broke down. If you dont have long in Singapore dont bother too many other great things to do . Expensive for so few rides they have also very hot. We wished we had done the water park instead. We had just been to Waterbom in Bali and enjoyed this way more than universal studios
Overrated only rides and high cost. Also, need proper display of info on cost and other things.
Bad costumer service. Offensively expensive. Would not come back
Not for adults gift shops only sold plastic rubbish at a high price. Rides were slow
Outdated. Needs investment
Entry is around 750 dollars

The modern rides are very exciting and fun. Some rides have long queues. It is recommended to add extra money to buy express tickets for better value in playing the attractions. The weather is a bit hot. Food prices, if calculated in Thai currency, are quite high.
Good rides but a day is not enough to cover all for the price you pay

Very expensive. I think it is Good for children as there are only a couple of Scary Roller coaster Rides the rest of the attractions are mostly for children in 76 Singapore I think it is very expensive. Bangkok's Siam Park City is better I think With more and better Scary Rides and also there are a lot of attractions for children and tickets are only 30US I think.

It's expensive, but it's worth enjoying because there are high-quality attractions. However, the price is quite expensive during Lunar New Year or public holidays. None of the rides are too scary, and I think even people who aren't good at rides can ride them.

The entrance price is a little high, but the attractions are well done and it is pleasant to walk around the various areas. Many areas are covered to protect themselves from the rains which are sometimes frequent.
all most spent out evert penny in my pocket and its really worth to visit even you only have one day in Singapore

There is no point of reviewing universal studios its an amazing place to visit and a most attractive place for tourists. You can find so many rides and so many theatres to have fun and enjoy and on special festivals they arrange theme and its really amazing. The ticket price for one time visit is 78 SGD and for yearly pass for students it is 88 SGD and I think 98 SGD for normal people. I would recommend you to buy tickets from klook app you will get better deals there then normal price.
The most happening place in the whole Singapore Make sure to have alot of time and money when you are visiting this place but it is worth spending the splurge
Ha ha Come to relax and vent Although the cost is high, it is worth playing for a whole day
There are a lot of games and show. The place is very cool. Took a lot of picture there, every corner is very instagram-worthy.
Terrible commercialism.
Costly place...
Not very interesting, tickets are overpriced
If it said a 20 minute wait, it was usually 40 minutes, and everything was very expensive
Must visit. Plan to spend a full day here. Locker charges are on higher side.

Not great. Over priced. There are only 2,3 good rides. Rest are over hyped ones. One tip for who wants to visit dolphin park too is, try visiting universal early in the morning. And take a break for 2hrs from 1-3 when it is hotter and visit dolphin park which is in sentosa too. You can come back again to universal and spend time till 9pm.
Place ok good for half or a day trip. Beverages n Food too costly even at their Food Court

1. Its small, but theres a lot to enjoy 2. Express unconditional additional purchase 3. It may seem expensive, but it is actually quite reasonable once you enjoy everything. 4. I recommend going early. If you go when there are a lot of people, it's already hot, but it gets even hotter.
Bit expensive for a tourist.
Such a amaging place to visit lifetume good experience but a bit expensive.
Awesome experience! Enjoyed each and everything with my partner there! Its just that products and food are very costly but the rides and other activities are great and enjoyable!
This is definitely the most worthwhile attraction in Singapore. You can buy a ticket on Taobao for 300 RMB. Whether you are Hong Kong, Macao, Taiwan, Japan or Korean, you can use 300 RMB.

A very famous playground in Singapore. The entrance ticket is quite expensive but it is comparable to the facilities and rides that can be enjoyed while here. The prices of food and drinks there are quite expensive. But... It's also called a tourist spot... For those who like taking photos... You really have to take photos at every corner here. Because it's really Instagrammable. Oh yes, because the place is quite spacious, it's better to wear comfortable shoes, comfortable clothes and don't bring big bags. Because it's a hassle.
Expensive food, expensive food, recommend buying outside to eat.
Everything is expensive. Stay home better
Too much money for too little. Too crowded, too hot, too much of waiting. USS should stop overselling or change fee structure.
No bad..but ticket price abit higher..more to improve
Too expensive .. too many people .. not a great quality of rides.. shows were amazing..

It is an amusement park mainly for small and medium-sized children. Only a few thrilling attractions but really little to sink your teeth into. The prices of drinks and dishes are excessive compared to the cost of living there. Free water fountain. Some cool photos and two or three interesting attractions, Shrek 4D for example...
Mainstream tourist attractions in Singapore. Many tourist attractions are quite expensive. The place is clean and tidy.
Good rides but so crowded in some rides even though it's not a public holiday. All of the food and drinks are very expensive
We had a good day out here, long way from Johor but subway was cheap. Nice and clean, very expensive as you'd expect
Having so much fun. Too bad it's a little bit pricey for such limited rides. And the locker is not free.
The best place in Singapore. If you miss this...you missed a big deal in life. Its big..its value for money...and it's tons and tons of fun overloaded

Of course, you shouldn't expect the same dimensions as in Orlando or Los Angeles, for example, but in my opinion the Universal Studios in Singapore are definitely worth a visit. The park is beautifully designed and extremely clean. The prices seem high at first glance, but you should not forget that the price level is simply high throughout Singapore. Either you accept that or you stop vacationing in Singapore.

This place is really cool It's not in vain to pay almost a million hahaha Especially the transformer!!! huwaahhh try if mummy is also like a transformer with animation, there will definitely be more people queuing ahahahaha

Sorry for giving wrong ratings. Cause there is no option for giving more than 5 stars. Am i capable to review this magnificent place? I can't just write a review. If you really want to learn about this place, go get your tickets man. But one thing is, food is not allowed and everything is very costly inside. So make sure to bring some good cash with you. Bon voyage
the entrance ticket uses an MRT of 4 SGD, has extensive land to play as much as possible with challenging vehicles
worst part about this place 1. It's dam hot. 2. Staff is very rude 3. Everything inside is dam expensive. Not suggested for kids below 5 Yr
Awsome place to visit, many places to see with kids if you have kids ? But food overpriced and not that great to eat
Over crowded and over priced
Expensive with not a ton of attractions. Everything had an extremely long wait, so we rode very few rides. Wouldn't recommend it.

Universal studios is not that much good as compared with cost. I think there are much better places than Universal studios. It's just Amusement park with some rollercoaster rides and few shows. I felt, I just a wasted my money.

Good place for fun, decent souvenirs. Prices for FB is not worth it. If you want proper drink prices, look for some drinks at VivoCity mall (use the monorail from the nearest station an get off at harbourfront) instead.

The place is nice, cool, the entry price for tickets is in rupiah, around a hundred thousand, I suggest if you want to go to Sentosa Island, take the train, the ride from Vivo City Mall costs 2 - 4 and you can get it by way of return. So that's basically good.
It's too big. English was difficult.
Located at sentosa, you need to pay 4 SGD to take the monorail
Love the place. Lots of food and you can take beautiful photos without having to go inside. If we want to go there we have to use the train, last Saturday we paid 4. Like. Look at the candy trees...

It was awesome. One of the best theme parks in Asia. All the rides were so thrilling especially Revenge of the mummy and the Human cyclone. The water world show was nice. But we could not cover all the attractions coz there was a long queue for the attractions. One day will not be enough for visiting all attractions. Better go during weekdays it will be some what free. Price details are .80 for an adult. There is locker facilities inside the park which cost around .10. If u visit singapore this a must visit place with your family and kids.
This is a wonderful place for my family last week. But you will waste time if you join with treasure hunter show
A world of fun stuffs. Very clean. Food is quite expensive.
This is a very complete and classy game vehicle. The entrance ticket price is quite expensive...
Very costly. Firstly one has to pay for the entry fee depending upon the facilities one would like to avail and then pay an amount of 79 for Universal Studios.
Expensive food. Hard to find good food. Better eat outside first in vivo before going in
If you're going to go here, be sure to buy an express ticket. Don't save your money. There are a lot of fun things to do.

The shop has a very limited selection of HK merchaniu, and it was extremely repetitive. I'm sure some are only available in the shop due to the crossover nature of the designs (e.g. HK in mummy costume), but it has very limited appeal.
Money flow . Huhuhu
Good place to visit, a little expensive tough.
If you come to Santosa Island because of this, well... the scale is vague, but more than anything, it's so hot that you can't enjoy it properly.
Quite beautiful, big aquarium but a bit expensive, 2 adults and 1 child cost 198 USD. As for the casino, you have to bring a lot of money to enter
The experience was just epic. But the tickets are a bit costly(75 singapurian dollar per head)
The rides are suitable for all ages. But the food and drinks there are expensive.
Awesome place.. too gud.. great experience
Had a great time there. But the rides in Ferrari world is much more thrilling and Ramoji Filmcity is much more amazing and whose price is much lower than Universal.
This place was owesome n amazing,very crowded coz so many people from different countries.Make sure u have enough time so you can spend whole day in this place.buy ticket thru online is much cheaper.

Many fun activities for kids and adults, feeling excited and nervous with strong outdoor game or relaxing in fairy castle with indoors activities. I buy entrance tickets on baynhe.com website, about 60sgd ( dont remember excactly :D), its cheaper than buying directly at entrance gate. you should spend 1 dqy to explore full of games.
Great and expensive place to stay
Fund day out. Watch out for the overpriced food *duh*
Very expensive and crowded not worth .... Kids Games
,,,,,Very unfriendly check in person!!!!!

Check weather before come as if it rains all could be ruined. So croweded even in weekdays and many delays while in the queue due to technical issues (many many technical difficulties during the adventures and stuck in middle of the journey and your valuable time will be wasted soz they might need to renavate equipments). As a result you might had to pay locker charges. Food and selling items are very expensive even a polithin rain coat cost SGD 5. Vegitarion meal is over SGD 15. Express entry price also much more higher and it is even costly than the entrance ticket. Its better to book ticket from your hotel (bit cheap: SGD 71). Better only bring your ticket and some cash to spend to avoid paying a big amount for lockers if you stuck in a queue. Also, no need of water bottles as water dispensers are everywhere. Other than than these issues most of the activities are mind blowing.
There's nothing very attractive for adults except few rides and two water shows. Not worth the ticket price 79 sgd.
It's quite okay but can hardly say that it's great. A lot of people as in all the amusement parks. But the price is too high for what you get.
I find the entrance price quite expensive for such a small park. The attractions are nice, the scenery incredible but the tour is empty. Not enough thrill rides
Just a universal theme and nothing more The size and facilities are smaller than Seoul Land... It's so hot that the drinks cost a lot.
Nice view. We paid 60 for the whole trip. It wasnt very expensive but we had waited for a long line before we played the games
The rides are amazing, but the prices are quite expensive
The best entertaiment for family, food and drink so expensive but very taste. I love here
A good place for a family vacation, the ticket price is IDR 800 thousand, there are lots of games. There is halal food, there is a place for prayer
LOVED IT!! Especially the galactica battle star rides. The only fault is the prices, very expensive
Extortionate prices 2 hour waiting times for rides ( and this was off--peak) unable to buy "express" pass waste of money. Total disappointment unless you want to spend the day in long queues.

absolute rip off! not worth a cent! not recommended!! Way too many people and the attractions are nothing special! So if you don't want to be jostled by 1000 people to go through normally and wait more than 60 minutes for each train, this is the wrong place for you! You can visit this place with children, but even then it's just not worth the money! I'm super disappointed and I really regret spending my money on something so pointless!!! There is simply nothing worth seeing here!

Awful experience for the whole family! Very expensive and only has rides which we have to queue for at least an hour to go on them. All you get are shops which have expensive things. Regret going at all!
Google does not have no star if they did will give that, worst customer service, money hungry and self centered people. Would recommend go to one when you are in Japan or USA
Overpriced. Long Q
Pretty fun theme park. however, in my honest opinion it wasn't really worth the price
Nice place for tourists to go hangout in average budget.

It was really good few years ago but now, it's better to stay outside the USS area rather than paying so expensive for something which is not so entertaining. You better go to Batu,east java - indonesia... You can find something better with much much cheaper
Good park but expensive
Good experience on rides and shows. The only thing that i don't like is the food price. 17-23 for a single portion is too expensive for most.
Wonderful place... The best area for singapore..!! Price sky rocket.
I wss amazed at how many people/tourists are visiting every day. plenty of attractions and shops around. the place is somehow expensive but worth it

I thought the visit was very good and fun, I loved the sreeck area, and the Waterworld show, there are no words to describe it!! Actors play their part every day. Perhaps what I liked least was the prices of food and souvenirs, but that's the norm! Still go and have fun!!

Small and reasonably spacious. It's quite crowded, but it's small so I think it's more fun for families with children than in Japan. The water show is like being abroad, and getting drenched without hesitation is more fun than I expected! If you don't have a raincoat, you'll be soaked! Kappas are sold within Jurassic World for 5. There are no checks on food and drinks brought in. Just make sure to bring plenty of water. I think it cost about 3 to 4 dollars to buy. The characters will come out for photo shoots at set times, so check the brochure for the day and you'll be sure to get a pair photo.
nice place . it take 4 sgd to use mrt to go. but it's free to come back
Need a full Upgrading and painting. Wgole place looked unhygienic and filthy now. Need a coat of painting. Surely they can close and refurbished the place. Compared to charges they do.
Poor on the room prayer/religion facility.....
Expensive, only for tourists
Don't have high expectations and visit us.
Only the picture is ok, ticket is definitely too expensive at over 100 dollars.
Clean, bright, Malayan food is delicious, but relatively expensive!
The entrance fee is really extraordinary.
The place is full of fun. But no outside foods. Foods & drinks is expensive inside. Bring urs water bottle, can refill drinking water inside
it wAS AMAZING. BUT PRICE IS JUST WAY TOO HIGH. FOOD IS ALSO VERY COSTLY IN THERE.
Nice place but they ask you to pay every thing, like drying you, or lookers.

This place is really busy. Lucky to be able to visit this place.. Lots of beautiful photo spot areas... Hunting for culinary delights here is satisfying, there are many kinds, but the prices are for the upper middle class...

I love coming here, this is my 6th time here. I love all the games and will defi. Come again. Parking for full day at 28sgd max. Find east side parking sport blue colour, and near to escalator for entrance. The ticker i bought online so expensive eventho it it promo and not worth wothout meal voucher and retail voucher for max 35sgd. Please consider a value package to visitors, especially malaysia tourists. If you bought online, please print at home separately paper in order for cashier to scan and keep the voucher.
It's fun if you go with VIP strings. Skip everything and get first place with characters I also take solo photos. About 230,000 won per person
Expensive place worth it visiting family fun

We paid a ticket to spend all whole day and it was so crowded that we use just 4 attractions. We went to spend our last day in singapore and it was disappointed. Quality and price do not seem to go togheter...
Ripoff. High entry cost and then have to pay for rides. Disgusting

Lets have a conscience about Horror Nights. Its a waste to do it separately. It's a waste, it's impossible to say Last year in Japan, there was a zombie parade. There is nothing to say other than that this is just open at night.

Don't waste your money! Paid extra for the fast pass unlimited and still had to wait in massive lines. Took us half an hour to get through the gate even though we paid 430.Told the staff about how dissapointed we were and that nothing was organised only for us to get a 10 food voucher!!! Been to both universal America and honestly can say it is way better.Save your money and go there.

Very expensive. Long wait times. Unnecessarily loud. Need to put your bags in lockers to ride some rides, which cost more money. This is one Giant money pit where they keep coming up with new ways to steal your money.

This is why my couple came to Singapore haha. It was fun, but less fun than Osaka Universal. We even paid over 130,000 won for an express ticket, so I don't think it was worth that much. And there are no restaurants that cater to Koreans.
The price still high tho

This place is amazing the employees are super friendly and the rides are amazing. Theres are multiple rides and there are multiple zones. There is a kid zone which all the cartoon are and there are the other zones where all the intense and fun rides are. The food is delicious and fun to eat, but the food there is way to overpriced and they should lower it down. Overall great place for vacation

Tourist attractions that are delicious, good, modern and fun for children, teenagers, adults and families, gathering with various nations in the world are here... the prices for food and drinks are really expensive (see photos), perhaps because there are no international class tourist attractions, each vehicle is equipped with free lockers, but there are also those who charge 4 for white water rafting. The queue is long for regular tickets, if you want a quick one, use the express one (more MHL).. The weather when I arrived was scorching hot (September).. My suggestion is that the manager should provide a canopy route and a water mist fan, so that visitors don't get too hot when walking from one ride to another, the tickets are cheap..

I had a stay there for 2 days at Sofie tel and they had a complimentary fish spa! They had a pool that is so deep but don't worry! They have a not so deep area too! The hotel bed is so comfortable you will sleep on it within 1 minute!
Love this place. But food expensive.
A complete amusement park in Singapore, even though the rides feel expensive, feels satisfying

Worst universal studios ever. They have a lot to learn of the studios in LA and Orlando. Don't spend your money here you just gona be disappointed on the bad quality. Budget park not at all the standards you aspect from unirversal.

Universal studios, Singapore is a theme park ,located on Sentosa Island, featuring amazing rides, shows and attractions like Jurassic park, Fairy tale world. It's an amazing experience amd you will be totally in a different world. It costs about 80 dollar (Appox. Rs.4000) per head.

The entrance fee for the size of the park is completely overpriced. The waiting times were at least 2 hours. If you want to go on a train you have to put your luggage, money, cell phone and lighter in a locker, which you can use for free for 2 hours, but then you have to add money. In other words, you can't open the spinner afterwards because you don't have any money with you! Everything else in the park's shops is also completely overpriced. Conclusion the park is absolutely not recommended.

I do not recommend going here. For over 80 per person you will get hour-long queues that will drive you crazy, especially if you are with children. The fans are only there for show, more than half of them do not work and therefore it is hot and stuffy. Everything is not just expensive, I think you cant find more expensive anywhere in the world. The rides are not from the last century, but even from the century before last, and after standing in line for an hour or more, it can close for an unknown reason because it is broken. There is only fast food, and the most expensive in the world, no choice, only chicken and incomprehensible potato balls. Everything is spicy, unacceptable for Europeans. I do not even consider local food like noodles. In 6 hours spent on this Sentosa we visited only 2 rides, and as I said earlier we left one because it was broken. Money wasted. Basically, after buying tickets you just end up in a bunch of shops selling stuffed toys made in China. There are probably more of these shops here than cafes and rides combined.
Overpriced food; not enough sheltered areas when it rains, and not enough sheltered walkways to get from point A to point B without getting drenched. rides are not "hardcore" enough.

Extremely disappointed after visiting Universal Studios Singapore. Extremely overpriced and with so little to do and see inside. And so very hot with no shelter from the direct sunlight and almost nowhere to buy cold drinks/beer or any restaurants/bars with aircon. Also many closed restaurants etc which seem to be open and when you try to enter the doors are closed without any closed signs so you have walked to the entrance in the heat for nothing. Why not put up signs to inform everyone that the restaurant/attraction is closed?... Big dissapointment for the whole family and a total waste of both time and money. Will not recommend to anyone and definitely not visit again!

Great park with beautiful scenery and attractions for the whole family. The only downside is the late opening at the park: 10 a.m. In one day we only visited 4 attractions so there was a wait of over an hour and a half. The price is 80 Singapore dollars per person. So at 4.. extremely expensive.
Fun place and value for the ticket. Need whole day to explore all.

Beautiful place for some extraordinary experience! Loved the activities and the shows. The 3D, 4D and 7D shows were extraordinary. All the shows in general were good. But Transformers, Minions, Shrek were indeed some of the best. Food and drinks were good. However, things were a little expensive.

For the Transformers project, I queued for an hour and then the facility broke down and I had to go out to play other projects. The park only apologized verbally but did not compensate tourists for their sunk time cost! For the other three roller coasters, you have to rent lockers to store all your belongings before you can ride them. The price is SGD 4 per hour, which is a gangster charge! Other projects are either not fun at first glance, or they have to wait in a long line to enter and find that they are not fun at all...the food is also expensive and tastes terrible! Among the tourist attractions in Singapore, Universal Studios is the one with the lowest value for money and the worst experience; compared to famous amusement parks in other countries, it also ranks last! I am really disappointed and angry before I rate this. I hope it can be improved in the future, but I will never come again!

Theme park is too over rated in terms of price. It was highly crowdy and they should limit the number of customers to a capacity that they can manage. The waiting time for each ride was above 50 mins. Even though we reached the theme park in the morning, we were hardly able to cover 5-6 rides. Such a waste of money. Vegeterian food is not easily available. I have visited at least 5-6 other theme parks. Other national and international theme parks are much more value for money.
Expensive for people living in Singapore who want to visit regular, especially for 2 adults and 3 kids...

The Transformers and Ancient Egyptians attraction are nice. It is possible to go out for lunch and re-enter the park.

Worth a visit. Thank God we weren't there in high season, so we got through the attractions relatively quickly. The park is not too big and the price is expensive enough at around 50 euros per person, which is why it only gets 4 stars.

Very disappointing visiting Universal Singapore. Would not recommend even if you want to waste your money. The majority of attractions were closed. Shocking customer care! I have asked on numerous occasions for our refund. Please dont waste your money a complete fraud!!!!

Seems like a great resort but unfortunately we never had the opportunity to find out for ourselves. We were there for all of 5 minutes before my sister fell off a poorly marked curb and broke her arm. We had bought 6 tickets and vouchers for a combined cost of approximately 600. This ruined both our day and also our New Years Eve. A compassionate organisation would offer us return tickets at the very least. Unfortunately Universal Studios have not done so. They made a few bucks that day Im sure, so showing us some compassion and offering return tickets at the very least would not be too much to ask no? Unless they really are a heartless, unempathetic, corporate conglomerate? Avoid if you can, there are less artificial family days out in Singapore

While everything is so expensive here, you get a decent experience riding the attractions. Long queue may happen in some of the parks most anticipated attractions like battlestar galactica and lost worlds. Before arriving at the park, make sure youve planned what attractions you wanted the most since its almost impossible to ride all the attractions. At peak attendance, most of the people can only ride 4-5 popular attractions. Or you might buy the express ticket which is also expensive. Singapore is so hot and humid, make sure you bring umbrella and apply sunscreen to your face/body.

Very crowded if it's on the weekend and it's still July - tourist month. The price is also relatively similar to Ba Na Hill. If you come to Singapore, you should go. Choose to go out during the week to avoid crowds.

I went on a weekday and there were so many people. Exticket is required. It wasn't large so it was nice to walk around. If only it were wider... If you are going to take pictures at the globe, there is no admission fee. There is a globe before entering.
The best massage in johor bahru, the technique really good and the price also cheap Staff very friendly, they really feel the muscles that need to be rejuvenated!!! Enjoy!!!

Magnificent, in one word... You should definitely go. It deserves the money you pay. It's better to go on a weekday, it gets very crowded on the weekend, we went on a weekday and repeated all the activities many times.

It sucks. All the food and drinks are so expensive. You pay 130 for a standard ticket and you can only ride 1-2 rides after waiting 4 hrs or so. It is a total ripoff and it is humiliating to singapore. It is so overrated and you should never once come here. You can go to adventure cove or something but please don't waste so much money to come here. I wanted to give 0 stars but I don't have a choice

the most disappointing experience for this park. Amazing prices for very few attractions: 16 attractions including 2 closed!! (220 SGD for 3 and 230 SGD for 1 attraction pass). it borders on theft or even scamming visitors. As if that wasn't enough, they charge you the lockers 4 SGD (1 hour) to be able to access certain attractions. Finally, and this is probably the worst, they sell so many Passes that the line is almost as long as the one without a pass. We are used to doing parks around the world (France, USA, Canada, Spain, Germany, etc...), this is the first time that we feel cheated. To flee !! (Park made on August 14, 2023).

Too overrated with those kind of entertainment, kids under 4 years can ride just a very few entertainments, the staffs had a bad behavior, and with that price that was not a worth experience. Definitely won't come back and won't recommend to anyone.

I'm thrilled to share a fantastic review of the 2023 Halloween Horror Night, now in its 11th year! This spine-tingling event features five haunted houses, each with its own unique theme. From the chilling "Weekend" with a clubbing vibe to the haunting "All of Us Dead" inspired by Netflix, and even a school-themed experience, there's something else for everyone to explore. In addition to the haunted houses, there are three scare zones that provide perfect opportunities for video capture. Explore the eerie Hindu and Chinese themes, and discover the mysterious XXX theme as shown in my video. For the regular admission (peak times), it's 89 dollar per person. But for an unforgettable experience, consider the Halloween Horror Night RIP Tour at 349 dollar per person. This VIP package includes fine dining, express access to all haunted houses and facilities, even the rollercoaster with unlimited rides! Moreover, you'll get the 6D photos printed during a private meet and greet with the selected ghosts, and a tour guide will accompany you for 3 hours, explaining all the chilling themes. With the RIP tour, you won't miss any haunted house, and you'll finish early, making it well worth it. I've already attended for 2 years! This year's Halloween Horror Night deserves a solid 4.5/5 rating. Don't miss this thrilling event it's a scream!

Spending 6 hours at Universal Studios in Singapore was an interesting experience. If you purchase the Express Pass for over 7 million VND, you wont need to wait in lines everywhere. However, if you opt for regular tickets, be prepared to queue for each ride, which can take anywhere from 20 to 50 minutes, sometimes even with 100 people ahead of you! The term rides here doesnt necessarily mean actual games; it often refers to attractions where you sit and enjoy the experience. Universal Studios offers various themed areas, including NYC, Transformers, Ancient Egypt, Jurassic Park, and Far Far Away (soon to have a Minion land). However, there arent too many games. If you visit, prioritize the Jurassic Park ride (remember to bring a raincoat from homeit costs 10,000 VNDbecause the 6 SGD per person fee here will leave you as wet as a soaked mouse! ). Next, try the Transformer ride (it felt so real that it made my heart skip a beat). Theres also an impressive show that recreates an action scene from JAWS, directed by Steven Spielberg. Its fantastic, although experiencing 2-3 scenes instead of just 1 would be even more satisfying! For younger visitors, the other attractions are more relaxed. Universal Studios has several roller coasters, but unfortunately, my digestion and heart arent up to the task, so I couldnt review them. Overall, the 1.4 million VND per person price tag for an experience comparable to what youd find in the United States didnt leave me completely satisfied. Id rate it a 7 out of 10. Heres hoping for a Disneyland visit someday to add to my reviews!

The plate of curry in the food court nearby was probably flavored with cinnamon or star anise, but it was quite strong and not to my liking. Also, the person organizing the queue only spoke in Chinese, so I couldn't understand anything. Overall it was fun, so it's worth going at least once.

All theme parks have an air that someone else is in control of your wallet, but this one feels particularly Iike you're being fleeced. It's overpriced for the number and length of the rides and impossible to enjoy without the express pass. The rides themselves are mostly entertaining, but extremely short. The park was also quite well managed with enthusiastic staff to help at every turn. Speaking of the express pass. We purchased ours in advance expecting to be able to take all rides using it. Unfortunately, the freshly opened Minions section of the park required yet another upgraded express pass on arrival. Looking at the attractions in that section, we decided we'd spent enough at this park. In addition to that, transport to the island is completely inadequate for the number of visitors. Given the cost of any of the attractions, I don't expect to be shoved into a two-car monorail and covered in the sweat of others before I even arrive. This needs a serious upgrade. Take a quick look at the Disney parks in Hong Kong or Tokyo for inspiration. The rides to those parks are comfortable and inspire you to have fun with its decor. This one just feels like it's squeezing your wallet open by packing you into the train. On a final note, the food was some of the best we've had at a theme park. Typically parks like these serve scraps at best, but it was actual restaurant food here. Well done on that!

If you're already staying at Sentosa Resort or want to play in the casino or waterpark, take the cable car as well and not go anywhere. It's worth it because it's so wide that you don't know how to walk.

Universal Studios is an absolutely massive theme park, bursting with movie magic and fun for everyone. Oned day just wont cut it if you want to experience all the attractions and activities it has to offer. Prepare your wallet to spent on movie merchandise, snacks, drinks and fan stuff.

The parks atmosphere is immersive, with movie-like decorations, stunning effects, and live shows such as WaterWorld, which delivers exciting action. There are plenty of food options and souvenirs, though prices can be quite high.

We came all way here from New York to Singapore. Universal is known for its great rollercoasters and amazing entertainment. Unfortunately, Universal Singapore doesn't have enough rides or even shows to be entertained. There were a few rides out of comision which didn't help the lack of rides. That said, we did enjoy ourselves, but we wanted for more. We paid for express plus tickets at entry. Do not waste your time or money. We did not feel that it was worth it. The park was too short, and lines were short, and we found that we didn't really save time by getting in the express line.
Nothing much, it did not meet our expectations. The fee is expensive

How many are there now... but this is only a photo of the universal ball it's more exciting x qta going to universal...it's really hot We took a Grabcar here...it's cheaper than the hotel...so now it's really hard to find a place to eat there

Some of the rides were fantabulous especially Transformers, meet and greet sessions were real life experiences where small kids enjoyed it along with the adults. Every corner is filled with enormous joy and overwhelming experience which can be easily covered within a days time. You need to really eat well or might carry food before entering into the different zones of Universal Studio as food cost is on a higher end. Souvenirs, toys and other essentials are also expensive. Reaching Universal studio using Sentosa express is easier than a cable car, however if you would like to experience the cable car it is up to your budget.
Beautiful place to go but its so expensive. But its worth it.

Big joke and no value for money whatsoever. Bought an express pass for two adults and 1 child and spent 680 SGD. At least three rides were down for maintenance, two did not take the express pass. Never again.

Personally I do not think this is worth the money if you are visiting singapore especially if you have been to other universal studios this one falls flat on quality and size. The price is quite inflated and there are continuous costs. For instance I was told I should put my backpack in a locker so I paid 35 dollars outside the park to put my bag away and just kept a small cross body bag for my wallet. Then when you try and go on certian rides you thin need to buy a locked in the park for your smaller item and suddenly one ride is costing you 15 so you can store your bag for it. So if your alone this is an expensive day of storing your items and if your with people expect one person to sit out and wait with your bags The food as all theme parks go was of course over priced. But this is a pretty well known fact so always eat before and bring snacks. The size of the park is quite small compared to others and the majority of the rides were more or less 4d so your just sitting in a cart rattling with screens around you more than anything really. I do not recommend buying tickets at the gate as I found them through tour companies much cheaper

Just before closing, all shops will no longer accept credit cards and only accept cash... It was my last day in Singapore, so I was very disappointed that I didn't have any cash on hand and couldn't buy any souvenirs.
very expensive and there is not much rides
The price for a ticket is no longer practical
Singapore's highlights and landmarks, lots of tourists .. Food is quite expensive here

I mean, it was a little expensive, but I guess that's something you need to factor in when going to a destination that's dense with tourists. The rides made me feel like i was a child again. Until my back was in serious pain, that is. All on all. A good way to spend a day out
Long Queue Expensive Souvenirs Expensive Foods But Daughter Happy ...
Attraction getting aged need changes ! Need fresh attraction & uplifting to bring vibes back ! Over Priced !
Lots to see and do, for a hefty price SG98. (April 2025).

A city rich in definition, I was surprised that it could be in Singapore and not covered because it is free, and to be honest, it is much smaller than Universal America, and there are no studios that have how to shoot films and cinematic tricks. But if you pass through Singapore, the ticket costs 82 Singapore dollars for adults, and I recommend the Express, even if the games are not many!

many high-end brands! the environment & architecture around also very goodd! they often had events during christmas, newyear, & other holidays they also had the iconic singapore ice-cream-bread, but u must early to get flavour u want bc it's get rlly viral on social media

80 dollars worst spent in history. Read 10 minutes of queuing and it's an hour, eternal queues everywhere, a queue skipper that costs more than the ticket, 4 clouds and all the outdoor rides close. Worst value for money in history
Worst place for vegetarian, not much options to eat , you could get icecreams or juices but overpriced. They didn't allow outside food , they want kids to starve?
It's a waste of money to go there
Don't think it's worth spending money on this.
I did not personally feel that this is worth the money that we are paying. Maybe, because the rides that I've been back in India are better and cheaper
Good for people who love fictional characters and rides.. not worth the price yet!
Full one day need to spend other wise you can miss a lot .
Not comfortable in many ways
Lots of amazing rides and attractions. The price was 85 Singapore currency, and its unlimited rides.
My family had an amazing time at USS. Not very crowded on a weekday. The food was quite pricey though
Felt its over hyped and 5000 inr is bit to high for this stuff. Transformer and jurassic park are definitely superb. Key call out, prayer hall in universal studio is a very good thing.

Not many rides but we knew that going in. Amazing shopping, albeit overpriced. But that's to be expected. Minion land was fantastic and where we spent a majority of our time. Staff were amazing, so friendly and helpful.

Great attractions but worst service and management ever. We two families were in line for a photo shoot with the transformers. The first family did a shot first, but when they saw we talking to each other, they claimed we were in the same group and refused to let the second family take a shot and the staff were super rude. We have been to Disneyland and Universal studios in many places and this was the largest disappointment! We used to have an annual pass with express. Will not renew it anymore.

I really wouldn't come back and wouldn't recommend this. It's one of the smallest theme parks I've visited. And because of that, queues tend to be quite long. In addition some rides were closed. It's ridiculous when one theme areas only have one or two roller coaster ride(s) and one of them is not working. My daughter spent an hour in a queue, only to be told, when she almost got to the end of it, that the ride was closed. They could at least give her and others in the same position a fast track for other rides. But no compensation for the lost hour. Hated it. Not recommended. Avoid it.
Unacceptable themes park
An hour of wait time for almost every ride, everything looks cool but unless you have the 90 express ticket, not worth it.

The rides are too prone to malfunction, much worse than Universal Studios Hollywood, with three people lining up for almost an hour before two were declared out of order. But the Water World show is also very good

Good place for experience how a fantasy movie made. Must try zurasic park but need to prepare rain coast because it costs 5/1 item inside. Actually you may get wet but not much so if you dont mind, no need to wear rain coast.

When purchasing an electronic ticket, you can enter directly by showing your ticket, leaving a lot of time to wait in line. There will be a lot of people on holidays, and you will have to wait a long time in line for facilities. If there is a facility failure, it will be repaired quickly. It is recommended to enter the park early as there will be fewer people.

USS provides a very unique and immersive experience IF you're ok with waiting in a massive queue for close to 2 hours( yes that was the waiting time for the Jurrasic river cruise-and this was on a Monday ) for a 5-10 minute ride. Highly recommend the Transformers Evacuation 4D ride and the Water World show which is an impressive display of action sequences and pyrotechnics.

Place to visit if you are a lover of Universal pictures, large amusement park, well-maintained film scenarios. Lots of restaurants and shops related to the various films. There is often a long queue for the various attractions, you may find yourself waiting up to 30 minutes in line for a 5/10 minute ride, but fortunately at the start of each route the waiting time is estimated and written down, so the choice is yours whether to do it or not. Clean and well-kept place.

Very disappointing day today at Universal. Queued for 'The Mummy' for over 40 minutes only for it to develop a technical fault. We had the option to stay in line but they couldn't provide a timescale for the fix. We tried to go back later in the day but we heard an announcement from outside that there was a 'short delay due to a fault'. That was the same message we heard repeatedly in the morning which had turned into an extended delay. We tried 'Battlestar Galactica' but that was closed for the entire day due another fault. As a result the queues for the other major rides where in excess of 2 hours each. As a family we decided to try the queues as 'single riders', where available, in the hope of getting on quicker. For the Transformer 3D ride we were warned that we'd have to wait 30 minutes. It ended up being 55 minuted. As a result we only went on about 5-6 rides all day. I felt robbed given how much we'd paid to get in. It's easy to identify ways that this park could shorten the queues. An extra member of staff on each ride would make the changeover a lot quicker. Also on the drink stalls, my wife queued for 15 minutes to get a slush because there was 1 person taking the money and preparing the drinks. If one person sorted the payment and a 2nd person prepared the drinks the queues would be a fraction of the size. It annoys me that these places charge the earth and provide such poor service.

Was extremely disappointed. Small park with few rides. Except for the Waterworld Show, the attractions are absolutely nothing special. Extremely long lines and waiting times that could be observed. Luckily we were spared this thanks to the Express Pass. For me it was a wasted day that could have been spent much better in this great city of Singapore.

Very bad ... 80-90 min waiting for each main ride, no problem, but at 2 main rola coaster, we stood in line so long , and then due to some technical problem, they cancelled rides ... and when it stated working we stood again for same inline for 80-90 min ... problems happens , but then they shd have handed over have priority tickets to come again after some time to save time .... we spend 288 -- only tickets--- travelling, food extra , so almost 350- 400 and in whole day we were able to take only 2 rides .... one before lunch and one after lunch... bcos lunch also had 30 min que ... what a waste of money and time Dubai IMG is the best
Too crowded. Bad food. Very expensive. No single line to expedite the use of attractions. Express pass unaffordable. Crazy experience

Very small for a Universal park; only five main attractions, and two of them were closed, which was a huge letdown. This left the line for each of the remaining rides pushing past two hours each. Staff are not genuine and unhelpful. When asking which way an attraction is, staff pointed out over there, check the sign board instead of simply pointing which direction it would be in. Luckily, there are other things to do and see on Sentosa island, such as the cable car ride.

Rides are excellent but length of time for queueing is unacceptable. People have to pay double the price to go on all rides which is fine if you have the means to do it. But most people don't. Some of the staff are also quite rude which is why I have only given a 3 star rating. It also needs better cooling facilities outside as it is very hot around the park. Invest in better water cooling fans (see Medina as an exemplar)

Usual Universal theme park only not as big and not as crowded, staff were a bit tight on the ground , one comedy show we were ushered into a large room and given intro before been directed into much smaller doors for main event, this was dangerous as there was a rush in and small kids or elderly were just pushed in the rush to go in..not well thought out here maybe more staff would help here. Overall I would come back though purely as its not as manic as Universal in the USA.
Lines are pretty long and rides are pretty mediocre. Atmosphere is nice though
The theme Park is quite affordable. Do not visit the park during the school holidays and on the weekends as there's many people and the Q-ing time for the rides were quite long.

There are a lot of people on weekdays, so you have to wait a long time to get on the ride. The scale is smaller than I thought. The Transformers ride was good, but the Jurassic Park ride was not as crowded as I thought. Cyon Roller Coast is really scary. I had a very unpleasant experience while riding the Cyon Roller Coast because it broke down in the middle and I couldn't get off for 30 minutes.

This is definitely my must have place during off-peak season. Queues might be crazy especially for Transformers and roller coasters. I find the closing time to be very early. But if you manage to get there on Chinese New Year season they will extend operation hours till 9-10. My favorite ride are Cylon and Mummy, absolutely love it!
Fantastic theme park in Singapore, super crowd in the weekend. I have to wait 3 hour just for The Lost World.
Amazing rides. Try avoiding peak hours to avoid standing in lines. We had to wait at a line for over 3-4 hours, but the ride was super fun.

Truly amazing. Be patient in exploring all of the studios as each of them are designed to awe you with shows and truly informative narrations. Queues are everywhere but is generally quick so be patient coz mostof the really nice ones will be easily identified with long queues, but well worth it. Exploring the place could really kick-up an appetite but dont worry, food and drinks is everywhere. Well worth the visit.

It was awesome experience in Aug 2018 in Universal studio Singapore. Transformer ride , Jurasic park ride , shreak 4d , Mummy ride was one of the best attraction I found. Just wanted to share some suggestions for improvement. Universal studio Singapore should have some app which will give you continuous updates on waiting time of rides. Also should have sitting arrangements for elderly people in attraction which have usually long queue.

Huge crowds and the waiting time for rides was mentioned to be 70 minutes, or 150 minutes or 200 minutes. That was just ridiculous, so we left soon. Felt it was a waste, I wouldn't have gone had I known about waiting times.
Too overpriced and too long queuing...up to 80 minutes for one attraction
Too much tiring... U will unnecessarily waste a lot time just by standing in queues. For a less than 2 min ride I ended up Waite for 2 hours...
Few thrilling rides. Unfriendly staff.
Food and drinks are a complete ripoff! Way too crowded you waste soo much time waiting for a ride like 45 min each. We just gave up and walked away after about 3 rides.

Average park average rides. Paying for the brand more so than the rides and park. Think 3 rides were not working. Otherwise it's an alright experience. Moreso for kids and families opposed to thrill seekers.
Disable friendly, the game is OK, the tickets are not bad
A nice attraction for tourists overall. However it might get too crowded leading to extensive queues.
nice theme park but queuing too long
Good but not the best theme park in Asia and Australia.
Inspite of the long wait lines, Universal Studios Singapore is worth it. Needs one complete day to enjoy it. More than one day to enjoy everything. Great fun for all ages
Awesome, I was especially impressed by the show Water World and Transformers 4D. The main disadvantage is the huge queues(

it is indeed a perfect place to be entertained! the crews and the performers are all adorable while entertaining thier guests in everyway. i would recommend my friends to visit and experience the best entertainment place in asia : ussg! thank you for the amazing experience!

You can't go wrong with this theme park. Been here in Universal Studios Singapore twice already and still can't get enough. Rides are fantastic. The only downside in our experience is the long queue. As this is a quite popular attraction expect to see lots of visitors. Got my ticket thru Klook so it's a bit cheaper than the normal price.

My first time in one of the large studio parks. It was really good and a must for film lovers. We were pretty lucky as there are fewer people there at the end of the season. We never had to wait in line for more than 30 minutes and only once for Jurassic World and Transformers. Perfect for a DAY and really well built.
Lots of rides, staff are nice, the worse thing about this place is the line. The lines are absolutely ridiculous, without a skip the line pass, you are looking at an hour a ride.

Went to the Jurassic rapids adventure. After a long wait, just when we finally got onto the raft, we were told that there was some kind of malfunction and we had to get off. The staff there were not very helpful, we were simply told either you wait (they weren't able to tell you for how long) or you leave. We ended up waiting for 30 more minutes
Not worth the money, not much attractions, long waiting times.
Dont go to Legoland, it sucks!

Too much waiting time... Wasted most of our time in the queue.. Please buy express tickets in advance so that you do not have to waste your time in the queue.. place is awesome... Well thought off in accordance with the theme but not well planned to accommodate so many people..

Because it was a rainy day, there was less of a line than when I went before. It was well divided by theme, so there was a variety of things to see, but it may feel a bit disappointing for those who want extreme rides. Smoking areas/drinking fountains/restrooms are a bit worn out here and there, but there were no inconveniences in using them. On days when the weather is nice, it seems to be physically and mentally beneficial to buy an express ticket. Unlike in Korea, there is a mindset that if you pay a premium price, you will naturally receive preferential treatment. The taste of the restaurants here and there was average, and the facilities were also so-so. I think it's a place worth visiting at least once when you visit Singapore.

It is an interesting place with rides and shows. However it pales in comparison to Disneyland Paris. The lines for each of these rides seemed to take forever and I had to miss the most exciting ones because the lines never seem to end for these. It was really hot and sweaty in July. I think it would be a good idea to have sunshades near the rides. I did not find anything exceptional or unique here. Children would probably enjoy the stunt shows and the rides. Anyway it would be worth a visit when you are in Singapore especially if you have children.
Typical theme park. Expensive and long queues.

Most of the rides are enjoyable but waiting times are 30mins on average. So you don't have a chance to cover all attractions in a day. Instead of going for all the rides, select a few important ones and stand in their queues only. Revenge of the mummy and Transformers rides are very very good. Shrek 4d show is most enjoyed by kids.
Fun rides but the queues are insanely long

It jus an awesome.... Must visit place... Jus wow rides It has a theme park adventure place Wonderful attraction of Singapore I had a great time there... If you are planning to go there jus remember that cover all the themes as much as possible And most important their closing time is not fixed so plz be alert of the closing timings So that u can enjoy each and every moment thoroughly....

AMAZING STAFF!! The fright night was soo good!! I was in a wheelchair and all the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. They brought us to the front of every queue and helped me through every haunted house and ride. I had the best night here whilst in Bangkok ALL THANKS TO THE AMAZING STAFF!!!

What a great experience with park. lot of funny and dangerous rides have. if you are planing to go to this place, please visit very early in the morning weekday. if you go weekends, there are lot of crowds and you have to waiting 1 or 2 hours in the ques. foods prices are little bit expensive and don't forget to bring a water bottle. it is also very expensive in the park. when you booked tickets via online, please print a copy of booking conformation. it is easy to check in to park.
The rides were awesome the best ones have to be the transformers and the Egyptian one. But next time i really have to buy the fast tracking one since the queues are massive
Best Theme Park in Singapore you can find many attraction and fountain here also the place have many facility and so big.

I never had such disappointing experience in a theme park like universal studios Singapore. the attraction was good. but what destroyed all these was the WAIT TIME. To WAIT 90 to 120 minutes just for 2 minutes of fun is nonsense. The management should have crowd control and STOP issuing/selling tickets when the park is running full house. not to mention your rides closes at 6pm Sharp. there is simply not enough time to try it all. BTW, Halloween Nights 2018 was a REAL nightmare. The queue was scarier than anything else. thanks USS for the scary experience !

Please avoid the park as this is pure waste of your hard earned money...every ride takes more than hour...it sucks standing in que for hours before you take ride. I would rather suggest to save your money going to better places...even the ride are pathetic. Total disappointment... if possible I would have given -5
Overcrowded place. If you want to spend all day in hour queues to get to poor rides and pay money for that, come here.

We are still waiting for TRANSFORMERS show for last two and half house - from 10. 45 am. They only announce LITTLE delay but don't mention how long it will take. This is not first time as my friend also had same issues few days back. We just had 2 rides so far and entire studio needs to be covered in barely 4 hours only. They deliberately do it so that tourists don't get time to complete the entire studies. Hence spend Amount again to revisit Very cheap mentality. Not worth giving any ratings.
Mechanical failure, stuck inside for 15 minutes, only got a ticket for fast pass to the next ride, very poor travel experience.
Expect queues! Its Good to get season tickets but not so much annual passes as you'll get tired after three visits.

The experience is obviously amazing, but certain things are there that they can improve like the huge queues for rides which take up all the time! And if you are closing earlier than usual time for any reason, please compensate for that.

It closes too early for my liking. Take the weather into account when visiting because some attractions are closed due to rain. If you want to enjoy the most extreme, start your visit on the right and go around completely. If you go with children I recommend the opposite direction. Shrek's castle attraction is bad. In general it is a good place to have fun during the day. Well connected and with different restaurants and souvenir shops to buy. The locker service seems expensive when paid, the free rental service for at least 45 minutes is an excellent idea. I do not recommend the Express pass, as it is rarely necessary since the place is small and there are not many people.
A universal amusement park, but this one is a bit small. Just half a day to walk around. The queue was long and long as usual.
It was a good place and there were lots of fun things to do but inn some rides the queue was long.The best thing to do in Universal Studios was the waterworld show and Si fi city.
The best ride is Transformers 3D. The queue was the longest of all the rides but the experience was amazing

Such a great day of thrilling roller coasters and great shows with a must visit place on Sentosa Island. Highly recommend the fast pass option for the additional price to avoid the long ques for the more popular rides. Some rides had over 70 minute wait times and with the fast past we were in within 5-10mins. Plenty of food places and not to over priced. Lots of great rides for kids as well in the Madagascar, shrek and Sesame Street zones.

I love the theme ride in this place, specially the transformer ride. Make sure you go early in the morning and cover the rids first since those get crowded quickly, and there is a water show at around 4 pm, don't miss that it's an interactive experience.
Superb place. Enjoy the Rides, roller-coaster and various shows. Special Water world, Transformers, Mummy, Donky Show etc.
First time going there. Fun and all awesome. Recommend going during off peak season so you can enjoy shorter lines waiting for the rides.

Most pathetic park ever seen. I do appreciate the rides and the ambience but the staff is just lathargic very slow. Person spends around 75 SGD and then he gets a wait time of minimun 60 min to 85 min per ride. So irrespective of what u r offering but you have to wait so long for each ride. Most pathetic experience and lack of management. Staff or crew at each ride is just slowest in the world. I will never visit the place again
Poor management of immediate problems In the case of broken equipment, long queues, and lockers
Poor service rendered by staff at the snack store near waterworld and jurrasic park. Poor attitude and still want challenge me. Very arrogant attitude and not the right place for him to work there.
tremendous waiting times, inefficient handling ! As long this does not change we can definetely not recommend to spend time and money there.

Universal studios without express pass is cumbersome. Staying in line is a waste of time. Do not buy candies from there, they are expensive. Toys are also expensive but it's upto you. Can't buy same toys from anywhere what in Singapore outside universal studios
Long waiting for rides. Overall is ok.
It's a bit small park. Not many rides. I liked the The mummy revenge and transformer ride a lot. The New York section is boring.
A decent, medium-sized amusement park. Bring an umbrella Express tickets are required.
Rides are good but too much crowd....need to buy an Express ticket during holidays
Decent experience. I have now visited Universal Studios for the fifth time. It is a good place to visit once or twice, but it is time the Universal guys start adding more rides and thrills.
Awesome thrilling rides and long long queue for each ride :(
Boxing day was a crazy day for amusement park attendees. Lots of people with 60mins in queue. Best time to go is weekdays on Tuesday and Wednesday. Keep it up. Good work.

A really fun theme park in , though the tickets cost me an arm and a leg that last time I went there. I adore the adorable and funny Minions! I also like Sesame Street! Had the best time of my life at this thrilling theme park! Would highly recommend you to go here if you are willing to fork oit the money to pay for the costly admission tickets!
Awesome place with lots of cool attractions. Worth spending a full day there, and better to prioritize things since there could be long queues specially in weekends and school holidays.
Super excellent place for amusement and food. Clean. Elderly persons should enquire first about the ride inclusions as speed, jerks etc may be unsustainable to them.

To be honest, I'm a little disappointed. It feels a bit worse than Japan. There are not many small hardware facilities in the park and there is no excitement. There are quite a few kindergarten-level ones. There are really no facilities that should impress me. I don't think the service attitude is very good. Although many of them can communicate in Chinese, they don't smile much and their answers are not very patient. I also feel that the staff's adaptability (or work attitude) is not up to par. I queued for nearly 90 minutes for Transformers and when I got there (about 10 people left in front), I had already seen the car. At this time, the facility actually broke down (sorry)! The announcement kept saying that they didn't know when it would be repaired, so I had to wait for nearly 30 minutes. During this period, a bunch of impatient customers kept trying to leave from the back, but the staff on the scene didn't know where to go, causing the scene to be chaotic. This made people have a bad impression and really needs to be improved.

Worst Universal Studios ever The queue is marked with 5 points or 15 points The actual queue was over 1 hour Then add the locker fee Standard fraud group There is a huge difference compared to the United States and Japan.
Queues too long and got food poisoning

: . . . ! ! : There were so many Indian men taking the photos and videos of me n my friends. So crazy.. Even a man with his family did the same thing, so you had better be careful. Although I explained the situation and asked a help to the employees of the universial studio who were working close to us, they just ignored and did nothing after listening to what we said. The men kept laughing and talking to us. Too horrible experience to be happened in the amusement park. Absolutely an illegal violence but the universial studio staffs just threw our last hope. So thankkkk you

It's no Disneyland. Perhaps other Universals globally may be better. Food overpriced as expected; staff fall into one of 2 categories - upbeat and happy to see you or have an extremely apathetic attitude, no in between; shows are hit or miss (as are rides); gift store staff are rude.

Sure the rides are mostly fun but unsurprisingly, its extremely crowded with some ride queues lasting up to an hour. The toilets were decent and food at the retro americas restaurant were just ok relative to price. I really like the transformers ride and my sisters and parents really enjoyed the mummy one. But seriously if not for the queues you will be able to finish the place in less than half a day.

The park didnt impress me, its small, there are no spacious roads and paths, crowds of people, an hour-long wait and few attractions, I liked 3 attractions - Transformers, Roller Coaster, Egypt. Maybe because I compare it with Discoveryland Dalian.
