We went to USS expecting to spend a whole day there but in the end we left after a few hours. There are certainly a number of decent rides and queues do form early straight after park opening. However, the heat is a real factor. You get a bit unenthusiastic after awhile for joining long queues. Maybe locals can handle it better. Individual mileage will differ for overseas visitors. You can purchase an express pass once inside the park to skip queues but on the day of our visit, it was S70 extra which was only a little less than the normal park admission. You really have to want to ride those rides multiple times to justify that amount of money. Word of advice, queue up for transformer ASAP. You can also re-enter the park multiple times (just get a stamp) so you can go out, get lunch at the gentrified hawker centre and then go back in. The park feels smaller than the one in LA or is it just more compact?
It's a good tourist spot. Need lot of time to cover everything peacefully. One full day wasn't sufficient as waiting time for various rides itself consumes so much time.

The park is small compared to other universal studios. The park itself is clean and staff are friendly. The lineup is not bad on a weekday and the average wait is about 20-30 min per ride (weekday) for us.

The best place in Singapore. I bought the season pass twice. Will never get tired of the rides even though the queues for the rides are crazy. But the foods inside the attraction is a rip off so I recommend to go out to get some grub and come back in. And their Halloween horror nights are the boom too. It's another level. Totally awesome.

Great. Attraction have proper care and facilities like the washroom is very accessible. It would be great if the management team assign or create a pickup point to ease the people who book grab and knows where to wait.

Had such an amazing experience. Mummy and Transformers rides were awesome. For rides, you will have to wait in a line for 40 to 90 mins. But it's worth waiting. All the rides are unique and have some story to tell. Meet and greet is great too. Get yourself a map when you enter. Also, 2-day pass will be great. Covering everything in 1 day is not possible :)

This is the best place to go in Singapore. Keep a complete day for Universal Studios and start early to reach by 10 AM. The rides are amazing and the place is just wonderful, like it's being Alice in wonderland. Good food options available and huge crowd. Normally, most of the rides have a wait time of 30 mins, but that should not deter the spirits. Have a great time.
Great place and great fun, feels like wonderland. Better to go on a week day to skip the amazingly Long queues
worst amusement park in the world. shows are good as other universal studios. ineffiecient operation and rude and insincere staffs. mad at making money and not consider to make this better.

Very poorly managed system. Tourists pay 79/day for their precious time, yet the waiting times are around 40-70 minutes for attractions. Despite this high daily rate, day visitors are not given priority service (annual unlimited pass is around 150). The attitude is "You're here for one day. Who cares about you. You won't come here again anyway."

The experience would be successful if you didn't have to wait 60 to 80 minutes for the major attractions (which are rather very successful)! Time difficult to explain when seeing the waiting space occupied at 20-30% or even less!!! Time worsened by the extreme nonchalance of the staff who take their time and poorly manage the express line which annoys even more (or how to exasperate 99% of customers who have not opted for an Express Pass at a prohibitive price of 90-120 dollars! ) . Here too the commercial policy is more than doubtful and ineffective. As if by miracle, the addition of car in the roller coasters reduces the waiting time, but very late in the day! It is therefore either incompetence or deliberate will. In both cases this makes the experience execrable. The lockers are free for a period that depends on the waiting time for each attraction and that's the good news. In the end, a nice and successful park but ruined by particularly incompetent operating and sales staff!

They should only allow a certain amout of people to enter the park. The lines were too long. Regular lines had a 2 hour wait, even the express line had a 40 minute wait. The tranformer ride wasn't working and it cost between 100 to 140 singapore dollars for an express pass. It's daylight robbery.
Too many people and the waiting time is quite long. Not suitable for children as well. Disappointing.
Lines are long, but the wait isn't that bad. The staff are efficient. And the rides are great.

It's no different from Dufan in Jakarta, the rides on offer are almost the same, only the Mummi ride is a bit interesting, because the statue is quite big, I think the big statue at the front and inside that is hanging should not fall or break and it could be dangerous for the visitors, regards K3

It's hard to give a relative evaluation since I haven't been to other Universal Studios, but I enjoyed my visit. I entered at 1 o'clock and it looks like I've ridden almost all of the attractions recommended by many people. Even though it was Saturday, I waited 15 minutes for Transformer, which I boarded around 6 o'clock, and 35 minutes for Mummy. Of course, there were some rides in the beginning where you had to wait an hour to get on them. It seems like most people had a fun time waiting.

Love the theme park but i wish there would be more staff available. There were some chinese tourists cutting the line and the staff do nothing about it because they were too busy to take care of the line. The toilet smell bad with tons of tourists visiting the theme park. Also, when we purchased the express card for all the rides, the staff actually gave us the single ride card instead which was the waste of time. Other than that, the theme park itself was good with the mostly good queue system.
Good park. Queues on some attractions too long

Great place. Lots of rides. Best to arrive at opening to avoid waiting for all the rides. Rides for all ages. Good information available. Lots of food outlets and drinks stalls. Can do the whole park in a day. Easy to get to by taxi, cable car, mono rail or walk from mrt. Well signposted. A great experience for children. If it rains there are plenty of sheltered areas, rides may close but soon open after. The waiting time on rides is displayed in lots of areas and particularly well at start of wait. Hotels there also.

USS has always been a great place for people who are kids at heart. Been to this place few years after it opened.. now I am a pass holder so I can bring my child often.. I'm glad with how the management is able to preserve the cleanliness of the place and the safety of each ride. Staff are always been cheerful and helpful. Just sad that the price keeps increasing. Though they offer a lot of prmotions most of the time. This place has always been fun... so keep it up guys.

A fun place to visit.it has Many rides and shows...you can also see live parades and performances. This is a very lively place. Come for a day with your friends and family and you won't regret it... Just make sure not to go on weekends...you might die in crowd.. choose Monday for your visit and you will be happy with short queues and lesser crowd... Visit around 10AM in morning and get the most of it till the evening. If you arrive late, you would regret it...

Lots of impressions, absolutely delighted with the attractions. The only negative is the large number of people. If finances allow, I recommend purchasing an ExpressPass before visiting the park, which allows you to enter the attractions without queuing.

It is a famous theme park, like others in more than one country in the world. The atmosphere is very wonderful, suitable for children and adults. The games are diverse and wonderful. I advise everyone to visit it.

Well, it is worst managed universal studios. A very tourist place. Long queues everywhere. When i say long, it is really long, upto 2 hours for some rides. And there is no place to sit while u wait. U ll have to keep standing for 2 hours for every other ride. It is a very compact place. I would say tourists to stay away from this if u hv already been to other theme park.

Our experience was quite disappointing. To begin with, the price for an adult ticket -74 is too expensive simply because not all the rides are made for adult. There was nothing an adult could do in Hollywood, Madagascar or New York.. that leaves us with just a few more parks to go and not all has exhilarating outdoor rides, some just have boring indoor rides, only parent with kids would go there. To top it up it was raining and due to the lightning alert, they closed the outdoor rides from 3pm to 5.30pm. The entire place shuts at 7pm which gave us less time to complete our outdoor rides. And when the rides finally opened up, of course everyone rushed to the queue, we waited 40 minutes for each ride and only managed 2 roller coaster rides. I think when such safety hazards surface (which is of course out of their hands) its only fair that they allow an extra hour for the park to be open, for us who paid full fare to at least make use of the ticket and have a good experience. Also, the staff were completely uninterested from the entrance onwards. A fun park is usually expected to have some motivation, fun faces, fun pitch intonations, enthusiastic participation etc..to create a hype among the visitors there.. but most of them were just mundane, bored with their job, not even a hi when we entered a ride. I could count the numbers of staff who were enthusiastic and sadly that was only about 10%. Its a shame that Universal Studio Singapore doesnt stand up to other Universal Studios around the world, and its one of the most global countries in South East Asia.

The staff here is very arrogant. I was doing Rock climbing on artificial wall (dinosaur)and The staff person spoke very rudely to me for no reason. Other than that my experience was good. But please value your paying customers. There was just too much crowd.
If you stay longer than 45 minutes, you will be charged a locker fee. You end up paying for a locker every time you ride a vehicle.
I didn't watch Transformers at all. I queued for more than 2 hours and wasn't even halfway through. I wasted time and just gave up and gave up halfway.

An interesting amusement park, although there are long queues for the rides. It is better to visit on weekdays; on weekends there are a lot of people. It is better to order tickets online to avoid standing in line at the box office. There are smoking areas. The prices in the cafe are very high.

Fun place quite small basically but still needs a full day. (Half if you have express tickets) If your here for roller coasters you will be disappointed, there are 3 average coasters the rest are small designed for the little ones. We went on a Tuesday and in march and it was quiet, que's were around the 20-40 mins.
On weekdays, the crowds are okay, and the ticket price is okay. For must-see rides, it is recommended to buy express passes, otherwise the queue time will be about an hour.
not bad, friends n I had fun, few rides still need to line up for long time but not bad!
This place is not as big as the other Universal Studios theme parks but good enough for a day pass. A lot of dining option but pricey. Lot of drinking fountains and waiting time wasn't that bad.

i love love love it! rides are fun, people are friendly..the place is beautiful and theres non stoo activities. i came in the morning and left right before closing. food is really overpriced so i didnt eat that much. but if u get their drinks , keep the cup/bottle cause you can refill it with different choices of drinks with only 3 at any shops around uss .. slush are at 5 for refill. it was a fun experience. waterworks show and the mummy rollercoaster ride is highly recommended!

Extremely Amazing theme park. Starts morning 10. At entrance you can get park Map. Using Map you will be able to explore step by step wise. Make sure you wear good and comfortable footwear as there is much to walk throughout the park. Transformer ride is must to enjoy along with Mummys revenge. All rides and theme is Amazing. There is special queue for single traveller. No need to wait along with others for long time. Single person can use that special queue and enjoy ride much early. Also Locker facility is available to keep valuable and backpacks while going to rides. Rest room / toilets at all directions. Stroller facility available on rent. Good eateries available all over place. FREE WIFI AVAILABLE at whole place.
Great to have USS in sgp.. Only few on the world and proud that sgp manage to have one... Only drawback is our weather... the heat is not the best partner for theme park, Else it's worldclass
I highly recommend it! And arrive early to make the most of it and avoid queues!!! The roller coaster called Cylon deserves about 5 spins!!!

Great theme park with a lot attractions. Coming here early will give you an advantage to be able to see everything in the park. The park features 28 rides, shows and attractions in seven zones. I really enjoyed my visit here and recommend it for both children and adults

Overcrowded, for one ride one has to wait for 95 minute's, apart from that Express entry was also taking 45 min waiting time. It was just a tag universal studio. Else whole universe was there. Overcrowded overwhelmed, just wasted money and TIME.
Very worst experience in my life for transformers ride.. 2 hours in queue f___ki_g wate

The worst ever experience when its raining . We just finish the waterword show then heavy rain . Stupid workers chase us out even its raining outside and saying they need to clear up the place . What kinda excuse is this ? Really spoilt the mood and we even cant be refund and the one excuse is wait for the rain to stop . So mow i waited for 3 hours alreeady and its still raining
Worst managed....never recommend anyone to waste their valuable time.making all visitors fool.

Too crowded and spent most of the time in queue express tickets were more costlier than the ticket fare...100 ticket... Veg options were 2 restaurants where they chop veggies in 4 pieces . Waste of money during holidays...

Quite a small theme park but ok for half a day. Used my MasterCard to pay for tickets and get a discount a gift. Not sure if the offer still exists. Stand out rides were The Mummy and Transformers. Expect long queues though. Easy to get here from the mainland.
Good, cool place, but the queue is quite bad

Had a good day out at universal singapore. The park was a little smaller than expected but we'll maintained and a good selection of attractions for all. We went in the week and the place was reasonably quiet, meaning we never had to queue too long for rides. As is usually the case with theme parks, the food options were average and over priced. Lots to see and do though and overall an enjoyable visit.

Pretty small theme park compared to the other counterparts in Japan and US but it does have a mix of thrill rides and slow kiddie rides. Try to come off peak and on a weekday to avoid the crushing crowds. On those days, rides can go up to 1-1.5 h waiting times.

Nice attractions and shows. On a weekday was not too crowded and I also went right from the start. If you are a solo traveler many attractions allow you to skip the queue. Rollercoasters were ok, but I've been to faster ones in other amusement parks.

One of the best amusement parks ever. Loved every ride, especially the cyclone, Transformers and The Mummy. If i visit Singapore again I will definitely visit Universal Studios again. Try going on a weekday and during off season for lesser crowd or you can always pay more and get an express ticket for a shorter queue.

I honestly loved this theme park a lot! I found that it was better than the other tourist attractions in all of Singapore. The rides are awesome! The children rides normally have a very short wait ranging from around 5-15 minutes. The bigger and scarier ones have a much longer wait ranging from 45-70 minutes. The food that our family bought for lunch was a little overpriced but it was tasty and everyone loved it! This would be one of the few places I would visit again if I was to revisit Singapore. Amazing place!

The experience at Universal studio Singapore was amazing, Must try transformers 4D show.can spend full day even if you plan to see all attraction at Universal.Night view is amazing.Look for the information board and attend all live shows and meetups with your favorite characters from Movies.There may be long queues for the attraction during day time.Park open at 10.00am and before to avoid long queues. Less crowded in evening and Night also.

This is the best place I've visited recently. I liked the roller coaster the most The design of the park is off the charts, everything is very colorful, the service staff always has a smile on their face and is ready to help in any situation. When I arrived home in Russia, I told and showed all the numerous photos and videos of this amusement park to all my friends. Everyone wants to go there. At the slightest opportunity, I will definitely visit this park again and again.
Oh I loved it. Totally enjoyed it. Best time to go is after lunch when the queue is smaller. It will take around 3-4hrs to see the whole place. Not more. Beat rides are mummy revenge and avengers 4d.

Today I had the worst experience ever in Asia (I am traveling here for 6 months now). We came here on Monday to avoid crowds but there was too much people almost all the day. We were standing in the lines for 1,5 hour to have 1 minute ride. It was terrible! We spend all day and it was not enough to try all the attractions. Also, only 4 or 5 were interesting, others were only for children. The funny thing was that almost all the time we were obligated to leave our stuff in lockers and these lockers were for free only for 30-40minutes. After that there was 4 dollars fee for every 20 minutes. But almost all the time we had to wait for the attraction for more that 1 hour, so it was so unfair. It is not worth to pay so much money for this experience!!!
Nightmare! There are queues all around, for each attraction, for at least an hour (and this is with the express pass purchased, for an additional 110 per person!) I do not recommend it to anyone.

Waiting times are not clear or reliable, attractions stop working for no apparent reason and it's not communicated clearly or transparently. Express queues make normal ones not move at all for minutes during peak times.

Universal studio staff , some are very arrogant and rude. To be honest, some are double standard. they treat Asians poorly. The attractions and rides are amazing. Few rude staff spoilt my mood. I paid so high and yet treated poorly. Universal studio should train their staff to be polite because that's their core job being in tourism place. To be resourceful and helpful.
Thick queues, unfriendly staff...

My trip here was fun as I've had enough time to play most of the rides, the line is bit long though (but its okay because usually theme parks will have long lines). Surau here is a bit small and does not have enough telekung, so be prepared by bringing your own telekung.
Good visit although very long queues for the rides and attractions
Nice, shows are excellent but rides are ok

Wonderdul for playing. But in week day, a lot of visitors are coming and give a lot of time for playing. You shouldn't go when the weather is not good. The machine are not run lightening, raining and weather is bad. I suggest you if you have there at 8:00 PM , you should watch crane dance at Sentosa's sea view.

It's quite compact. Compared to USJ, the crowds are smaller and you don't have to wait long for attractions, but I think people who have had fun at USJ will feel something is missing. In my case, I don't think I'll go there next time.

One of the best parks! You'll enjoy everything from live shows, thrilling rides, restaurants and shopping stores. Everything here especially the rides are worth the cost. Great place to enjoy with your friends and family, and also by yourself! Just be prepared for the long queues per ride for 30 minutes or more each. If you want to try every ride then you will need to visit another day since one day is not enough to try them all. As far as I remember, no food and snacks allowed. So bring enough cash and use a small bag to avoid any problems and have a hassle-free day. Highly recommended for all ages. Want to visit again soon!
Simply fabulous... One must visit universal at Singapore with express tickets to avoid long queues...

The Best place for entertainment. You need 1 full day to enjoy there. And yeah the best one is transformer and don't loose time by waiting in a long queue, just go a as single rider, even you are a couple or a family, then also go as a single riders, no doubt you will enjoy lotts.. There is full on masti, fun and entertainment for everyone.
The place is great! There are amazing rides and also some amazing restraunts as well!

As phenomenal as a place could get. One full day is what you will take to cover everything satisfactorily. There are 23 rides as of now, and on a typical day, you can cover at most 18-19. We were there for 7 hours, and we did 8-9. This included lunch. The wait time for every ride/show is mentioned at entry gate so you can plan accordingly. Transformer 4D,revenge of mummy were my beat ones. Discovery food court has limited options, you might try out other food options. But do get a coke for yourself from discovery food court, it will get you a Universal studios sipper, additional souvenir if you want. Lockers are available free of cost for most of the rides. The most amazing part is, that even if you are in queue for a ride/show, don't worry about convenience. They keep you engagaed, and under AC chambers. 40-50 mins are not a problem here. There is also free wifi covering most part. Plenty of shopping opportunities, almost after every ride/show. Madagascar (ride) is smooth and good for anyone. This is Universal Studios for you. Spend as much time as you can. They have taken care of every little details. This is separate from Sentosa, which requires another full day by the way.

Very bad Experience...Overcrowded...very rude staff specially at the Revenge of the Mummy ride. There is waiting time of 90 mins in each ride. Whats the point of giving tickets and admission to so many people that no one can enjoy the day out. Have been to many other theme parks and never had such bad experience.

We have been here several times throughout the past 4 years, kids... Lines are very bad on many rides - especially Jurassic. Queue times are not accurate. The Express Lane customers are a major reason for the long lines as they are very many, a significant percentage, and often times result in the line standing still for extended periods. Not worth 1/4 of the entry cost. Poorly run park.

Staff at battlestar Galactica being rude and impatient to visitor. An Indian male staff rudely asking queuing visitor to leave the gantry door even the previous ride visitor havent get off from her seat. He can rather asking visitors politely to move away as he want to close the door. Very rude of him. If hate to work please quit as well. (Visited at 5 April 2019)
After being to the one in the US , this is not a patch . Even after buying the expensive express pass, some of the rides , would not accept it .

Not well managed. Most of the rides were called off due to bad weather. Recommended to get express pass. Not much variety of food hub. Avoid Saturday and Sunday. Get tickets online you may save 5 dollars.
Good tourist attraction but so crowed that you might not enjoy your visit

It's a very good place for entertainment. There are different theme based area. Heart throbbing rides. But the problem is long waiting. So always better to purchase express universal ticket. So no need to wait longer for each ride and you can used almost all rides. Good photographic views.very limited choice of food for vegetarians.
Though crowded, it is worth one's time. All the rides are enjoyable. Although the goods are quite pricey, it is alright once you're able to purchase something that can only be bought in USS

The entertainment area is very good, it's a shame it comes during peak season so you can't enjoy the rides, it's recommended for those who want to come here during peak season, you should increase your budget by buying an express card spy Don't queue at the rides.
The rides are in good condition, very well maintained. But for it, we pay a huge price, which is not really worth it in comparison to other universal studios.

Great experience. You don't realise how much time is spent here. Can easily spend an entire day here. Some rides have huge queues but the expected waiting time is displayed outside. So you can decide if you want to join that queue or go on to the next ride. The place is really clean and people friendly. Lots of eating places and restrooms scattered throughout. Something to do for each age-group.

We had an amazing experience. The queues at night were much shorter and much more bearable than in the day. The park is open till 10pm on Fridays and Saturdays. We were impressed with the Water World show, Cyclone roller coaster, Transformers and The Mummy rides. We spent a full day in this park and enjoyed the experience. There were many attractions and had something for everyone in the family. My favorite was Transformer's Ultimate 3D Battle Ride. We had to wait because of the long queue but it was worth it. And you won't get bored. Everybody was so excited. The Revenge of the Mummy was jaw-droppimg. I also enjoyed Spielberg's Lights, Camera, Action. I love the Minions! We enjoyed dining at the Jurassic Park-themed food court and brought my nieces' Universal Studios tumblers so we could buy soda at a discounted price. There was so much to explore. What a load of fun and wonderful experience! Would love to come here again!

One of the best amusement parks ever. Loved every ride, especially the cyclone, Transformers and The Mummy.Try going on a weekday and during off season for lesser crowd or you can always pay more and get an express ticket for a shorter queue.

Great amusement park, many rides come from characters from Universal movies. Water World show and Transformer game are two must-visit places. Although the queue was quite long, it was worth the wait. Food and drinks are quite expensive, but everything else is great

Such an amazing n awesome fun do place it is. You need a whole day to enjoy universal. Also the staff at the ticket counter were so good to us. I had some problems related to the express tickets, but the boy and girl( handre amd pearlyn) at the counter solved it in a wink. Keep it up guys.

Been here many times on an annual pass. Seems everytime I visit at least one ride breaks down after a long wait in the line. Given the unusually long wait times for their rides in general I cannot recommend this theme park. Poor maintenance, filthy toilet facilities, and food that tastes like it was prepared in the filthy toilets only subtract further from this low value for money attraction. By the way, I'm sitting on the floor waiting for the Mummy ride to start (its been delayed for technical difficulties).

It is open until 22:00 on Saturday July 6th, but the business hours have to be changed because other companies have booked the venue. At 18 o'clock, other ticket-buying tourists were kicked out, and the Saturday parade and fireworks that I was looking forward to were also cancelled. The way the staff dealt with it was also very rude and they rushed tourists away, which was very bad! Since tickets bought in advance cannot be changed, we can only accept Universal's statement that "the company has the right to change the time." Although Japan Global is more expensive, the service is much better than in Singapore. Singapore Global's service and handling methods are really terrible. For a large global company, Singapore Global's handling is very poor!
Terrible experience. Management is exceptionally terrible. Dont waste your time

Waste of time.....it takes 2 hours to leave....failure....large queues everywhere... designed so that no one sees how long they are. You don't know or see the waiting time for a given attraction... drama

If you love queuing cumulatively for 5hrs with 2 small children to ride for 30 mins total then this is definitely the place for you! If not, then save your holiday, your money, your family's time and go somewhere else. Honestly this was one of the worst paid for 'experiences' we've ever had anywhere in the world. 1.5hrs of queuing for a ride which said it was a 45 min wait at the start. The ride took 7.5 mins. Another one was a 45min wait for a 35 sec ride. Hot, stinky, crowded queues. Two of the family rides weren't even working when the park opened because of what the staff said were technical problems. The kicker is when you do decide to pay the extra 70SGD pp for an 'Express' ticket to jump the queue, they then use surge pricing and say it will cost 140SGD pp (no discount for kids). Even those with Express tickets had to wait 45mins to ride the Jurassic Park Rapids when the average ticket holder had to wait 2hrs. In the midst of this self-punishment I tried to get a beer. Waited in line for 5 mins to get to the front only to be told the 11SGD beer had sold out. I guess there were other desperate adults who'd got there quicker. As well as that when the kids wanted photos with the characters they were told no, only photos taken by professional photographers. Like I said, if you like to wait in line sweating while having your pockets emptied by Universal then you'll love it.

It's a fun theme park and the queuing areas are really well thought out and mostly out the heat. It's more suited to kids younger than teenagers as there aren't many large rides but there are lots of good shows. It's frustrating that you have to use lockers before entering the ride queue which causes chaos with everyone trying to put things in and out and half the time the fingerprint reader doesn't work, but still a good day out.

Overall, it's pretty good. The service staff are very enthusiastic and there are many souvenirs. The disadvantage is that the operating hours of the Sentosa Train do not match those of Universal, and things are more expensive.
Beautiful place but really busy with long queues for upto an hour and not many rides disappointed was expecting more but a nice place to visit and not forgetting the entry is quite expensive

It is the iconic tourist spot to visit. But don't visit the place on weekends cause long waiting cues for the specific theme rides. The tickets area is well organized and service with smile, also provided the meal voucher as a token of appreciation along with the tickets but you'll just grab fries or drink in that amount. Its the second version of the original US Universal Studio.

Although it is probably the smallest of the existing Universal Studios, the number of rides seems to be large compared to the area. It is quieter than Osaka, but the waiting time is quite long without an express pass. Representative rides include Transformers and Battlestar Galactica roller coasters, which combine 3D and rides. It's comfortable, but Singapore's unique heat and the fact that there are many visitors from certain countries have a synergistic effect, so the bathrooms are dirty and you bump into a lot of people. However, character products are cheaper than in Osaka.
Theme park is absolutely amazing. My personal favourite is Battlestar Gallatica. Park is clean and very well organised. Although I have been here a few times, it is still enjoyable.

Our family spent an enjoyable day at USS. I especially enjoyed Jurassic park ride, the mummy ride and the shrek waffles. Actually a day is not really enough to spend here because of the long queues. Loved being there. Would definitely come back!

it was the absolute most best theme park i've been to. the staff were helpful,friendly and kind. i could spend my whole day there. all the attractions and rides are fun and thrilling. one of my faves would be The Revenge Of the Mummy,it was thrilling and fun. i would totally recommend this theme park to other people. :)
went there on summer holiday, so it's full of people, ant the queue is too long, but worth to wait. the attractions were great.
One of the best theme park ive ever been.. we got the cheaper ticket price at online. In the end of afternoon. They have a parade and the other fun event.

The worst experience in a theme Park in my whole life. Large queues to enter and without any organization so many people dont respect the queues. Inside the Park again Large queues and terrible organization(I think they need more personal inside the atractions to organize the people) .One of the atractions (shrek in 4d)didnt work correctly.

We spent the whole morning lining up for rides. (Wait time 45mins per ride). A lot of the other tourists were rude and pushed in and get too close to you in queues. Then it rained and they cancelled all the entertainment parades Then we spent the rest of the day lining up for rides again. If you have limited time in Singapore i suggest you skip this place. Waste of Money and Time
Extremely poor management. Unlimited tickets selling, unlimited entry, causing unlimited long queue of all attractions.

Worst experience ever. I visited a lot of amusement parks, but never faced this. Big lines, everything is very very slow. We waited 2 hours for one ride. Ticket is 110 SGD for one ride per attraction plus USS entrance. It's crazy.

Most of the rides having 'technical difficulties' without explanation. The weather is fine. And all visitors queueing up and wasting a lot of time!! It's not worth the money to come in. Unless you want spend another 110 for express pass. They ripping off money by surge the price based on the crowd. Given the 'trick' of 'technical difficulties', the crowd is overwhelming and it doesn't spark joy at all. Waiting time for one ride is 90 to 120mins. Not recommended to visit here.

A typical large park like Disneyland with a lot of interesting games but unfortunately takes to long to see them even the main games are difficult to catch them all. A big variety of interesting things to do. I didn't like the prices there the food is too much expensive and the quality is kind like one star. But I enjoyed some of the games transformers is awesome...

It was a nice experience. The thing why not full stars is because they do not limit the number of entrees. Too much crowd. For one ride we had to queue up for 3 hours. So had to miss many other rides and shows due to time limitations

Great theme park, though not too big, the roller coasters cyclo and human are quite scary. The revenge of the mummy is not as scary as you thought. The 3D transformer is worth to line up. The canopy flyer is too short, not worth to line so long. The food and restaurants are OK. The water show is quite good.

The place is amazing but only three stars because you have to stand in queue too long for any ride. Here, by too long, I mean around an hour or two. Otherwise it is very great place to visit and also express passes (which costs some money) are available to reduce waiting time drastically.

Good but mostly staff are Filipinos, so their doing first priority for own people in a unprofessional way. But Singaporean's are good people and very helpful. Universal studios you'll have fun more than you pay.

Amazing and brilliant place. The Mummy and Transformers are amazing rides and worth its wait, as one has to stand in long queues in the hot weather. Prepared for long queues and some thrilling experience

This is the best of the best in Sentosa and in Singapore and may be one of the best in the whole world. Definitely you are enjoying your time there , regardless your age. Do not miss the roller coaster ( both the red and the white ) , and the transformers . The mummy is also great and worth trying. The only negative point is the queue , same as Disney land main problem. It needs 8 hours minimum to play 5 games !
Great experience!!! Superb rides. Awesone 4D effect studios. Good time at Madam Tussards. Enjoy the Merlion
One of the best theme parks i have ever been to. The staff is amazing and the place is very clean.

Well we arrived early and spent a full day in the park. We went clockwise and managed to do the Madagascar ride and the 4d Shreik experience without queuing. What made this a five star event was the kindness of the staff who pulled us out of the queue as they had noticed one of our party had a white stick and allowed us to access the express queue which in the heat and humidity made our trip extra special. The rides were slightly different from Orlando which was an added bonus and due to the heat another fantastic day in the 30c we were very pleased to visit Hard Rock Cafe for our ritual Cheeseburger and Coke which was excellent. The Hard Rock Cafe was not the largest we have been to, but the shop was full of excellent T-shirts which makes the prices a bit more acceptable. We got our forearms stamped and went back in to the Studios to do a bit of last minute shopping before heading back into Singapore.
I only got 3 rides. waiting in line for 120 mins for transformer was horrible experience ever and had to leave after 7pm so only stayed 3 hours and couldn't even get night pass .

Third rate staff. Not helpful at all. The transformers ride the queue just goes on and on through a maze and there is no one who can guide visitors. It is designed just to get people to waste their money.

Last tuesday we visit the Universal Studio here in Singapore we choose this country because it was known to be one of the safest country for its very low crime rate.Me and my family was feeling fortunate and full of excitement that day.Lunch time came and all of us are so hungry so we rush to enter in this resto since this is the 1st resto we saw that offers rice. The receiving area was small so my wife and my kids sat beside the counter together with my sister in law and father in law while I was the one who approach the counter and make order. One of my son was playing with our GO PRO camera,afterward he placed the said camera on the couch beside her mom then one of the staff called us to enter and approach the table they preparedfor us,unknowingly they left the Camera outside but we did not notice it at first, after eating we went out of KT's grill, a few min. And meters away from the resto me and my wife was rushing to go back to get the Camera.As we enter we approach the crew of the resto and they said they haven't seen any camera was left so we call on the manager to ask help if we could review the CCTV cameras of their resto and they said we have to follow the protocol of the eatablishment to report it to the Lost and Found Section and so we follow everything they told us to do. The Lost and found section took our contact # and told us to wait for their call as so we did.By around 5pm one of the staff of the Lost and Found Section called us just to tell us that they could not see the footage in that area where we alleged that the camera was left becauae the camera is in focus to the resto's reception counter only and the full area is not visible. We are so fraustrated with the KT's Grill as you can imagine the people entering there is not safe they cannot protect their customers from those theives around the area of their resto..if you visit the place you can clearly see what i realy ment that their cctv camera could not capture the area of their receiving where they took orders for the mere fact that the area was too small.i am very disappointed!

I will update this fully later. At the park now and unable to be allowed yes I mean allowed to access the attractions as I am an electric wheelchair user. Despite signs saying if able to transfer rides are allowed. I am having to leave the park with my family now. I strongly advise staying away if you are in the same situation as me and dont waste a day or allow a day to be ruined. Like today has.

Been there on a weekday, it was a complete rush. Had to wait for 4 hrs in line to get into Battlestar galactica(including time taken for them to rectify a technical issue). Also, revenge of mummy was closed due to maintenance. Rest of the rides were too crowded. Water rides were housefull. Couldn't do much. All i can advice people who are going there is to buy an express pass! Otherwise it's a total waste standing in line for many hours

It's just an average experience. Rides & shows are good but waiting time ruins everything. On some rides waiting time can reach 120 min with customers paying extra given preference over normal visitors. Food was good with Oasis having good Indian options with great taste.

Though the park is fun, I would expect some more rides for adults specially. One quick hack is roller coasters are heavily busy in the morning with weight times exceeding 1 hour However after 4 PM they get a little lighter with wait times reduced to 20 minutes or so. So I would suggest to do all the rides with lesser wait times early on and then move to roller coaster.

Perhaps because it was a weekday, there weren't many people, which was nice. Mummy also boarded after waiting for 5 minutes. Besides that, you can ride without waiting and go to the souvenir shop. The air conditioner comes on to cool off the heat. However, the restaurant is not very cost-effective. Going out and eating seems to be the answer. It's nice that it's divided into zones and decorated with characters. Fun guy. madagascar characters It's a shame it ends at 6 o'clock.
The park is not big, the tickets are a bit expensive, and some of the game facilities are ordinary

Good experience. Really not very busy on a Wednesday when it rained first thing. I think the rain may have deterred some people but once it had cleared up the park was fully a liable and pretty much empty. Longest wait time 40 mins or so..

The best amusement park in Singapore. We visited Universal Studios and its really memorable. The staff service is excellent, we bought our tickets online and the registration went smooth. Little tips for the Transformer Ride, during high season you can visit it after 4PM, no queueing at all.

Had a great time. You need all day to attend all the rides. Transformers and Battlestar Galactica are the best. The staff is very helpful. The location is fantastic and there are many interesting things to do. We had a great time and we hope that we will be able to attend again.

AMAZING! Rides are fantastic BUT missing last star as wait times signs are not realistic especially when posting 30 mins and it's more like 60-70 mins and some queues definitely need fans or air conditioning turned on. We didn't purchase priority express (an extra SGD40 on top of ticket price) but this may be worthwhile as most of the popular rides have express lanes. If you LOVE roller coaster - DEFINITELY recommend Mummy ride as nd Galatica rides but the waiting in queues is a killer...

Amazing place,lots of rides, something for everyone,best was battle star Galactica,Mummy was a dark ride, transformer and Jurassic park was also must ride.We visited in weekdays morning,up to 3 pm it was long queue every where but after that it was smooth, express pass is available but cost varies as per rush.Waterworld show is also must.Many place to eat serving different cuisine.

One of the best theme based parks Must visit if u come to Singapore Roller coaster and transformers are must try ride Though the waiting time for the ride is 60-90 minutes it is worth that 1 minute ride

We went to Universal on 4th Oct 2019 and had the worst experience ever. Far too many people the park can accommodate. Each place waiting for at least 2 to 2.5 hrs. We could only take 3 rides. Getting in itself took us 45 minutes. With so many people it a serious violation of safety and security. Kids cried out of suffocation and tiredness in tight lanes. Too much greed and selfish state of affairs. Sadly no one seem to regulate the number of people allowed at the park and sadly Singapore govt is not keeping a watch of it.

Worst experience ever i hate this place its been three hour I keep standing in different ques and every rides keeps shutting down due to technical fault not even a single one is working. Waste of money & time in Singapore.
Worst crowd management. Huge waiting time for most of the rides. Standing in queues will take up half of the time.

Got very bad experience with normal day-pass even it doesn't cost cheap though (79). Normal Queue is at least 60 mins in just a basic simple rides in weekdays. 79 is just like an entrance fee, with Express Pass goes first and first and you would never know when you can get the ride. There is lack of maintenance, 2 rides broke down & stop during the rides with system failure on my day in. Rude staffs with command acting rather than welcome help. Most of the rides have only 1 staff to operate a ride; Ticket check, Security check, Open-Close doors, Switching On-Off. That's boring wasting time. My conclusion, this is the worst World 's Known Amusement Park in the world.

Very badly managed studio in terms of crowd management and staff cooperation. Some of the rides were shut stating technical error after waiting for 2 hrs in the queue . Try to visit this on weekdays to avoid over crowd

Fun and endless amusement, the holiday and weekend crowds though would make it difficult for patrons to try all the rides and attractions. Plus if you chance to go with a scheduled evening event it halves your time at the park. The kids kinda felt shortchanged and frustrated when they were let out of the park while they were just warming up.

The scenic spots are small and beautiful, and the restaurants are also unique, which is convenient whether in the park or out. The service attitude needs to be improved. It seems that Singaporeans dont even smile or say hello.

I went here for the halloween horror nights attraction. Of course, it was night time. The event was nice. Some shops inside this theme park were still open. There are many gift shops, souvenir shops, movie characters shops, etc. A popular coffee shop was also open. Unfortunately, some food shops and other attractions were already closed because they operate only at day time. Anyway, this is still a nice place to have fun.

It is an amusement and tourist attraction in Singapore. The famous Universal Studios!! However, the area is small and there are a lot of tourists, so the waiting time for each ride is very long. It starts at 10 a.m. and closes at 6 p.m., so even if you go early on weekends, you won't be able to ride all the popular items unless you take the express.
Unfortunately the park wasn't quite as expected. It is lovingly designed but far too small and, with a few exceptions, the rides are only average. Nevertheless, we had a nice time.

I recommend being present at the opening so that you can experience a few attractions right away. The park is only open for 8 hours and with waiting times of one hour. Of course it will all be over soon. The attractions are excellent. It's just a shame that you have to store all your stuff near the 2 fast roller coasters. But I had a great time and was able to do all the attractions in the 8 hours. The entertainment in the park is very well organized and entertaining for children and parents. Good food and drinks. And you have plenty of choice in souvenirs.
Awesome place to visit .wear comfortable shoes shoes as you have to stand in long queue to enjoy rides

Universal studios Singapore is one the most favorite tourist attractions of Singapore, a bit overcrowded but is must for an adventure enthusiast, any amount of wait time on any of the ride will be worth it
Awesome place.very love it.we enjoy the 1 day adventure here.many attraction canllay.but need to wait very very long time.
Transformers ride is best ride, everything is great but long queues takes too much time(if you're with group)

This place is completely disorganized. Onboarding and offbaording causes massive delays even though lines are NOT so long. Also don't believe in waiting times appearing in the Universal app, they're much longer. Equipment must be worn off as "technical breakes" happen quite often (causing even bigger delays). Food is awful (mostly really low quality junk food). All in all - not worth your time and . Go some place else on Sentosa or just enjoy your time by the pool in a hotel.

Not many attractions compare to the park in Florida. Horrendous waiting times despite Monday outside of the main season waiting times not shown correctly (displayed 25 min, reality over an hour). If you want to come here spend the 40 SGD more for the express pass. Overall impression, not worth the money spent, there are better things to do in Singapore.

The Madagascar ride was horrible due the extreme foul odour coming from the restrainer bar from the boat ride, the stench was horrid and my feedback was greeted with a lackadaisical grin. Next is the Madagascar Carousel and again the safety belt emitted an pungent and repulsive stench that was apalling for such a theme park. Indeed a horrendous and smelly experience. Regret becoming a season pass holder.

I wouldn't waste my time or money on this place.The rides we did get on were good and I understand the long wait when the park is busy. But after lining up for 3 different rides for close to an hour to be told that each of these rides was then closed when we got to the very front of the line due to technical reasons (for two of the rides) and finally "inclement weather" on the third ride ruined our day. The "inclement weather" was not a cyclone but just a typical storm that seems to pass through Singapore every afternoon. The apparently "severe" weather then shut down almost all of the rides in the park leaving us feeling that we had wasted our money since we couldn't go on most of the rides that we had paid to use. The weather really was no worse than the usual daily rains in Singapore. Absolute waste of money.

Disappointed, not enough shade. Overpriced and too many people paying to queue jump therefore making queues longer. We spent 5 hours there and only got to go on 4 rides due to the queue wait. Would not recommend.

Place was good but they need to do something about the long qeue but i guess if they will do something about it they don't have much rides and people will not come again but if you can do something about it please do..... And some of the staffs were rude kindly do something about it too.. Peace
It's ok. Small theme park with quite cool atmosphere. Compared to others it is small but packed with interesting things to do
The place is good, but have to stand in a long queue for taking rides.
It is a good theme park.. just that the weather is not so good

Visited USS on 4th Nov. Transformer ride was closed due to maintenance and my target spot- Elmo TV show was not available as well. Didnt see any minion and Elmo characters throughout the whole day Recommend tourist to get an express pass if you cannot bear the long queue. Get yourself a mini cooling fan too as the weather in Singapore is just way too hot! I tried Cylon, Mummy and Human rides and the rides were okay-okay and not so thrilling as described on the web. USJ would be much better than USS. Nevertheless, twas a great experience as the staffs and characters were really friendly and helpful. Worth a visit!
Must visit place.. Amazing experience.. Deserves the price they charge. Visit on weekdays to avoid long queues.

Awesome place for both young and old! Happy place for everyone. Fantastic theme park. Everything is well maintained and clean. Great rides. Amazing and super friendly staff! Came here on a weekends, the crowd were high! Many halal food options available. Good selection or merchandise. But the price is slightly on a high side marketed to the tourist. Spend an entire day here. Very hot.
Amazing place. All adventure activities are enjoyable for all age groups. Avoid weekend Sunday and national holidays. On national holiday buy classic tickets to avoid long queues.
Amazing experience, awesome rides and effects. Huge lines. Be ready to wait for hours on a busy weekend or public holiday. Reach early and be ready for en entire day of fun, here at universal studios
Great experience and we'll managed by staff

Worst experience ever. Let in so many visitors for the day where every ride's waiting time is at least 90mins and yet there are a few rides that are down with technical issues.... wonder why we pay so much for such an experience

SERVICE After trying various paid attractions and also 5 star hospitality services in various different places in Singapore, I got the impression that the workers who served us in various places did not understand how to serve customers. Of course the customer is not king, but customers pay money to get their service. So customers hope to receive the service they have purchased like customers, not just receive their money and then ignore it. The staff (especially young people) at various rides on the USS are generally reluctant to provide even the slightest information and are rude even when answering basic questions from customers. For example, when I and other guests approached the entrance to the Cyclon (roller coaster), the staff spoke quickly and their English pronunciation was far from standard so it was difficult to understand, it was only natural for customers to ask "Excuse me, what do you mean by this is the last hour?" the staff even got angry and shouted in response while looking away "10 minutes" he said. It turned out that the ride was taking a break for 10 minutes and there was no announcement, so many customers continued to come to the ride because they didn't know. Instead of conveying information about the break and when it would reopen, the staff immediately rejected customers curtly. It's not surprising that if other customers asked when it would reopen, the staff answered by shouting, rudely, curtly and angrily while turning around. Interestingly, in contrast to the attraction staff found on the streets in Universal Studios who are warm and smiling. These non-vehicle staff try to greet and smile at every customer passing by and don't even hesitate to ask them to take a group photo. OVERALLS The place is not big. Likewise with the number of rides, it is quite small. The only advantage or attraction of the USS is the roller coaster. If Dufan had a roller coaster that was better or at least the same as USS, of course the experience at USS would be even less memorable. The service from the workers at the rides is bitchy, rude, angry, degrading people who can't understand what they are saying as a sign that the tourists don't speak English, even though the tourists are fluent in English. Even though the experience offered by USS can be enjoyed and some of it is enjoyable, it all disappears or becomes less impressive because of the service provided by the staff who are rude, uninformative, lazy, angry, rude, etc.

Two major attractions are not operating and still charged the same price. The restaurant food is 3x more expensive and quality is horrible. Express pass should be helpful but who wants to buy express pass when two major attractions are not operating?? Very bad experience.

Universal express pricing method is way too greedy of the park. The rides queuing time is horrendous, but the rides are good quality. Food is horrible and very much overpriced. They recently changed the drinks so normal drinking water is no longer sold (WTF?) instead replaced by a disgusting alkaline water.

Terrible experience. They dont have any control on incoming numbers. The ticket prices are already very high. On top they give preference to people buying an on top express service. Its a complete rip off.very dishonest. One has to stand 100 mins plus in most of the rides. Certainly not advisable.

Sentosa's Universal Studios is the obligatory stop for the island featuring some of the same attractions as the ones you may find in the US as well as some exclusive ones as the excellent (although a bit outdated) Battle Star Galactica Roller Coaster. These amusing rides are however offset by the extremelly inneficient staff and logistics of the park which leads to clearly unecessary long queus as well as several closed rides even in the high season. Best to avoid in crowded periods
Good place but lengthy lines with long waiting periods for rides on holidays.
Busy theme park, lots of great rides, food is average in quality and expensive.

There are better experiences in other locations in Singapore. I enjoy theme parks and have visited many across four continents, and this is the first major park where I left early, disappointed. Wait times were eye wateringly long 2-3 hours for the major attractions, and there were a few breakdowns. Food prices were even further above the normally inflated prices. Anyway, if you still need to go, their are a few good things to know- * bring a water bottle, there are plenty of refill stations * staff are really friendly and helpful * fast passes will get your wait times back to tolerable if you have the extra coin. I'm not sure if paying the extra just encouraged the park not to fix wait times though * food in the Lost World area is more local style, and the best priced option, or there are options nearby outside the park

It is a great place for holiday especially the attractions. The roller-coaster is great. Cyclone is the best. Transformers is a great experience. Mummy too The Jurassic Park is overrated. Not that great actually. But the performance, particularly the Elmo's. It just bring back my childhood memories. Shrek and Donkey. Man, that is interesting. Unfortunately, it was raining. The stunt Waterworld was not shown. I bought the express pass. It is worth it as we went during weekend. But I had the fact that it is much more expensive that the actual ticket and the prices are up according to demand. I think this capitalist approach is quite bad. For that I pull off your star.

I spend a great day in here. There are a lot of attractions in here, but I suggested you to visit here during weekdays because Its so crowded during weekend. also to buy the ticket online (to save more time). I took a rive boat ride on Madagascar : A Crate Adventure (Madagascar Zone), then I watched 4D Film Experience on Shrek 4D Adventure (Far Far Away Zone), I watched Movie special effects show on Lights, Camera, Action! Hosted by Steven Spielberg (New York Zone), also I took Hyper-realistic 3D thrill ride on Transformers The Ride : The Ultimate 3D Battle (Sci-fi City Zone), and the last one I took High speed roller coaster on Revenge of the Mummy (Ancient Egypt Zone). You can also take a picture with the characters before entering the zone / after your visit the zone (after you took the picture you will get wristband that will be scanned after you took the picture, you can also took the picture with your own phone - so you don't have to pay).

Amazing place to have fun with friends and family. If you plan to go, better spend the entire day here as you will spend at least 45mins waiting time for each ride. Transformer ride is recommended to try! Regular entrance fee is 79SGD. Food and drinks are at least 10SGD so prepare extra money!
Awesome place. The best part is how they efficiently manage so much crowd with different lanes for rides.

Still one of the most fun places to visit in Singapore! Aside from the top three rides (Galactica Human and Cylon, Transformers and The Mummy), they also do special events like Halloween scare nights, which easily sell out. Lines can get long, with waits up to 2 hours for popular rides. Best to go between Monday to Thursday to avoid the weekend crowd.

Amazing park with lots of games to play. Transformers and The Mummy are the main highlights for adults. Book from website for cheaper tickets with parking fee. Advisable to spend the whole day there. You can visit the USS globe for free for photos!

Its a theme park and yeah its always busy and crowded. So the long wait for each ride is understandable. But what makes the situation worse are the staff. 1. They never smile. If I give a dollar for each staff that I see smile, I would never finish 10 for the entire day. 2. They act like police officers. I have seen a number of staff scolding visitors or raising their voice because they (visitors) dont understand them. 3. Very low frustration tolerance. Staff must understand that some of the visitors are first time theme park goers. Staff have no patience and would even talk to them in a very condescending tone. Im a season pass holder to save money whenever I need to bring some friends who are visiting Singapore. So what I mentioned above are recurring observations.

It was the worst part of my trip to singapore. Heavily crowded. Have to wait 50-80 mins in long queues to het into the ride. Was a waste of time and energy. Please take express ticket if u go there as the people with express tickets has priority in queue. It costs around 150-210 additional to normal ticket. Highly disappointed

The service attitude is extremely poor. It is probably a place I would not want to visit again in an Asian paradise. "Each" service staff of the park definitely needs more than 6 months of education and training. Shrek 4D Cinema, when we first entered the theater, the service staff explained that he shushed the guest three times in a row, which was very rude. Then he shushed the guest two more times. Can you not speak? During the 55-minute wait in line for Treasure Hunt, the instrument completely stopped twice. Of course, it is necessary under safety conditions, but the service staff looked indifferent to the guests and did not explain it. Even when the machine stopped for the second time, they looked at each other and laughed, and the guests in line were so sad that they wanted to cry. It ended by picking up an empty can under a game vehicle. Not only did the guests have no interest in playing at this time, but the service staff were still completely stupid, as if the only thing that was interesting was when the machine was down. All of these happened on January 25, 2020. Compared to Hong Kong, which I have visited more than a dozen times, the Japanese Disney service staff are full of smiling professionalism, allowing guests to feel a full atmosphere of joy as soon as they enter the park. "Universal Studios Singapore is really disappointing."
Bad customer service. Lack of management. Tranaformer ride does not work. Lot of guests wait more than 1 hour and have to exit. No crew members to direct guests. There was no apology to guests.

Appalling queue management. The estimated times provides by the app and also at the attraction entrances were simply outrageously underestimated. We queued 2 hrs 20 min for a purported 50 min queue ride. Food price is also outrageously expensive.

3.5 STARS Getting there was easy, used Grab. Seems there is also MRT station. Queuing for the entrance was not streamlined. At the end of the lines, it was just people bunching up in a mass. It got better 5-10 metres to the actual gate. They need to possibly have staff guide people. Food was, like any theme parks. I suggest that if you can, buy tickets with the S5 meal voucher (cant be used in cart stalls). We had 6 vouchers and it was worth it. We paid extra S0.50 per ticket to get the S5 voucher. I tried the transformer 3D ride. 2 hours queue but it was worth it. My family lined up for the roller coaster and was told it was not working when they got closer at the start of line. There should have been told as soon as possible and given some sort of express pass for something else. They waited for 40 mins. There was a "storm" which caused delays to Waterworld show but at it was a good show. I am comparing this to other theme parks and its 3.5 stars compared to them.

Fun day trip with the kids to this really high quality theme park. There is a good mix of attractions for both small and large children. There are plenty of places to eat, although it is quite expensive to eat there (even for being in Singapore). Unfortunately, the waiting times for the attractions are quite long (and we were there on a Wednesday). Each attraction has a sign showing how long the waiting time is but unfortunately these are often wrong and the actual waiting time is often much longer than stated. Also advises downloading the app which has a good overview of the park with associated information.

Its a nice place if you don't mind waiting in line for most of your time there. In my opinion they should either build more rides or limit entries. Also its annoying that for some rides you need to store your stuff in lockers and they charge extra for the lockers.

our family went there during Christmas, it was full of fun though it's a bit crowded. We had our express pass, yet the crowd was enermous. We payed to get all our photos online, but unfortunately there were only few photos in it. It's frustrating bcoz we were so excited to look for our photos during the ride.

It wasn't too crowded and I had a lot of fun. Perhaps because it was before the New Year's celebration, the music playing from the entrance was Chinese music, and it felt a little less like Universal Studios, but it was different from Japan, so I guess that's okay. It was nice that the food court in front of the entrance was well stocked.

Never would i imagine Singapore to have a legitimate actual theme park that is this humongous and has many amazing rides and shows. The last theme park we had was Escape Theme Park and it was nothing compared to USS. USS is amazing. Theres many rides, many new shows, many interactive activities and also amazing staff and actors. Even as a local, Ive been to USS no less than 5 times. Every festive seasons, there will always be new shows, new activities, new games and such. Love how every year theres different shows and that they dont really recycle their ideas. Downside is, its a popular theme park so expect long queues and long waiting time. But trust me, its worth every minute. You can even top up for Express pass to skip the queues. Do visit if you have the chance, because its genuinely magical.
Wonderful experiences yesterday. From the membership counter to the rides, the attendants are friendly and patience. Best to go for an Express tickets if you want to skip the queue.
Best experience you can get in Singapore. Do not miss the transformers ride. No matter how long the queue is.

The greatest fun place I have been ever, and its good more than dream world at Thailand. There are many places to have fun here. You may buy an express ticket if its a weekend day you're planning to go. There are much queue over there for many activities. Food and beverages are much expensive inside the universal studio, and its better to take food and water from outside. First find the map of studio from the entrance and start your journey backward , this reduces some queue for many activities. You may go and enter Universal studio exact 10 am to experience whole part. Each and every activity can do in day if you plan and check the wait time in every activity.

We had an amazing experience! We went there early and when the gate opened we headed straight to the transformers ride, which is a good idea, when we finished there was a very long line. The roller coasters were also fun, the lines get long fast so you better prepare to stand or go on a weekday. We were able to enjoy all the rides and shows that the park offer. Bring extra clothes and always drink water the weather is hot.
They are very strict with absurd rules, very poorly organized, a very small park and collapsed due to the excess of express passes that they sell without control. I don't recommend it.
The 55 that has been excessively for what they offer, after opening from 10:00 to 17:00. It should be at most 15 for what they offer. Unacceptable.

I decided to go for Battlestar Galactica for my first ride and had to put my bag in the nearby locker with a time limit expiry. The ride broke down halfway through my queue. In the end, the waiting time which was supposed to be 45 mins came up to be nearly 2 hours as they keep letting express pass holders through instead of clearing those who were stuck during the breakdown. Upon returning to the locker immediately after the ride, it was locked up due to expiry of time limit and I was forced to pay a fine to retrieve my belongings despite trying to explain the situation to the locker crew. There weren't any staff that could redress such issues at the BSG. There weren't any staff available along the way as well and I have to make my way all the way back to the ticket entrance customer service. And there was such a long queue that the usher outside the office advised me to come back later. Basically, it is compulsory to place all your belongings in lockers located near the entrance of thrilling rides. I have seen more than a few riders being sent off because they have stuff inside their pockets just before their turn for the ride. You will definitely be bored to death while queuing more than 60 minutes without your mobile phone and stuff, especially if you are a single rider. So be mentally prepared.

Never miss this if you are a thrill seeker, but to much crowd to stand in a very long queue for several hours For Administration just to give ONE STAR Management to create an appointment system to avoid wasting the Time in Standing on Queues For Tourist who comes for few days wants to enjoy at its maximum but most of these attractions just eating our time
I am extremely disappointed when I visited that most of the fun rides are under repair. There should have been a warning prior to the purchase of my tickets.
Not too bad ut as always lines for attractions too long

Went during off-season, so didnt have to wait long for anything, which was nice. Park is well kept, but considering what it cost to get into the park (and the prices inside), I expected the rides and shows to be much newer.
The park is good, but navigation is a problem. If you plan to visit all the zones, a day is not enough.

Reached around 930am and already packed of people. Recommend to buy ticket online. Although the line is long, only take 15-20m to get in. Better go from morning (short line for rides, around 5m only) on evening waiting time reach 70minutes. However, around noon and up there's a lot of performance and shows. So its good to spend a whole day at there. For muslim, there is prayer room but very small. Halal food is available but pricey (cheapest 15sgd per person) so better bring own food. Lockers are provided almost everywhere with free for 45m.

It is much smaller than Universal City in Japan. Half a day was enough. I think it's empty on weekday mornings. I think the admission fee is high considering its size, but there are rides that are not found in Japan, so you can have a lot of fun.

Had a great time here with my wife. Got there at opening on a Thursday and we went straight for the mummy ride. It was awesome. Did it three times in a row without waiting even one minute. Then went to Jurassic Park for the log ride. Waited an hour and it was pretty disappointing. Then waited an hour for the Battlestar Gallactica Ceylon rollercoaster which was incredible and well worth the wait. Shrek 4d was great fun too. Transformers was amazing with a 45minute wait. Compared to Movie World on the Goldcoast the wait times are nothing! If youre in Singapore with some free time then I would definitely recommend Universal.

A rather small yet nicely themed theme park with some outstanding attractions. Namely: Battlestar Galactica, Transformers the Ride and Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure. The queue times varied between a max of 50 minutes to litterly empty queues. The average wait time during my visit was /- 5 minutes per ride. Looking at the parks history they are adding new attractions regularly. With Battlestar Galactica now reaching an age of 10 years the park is in need of a new thrill-ride to stay relevant for thrillseekers. In my opinion a Spinning-coaster would be a grate addition to the already grate lineup. A rather compact spinning-coaster could fit just perfectly in the upcoming "Minion Park". Universal Studios Singapore is worth visiting during a Singapore stay.
Great experience in USS! My favourite rides would be Battlestar Galactica: Cylon & Transformers The Ride. The Waterworld performance is good.
Amazing rides!!! Great food!!! Beautiful place. Fun atmosphere. Loved all the rides.!

A magical, wonderful and just incredible place. It does get hot in the park during the day so loose clothing would be helpful and there are free water traps all over the park so you don't need to buy water. The shows are highly recommended and so is going there for the full day. Great experience with the lovely and helpful staff.

The rides are average but customer service has plenty of room for improvement. The staff have poor manners and they are clearly not trained. I didn't walk in to expect a Disneyland experience but I certainly didn't expect to walk out feeling like I had been just another chore, another person in the queue to the theme park staff, considering the fact that I had paid 80 to get in. At the raptor meet and greet, a random officer interrupted and snarled "no more!" when I was just telling my husband about the queue for photo. At the Goldilocks eatery, we were given a buzzer for our waffles that never buzzed. 30 minutes later, we went back to the counter and they told us either somebody else took our food or they forgot about our order. So we had to wait another 30 minutes as our 16-month-old toddler grew impatient. At Treasure Hunters, our attempt to take a photo was met with a crass "no photo!" I saw them using similar tone on other visitors, too.

Today I tried calling to universal studio to ask if they are open before making my way there. No one answers the phone and plays only recording of unrelated information. No option to speak to someone, hangs up automatically. Very Poor customer service.
A lot of queue in Universal Studios. Don't recommend this attraction. For now, don't think that there are tourists there anymore.
No hand sanitizer for use. Not all rides are cleaned after use....pls bring your own hand sanitizer and wet wipes.
A main attraction in Singapore which boasts a number of different areas, each with its own theme. Very much like all other theme parks around the world. Expect queues, especially during peak periods!

We didn't like it that much. Were there on Monday and still had to wait up to 80 minutes. And if there are people with express passes, it can take longer. The shows were fine. What we liked best was the show in Waterworld (12:30 and 3:00 p.m.). Phantasialand in Germany is, in our opinion, much better.

I left a little early, but waited in line before entering. Because of the heavy rain, I couldn't go on many rides, but there weren't many people, so the waiting time for the rides was short. However, Universal Studios Osaka seems to be bigger and have more fun rides.

I went today! It was empty, probably due to the influence of Corona. There is almost no waiting time for rides. I conquered the attraction. There are no food-related souvenirs, so the only souvenirs available are things like stuffed animals and keychains. I think I would have enjoyed it more if I could speak English, so I would like to study a little more.
Quite big for an amusement park! But a little (over) crowded
Absolutely amazing. Try all the activities. Queue is long in some areas. But its worth it. Go in the morning and cover the entire park.

Even though the virus is spreading wildly, this means less people go out, which means lesser queues! Either way, at this time, you should get the free 6 month season pass with a one-day ticket! The rides overall are fun, especially my favourite being Battlestar Galactica. It's fun, and both for adults and kids. Definitely recommend a Express pass though. Overall, great and fun, but the things there are a little expensive, so bring your own food and drinks (There are water coolers). Bring a poncho, in case of rain and if you want to ride the Jurassic Rapids Adventure. :)

One of the biggest advantages of universal studios Singapore is it's well planned design of the entire place. All the attractions are situated at the right distance so that it's easy to get around the attractions. The only caveat is the waiting time for each attractions especially the popular ones like the transformers and roller coaster which has one of longest waiting time. My advice would be to go to these attractions right after the park opens or go after the rush hours. Also try not to miss the Waterworld show. I hope my review was helpful to you. Thank you for reading and have a nice day!

It was amazing experience, ride was unique and very fantastic. Don't miss Galcatica Cylon, Galactica Human, Transformers, The Revenge of Mummy amazing...we went in feb end it was very less crowded there was no queue in any rides and don't miss the Water Show its like a short film

Like what people says, it's a must place to visit when you're at Singapore or specially at Sentosa Island. Easy to access from everywhere. It needs a full day to enjoy all the playground. You can start queue from 10 AM 'cause it's always full even in the low season. If you have more cash you can buy the VIP ticket.
The queues are really long and tiring. Rides were nothing really great, the day was awful with waiting in queues with kids under the hot sun.

Not enough rides. Waiting time was too long. Nothing to do while waiting except your phone (if you have one, which you probably have because your using one right now). Only three, four rides were fun. Rest were quite boring unless you arechicken -hearted

Transformer is very good... Although I waited in line for about an hour, there was not enough time to play more times. There were many people in the park, so I couldn't play the entire park. If I have a chance, I will go to the park again and have a great time.
Staff maintained smile and service standard even during Covid-19 situation. The offers for the 6 months ticket is hard to beat but too bad the circuit breaker kicked in.

That's really cool, in Indonesia there are no ceunah You have to use a map of the USS area so you don't get lost and don't go around, it's easy to get to the ride quickly. But just be prepared when you hold a map while walking, there will definitely be lots of strangers who will ask us questions One day is not enough to explore and ride all the rides. One ride can take more than an hour alone, the queue is really big, wow! Even at that time, the queue for Transformers could take 2 hours and Jurassic World 1.5 hours If you have more money, my advice is to use fast track. BTW, there are lots of photo spots guys, for those who prefer to immortalize the moment, don't forget to wear cool ootds and the most important thing is to wear clothes that aren't hot, if possible, bring a hat/umbrella.

really.... It was so much fun! Be sure to go. I went there 3 months ago, and there was an express, but because of COVID-19, there were so few people, so I didn't wait and got on it almost right away!
