I didn't wait right away and got on the popular one where I went to Mummy and Transformers. But there were two downsides! It was hot. It was humid because of the mask... I ended up skipping the express because there weren't too many people
It's a great time to bring your kids here. The only problem is that the famous roller coaster is under maintenance.

I think there cannot be a review left for this place. This is an amazing amusement park, wonderland and best rides ever. I would suggest take a full day to spend and do the rides. Reach here as soon as the park opens. I love the mummy ride. The queue in ride share usually very long. Enjoy your time here.
Its fun, but some facilities have to wait in line for a long time

Arriving at Universal studios it was late, and we were in a hurry because we had to continue our journey to Johor, Malaysia. Maybe it would be better if the photos were during the day/evening and not too late/dark. Don't forget to buy popcorn...thank you see next time
lots of things to see. need more than one day for see full park

Great place. Very beautiful and worthy. The park is not very big. And, unfortunately, we didnt get on any of the attractions due to long queues. I was impressed by the musical or theater on the water, it was cool! The guys are professionals.

Playing major amusement facilities requires you to store all your belongings in lockers, and you will have to pay extra to store them, which is quite expensive. The attitude of the service staff is poor, the rides are old, and when the roller coaster is broken, they actually announce that tourists can continue to wait. I dont know when it will be repaired. I spent money and didnt have fun. I wont go to the place I want to go again. Its a waste of money.

Went first Saturday after re-opening after CB. Complete joke. Werent told when we got our tickets it only opens 2pm onwards (unlike 10am normally). So already had to came back at 2pm. Immediately long queues for every ride. 45min to get on Transformer ride, 40min for Madagascar. They left 2/3rds the seats empty for social distances, which I understand but even within family groups? The worse was the carousel... where they onto used 1 out of 6 seats... !! So families with small kids queuing 30-50min in the hot just to watch an empty carousel going around and around... see the photo I just uploaded... of a MOVIE carousel and a 40min queue... ! In the end we only managed 3 rides in total before coming home for dinner. So unhappy, and really disappointed kids.

They are encouraging you to get tickets but as soon as you get in, youre not allowed entry to any attraction because they say its fully booked- which it is not. Had to convince them that theres no line (which they should be able to see) before they let us in.. such a bad experience
Bubble Bee line up like years, it just too long (more than 2 hours) n there is no way to let people rest their feet. The design of line up so crazy, please make a better arrangement for visitors.
Too crowded. Queue always gets cut by people with premium pass.

A very good tourist attraction as there are many rides but not as many as other universal studios E.G. USJ,USH. But for me personally I have went there many many times so its kind of boring for me but maybe if its your first time it would be fun hopefully and also it has the tallest duelling roller coaster
Fun but long waiting time for some rides food is overpriced
Well managed covid processes. But some rides had very long wait times.
Every ride has such long queues. Waiting under the hot sun is agonising.

Great place to be with family and friends. Its full of fun, great rides. Very crowded place even in weekdays. You can spend an entire day and would still want to come back the next day. For few rides, be prepared to stand in a queue for an hour or more. Not many restaurants though. Very limited food available.

Went there at the beginning of the year in January 2020. The weather is hot and stuffy. It rains regularly The place is very wide. Even if you come on a weekday, you have to queue to enter each point. It is recommended that if you want to play quickly, buy a VIP pass come on weekdays.
Great place, exciting rides. Although they could revamp the place a little; I heard they're planning to renovate next year.
Came during post CB. I appreciate that staff are cleaning the seats after every rider but the same cloth has been used the entire day without wash

RW resorts world is incredibly difficult to deal with and good luck if you need any assistance. Their website is only useful if you're there to drop money. No way to contact any of the hotels. Requested a quote and heard nothing back. Issues with your ticket for a theme park? You'll need to jump through multiple hoops before you can talk to a person on chat to get any assistance. And even them most of the people on the chat are barely helpful or friendly. For a company that boasts first class vacation experience this really falls short.

Just a suggestion,Maybe they should revise their entry fee charges for those below 1.2meter, because they a unable to play most of the ride.. Pay full payment for the tix but can't take the ride. Sad..

Most of the rides are closed. Most of the restaurants also closed. The foodcourt offered local food which I'm local. And they charge almost 60 per adult ticket, I find it overpriced. But kudos to the staff, trying to make this work in the hot sunny humid weather.

Theme park with nice environment and set pieces. Not too crowded early on a Thursday with social distancing (1200-1430; some rides open before 1400), but got more crowded after (1430-1700). Was disappointed that all watercoolers closed (COVID measures) and some technical issues in rides (apparently not a normal occurrence), but customer service rep apologised after email in (1 star). Waiting time for popular rides during social distancing around 50-70 mins, kids rides maybe 20-40 mins.

Went during COVID PHASE II, no queue at most of the attractions during the early openning hours (2pm-4pm), average waiting time around 5-10mins. Btw some places are closed, please do double confirm on the USS app on the attractions available before purchase your tickets :). And cos of the heat, please do bring enough water to hydrate yourself if you dont want to pay too much inside. (Water cooler out of service due to COVID or some other reason)

Back again after a few months because I bought the half season pass. Playing pretend to be tourist in own country on a weekday has its perks as crowd is much thinner, mostly due to COVID-19. Interestingly, where we didnt see a lot of people, the rides are chock full of them as the waiting time stretches up to 1.5 hrs to 2 hrs, notably due to social distancing and limited number of people can get on the rides due to enforcement of distancing. It is a good thing actually. Kudos to the staff for diligently wiping down every seat and cabin whenever each ride is completed. Timed tickets have to be issued for certain rides as they are overwhelmingly popular. Good idea though as it spaced out the crowd but at the same time created additional long queues to get the tickets.

I went on 8/10. I was told that I could enter the park with a ticket that would allow me to enter the park from 12:00, and that I could ride the rides from 2:00 pm, but some of them actually started operating from around 1:30 pm. Although there are quite a few people inside the park, the number of people who can ride the attractions is strictly limited, so when popular attractions like Revenge of the Mummy get a little crowded, the wait times can get much longer. Since there are only a limited number of attractions in operation, I finished most of the rides and returned home around 4pm, but I think it's the only time there aren't many people, so that was a good thing.
Beautiful place but the queue tho especially during the phase 2 season is ridiculous. 70/80 mins queue to enjoy a ride that lasts 1-2 mins definitely aint worth it.

A lot attractions are closed and there is safe distancing in all rides. This means reduced capacity and looooong Q. Say wait 30min... I wait 50min. Cannot read clock Universal Studio? Also no shows and not many street performances. I think best wait phase 3 or go weekday.

a very exciting entertainment place, it could even be an alternative tourist destination for all ages.... lots of interesting places with good views... I highly recommend taking the Transformers ride even though the queue will be long.... for food, friends, you can buy it inside the USS, some of the prices are quite high but there are also many that are delicious and comparable to the price at the food court and some even have themes...
The best experience in the world. The water show is great. The dance show is awsm. The rides are really good.

I was impressed by how they will sanitize the seats and safety bar and belt after every use. Theres gap in between the ride. Social Distancing ambassador was everywhere, the food place has crowd controlled. Theres sanitizer everywhere. Awesome job to the workers there! Even with the longer waiting time but id rather be safe!
Well everybody love the theme park.It's kind of special because I got to enjoy it with my grandchildren and it not crowded due to Covid things.Not much visitors from outside the country.
Its fun but you have to wait till 12.00p.m to go in and have to wait for another 2h to go on the rides other that that it was hot and the food was AMAZING

Practically half the attractions are closed. Extremely inaccurate queue time estimation. The sign shows 70 minutes for The Mummy, placed bags in a locker with 120 minutes grace period but the queue eventually took 135 minutes. This cost us 6 per locker. Huge waste of our day and money overall. Spending 59/pax to queue 1-2hrs per ride.

Waiting time is very high. They will tell 40 mins, but take at least one and half hour for each ride and later they will announce due to technical difficulty ride is closed, after we wait so long in queue...Waste of money...

Long queues with at least waiting time of 1hr and more for most adult rides. Despite the high cost for entry tickets, you have to force yourself to top up to get the express pass to enter another queue around half the waiting time for the rides. You will know what i mean when you dont want to disappoint your kids or when you are trying to impress your new gf on a trip to this place...
They are not allowing to convert one day ticket into season pass due to COVID, their website also doesn't have notice of unavailability of season pass.
Not as worth it anymore. Lots of the attractions closed due to the restrictions. Especially as an annual pass holder with the express pass add-on.
Pretty good theme park with a lot of rides to be kept entertained.
Just okay. When we went there some of the rides was not working

Here by accident! But it was fun and relieving during these times of no travel. Many of the attractions were closed due to government restrictions, however the queue times are much shorter compared to peak period. Enjoy!
Enjoyable moment with friends if you don't mind killing your legs for a day and exchanging your soul for the rest of the night. Some rides are unavailable like the cylon roller coaster.
Nice food but some of the regular customers adherence to the anti-Covid-19 measures are questionable.
Great place. Fun rides almost no lines. Some shows no happening because of Covid but still fun
I loved it. Although it's little crowded but it's worth waiting the most irritating part is few of the rides are closed for ever. Overall good experience..

It was raining the whole day, some of the rides are not operating due to the weather condition, but overall, the hospitality with the fully safety measurement it makes me more confident to enjoy the rides and gives me a different experience.

Exciting theme park with 5 different sectors to explore, food is pretty expensive which is normal. Got tickets to go in at a discount too! I love the human and cyclone roller coasters! Could take them 3-4 times in a row without getting sick Great for first and second timers, thereafter it will get boring as the rides are the same
Such a long line for each attraction with unreliable weather. For one day pass without the Express pass, you will be lucky if you can make more than half of the attractions.

0 Stars if possible terrible experience, too many people crammed into this park. Seems like the park does this deliberately so they can upsell express tickets which go for 80 extra per person on top of entrance fees. Everyride you have to wait 1 to 2 hrs not worth time and money. Food is sub par for price because of so many people everthing premade and left on food counter everything cold before you eat. All food court everthing is well worn and dirty needs update soon. Forever fighting crowds impossible to take photos. Worst place in Singapore, don't recommend.
such a disappointed management. as during phase 2 uss should limited amount of visitor so that queuing are not more that 20 min. 2 pm reach there only 3 game ..so bad management

The waiting time is too long. Almost every attraction has to queue for more than an hour. Especially for Ancient Egypt, the queue alone takes more than an hour and a half. I dont know if I spent 81 just to play or to queue. It is recommended that those who dont like queuing can buy fast-pass tickets. Even if they are expensive, they are worth it. At least the queuing time for playing facilities will be reduced a lot, and it will not be impossible to finish the entire ride in a whole day. This is a waste of money and time. Ordinary ticket. In the current situation, some amusement facilities are also closed, so it is really not worth the price.
Missing USS!! with COVID around family doesn't want to go :(

If u came here 10 years before, it should be the best experience and best technology. But 10 years past everything is the same, the screen shows spots and seems to be blur, even thousands of people still come here for some reasons, it's far more worse than the Universal Studio in other countries.

it was cool! wish I cud tell you guys dat it was fantastic, but sadly it wasnt... its still so fun to be there though, with limited attractions, hot weather, and long queue The Mummy, Transformer, and Jurassic Park are somehow worth to queue for the food also wasnt bad. I had lunch at Mel's Drive In, ordered Burgers, Float, and Softdrink (bottles included). the portion was huge and taste good wouldnt mind to be back, but need to wait promos

Always a joy. Queues weren't exactly long, but because of covid measures, waiting time was longer than expected. Rides were seating at half capacity or less. Food was overpriced as expected, but the Halloween free treats that were being given out generously was a nice touch. Definitely a must to go at least once.
It's busy because there's no corona yet, the ticket queues at all the entertainment venues are long

Went there a few times. The Halloween show was not that great only seat outside the floor and given some candies and biscuits, not much shop open and no need to queue at all. Very quiet, the hotel Equarius wasn't that great either. Prefer to go back to hard rock next time.

not crowded at all on a sunday, probably due to the advanced reservation required. we didn't have to wait for more than 25 mins for each ride. no shows and no parades though. the kids did manage to get many packets of ribena pastilles as part of meet and greet sessions for halloween.
Always FUN! FUN! FUN! @ USS. Now due to pandemic, it's more organised and lesser people so you'll be able to spend more time on rides than queues.

Lots of people but a great place to hang out. It is best to go as close to opening time as possible. Re-entry is possible. When you leave, if you say you're coming back, a separate sign is provided, and you check the sign when entering.
Compared to Univa in Japan, it's very empty. I arrived around 2:00pm or 3:00pm. I was able to ride all the vehicles.

During the epidemic prevention period, ticket prices are discounted, and there will not be too many holiday crowds. Although it is Halloween, activities that will gather crowds have been cancelled, and there is not much festive atmosphere. The facilities will start at 2 p.m., and people will queue up to keep distance. Even during the facility period, the epidemic prevention situation is good. At the end of the day, we can leisurely explore all the facilities (Shrek Theater and Water World are not open)
long queue, staffs lack of enthusiasm to operate rides which further lengthen the waiting time
Due to social distancing, expect to queue at least 45mins for all rides.. There are no live shows and food cart in operations. Be prepared for the minimal food choices and merchandise stores!
Long but moving queues that require some time to get to the rides. Good to make a couple of return trips to experience all rides. Not advisable to rush for all rides.

I took my niece for her first trip to universal studios yesterday and she enjoyed herself throughly and I felt that the overall experience was pleasant but it could be better to lower the volume of the special effects for rides as she did mention that it was too loud. I do agree with her regarding this and even as an adult it was too loud for me and therefore it could have been overwhelming for young children who are more sensitive to sounds. We look forward to visiting it again.
The rides here are cool, especially the transformers one, but it usually has a long queue.
Performances are still closed, most of the restaurants are not operating. However the only good thing is that they had repaired the little things happening during the rides.

No more face cast, for now. Lots of mascot photo taking opportunities. Not much people during weekdays. Rides waiting less than 30mins. Many stores are closed, except for the main stores near the entrance. Feels less festive, though it is still fun.

The place is a wonderful experience for all types of people. I went there with my family and joyed all the rides specially rollercoasters , sisimpur ride, transformer show. This is a must visit place if you visit Singapore. Try to enter in such a way so that you also can spend the evening time here. There are long queue for some of the rides, so please keep some buffer time. If you have children with you you may get some priority line and some rides/shows are not allowed for the children below specific age.

Very nice park, universal style. Very friendly staff and free lockers during the queue period. The park is not particularly large and the attraction in front of the mummy is definitely not up to par. Transformer and the mummy absolutely at the top. We hope for future expansions. Definitely worth visiting
Worth a visit on a weekend. Even tho it was packed, the staff was more than capable in handling the crowds to provide a fun yet safe experience.

A bit small for a theme park, as you can walk one round within 30 mins. Very long queue for the rides even though there wouldn't be any tourist and queued for the Transformer for more than 90mins already killed me to queue for other popular rides. The most memorable was the Mr Frankenstein, as I didn't want to queue up for photos, so I took a photo from far, but being a true professional, he spotted my intention and waived at me. 5 stars for that!
Friendly and responsible staff, well-maintained rides
Don't bother going. Poor crowd management with queue times over 2 hours. Also screw up with third party booking platforms with misleading booking information. Do not go USS and Do not book via Klook

One of the horrible experience one can have of amusement park!! Went with family spending 180. Lots of people! (Dont they count the number of tickets issued). No water dispenser working. Most of the ride waiting time of more than 75min. Hardly could sit in 3-4 rides. Studio authorities robbing off people the privilege SG government giving to locals. Decided not to visit this horrifying place again nor recommend it to anyone..

horrible experience. went to human roller coaster, and was told at 5 separate times there was a BRIEF delay. the was told twice that the ride has resumed. they got everyone on the ride and i was at the front of the line. once agin was told that there was a brief delay. after waiting for an hour, it was finally announced that there was a problem, and that we were welcomed to wait longer. 1, why did they have to wait for so long before announcing? why have us sit on the floor, the tell us that there was a problem only after so long. 2, why was more info not given? it was announced that there would only be a brief delay. im sorry, but one hour is not a brief delay. after i left, i realised that all the more exciting rides were closed as there were issues. even small rides like the elmo ride, or the madagascar crate adventure had a 30-45 minute queue. in the four hours i was here, i could only ride two rides, both being rides meant for 5 year olds. save your money. dont come.

I had a TERRIBLE time trying to request a different day for the online ticket I'd purchased for my son. On 10 December, I purchased a ticket for my son for 21 December. I got busy and didn't book a date for myself. I'm an annual pass holder; there's a different calendar we book from. On 20 December, I tried to book a time slot for myself for 21 December. To my dismay, only 5pm entry was left. I tried to call or email Universal Studios/Resorts World to ask them if I could change my son's ticket to a different day. That's where my nightmare began. Hour after hour, throughout the whole night - 2.30am, 3.30am, 4am, 5am, I was emailing back and forth. Each time, a different staff member replied me. I was being shunted from staff member to staff member. One even was dismissive of the whole issue and tried to tell me to check my junk email folder from time to time, in case the confirmation email had been sent there. As if I'd just started using email yesterday! Finally, I went into the park with my son at 5pm, because I didn't want to forfeit his ticket. We only managed a couple of rides, because the park was too full. My experience with Resorts World Sentosa was terrible.

Let me give me real advice as of my experience from visiting universal studios sg on december. It is a no go place and the worst place to visit in Singapore during this holidays . I had to wait for 2 hours for literally every single ride. The fact that u have to pay a lot. It is not worth the price. There are a total of 20 rides. I stayed from 12pm to 6pm and I got to go on only 4 rides only. I spent 5h 40 mins on just waiting in lines. If u want to really enjoy some rides, u can go to places like wild wild wet and if u visit sentosa try to avoid universal studios. It is a no go. Only go there if u have a express pass
the place i been to USS is okay. need to buy express ticket to access faster because is very long queue

The place was crowed probably due to the Singapore Rediscover Voucher. Heavy downpour in the middle of our visit and not many shelters around. Many people flocked into Mummy attractions and end up queuing 2 hours in wet cloth. No stuff to monitor the social distancing on the extended queue. People were literally standing toe to toe. I was too navie to put my phone in the locker as instructed. Could not recall how I survived 4 hrs queuing without a phone. Many other experienced folks just have their phone with them and still were allowed to ride. Why do they have such instructions in the first place? Or can't they adjust the process to be more reasonable? All the attractions were pretty crowded even we visited on a weekday. Enjoyed a few rides but could not conclude as a pleasant trip overall.
crowded on weekends. Most of the popular rides wait at least mitre than 45 min. Weekdays are ok still crowded.
Fun rides but would be better if they can stagger the timing to meetup with the characters so it would make more sense to walk in a particular route so as to meet with as many characters as possible.

The queue takes forever, I spent an hour lining at one, and another hour at another site. Don't go on a rainy day as many outdoor activities won't open, and indoor activities has too many people waiting in the line. And the queue walk doesn't have any place to rest or sit... too tiresome... except if you really want to go. However, the roller coasters are super fun. The cylon and human are the best.
Great rides. Long queue. One of the rides broke down mid way. Otherwise wouldve been a perfect trip. Still pretty awesome

I love this place.. no matter how many times do I visit here. A perfect weekend outing for fun lovers and ride enthusiasts! Kids are crazy about this place.. so am I! Lol Try the hamburger at the new eatery junction "Drive in"...yumm. Due to covid, park timings are changed now.. its 2 to 9pm. Do book a slot in advance before going. Only one set back.. No renewals for annual pass holders these days. So if the pass has expired.. you have to buy a day ticket to enter everytime you plan to visit, till further notice.

Lock down or no lockdown, my family has a good time at USS. We did almost all the rides, because the hours of shortened. But that said, the experience at every ride was as what we expected. Awesome! Kudos to the people there who continue to hold their head high, and make things work. Well done! I thank you all.

The staff is extremely friendly. Despite the rain, they accommodated the whole lot of the crowd very well. We had a lot of fun at USS. Definitely get the 60 add on express pass if you want to take all the rides in a day. Each queue is like 60-100mins via normal pass!

Great rides for kids. Too long for the queue. 1 thing that frustrates me is that we queued for the mummy ride for almost 2hrs in the end didnt get to ride it as my child is abit shorter. Didnt mind that my child is short for the ride as it is for the child safety but would appreciate the staff to measure the height of the child before we start to queue like other rides. Needed to pay extra for the locker as i exceeded the timing to collect my bags when i was queueing. That part really frustates me. Overall great atmosphere and a fun day with great and friendly staff.

Safe distancing measures are okay. But some people still dont follow especially when lining up. Rides have 30-40 mins waiting time. Most of the attractions are closed and they did not provide any info on which attractions will be closed while buying the ticket and not even indicated on the ticket itself. Yes the ticket is 66 only but they should've informed that most of the attractions are closed. F&Bs are closed! Only Mels diner is open and the italian resto near the sesame street area the rest are closed. Snack bar booths are open. Air purifiers are visible in Human and Transformers line area. Had two 5 retail voucher as well but we are not allowed to combine it so you need to have two separate receipts and can only be used with a mastercard.

Been coming here off and on since 2013. They are not even showing the waiting room pre-show entertainment anymore, at Lights Camera Action and Shrek 4D. So disappointing. At least Transformers the Ride is still as good as before, but you can really see the whole place needs some maintenance.

The rides kept breaking down and they recommend guests to try and explore other rides. However, upon queueing for the other rides, they also broke down. These left us riding only 3-4 rides and we were here for 7 hours. Only one of which is the popular one. This is rather disappointing. If only the rides can be as efficient as other countries. Jiayou singapore!
The roller coaster is broken
Waited more than an hour for 4D Shrek experience. USS also stopped showing preview of the show. Overall experience is very mich reduced
Had a fun day at universal studios but due to covid lot of the usual attractions were closed which was a bummer. Love the transformers and mummy ride!
It was fun but the queue is too long, it's nice to try once. Merchandise is a bit pricey but I think that's normal. Love the Jurassic park
Rides are interesting, exhilarating. However, the wait times are really a drag. Food and drinks are exorbitant!
There are many interesting areas. The queues take a lot of time, maybe up to several hours, you need to buy an Express Pass Ticket if you want to have enough time for 5-6 games/visit.
long queues despite controlled numbers because of social dostancing measures on some rides but it was still fun !

I love theme parks and I had USS season pass awhile back. I visited the park often and had so much fun! Definitely eat before going so youll have full energy for the rides. The prices at Sentosa in general is high for bring your own water too. Sometimes, the waiting time might be a little long so stock up on entertainment. Whether be it your mobile phone or friends, a little entertainment could make the wait more tolerable. The only bad thing is that its small. I would love to be able to experience more but for a small country like Singapore, its good enough :)
Superb place for kids and adults. Fun for everyone. The wait for the ride depends. For Transformers ride you can wait for 80mins! Food is pricey but overall it is worth it.

It's a very great place!!! This theme park features movie-themed rollercoasters, rides and attractions. You can meet some of your favourite cartoon, movies characters. It has many zones and each zone have their own themed rides, shows, shops, restaurants and street entertainment. The staff are very nice. I have a lot of fun and Im glad to have an experience in this place. But its a pity that I cant try every rides because of the crowded. The park get very busy especially at peak times. If you go to Singapore, dont miss a chance to visit Universal Studios Singapore!
Had a great time at universal studios singapore. Would recommend you check the list of rides and attractions which are open now during covid because when we went lot of things were still shut.

Ive been here so many times, its always been a 5-star rated attraction. I dont get it why many people complain or give a bad rating. I went USS on 29 dec and it was super peak. U cant expect the park on that day to be very loose and a 5 min waiting time on attractions(?). if u cant wait, get an express! & its super understandable that some rides are closed down or the hours is cut short. I am still grateful that we are still able to enjoy whilst in the midst of Pandemic. i understand the hassle of having to buy the ticket first, then to book time slot online before entering. I understand the need to have Safe Distancing Ambassadors making sure we wear masks and maintaining our distancing. Its hard for them to manage on that day but i can see how hard they are working! I was only able to get on 2 rides BUT it was worth it. Because with the vouchers,i get to finally enjoy after months of staying home
Having twice interruptions in one day due to technical issue for 2 different facilities, wasting to queue for nothing. Had a bad experience.
Queued for more than two hours, equipment was broken, terrible experience
Was in the queue for 2 rides for more than 1 hour. Ended up the rides had technical difficulties and was told to queue for other rides instead. Wasted 2 hours queuing.
Little boring due to COVID measures. Many shows are closed. Missing post covid USS.
If you Don't have a VIP pass, you will spend the day only on long queues.

During the covid recovery period, all shows are closed. All the rides are still open though! There's also lots of character interactions! Do take note that there are no water dispensers working so its probably better to bring your own drinks. Might be better than buying soft drinks for the whole day. There's also re-entry allowed so you can go out to have a meal before coming in if the food inside is not to your liking. Do inform the exit staff you will be re-entering. Bring umbrellas if its the rainy season. Rain coats not recommended as you will still need to take it off when going for rides. Taking it off and putting it on repeatedly when going for rides is a hassle. It opens until pretty late at night, but basically during dinner time the crowds almost dissipate. If going during peak periods, it is recommended to get express pass. 5 mins per ride is very different from 1-2hrs per ride! You can even take the same ride 6-7 times if so desired. But since you can always buy passes on the spot, you can use your normal ticket, look at the crowd condition on the actual day, then decide if you want to buy express. Hope the above tips helps everyone have a great time there!
The waiting time is not as bad as i had expected. The service was great

Fun place to be for all ages. Beautiful architectures and themes for photography. Depending on what day you plan to go, because the queue can get crazy. I waited 2 hours for the Mummy ride, 1 hour for Madagascar, an hour and a half for Jurassic Rapids ride. Almost all rides average about an hour of waiting time. The rides are fun, if you are willing to spend more on Universal Express Pass aka No Waiting Time.
It was not so crowded due to pandemic. But there were many f&b outlets also closed. So, there are pros and cons. Less waiting time, but activities are limited.

It only opens Thursday to Sunday now when we visited on a Thursday in Feb 2021. The queues were mostly short for the rides. Depending on where you buy your tickets, you might have the option to redeem for a sesame Street bag and corn dog. We were disappointed that the corn dog ran out of stock early and was substituted with chicken nuggets. The sesame Street bags look pretty useless too. Rides start at 2pm but you should be able to go in at noon for photo taking and restaurants. Fireworks, live shows and 4D rides are suspended at the moment due to COVID. Parking at resort world sentosa is now cheaper at 6 per entry.
Awesome experience! Love the ride, love the ambience, great service!!

It was an amazing and beautiful experience i have ever had, the only tiring thing is that you have to wait in the queue for long time hence you cannot explore the whole place in a day. Merchandise is a bit pricey but I think that's normal. Love the Jurassic park and the Mummy. Well maintained.
TAT on each ride is very high due to crowd - try not to go over weekends or holidays. It is made beautifully- loved it

Went to Universal Studios Singapore last weekend. Despite the rides only starting from 2pm onwards, we managed to get onto all the rides we want and the good thing was the very short waiting time. Most rides, even the popular ones, only needed at most 10 minutes of queue. USS did a good job in maintaining safe distancing during the queuing process.
Less people to go in this period. The BSG Human and Cylon is the best ride in this park. The cons is quite pricy for the food inside the park. You can reentry after get food outside of park.
Too crowded at one time and poor service?
Poor services

Everything is fun except their decision to assign staff at the entrance of two sci-fi rides to not let anyone enter if they have phones, instead of telling everyone to place their belongings in the shelf beside the ride (which we put our other items in the shelf for our ride anyways). This forces the guests to pay for lockers even if they already paid for the outside of main entrance lockers. The positive side to this is the used to be over an hour waiting line was only 20 minutes because of all the guests they denied.
Waiting time for station is terrible

How I wanted to come here, not even for the attractions, but in general to see what interesting things the Singaporeans had put up here. But alas, the rain ruined all plans, although the first half of the day was a success - we took a ride on a megazip and just walked around Sentosa, it was hot and the sky was clear) but as soon as we crossed the turnstile of the park, thunder struck) the rain continued for 3 hours, it just got dark, and there was nothing to see) so as not to completely waste our time sitting in the shelter, we reached the transformers in small dashes, stood for about 40 minutes in queue to play around in virtual reality glasses for 5 minutes, then bought raincoats and went out into the rain to look for what else works) Jurassic Park was open, dinosaurs are even more spectacular in the dark) in general, plan your time correctly! And dont worry about the priority pass, youll save a lot of time!
Good, long queuing though probably due to covid so can be expected. Was actually not that busy but still had to queue 40mins on average.
Nice rides but long queues. The wait is longer than the ride.

Overall this isn't a bad theme park. But it's so small compared to those overseas, tickets are overpriced, and the app that tells you the wait time for rides is not accurate. Food options are really not healthy and pretty expensive. But that's what you'd expect for all theme parks I guess.

Due to the social distancing measures, some of the shows were cancelled. Did not have to wait too long due to the smaller crowds. A huge pity that I couldn't extend my seasonal pass due to Covid19 situation though.
Able to enter at 1pm but the queue to the rides are still long.. waiting time for transformer is 2hrs long :(
What an amazing place! We visited before Covid era. There were long queues for almost all rides. We were lucky enough to experience the Terminator ride. It was awesome
Very good rides. Do not miss the transformer ride. Jurassic ride also very good. There will be long queues. Programs with long queues will be worth it.
Fun place..Must Go! Get on all the rides. Must also be patient waiting time could be more than 20 mins
A happy and fun place for everyone. Queues can be managed in a better manner to avoid long waits.

Fun, entertaining and exciting rides to choose from. Really nice staffs and queue management there. The crowd there was tremendous, I would suppose it's due to the March School Holidays period and furthermore people are utilizing their Singaporr Rediscover Vouchers which caused the overwhelming crowd within the facility. Overall I would day they managed the queue well with proper SDM in place to ensure minimal breach.

Very crowded. Long queue for each attracton. Terribly long time to wait, 1(one) hour for each attracton and this is not weekend or holiday. Waste of time. No sitting arrangements. Aircon and COVID restrictions well arranged.

Having been to Universal Studios Orlando, this one was smaller with limited experiences. The worst experience was the water. They have closed all water coolers and we had to buy 4 water tetra packs (500 ml) wish they provide water to guests.
Cylon ride stopped and had to pay 6 extra for locker services that was minutes overdue... disappointing service and rides

I used to come here to play here when I was a kid. It was really fun. It was fun and beautiful. But two years ago, I noticed that it had changed. Some of the dinosaurs in the dinosaur theme were broken. I went to play and he was broken. I went to play again next month, but it still wasnt repaired. When I went to play again, he was still not repaired. Its true. I play every month (two years ago), Autobot theme. Some screens were broken. When I went to play alone, I found that the screen was black. I was a VLP at the time, but I was just helpless. If I were an ordinary tourist, I believe he would have refunded the ticket directly. In short, there are many equipments that are broken, some are broken, some are broken, some are broken, and some are broken.

Why only open at 2pm when the sun is blazing, and only Thursdays through Sundays. It seems to me to create artificial demand so the park and rides operate at a certain capacity always. I wish it was like lesser known theme parks overseas where rides are walk up and wait for the next turn. Not a queue of minimum 40min. With ticket prices like this already, why cant one make a beeline for Battlestar roller coasters, do 5 consecutive runs, and be out of USS within 1.5hours? Instead, every ride has a queue of at least 30min, and the ride lasts all of 5min. And the lack of drinks station is unbelievable. To buy drinking water, the queue is the same as those ordering food(?!) very long. Why not place vending machines throughout the park, or drinks-only stands. Made worse by the opening time of 2pm, possible heat injury is a real danger! I know this is an attraction, so would pay up to 10 for a 500ml bottle of drinking water, if only there were more stands selling them to ensure no queue for drinks.

Quick queues, free lockers but required renewing, some rides getting abit old and jerkyish. Sadly not many family friendly rides, multiple fast rides instead. Food was decent, but somewhat expensive. Roadside stalls not open, but its expensive as well.

Standard Entry with a one-day ticket (in 2021) is 66, but Singapore Rediscovers vouchers can be used to offset most of it. I went on a drizzly Thursday afternoon in April, which meant that there was little or no queues for many of the rides. The longest queue I experienced was around 30 minutes for the Transformers ride, which I visited around 3pm. The wait was alright because the queue passed through various chambers with exhibits & panels before the ride itself. I revisited the Transformers ride at 7pm, and this time there was no queue. A small part of the Universal Studios complex is sheltered (the New York and Sci-Fi sections) in case of rain. There are also numerous indoor rides around. The most thrilling rides are both outdoor Battlestar Galactica rides, and the Mummy indoor ride. There are some other relaxing rides that are more suitable for young children, or those not inclined for thrills. Food & drink is extremely expensive within USS. Do note that ALL the water coolers are not operating (as at April 2021). To get around this, you can consider stashing your own food & drink in your bag to bring into the park. Alternatively, exit the park and ask for a hand stamp for re-entry, before heading out to a 7-11 store or similar places for a quick drink. All in all, not too bad an experience to temporarily feel like you are outside Singapore.
Good place. But due to covid many show is not showing

Die to Covid-19 have to book time slot then can enter. And it only opens on Thursday to Sunday and normal ticket only can be enter at 2pm but 1:30pm it allowed us to enter. Quite a lot of eateries never open even those kiosks too. Only certain crowded area for example Ancient Egypt Revenge of the Mummy ride, Transformer 3D ride. Never expected weekday also so crowded. Overall experience is good but am cannot endure the waiting times especially Sci-Fi City Transformers ride waited and completed in 2 hours,is really!!! The Mummy ride also since 2pm waiting time 90mins till 6pm still 90mins So we decided skip it. Another cons was the pricing of snacks. Fried Chicken fingers in a cup cost 7 and a canned drink cost 4.

Went on a Saturday, crowd was manageable. Supposed to get in at 2pm but they let us in earlier at 1.30pm. Rides started at 1.45pm, managed to get on 4-5 rides before the waiting time increased to 30 mins on average. The longest wait was Mummy, 60 mins. Transformers was 90 mins during peak but wait out the crowd, around 6pm the waiting time was only 5 mins. Around 8pm, there's practically no waiting time for most rides since it's almost closing.
Great experience here. Battlestar Galactica was a great thrilling ride. Waiting times not too long even on a Sunday.

Awesome place with a lot of attractions.. prepare to wear light as the afternoon sun will get a little hot. During the covid period opening hours at slightly later. On saturday its 2pm and closes at 9pm. PRO tip, come later and enjoy lesser waiting time late into the day. Cooler weather too.
Staff was extremely nice today n professional. Love my experience today..
Love roller coasters!! transformer n mummy rides!! so fun!! Sad many restaurants are closed. Water world also closed.

It's a good place to either release stress with friends or enjoy a family time together. Most of the attractions is great as the theme of each ride corresponds with each area. Lines are not long if you wait till the evening. It is also surprisingly empty as most people do adhere to social distancing measures. It's best to wait after covid ends as most if not all the attractions will be operating. With my review, I hope that it will help you in planning your day for your trip.
Most rides were closed and each ride has an estimated waiting time of 60 mins. Food is terrible and overpriced.

Are the park photographers paid per quota? They waited for us then told us they will take pictures with no obligations and we could take a look at the pictures at the end of the day at the shop. We also decided to take photos with Optimus Prime during the day. At the end of our day we went to the shop to look at our photos. The barcode had the wrong photos. The staff was helpful to find our photos. When we finally saw our photos we were shocked. The first photographer told us the Hollywood sign was the main attraction of the shot BUT HE CUT THE SIGN OFF IN THE PICTURE. For the photographer taking the pictures with Optimua Prime, it was crooked and really disappointing. I hope the park gets better photographers or dont bother with the service as it was a waste of time.
Disappointed that all the shows are cancelled, including outdoor ones. Many of the food courts are closed too
Most of the place close at 5pm lousy

good experience! went on a saturday and queues were very manageable 5mins for human and cyclone, max i waited was 45mins for rapid adventures (which was closed until evening time due to technical faults) downsides: water coolers turned off so either bring several bottles or buy a 200ml water carton from them for 4 dollars food options were also limited, on the expensive side and not that nice

Universal Studios is a theme park with many rides many attractions and many food choices, but usually very crowded before COVID. ticket prices are fine unless paying for whole family, which will be expensive. It is nice place, should come here and enjoy the fun
Pros - reduced venue capacity makes it easy to get onto rides on the weekends. Cons - a minority of staff and/or safe distance ambassadors here shout at guests to "remind" them.

Not really my environment but it's an interesting experience for once. Some of the rides are great, such as the Mummy and the Transformers. If you don't like queuing, just walk around and board on the rides with less waiting.

If you go during a weekday, you'll find that it's not too crowded these days. And even during the peak hours the average wait time for the most popular rides is 30/40minutes. The downside is that many of the restraunts are shut within because of the reduced footfall.

I had been here multiple times over the years. First time since this whole Covid situation. Some attractions were closed. Was quite disappointed that the Donkey show was not on and a couple of food places are closed too. Food and drinks are still easily purchased around the park. Majority of the rides were open and there were not much queue. Everyone had their mask on and practiced safe distancing around the park. In general the place was not as packed as before covid. Still had a fantastic time though. Took pictures with the mascots, can't stand next to them anymore, so just had to angle the camera. Appreciate the staff for keeping the ambiance lively and happy despite this whole covid restrictions.

Manageable crowds on a Saturday afternoon. Staff were helpful and engaging. Enough rides and attractions to keep you occupied until the evening. Rapids Adventure at Jurassic Park malfunctioned, but was fixed before 7pm allowing us to take the ride, which ended up being the best one for the day. Lots of fun.

I was there on my birthday in August and loved it despite the (sometimes long) waiting times. The staff is friendly, it's designed super cool and the rides are fun. If you're not a roller coaster fan, there's still a lot to see. For example, if you are waiting for people, you can also go to the beach nearby.
Wonderful day to go. It was not very crowded and waiting time for the popular rides were relatively fast. The popular rides are cylon and the mummy rides.

absolutely terrible experience. minimum 1h queue for most rides when the park claims to have 50% capacity. queued 1.5h for transformers ride until the park started announcing technical difficulties, end up the ride had to close leaving so many people disappointed. will not visit again until the situation improves.

Bad experience after all. Queuing time is just extremely long. Can take up to 2.5 hours. We hated for Transformers rider for 100 minutes then they announced that they experience some technical difficulties and foresee an extended time delay. Since everyone in the queue already waited for quite some time, people are naturally reluctant to leave the queue and miss the other rides as well. Then we queue for another ride and here we go again. The same technical difficulties! We pay for a ticket for admission yet we get hard time to redeem the service. I'd like to get a refund for this malfunctioned rides and overcrowded facility.
Queue so long. Minimum 35 mins. Even worse, queue 30 min to get a drink. No water refilled available. Terrible.
Staff unknowledgeable about the parc, many attractions under maintenance and restaurants closed while price is identical... Unfair and unethical. This clearly reflects that only counts. Sad, very sad

Going to USS is such a disappointment. Most of the food stores were closed, and many of the attractions too. They dont inform you that certain rides have different operating times. Mummy till 5PM Transformers till 7PM Human & Cylone ride is under maintenance. Waterworld is closed, the Steven Spielberg show is closed as well. My friends & I didnt know that the rides were only operating till certain schedules. As it wasnt stated anywhere on the brochure or notice board. We did not know and we blindly went to the other rides, spending a long time queuing up. We missed out on the good stuff. Lets face it, only the Mummy Human & Cylone ride are the best rides in USS. Yet we couldnt get on them. Its really disappointing. There was a free snack which are just chicken nuggets. My friends boyfriend couldnt eat it as hes a vegan so he was really hungry for the entire period of time. We felt really bad as well since there wasnt any vegetarian food for him. The water dispensers were all turned off as well. So youd be forced to buy the 5 water. There should be a sign on the USS website stating what rides are closed, and the other rides that are still operating, their schedules. So people can plan their trip appropriately and instead we just slowly strolled around without knowing all the crucial information. Only go if youre ok with the kiddy rides, Long queues, watered down experience, hot weather & mask wearing for the whole time.
A lot of rides were closed. :(

When I went there in December around New Year Festival, it's crowded with many tourists. It's many rides there and need to wait too much time to reach your turn. One of my favourite ride is Transformers and mummy rides. It's so real and feels so good. If you want to go there, please check weather. If it will rain, it is better not to go there. Some rides stop due to weather condition. Please bring umbrellas or extra clothes.

Honestly I am disappointed, so many of the major rides/attraction were close!! What a waste of time. Some of the rides queue were long nvm understandable BUT the opening hours of some rides is damn short, so hard to squeeze within the time frame. Based on info from friends and family, it seems like always got at least 1 ride under maintenance when we visit. It was nice that there was free nuggets that came with my klook voucher, but I hope that USS will consider having vegetarian option for the free snacks, Thank you.
Few rides not open. Waiting times is around 1hr for a rides don't recommend visiting during school holidays or public holidays

The social distancing ambassadors were good at reminding people for the safety measures. We got caught taking picture with no mask on, but we were having chicken nuggets at that time Overall, we had fun at Universal Studios Singapore with lesser crowd

I came in early pandemic, before circuit breaker in Singapore...and it's so very quiet...I can play almost all attraction and games, without queue.... I hope this pandemic ended faster, so I can come again to this place.....really missed Singapore...

I was near the end of the line before the show opened, but the show opened a little early. It was a weekday, so there weren't many people, so it was perfect. There is no waiting for Hamunaptra in the deep attack. I had to wait 60 minutes for Transformers, but I think I got it in about 45 minutes. I also got Shregg 4D easily. Is the restaurant also a popular bakery? There was a long line, but everything else was fine. UNIVA is small and easy to get around, and there are attractions that you can enjoy that are not found in Japan.

As for covid period, this place is great to visit. Every ride requires less than 15min of wait and there arent many people around. However alot of food shops and souvenir shops were closed. The human and cyclone ride was closed as well. Indoor shows were also closed. So if you don't mind not going for those, go on and visit!
Too crowded. Lots of kiosk restaurants and rides are closed. You pay for queuing hours and hours
Most attraction were closed...

Due to covid 19 capacity rules, many shops and shows were closed. The tickets shouldve been half off, if only half of the attractions were available. It was very tough on the elderly in our family group visit since the theatre shows were unavailable, so you may wish to postpone such visits until the park opens fully. Staff were top notch - super helpful and knowledgeable. We had a great day, but felt that it lacked value.

02/07 I went USS but I'm very disappointed about the roller coaster was closed for maintenance, If before covid USS is open for 365 days never closed I can understand the maintenance is needed, but due to covid USS operation for 3 days a week then why the roller coaster still under maintenance. This is really unacceptable and I feel the ticket is not worth without the roller coaster
Long waiting times for most rides. Pretty Overpriced food. Rides are fun though. Pleasant experience with the few times I have been there.
Loves the aesthetic vibes of USS. Battlestar Galactica is closed and was quite disappointed, really wanted to ride it. Heard that its closed quite often and for a long time.
Still waiting for reopening to be in full effect. But no crowds and easy night atmosphere is still really nice

An absolute great place in Singapore. Nice services and staffs but it would be more interesting when you visit it in fewer-tourist months cause it is pretty crowded. A recommend place you should try even though you have to line up for such long time is the Jurassic Park River Adventure. It won't let you down, so, be patient and enjoy every moment!!!

With safe distancing implemented it may look like there is a lot of people visiting the park but its actually due to the 1m safe distancing that make the queue look long. Take note of the different timing for each specific ride. I think The Mummy ride could be until 7pm as its the most anticipated ride. As of 9th July 2021 the Battlestar Galactic ride has been on maintenance check their website for their latest update! Do catch the appearance of Megatron as he is interactive which means you are able to talked to him like an actual person and he does respond sarcastically which is amusing to hear.
Beat place to hang around for entire day . Don't miss these rides : transformers 4D, the mummy returns, Jurassic Park ride , 4D Shrek show, and many more
Most of the fun ride not open. Very little people this period and so no need to queue..
Terrible service for customers, the best attractions are closed for renovations and it is not even reflected in price
If raining whole day my ticket would be a waste as i cant take rides...bad experience...really bad experience!!!
A number of rides and restaurants are closed but waiting time is less than 20 mins.

Worth a visit if you have kids, but ready to spend a lot of time waiting in lines. Even if you pay extra for the pass to "cut the line" and take the express line, you may end up waiting over an hour for some rides. A few of the rides are more geared towards kids, so that's why this may be worth a visit if you are entertaining children. Overall, it was nice experience to visit Singaporean Universal Studios, but wouldn't come a second time.
A tad small compared to other theme parks in the region. Cant be helped due to Singapores land shortage I guess. Other than that, its a nice place to visit.

Visited USS yesterday. A lot of rides / shows closed, including the battlestar galactica. I knew about this as they do indicate on the website, but thrill seekers may find it boring (rides more suitable for families / kids). Still fun as its one of the few fun things you can do during the heightened alert lockdown!
Great place to go. Even with covid, just one thing disappointing is the frequent break down of transformers.

Very disappointed as more than half the rides were closed and we were not even informed. Shrek 4D, Steven Spielberg show, battlestar galatica, water world show, multiple shops and food courts. If I knew so many rides and shops were going to be closed, would not even waste my time going. No characters on the streets at all. Halloween theme food was also terrible. Asked for NO BREAST MEAT, given ALL BREAST MEAT. 76 in total for a lousy meal. Would not recommend this park to anyone I know. Horrid. Boring.

The top three rollercoasters were closed and everything was not open until 2pm. Considering that the park is only open 3 days a week, that is pretty poor. Not a great day out, really. There are much better theme parks out there, and 81 is quite expensive for what you get.
Lot of F&B are close. Ride need to wait for too long. Not worth of money. Most ride start at 2pm. Tired of waiting for the ride.
Not so full of people during covid period
It's not fun at all, many restaurants are not open, and it takes an hour to even queue. Friends who dont know how to ask distant relatives to come here are really unforgettable.

Due to Covid 19 restrictions, there were not many people here. The attractions were fun and satisfactory. Some rides are less suitable for children however so keep that in mind. As for restrooms and such, they were amazingly clean with a cool aesthetic. Unfortunately for my Muslim brethren, not a lot of halal food options. Some of the juices are actually spiked with alcohol, though the staff will inform you. Overall very enjoyable.

Safe distancing measures are in place thus many facilities and rides are closed. Meet & greet can only be done at a distance. However, due to the crowd control, Q for rides takes no more than 30min, can even be as short as 10min. Overall, the place is still worth the visit.
Good to go to explore once, don't expect much shelter from the rain and heat. Wait time for rides can be hell.

it's not USS without Battlestar Galactica... Overall still fun due to the company. Do note water dispensers are off for hygiene reasons. Water can be purchased inside the shops at 4. Personally feel that tickets should be priced based on rides that are opened...
Really its a very nice place to spent some time with friends and family but nowadays A lot of rides / shows are closed due to Covid-19
Very nice and interesting place! The queue takes a long time but it's worth it! The queue is much faster now due to covid!
Best rides of the place was closed for maintenance
It was quite empty but then again we are in a pandemic. Not complaining I'm glad they are still open first time I ever visit USS and had fun.
2019/12 #visit once There was a company booking the venue that day, but there was no warning at the counter or on the official website in advance, which was a bad impression.
Almost all the rides are closed.... What a waste of money

Used to be a smashing experience, but this year's Halloween horror Nights was an extremely underwhelming experience. Understandably, the pandemic has watered down everything to the extent that there is barely any feel of Halloween. They chose to pipe in loud club music instead of scary music, there are no 'scarers' except the social distancing ambassadors that will appear randomly to say '2 in a group ah'. The 'scare alley' was over in 20 seconds? The exhibition was OK and actually quite informative but because there was just so many people I felt pressured to keep walking instead of reading every single infopanel like I usually do (am a museum buff). So many rides were closed, which meant that queues were long (even though kids are having their Os and A levels and on paper there should be less of a crowd). We got the express pass but I shudder to think what would happen if we didn't. We probably get to queue for 2 rides and that's it. I guess that's a scare too. Save your money and catch a horror movie, you'll get more of a kick than coming here ...for now (at least till after the pandemic)
Not worth the price. Few rides not open. Cannot refill water. Coz of covid I think it's not worth at all.

Overall the rides are fun, understably and unfortunately some of them are shut, but what lets the park down is lack of Covid-19 safety management and enforcement of safe distancing... Too many patrons blatantly ignoring the obvious 1 metre waiting markings but there's no staff to check. We try to show and educate other patrons directly around us all day, but unreasonable to need to for our own safety. Govt officers would be busy if they were present
Unfortunately a fair bit of rides and food stalls are closed.. The small numbers of visitors does not help

Went last thursday and there is really less people. Probably all locals due to COVID. I went in from opening to close and within that short time, i am able to get onboard for all rides, some even able to ride twice. Average waiting time for rides is around 10min. Some even do not have people so can directly get onboard. However, better to get drinks and food outside before going in. Overall experience is still EXCELLENT

Bias: I took a small child who loves dinosaurs. Never been to an amusement park before. Great environment. One ride was disabled but was quickly fixed and returned to service. Went on a weekday so queues were short. Actual time on ride were short but since waits weren't bad, this was acceptable. Rides were high quality and nothing was scary for small child. Cons: heat was high and closed water access means buying lots of water/drinks from food stands. Prices are extortionate, 15 for a fountain drink is near criminal. But you're stuck and have no other options. I'd give 5 stars but this is particularly awful and unforgivable.
This year USS Halloween opening hours is shorter. Free snacks vouchers, shorter ride queue... its not too bad. As we get to take rides.
Went multiple time, good experience but same old thing

It is my fifth time here and Universal Studios Singapore never fail to amaze me! The staffs are really helpful and have great hospitality! The rides are well-maintained even after so many years. It was also the Halloween season, so there was the Halloween Horror Night exhibition and also the scream alley and extended opening hours. Even though it was a toned down version of Halloween Horror Night, it was a great job done by the USS team! Cant wait to be back for my next visit!

Visited on 24 Oct 2021 during covid and i could ride everything despite the place closing at 4pm. Usually it operates from 10am-7pm. I love that it is not crowded, nice and calm. I could go for all the meet and greet as well! Would go back again! (Note that the huge globe is currently under renovation, so no photos there)
Cannot believe the amount of visitors there, they probably had more staff than them! All the ride queues were like express lanes! Love it!
Almost perfect, just some times certain attraction goes into maintenance. Do check out if they are operating before going!

Very disappointed. Many attractions were not available, in particular the live shows and many of the restaurants except on main street were closed. Yet the ticket price remained the same... I'm guessing because Afterall most were using the sg govt issued vouchers and the park enjoys full value on it

Really quite sad that the whole place is so empty. Just hoping that everything is safe again so that everything can go back to normal and the themed festivities can resume in full force once again. That said, if you want to skip the queues, go now during this season. Everything has a waiting time of about 30 min max.
Not the right time to visit during this pandemic. Most performance was cancelled and park closed at 7pm.
Not even open daily..... Especially now after exams and many people go there for staycation etc....
Cylon and Human were both closed at the time i went
Fun but some of the attractions are not open. Queue is long but waiting time is okay i guess

Fun place, but food and drinks are pricey so do come prepared! Queues do stretch to over an hour during peak periods like holidays so it would be good to buy an Express pass although those are very expensive to fully expend your day there

This was actually my first time to USS. Took this as an opportunity to visit with the family. Reached around 1pm, crowd was moderate. Didnt had to wait long while queueing up. I would say we managed to try 80% of the rides available. Most waiting time for the rides are 20 to 70mins long. I was quite surprised that the queue for the cyclon rollar coaster ride was only 20mins. Came during the school holidays, otherwise, i think the place would be more quieter.

it's all a little run down and some queue times were really crazy haha sometimes they don't correspond to the queue times shown outside lol so just give or take 20 min? I rode Revenge of the Mummy and the queue time said 40 min but it ended up being over an hour long :( Park closes at 9 but rides close at 8, just take note! Enjoy your trip!

A place similar to Disneyland and the same crowd. I mean, if one plays, there will be a queue for hours...but it is nice and fun, and there are singing and dancing shows in general, it is definitely worth a visit...

Nice relaxing experience..from routine life.. Need more shelters..and most of food shops were closed..long queue even to buy a can drink or water bottle..not fair..Atleast can set up few vending machines inside

Worst theme park ever in terms of fun vs price paid. Rides are run extremely slow with tiresome staff (some rides only 1 staff to do everything from crowd control, operations, ensure safety etc etc and its during school holidays peak hours!!) thus the lengthy queue. Get express pass and youll get bored of the theme park in couple of hours. Most rides arent replayable worthy (maybe only the battlestar), young kids will get bored and wish to get out asap. Really limited food choice, food sux really here and sky high prices. Summary: what a rip off. Probably Covid saving it to continue operating as locals are stuck with only this theme park..

Total Rip-off and dangerous!!! 1. The park only open for 9 hours, compared to Disneyland 14 hrs. 2. Some rides and food courts are closed. 3. Wet and slippery floor inside Shrek's. My son fell down and wet his pants.

This is a very bad place to experience! You can say that you are paying for it! You have to queue for more than an hour in each place but you can only play for 5 minutes. The organizer just crams people in without considering the customers' experience. It's like a car can only carry 4 people, but the driver crams 40 people! It's enough to be cheated once in your life!

Generally unhappy. Good sights and sounds, but being trapped in incredible long queues (60-90 mins for 5-10 min rides), spending on overpriced food and generally tolerating staff not trained in the hospitality business is really not worth it.
Covid is the worst time to visit this place. There are at least 6000 people here during a pandemic and the queues are crazier than pre-covid.
Place is packed with families during the school holidays. Waiting time for rides on average is 30mins. Some shows and rides are not opened.

But in 2019 the rides were little crowded,But in 2021 September they opened the park and everyone rushed for their rides as their kids holidays and got fully crowded.Rides in 2019 were 30 minutes but in 2021 the rides were more than 2 hours . For the timings

We got lucky. Today's crowd wasn't that bad and weather was good. We managed quite a few rides. Too bad shrek and waterworld were not open. Better to pack some snacks or bread for ur meal as half the restaurants were closed and those opened had long queues. We encountered machine faults twice but we were not in queue yet and the rides reopened shortly. I think its time USS updates with new rides. All in all, it was a good day.

Reached 12, managed to rode 3 rides only till its closing time. My personal opinion, I think they sold the tickets more than what it was supposed to be. 16th Dec 2021 was the worst day to go to USS. Spend almost Sgd300 for the tickets and managed to rode 3 rides only. USS should control the numbers of tickets being sold to ensure visitors enjoy and have fun especially children. It should be open at least 6 days a week during the school holiday

Need maintenance, quite some rides were suspended, and quite crowded especially during this festive season, each ride prepare to wait for 30-120 mins or more.. overall still good fun for families in Singapore.
I went here on December 2019 and had a really great experience since morning when it opened 'till evening! My favorite ride is Transformers! It's worth the long queue!
Wan & Anna of USS Guest Services are very friendly and helpful. Very positive and provide solution to resolve my tickets issue. They are assets to USS

Came here 5th time.This time is totally kanasai. Cause is too crowded. For transformers trip Q for 2 hours Food / Drink all Q up. Because of COVID19 pls bring ur own drink no more free top up distilled water. Cylon trip is awesome ,Q for 50min.

USS is one of my favourite attractions in SG, I've been there quite a few times, its fun and worth your money. However, some rides and attractions are closed due to the current pandemic which makes USS less fun now.

Universal studio...the 4d Shrek, the transformers car ride, Galactica, the mummy ride is a must ....Fantastic place....full of fantasy..didn't get time to explore more as I went in the afternoon....waiting time is about too long especially for the .Mummy ride..140mins... otherwise it's enchanting...

Two thirds of the park is closed due to covid, so what would usually be a whole day experience can easily be done in 3 hours. They don't tell you that all of this is closed and they do not tell you that more than half the food places are closed, so you go in blind, and end up hungry. The whole park looks like it needs a makeover, I get that it's tough times and they have fewer money than usually, but it looks like the park is not maintained at all. The entire water world is closed, you can even get in to see the - run down- decorations. They are practically the wish version of Disney land. So disappointed.

Every other ride was down every hour for 15-30 minutes. Seems like more of a crowd dispersion technique rather than real technical issues. Otherwise I would be concerned that broken rides can be fixed and certified in 20mins...also, very small compared to other countries and almost half the stores were closed.

Opening is from 12 to 9. But rides close at 8. Most of the rides have 60 minutes waiting time. Express costs 70 per person. So essentially, you will never completely go through all the attraction if you don't have express. That's the frustrating part
Dissapointing... 10years ago still same attractions and many were closed. Even the theatre and character parade were not experienced.
Only manage to ride 2 attraction cause the queue is so freaking long. Waited 3 hours for a 3 mins rollercoaster. Recommend getting express pass if you want to get the fullest experience of USS

A much smaller Universal Studios than those in countries like Japan or the US, but you still get a decent variety of rides. Note that new COVID regulations mean that quite a lot of merchandise stores are closed, only 2-3 restaurants are open and photo opportunities require you to stand 1m away from the mascots. Overall though, not a bad experience considering tickets were free using SG Rediscovers vouchers.
It was crowded, wait time was too long for most of the rides. Overall the place is good. Please include wait times in your planning before visit.

Average queue take about 30-60 mins and more for the more popular ones. Only tried a few of them as there are too many people. Enjoyed the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure although would get drenched. Prepare yours own raincoat or get one there if you do not wish to be wet and uncomfortable for the day after the fun. A pity have to give TRANSFORMERS The Ride: The Ultimate 3D Battle a miss as the queue is at least 2 hours.

Fun place to be at, but kind of expensive. Hopefully they have more water rides like the Jurassic park water ride, and the transformer indoor ride. When it rains, the queue in the transformers is about 2 hour. I wouldn't want to pay 70 to go in and queue for half the day. The best ride is the human and cylon roller coasters if you dare to sit. Otherwise, try out the transformers and Jurassic park water ride then the Jurassic park flying ride to dry yourself off. Shops has adorable items if you want to buy some as souvenirs.

Good place to chill but if you are trying to shun crowds, don't go.. best and only place in sg to satisfy your theme park and intense rides cravings but have to plan your rides :) the "minutes" waiting time signage outside each ride is merely for an approximate only, add another 0.5 times at least to the wait time...
Fantastic place... We have to wait for every rides.. Nice place to take photos
Super long queue during weekends! Christmas theme not that nice this time, still many are not operating.. hope it will be lively, happy place to be again soon. More power!
The escort security guards took care of my wheelchair-bound relative for the whole trip from the Universal Studios till SEA Aquarium. Amazing job, guards! However, great experience no matter what.

Haha, there are too many people! However, there were surprisingly few people on the roller coaster, and the queue lasted for five minutes! The upside down roller coaster is the most fun! The feeling of weightlessness is not strong, mainly because I like it, it is more exciting Transformers carefully considered... The queue queue is super long... After queuing for two and a half hours, I might as well go on a few roller coasters. The turkey legs taste good, but the smoothie has a lot of pigment. When I go home and go to the toilet, it's always blue...
My second visit to this wonderful place. I really missed the parade show of all the characters. We came to know It's because of covid the show has been cancelled.

Worst experience Park opens from 12 to 7. Rides are open from 2 to 6. In between you will have to walk in open park, and wait in queue for 60 minutes for each ride , which leaves you no time for even 3 rides , to board the ride and get pulled off, giving weather and maintenance as a reason, then what abt the 60 minutes I was in queue, cant you even issue a one time express pass for that ride because We sat on the boat and got pulled off and yet you want us to exit and re enter the 60 minute wait queue. They force you to buy the express pass indirectly. The staffs are racists and arrogant. They are not approachable. Not friendly. Would ruin your fun mood with their arrogant attitude. If your ethnicity is non Chinese or European or Australian, you better stay away from this park. You can see that in the meet and greets simply want to drive some ethnicities away.

Started the day off happy and enjoying myself but eventually turned into a horrible day. Some staff were rude, not helpful and most important made me feel uncomfortable being there. I was taking a sip of water in 30* heat when a staff member told me off for putting my mask down, how the hell do I drink my water then... Transformers meet and greet was honestly rude, with speeches being a bit too sensitive to guests and tourists as I was walking by and stopped. Don't think I'll ever be coming back.

Paying expensive entrance fee but not having the freedom to take any ride at any time during the opening hours. The official opening hour from 12pm-7pm but why does most of the ride not opened at 12pm especially the cyclone ride that open at 4pm during the official opening time. Very disappointing and upsetting to see it's standard have dropped over the years.

Disappointed that most of the rides and shows are closed. Understand that the pandemic is ongoing and there's a drop in park visitors. However if a magical experience is what USS Singapore is trying to provide. They have greatly missed the point. Whilst operating cost Is an issue, I'm sure they have enough experience to think out of the box and create lower cost experiences. Not coming back for a very long time.

Open 12pm,the best rides are all after 2pm,had to queue mummy ride for 1 and half hr, ended up paying fine for locker which has given us 75 minutes, transformers ride, had no audio, had to take again, wasted time
Some rides shut down and slow lines due to covid. Still worth a visit.

A lot of stalls (small carts) were closed owing to Covid. Not 100% of the rides were operating. That led to overcrowding on the remaining limited rides. Well, the timing wasn't great. CNY plus Covid restrictions. I am sure but can only imagine for now, this is a great place with kids. But, go for the express pass if you want to make most out of the visit.
It's a bit quiet because there's still Covid. But when walking in, the atmosphere still reminded me of an amusement park that was fun and cheerful.

Got some free tickets to Universal Studios Singapore (USS) from Red Cross Singapore in celebration of World Blood Donor Day 2021 for the blood donation did back in 2020. USS is currently open only for 4 days a week (Thu-Sun) and there is a need to go online to book the entry slot timing of 12pm or 3pm as it is now the requirement due to COVID-19 Safe Management Measures. Entered at 12pm and the park was still relatively empty as most humans have not headed in yet. Some rides and shows are currently closed such as Shrek 4D, Lights Camera Action and Waterworld. Some rides started at 12pm such as the Cylons Vs Humans Roller Coaster, Particle Accelerator, Treasure Hunt, Jurassic World Rapids Ride and Madagascar Boat Ride. Some rides starts at 1pm such as Elmo's Spaghetti Adventure and Transformers. Some rides start at 2pm such as Revenge of the Mummy. Much planning is required to ensure the golden hour of 12pm to 1pm is not wasted waiting for rides to open. It was fun trying the different rides and glad that most are not undersized.
