Going through the rides brought much joy and laughter. Only bad part of going to a theme park, stuck in lines and the poor air circulation. More fans are needed for the long queues. Enjoyed a meal at Louis NY Pizza Parlor bringing back memories of pizza at Julianna's over in DUMBO. Really miss good pizza. Drinks are crazy expensive too at SG5 a cup. Glad that the free tickets came with 2 x 5 meal voucher and 2 x 5 off with min spend of SG25 meal voucher to help offset the cost of the food and drinks. All in a great day of fun and reminder why theme parks are not in my travel plans. Just do not like dealing with long queues for 1 to 2 mins of mirth. Not a place for bigger sized persons as all theme parks are loathe to do.

Was here a couple years ago and thoroughly enjoyed myself. Lots of rides weren't open at that time so hopefully will be back again soon! One thing for sure though is that I prefer this universal studios to the one in Japan as it was just filled with shops and hardly any rides. Which really was a shame.

Singapore's one and only theme park. It has Hollywood glamour and showbiz appeal. Rides are awesome. Only drawback is once you've been through the entire park you will quickly realize that it doesn't have as many rides as a true international quality theme park should have. So, due to the ongoing pandemic, many food outlets were closed and also many attractions like the Lights Camera Action one, the Shrek 4D and the shows. And there was a lack of street side entertainment. So no Disney-style parades. Meet and Greets are also fairly detached and impersonal, you can't hug any of their characters for example. Hope to see this park get up from the doldrums and start shining bright like it once did, soon!

Came on a Sunday and it was raining very heavily in the morning and early afternoon and was worried we wont be able to play any games at all However thankfully some rides were open (merry go round and other indoor ones like the MUMMY ride that are not affected by thunder or weather ) And later in the afternoon the weather cleared up and we got to try all the others Favourites are: the mummy ( long queue) , CYLON rollercoaster (also long queue) Dislikes: the transformer 3d ride, very shaky and makes you dizzy, I felt I was close to throwing up. Overall a nice day out to explore USS sg again, its not a big USS at all compared to others like in Japan but still worth coming once a while
Super fun! Long waiting times for some rides though..

In the park right now. Starving. Dehydrated. Zero efficiency. 1H line to get water. Food and drinks not separated so dehydrated people have to wait forever for something to drink. Attraction lines are worse. Zero efficiency.

Worst USS experience ever - beware before you buy tickets. Read this review first: We paid 4 tickets plus 4 express tickets at full price and went on Thursday 24 March 2022. This was our sons birthday present and their first ever USS experience going on rides. When we got there however we discovered that all the shows are closed (all incl. Waterworld, Shrek, ALL of them). Lights, Camera, Action ride is also closed. The food court is closed. Some of the restaurants were closed. Half the food trucks are closed. All water fountains are turned off. One has to walk half-way across the park to buy overpriced water. We queued for 15mins to buy 1 slush beverage even though we were just third in line. We waited another half hour to order pizza at one of the few restaurants that are open...and mind you, it was NOT crowded and there were just 4 guests in front of us, max. Finally, the website advertises a Madagaskar parade. Beware, that was not a parade. They were just a couple of dancers and 3 Madagaskar characters dancing at one spot. There is no parade as advertised. They also do not inform on their website that all the shows are closed. Also 2 rides were closed temporarily due to technical issues. And they also halted the outdoor rides for about 30mins due to lightning risk (we never heard any lightning nor did it ever rain). Overall the rides are still great but paying full price for getting just half the experience is very, very poor, and very disappointing. Ive been to the Universal Studios park many times in the US and in Singapore and THIS was the worst experience Ive ever had. I highly believe that this lack of service goes against the culture of the real Universal Studios corporation (they would never allow that). Like another user puts it, this is a complete rip-off. Just take peoples money and dont care to deliver. Shameful.

Understaffed. Sometimes only one unmotivated staff holding the fort to check/clear park goers, check safety and operate the rides. So many youngsters queuing in the express lanes without tickets and were let through, while honest people queue for an hour or more in long snaking queues. The eateries, with reduced capacity, also had long queues just to get in. Even the slushee cart had an hour long queue. Only to be told the machine couldnt cope and only 2 unpopular flavour, and even then it had to be made with ice from one machine, and syrup from another. Overall, was there at 11:30 till closing time. Total ride time was no more than 30mins. The rest was spent queuing and walking from point to point. The attraction did not put in any effort to handle capacity crowd while letting in as many people as they possibly could. Waterworld was closed but not boarded up. Looks desolated. Madagascar will also be closed for refresh. Best to avoid until management does a better job at planning.

Our trip to Universal Studios as a family of 4 was fine. My 6 year old and 2 year old enjoyed the rides. The queues were not too long. However, the 1 star review is to reflect: 1. All water dispensers are shut off, which according to customer services, is due to covid-19. However, given that I have been able to use water taps to fill water bottles at gyms and other attractions in Singapore, this is clearly not a legitimate reason. It's just because resort just wants its customers to spend more money (min 4/bottle) on buying water. Even the restaurants are not allowed to provide tap water, which clearly has nothing to do with covid. Having already spent 70 - 80 per person on tickets. It is not fair to expect a family of 4 to spend 20 - 40 extra on water during the day.The extra waste generated is also terrible for the environment. 2. The 'farewell' show at the end of the day was cancelled due to 'heavy rain' (it was barely drizzling), yet the resort failed to even remove the sign advertising the event, meaning we stayed around an extra hour just to be disappointed.

The problem is at the souvenir (USS main merch store). Poor planning and improper crowd management. There were 3/4 lines of queues just for one cashier booth. Spent around 45 minutes queuing at one of those lines just to be informed that it was the wrong queue. The staffs at the counter are patient despite being understaffed. The main problem is with the management. Some queues are also in a loop.

The pandemic has really taken a bit of the fun out of USS. Different opening timings for the rides was a bit frustrating. One of the coolest part of the Battlestar Rides was being able to have both rides running at the same time as they're meant to duel each other, so really was unfortunate that isn't happening now. But hey, the pandemic has taken the fun out of a lot of things so to be able to still have rides going amidst these times was still fun. Kudos to the staff that work long hours to manage the long queues and sometimes impatient crowd. :))

Not a very nice experience as compared to the last time we visited in 2015. The rides were the only good thing. All food courts closed.. How can you spend a whole day's outing with little to no food options? Also the park is not being maintained well. Overall experience was just about ok

Rides were good, but we went during a hot day. Nearly all the concession stands/water fountains are closed with only one store open that had a huge line in the sun. Not appropriate for elder people/children. They need some vending machines dotted around. Also, way too expensive when youre only able to get on 2-4 rides in a day.
It's a nice place to visit... But because now have the pandemic virus so nos of games are not functional.... Maybe have to wait till end of the year if the situation get better..

No shelter so it's a huge bummer if it rains. Otherwise fantastic place that gives the feel of being outside of Singapore. Try not to go on weekend and holidays unless you want to queue over an hour for rides

Always fun to go. Sad that Madagascar is being replaced :( Also, the park opens at 12noon and closes at 7pm during this period. It was very hot queueing under the hot sun, but grateful for the free ice cream!
Everything inside is Great to play. Downside is long queue but fast

-As others say it's one of the best places in Singapore that you don't want to miss. -Not all activities are always open. but don't worry you get repeat access on what's open to compensate on what's closed. - Don't forget to get the physical ticket from the counter by showing the e-ticket. e-tickets are not accepted in most of the roller coaster rides. - Go early as possible ,they have unannounced closing time for few rides you would miss if you are late(example one of the roller coaster ride was closed at 3pm ) - Mummy ride,transformers ride, white roller coaster ride are the best. - Most of the rides have limitation based on height. so small kids may not be able to ride any of them. - Express tickets come in hand but with a cost of 40 or something. you get to go through the express queue with less waiting time. - Normal tickets: get ready to expect looong queue on famous rides. - You get free lockers for 45mins-60 mins (vary) keep most of your things as they are not allowed in roller coaster rides. - Finally,don't try to cover exploring Sentosa on the same day of visiting Universal Studios. Universal Studio is a whole day experience.

It's a small theme park where if you walk fast throughout the park, it would take you only 10 mins. If you have to queue up for your rides and shop around, it would take you the whole day. They don't light up fireworks everyday so it's better for you to call them or look at their calendar to see if they may have fireworks. Since it's the only happening theme park in Singapore, it wins hands down. Food is pretty expensive but delicious. It would be great if you have an annual pass so that you could save lots of money and skip the ticket queue.
Loved it! Except for the long queue. Each ride was 1h waiting time. Even for the drinks, have to queue for more than an hr.

Charged at full price, the park not even completely open. Many stores are closed, me, my wife and kids, and my parents had difficulties finding restaurant. Discovery food court is closed, many restaurant were closed. Madagascar area are upgrading so that section are completely closed. So out of 100%, rides are only 65% open, restaurant 30% open, stores are 40% open. Wont going back again for full price. It shpuld be 50% price for the condition they have.

Most of the restaurants were closed which severely limited eating choices. It was a massive mistake paying for express as there were only 2 or 3 rides which were okay. It was a massive waste of money.

Im unhappy with the express tickets. I bought 3 express tickets on Good Friday.. At the end, i realised alot of ppl are getting express queue as well.. To my horror, there are many rides that even normal queue got lesser ppl than express queue.. Really waste money

Wrong waiting time estimation, it wrote 20mins but we stood in line for more than 90mins, super annoying. Also they gave too much privilege to Express guests, as if regular guests didnt pay their ticket and can be put in line forever.

I use to love this place but it's not the same anymore. Iconic rides are closed. Others are now too old. The burger place is the worst to eat anywhere in Singapore. The saviour of this place is the rollercoasters.

Express pass was still kinda slow especially for the Jurassic Park ride. Some restaurants were closed and the lockers are so expensive. The pizzeria's food was decent but pricey if there weren't vouchers included imo.

The rides were all good, but many rides are now closed along with many indoor shows. The hefty price tag of 130 SGD(including express pass) for these few attractions didn't feel worth it for me. The lines were super long on some rides, but as I took the express entry I got to save on a lot of time for just them. Overall I felt the express pass wasn't worth getting on the day I went. Rides were good, especially the roller coaster. All in all a good experience.

Visited early April. Opens late and ride times scatered so u stay in the park longer. Wait times moderate. Plan your day a little and u will be fine. Water world shut indefinitely by the looks of it and Madagascar world also shut. So there is not a lot to do as most restaurants food stands shows etc all closed. Park shows wear and tear like all universal studios so hopefully restrictions lift more and the park runs to better capacity etc. Still a fun day out for a young family. Prices fair compared to usa's when it comes to size of the park.

Impressive scenery and several thrilling roller coasters! The really good thing about visiting now is the lack of tourists due to the pandemic. Almost no queuing! Great souvenir shops! Fun seeing some characters from movies on the street! The constant music everywhere is annoying because it is difficult to have a conversation. The staff was not very welcoming. They did not seem to enjoy their jobs unfortunately.
It was okay. But, there are a lot of spots, food stalls and other attractions closed.

Truly a themed park with many fun rides.. Spare a whole day if you want to try everything out there.. Get a express pass when theres a long queue on weekends to save your time... Dont forget to ride the tornado roller coaster..aa u will witness one of the most memorable time of your life on this ride.. Go to minions shop to purchase your souvenirsz Have the best time out there...cheers!!!

A wonderful place, although visiting in April is a guaranteed sweltering experience lol, the sun was not kind that day. Rides were very fun; the Revenge of the Mummy ride was by far my favourite, and I had a blast. Just as a heads up, expect the usual long lines: I waited roughly 40 mins for Jurassic Park Rapids, and 20-30 minutes for the Canopy Flyer, both on a Fast Track Pass (or whatever its called I forgot). Please please have a bottle of water at the ready, because it is bloody hot waiting in line and you will get a headache if you dont stay hydrated. Still an immensely fun experience after having not been to a theme park since COVID.

Well, I would like to give 4 and half stars as currently a few rides are closed, however Human and Mummy are amazing rides and they are working very well... Transformers indoor ride is interesting as well...Don't forget to carry your shades and cap as it is an outdoor theme park... A few rides don't allow you to carry loose items with you so you need to either keep them I'm a locked which will cost you a couple of extra bucks or you will have to give your luggage to a non rider...
Had a great time, rides and shows were really nice. Some of the shows like Sherk 4D, Lights, camera Action, were closed due to covid restrictions but otherwise we enjoyed rest of the rides/shows.

Went to Universal studios for the first time, probably the best time since the crowd is lesser during covid as Singapore is gradually loosening the social distancing measurement, most of the games start around 1pm but you can enter the studios at 12pm, managed to finish up all the exciting games such as transformer, mummy revenge, Galactica, etc about 4pm plus..because of less crowd and lesser queue. Although there are some other attractions remained close.
Long lines, very disorganized and understaffed. Bad food, bad experience, dont recommend.

Singapore already open up. Sadly the ride not fully open. Paid for express yet I waiting 25mins to ride my roller Coaster. You pay for the full price but you only get to access 60-70% of Universal Studio Singapore. Toilet is horrible, no toilet paper. Even Bangkok Chatuchak toilet is cleaner than USS. Very disappointed.

I went this place 25th of May, 2022. First of all, more than half of things are under maintance and the rest of things are suspended due to rain. Food is terrible and yacky and expensive. like really horrible taste redang burger cost you 16 dollars and 3.50 for drink so almost 20 dollars. secondly, they made an express line which you have to pay 80 dollars on top of basic admin so the basic ticket holder got to wait rediculously long so ended up you are wasting your time on queuing and QQQQQQQQQQ. it oepns 12 to 7pm. each ride and movies will be like 5 to 10 mins but you will be Queuing for each of them an hour. I really don't thing it is worth

Save yourself some money and don't visit until it opens up fully. Hardly 30% rides are working. All other shows and rides are shut. They are saying its due to covid but doesnt seem so. Tried all the rides almost twice, had food and still got done in 3 hours lol. No cleanliness and housekeeping and there is litter everywhere. What a waste of time and money. Had flown from India for this and very disappointed. They are charging full ticket for hardly anything.

I was expecting the same quality as Universal Florida and Japan. Turns out this park is much smaller, has two areas that were shut down, lots of rides/ shows and shops are closed and its severely understaffed. Not to mention it opens at 12!!! Seems like covid is now an excuse for mediocrity. Save your money and go to Universal Studios Japan; this park is not good enough.

It's ok for a one time experience only. This place is actually pretty small without that many rides, and a lot of shows are closed properly due to Covid. Also the opening time is adjusted to 12pm (only Sunday is 10AM) so it doesn't feel very value for money The queues are crazy, popular rides can goes upto 1hr, so you should try to go early and later around 4pm in the day We're a young couple so the best rides for me: 1. Transformers: The Ride 3D (a lot of flashing lights beware) 2. Revenge of the Mummy (the drop is crazy so probably not suitable for small childrens)
The place is good but a little bit decayed (paints and stuff), perhaps because of covid. Not all rides are open.

Considering other Universal studios, the one in Singapore is pretty small. On the day that we went there, the weather was bad and hence, a lot of the outdoor rides were closed. There were a lot of people despite it being a weekday. The lines for some of the rides were long and in the end, over the course of 5 hours we got on only 4 (though to be fair we did have dinner and walked pretty slow in addition to the on and off rain) The souvenir shops were kinda overpriced with 19 for a headband but this is the usual with theme parks. However, the place is beautifully decorated and every location is insta worthy and we took a looooot of pictures. The snacks were also pretty good. The corn dogs and fried chicken were some of my favourites. For a good visit, plan ahead for the weather and the order to visit things. Research on the rides and see which ones you definitely want to do and what you could dk with . You could rush at 6:59 to the more popular rides to skip the queue but the moment the clock turns 7:01 they no longer allow more people. Furthermore, by booking with Kkday (which I did) you get a 10% retail discount voucher, a free ice cream with set meals voucher and a 5 off any individual meal voucher (min 10) . Note: shreks swamp was also removed, which is sad

Nice theme park with some good rides and nicely decorated, but compared to other universal studios around the world this one is disappointing. I expected it to be smaller than the others just not with fewer thrilling rides. The mummy and Jurassic park rides are good along with some other rides but none are amazing. There's only 2 big roller coasters, of which when I was one closed so I didn't get to ride them. The human rollercoaster closed 3pm which, when the park was only open 12pm - 7pm was very disappointing and the other one battlestar Galactica had a technical problem which meant it was shut.
We enjoyed the visit but many zones and rides ate closed. Bad timing during post-covid.

One of the best thing is The cyclone ride. Its fast and thrilling! And also the vibe that the mummy ride is done well it definitely gives a scary and mysterious vibe! USS Definitely worth a second visit! One advice is to just buy the Express ticket or else youll have to wait for long queues
Amazing experience. Waiting in long 80 min / 40 min / 45 min. So must go for Human vs Cylone first and thn Shrek 4 D show. And Avengers ride is must visit too

Loved the rollercoasters (if you enjoy rollercoasters, the Revenge of the Mummy and Battlestar Galactica are not to be missed), loved the food(although it's pricier but c'mon what else would you expect here), loved the rides at Jurassic Park (although the Canopy Flyer was closed at the time of my visit) all in all, it's guaranteed you'll have a good time (whether you come here alone or in a group doesn't matter). The only downside? The waiting time and the queue for the rides (of which, there aren't that many to begin with, so if you come here expecting to ride 10 rollercoasters, nuh uh, not happening). If you arrive early and choose the sequence of your rides carefully, you can avoid long waits and complete your tour around the place within 3-4 hours (cue a cumulative sigh of relief, we all dread the Singapore heat).
Rides were amazing. Some of them were closed. Lots of shops were also closed. Wonderful experience nevertheless.
A great theme park. It wasn't crowded at all when I visited on the 11th May 2022.

Extremely poor customer experience. One the park is closed on Monday and Tuesday and the hours of operation are limited from 1200 to 1900 on the working days with limited staff. Eg One staff does all the work - checking for tickets, operating, cleaning for a ride and that leads to long queues. If one is keen on covering all the rides please go for an express pass. Also long queues at all F&B counters.This is one of the worst experiences for any attraction in Singapore currently. Please think twice before going till the situation improves

Ther queues at the only few eateries were extremely long. Many of those off-street drink stalls or food courts werent open. This is the worst experience I have had in amusement park. USS seriously need to work on your issue. Short opening hours is already a minus point and this F&B only make it worse!

The last time I visited this place was 2 yrs ago, before covid. Things have changed a lot at this place. Staff are friendly. This did not change though. 1. Cleanliness: leaves at many places/corners. It really look like theres no cleaning regime or the frequency has been reduced. Dirty. an ugly sight. Really. 2. Show, places for visit, attractions: many are closed. U can see from the photo, the food court is closed, the carts are closed mostly, the attractions are closed, some show are cancelled. Really, wonder why they still charged 98 sgd for an adult for this. Things that can be done in uss, reduced tremendously. Not worth the price. 3. Renovation: part of the theme park is closed. As such, the route is a mess. Sign put up for guiding visitors are..... not sure is for confusing the visitors or to help.... They are pointing to... dont know where. Really. I spent a lot of time walking here and there just to go to one place to another. Bad planning. Really. Again, why uss still charge so high if part of the park is renovating...? Puzzled... 4. Generally condition: the place is run down. Attractions, sign, boards.... Many of the Color faded. Need a revamp. 5. Ride experience: feels like the park is design to let visitors wait. For example, the dino flying ride. The poor lady 1 pax need to: (1) start stop the ride, (2) check and scan the express pass (which actually should be checked at the entrance to the queue, but it was done at the entrance to the ride. Waste time), (3) check the visitors exit correctly (waste time), (4) remind visitors to wear mask, cannot split ride... many of these steps can be done parallel, but not possible if it is just 1 staff. Management really need to think what they want the visitors to experience. If the objection is to stall the visitor by letting them queue more, they had succeeded. 6. On covid effort: signs are put up by uss to remind visitors to wear mask when in ride areas. But many visitors did not wear, no staff enforcing this. I guess the sign is for show. The site stated that uss put in enhanced smm, but.... Never implement. The whole afternoon while I was there, I did not see any disinfection done (against what was claimed on the website stating increased cleaning and disinfection. Not sure where did they disinfect. Side track, my recent visit to river safari, the staff disinfect the ride every round. Difficult, but they do what they said. Seriously, after my visit to uss, instead of full peace of mind.. I have full worry of mind. We are living with covid. But it doesnt mean the park can relax to a point that say one thing (Sg clean?), but do another ... Generally, instead of a park that is worth 98sgd per visit, feels more like 18sgd... Can see the staff are friendly. Trying their best. But... gosh, the management need to support the park man..... Sad. Disappointed.

The worst experience Ive made with rollercoaster parks. Quite a few attractions are either still closed (for no reason) or operating only half day. This also includes FB outlets. The limited availabilities lead to avoidable long waiting time.

Too many rides are closed. There's only 1 restaurant open, which causes long lines and no available tables. Bad idea if you bring kids. Even if you buy the express tickets, the lines are still too long. Way too long for the price. Avoid this place and wait until they get it together and save your money.

It was an average experience with my visit to the USS. There's no WOW factor, not because of any new installation. Just that few of the visit points have been closed. One good feedback about USS: well-maintained facilities except for the paints. One bad feedback about USS: a few attractions are closed. Does not make our money worth. If USJ can maintain its attractiveness for tourists to return, how could USS up its game to woo?

Universal Singapore is a decent theme park. Much smaller than most other theme parks in the world, but they still manage to pack a decent amount into such a tiny place. We purchased the express pass unlimited - Id say its definitely worth it with such limited opening hours at this park. The longest time we waited was 15 minutes, as opposed to the regular queues which went up to as much as 115 minutes. If you can afford it then it will definitely enhance your experience. There was only half of the food and beverage outlets open - which resulted in probably the longest wait Id experienced all day. Took me about 15 minutes to place my order and another 20 to receive it. There are other food/drink carts around the park but these only sell snacks or drinks. Pretty much all shows are still cancelled, including Waterworld. Its obvious the park is not fully operational (pre-covid) yet, but hopefully it gets back to this soon. Looking forward to my next visit at Universal Studios Singapore.

Rides are fun but service is not. I brought 2 kids for this day of fun. The merry go around has no queue, yet it took 15mins to get ready. The merry go around itself is just one minute. It makes no sense. This franchisee does little to make improvements. 80% of the food kiosks are closed, but it was a pretty crowded day. Where they are opened, there is always just one queue with one staff and of course a long queue just to get a drink. Throughout the park, you dont see any management people around. Only service staff, which are quite friendly. And 1/3 of the park is closed. Those opened has their own opening hours. I guess theyre cutting cost.

I visited the theme park on a Friday and found that the ride wait times were not too bad. More popular rides like the Transformers ride were over 80 minutes wait time. Unfortunately almost 40% of the attractions were not available for some reason, which was a real bummer. The park opens at 12pm. Lots of people are usually waiting around and will rush to their favourite rides so please come just before 12 to avoid wait times. Rides were in good condition and staff were helpful.

Some cool rides, but much smaller than expected. The whole Madagascar area is closed off which makes a big difference. Battlestar galactica got a fault while queuing and remained closed the rest of the day which was unlucky! Good place to take the kids but overall only 2/3 big rides in the park.

Plenty of queuing for rides and food, with many stalls closed. Rides are of good quality and fun from what was experienced. The staff are super friendly and helpful, and saved the day on our visit. Many thanks to them!
It was a very beautiful and impressive experience. Lots of attractions and friendly staff. Highly recommended.
Went here on a weekday to avoid weekend crowds. Staff were friendly, attractions were world class, meet and greets were unique, and the shows all had a great twist to make it worth your time.
Hopefully universal studio can open full time hours. Madagascar was not open which is one of my favourite ride. Minion event could be better. But overall fun for kids

I was happy... .! I thought I was going to die from the heat, but I was happy... !!!Its really cool inside, but the waiting time is hell. I visited on a Sunday and thought about buying an early entry pass, but it seems like I made a good decision not to buy it. I was able to get in right away without waiting due to COVID-19. I rode almost all the rides. There aren't many places to eat, so eating takes the most time.
Worst place, waste of money, long queues, average 1 hour long. Most food shops closed, overcrowded, bad management.

Bought 2 express passes and the waiting times where still anywhere between 30-45 minutes. Many of the food vendors are closed and so we waited over 70 minutes to order food. Spent more time queuing in lines than actually seeing attractions & rides. Would need to re-login into WiFi every 10 minutes which is quite frustrating typing your details every time. I wouldnt come again if charging an extra 100 for express pass and Universal management know that they are understaffed (I really feel for the staff dealing with so many frustrated people). I have been to theme parks all over the world and would have to be the worst customer experience.

I will not recommend this place to anyone, save your money and go somewhere instead. Theres a min of an hour wait for each attractions. The place looks very old and rundown . A lot of food stalls are closed. Its just a very bad experience overall. They should just shut this place down and renovate.

Very disappointed! Buy the express tickets or stay away from it. This park is far by miles from any Disneyland, the entertainment level of the attractions is very poor and the queues are absolutely insane! Without the express ticket you will be stuck in 1h and 30 minutes for an attraction that is not even worth at the end. Many shops were empty, like abandoned?! Also the merchandising shops offered a very poor selection and bad quality merch. Considering the extremely high prices, its definitely not worth it. PLEASE BE AWARE with 70 you only buy 1 express ride to each attraction which is absolutely ridiculous and not competitive with the other theme parks. Will not be back.

Went on a Friday. The waiting times were terrible. They treat people without express tickets as peasants by letting them wait longer than the expected ride times on the board stated outside each rides. Stay away from USS.

Had a lot of fun during my visit to USS. All the rides were very enjoyable that caters to all ages from chill to thrill rides. Queued for up to 45minutes for one of the roller coaster and they announced that the ride is suspended due to a lighting warning. However the ride was reopened not long after and managed to try it with relatively shorter queue. I would suggest to go for express ticket for a better experience

The size itself is not that big, so if you put your mind to it and work hard, you can probably ride all the rides in about 4-5 hours. The equipment course itself is short, but it seems to be quite worthwhile. There are also well-equipped restrooms in various places. I think there are regular and express tickets (I didn't make a reservation). I used the non-unlimited express service on Sunday and there were some people. I know the price is about twice the difference, but I think it's worth taking the express. While waiting to use the machine, many of the express waiting lines have air conditioning indoors, and even if they are outdoor lines, there are fans turned on. As for the regular ticket lines, many of them have outdoor waiting lines, and (compared to the express) you can often see places without fans in the waiting line. From 13:30, it seems that some of the rides don't run, probably because it's the employees' lunch time. They seem to start running again at 14:30, but the line is very long. Even for the famous ride, even though it was Express at that time, there was a wait of about 20 to 30 minutes. The amusement park itself is not very big and the course is not long. If you are going with friends and lovers rather than with children, I don't think you need the unlimited express ticket. If you go out in the middle of the day, they will put something like a UV stamp on your forearm, and it looks like you can go out and eat lunch and then come back in. It wasn't very fun or anything. Oh, and I get motion sickness. If you have something like that under your ears, put it on. When it closes, the line for the MRT or train in front is very long, so you need to pay in advance and leave early (last photo)
Overall my experience is ok ok. Some of the activity required waiting of an hour or more

Visited on July 28, 2022. There are so many people, but because of the coronavirus, it opens at 12 o'clock. The scorching sun is very hot. I didn't buy the express ticket in Korea because I wanted to check the situation later, but if I hesitate, it's too late. It's so hot that you can't see it unless you buy an express ticket. It takes about 40 minutes for one machine. Sometimes luggage storage is free for an hour, but sometimes it costs 4.00. I thought I would leave it there for an hour and then went on one of the rides, but they told me I had to pay again because the time had expired... Is there a card in the machine? It's full of really embarrassing memories. During peak season, you have to shell out a lot of money. Still, Jurassic Park was fun It was fun, but annoying...
The Madagascar land location is under construction. The line for the rides is still long but becomes pretty manageable as the park closes at 1700H.

It was one of the best experience of my life!! As per me the best ride here is "Transformers". Make sure once you are in, you quickly go towards the rides or else get ready to wait for as long as 1-2 hours in queue.
Best theme park experience so far, advice to go in earlier, and queue for those hot attractions

Yoooo this place is always how I remembered it, the rides awesome,fun,exciting, but one thing that's annoying me is the queues,they take so long but in the end they're kind of worth it. Overall if you're bored you should definitely come here, reccomend it.

A variety of rides for all ages. Love Shrek 4d and you can really get drenched at Jurassic park. Spaghetti monster , tea cup and flying dinosaurs are suitable for toddlers. Staff Nurhadiyah was very thoughtful to invite us to ride a second time at 5.55pm for the flying dinosaurs as the park shuts down with its last ride. The peak period is between 12.30- 2.30pm where you have to wait the longest. After that, its not as bad. Download the app to check for the waiting times. With the tourists returning, the wait can be 60 minutes during its peak but significantly reduced around 5pm. The animated characters also encapsulated our memories of the place with their beautifully crafted costumes and they interacted with the audience with a variety of poses.

I was there on July 1, 2022. Despite what I read about rides being closed, poorly staffed and so on - I didnt find that to be the case. ALL rides were open and they extended the park hours till 7. Staff was friendly, rides were super fun, and had a wonderful experience. It was a Friday, and a bit crowded, to the Express Pass helped. Rode our favorite things multiple times. They had some character meet and greets available, no lines for food, and just a positive experience. Im so glad I went!

Rude staff. That's my pet peeve. Poor poor service. When USS opened, I remember we used it as a shining example for wonderful user experience and customer service. Today? It would be a fine example of what not to do. Restaurant staff doesn't even say hello. Just immediately rattles on about what's not available. Staff in the queue at guests services was also rude. Even though I was interrupted by someone who was NOT in the queue, I was told to wait for my turn and that she was seeing to another customer. Hey if you guys can't handle the crowd, then close up. Staff in the guests service area INSIDE the park just after the gantries were really really polite though. Kudos to the 3 of them on duty at 1230hr on 17 aug 2022. 2 chinese guys and an indian lady. Well done.

80% of your time will be on waiting, queuing, people with express tickets will spend 50% of their time waiting queuing. Pay and wait under hot weather. Food is extremely expensive. What a regret!!! I should have go somewhere else

Lack of management before opening There was a lot of lining up, passing each other, but again, the market doesn't belong to buyers. I have to accept it... / The bathrooms outside are dirty, smelly, and PTT's is a total waste... / Regarding waiting in line, there are few outside, hundreds inside... / Consumer rights What you need to know in essence is the waiting time, the number of people waiting for the rides. If you come to Thailand and remove them, you probably won't have to come... / Regarding the fire escape door, while waiting in line, I saw it, but there were a lot of railings. will be used in time or will be carried out Well, it depends on the theme of the ride...

Horrible experience... Long wait for rides.. due to bad weather forecast all outdoor rides closed for 3hrs... No compensation by extending closing time . thanking my stars that I didn't waste money on express pass as it would hv been waste cause of sudden closure. Dissapointed

Parts of the park were shut down including many of the dining shops and food stalls so getting lunch was impossible..... Super frustrating to be unable to get food to your starving family, we ended up leaving the park and eating outside. In addition obligating you to rent a locker for 4 an hour is outrageous. Quite disappointing overall experience of

Don't get me wrong, I did enjoy the park in general but it's far from perfect. Few things here to note, 1. It's a relatively small park, but not like super super crowded on Sunday. 2. Most popular rides will take 30-60mins of queueing time on average. Sometimes you may have to wait longer than 1 hour. So it can be really frustrating to spend half the time in the park waiting. 3. We got the unlimited ride express pass, and it cut the queueing time down to 10-20mins on average. But yes, you still need to queue up despite spending 90 extra per pax. All rides are shared among regular and express lane ticket holders, it's just that the express lane usually has a shorter queue. 4. You may not actually play all the rides more than once or twice due to time constraints and exhaustion. So it's probably difficult to fully utilize the unlimited express pass. 5. Most of the rides are unexciting and catered for kids and family except Human and Cyclon, the Mummy indoor ride, Transformer... Most experiential attractions are not bad as well, but may not be worth the queue. Hence the 3 stars

Kids loved spending the day here. We were lucky as the children managed to do most of the rides with little waiting time. However, would imagine that there are days when the waiting time for rides would be really long. Good thing, however, is that you do not have to commit to an Express Ticket until you get to Universal Studios and assess the crowd situation for yourself. There are machines inside the park area that seem to sell Express Tickets. Down side of the day... the park restaurants were not all open causing congestion in the few that were operating.

Overall a great day out but there are certain areas closed for refurbishment but this isnt reflected in the entry price. We bought some drinks slushys and canned coke from one of the small kiosks in the main complex near the 1st few rides and had to return a can as the drink was flat so they replaced it, after closer inspection of the 2nd can after tasting similar I noticed the can was a year out of date, I ended up throwing it away rather than trying to explain the problem. Its the little things that make the difference but the children enjoyed the rides.

First issue was reaching the place. We commuted by bus and as per Google Maps we got down at village hotel stop and maps said to walk, but directions were not clear. And in village hotel stop there were no sign boards and no staff around. So nearly 10 tourists like us were standing there confused.then luckily some one returning from there pointed us to walk 200 ms and take sentosa express to next stop. Enjoyed all the rides and shows that were open. Many were closed or under maintnance and the queues were long at transformers ride, nearly 1.15 hours and food and drinks are costly than outside as expected. Overall had a good experience

The place was clean as expected, but quite a few eating stalls with drinks were closed. The queues for rides were incorrect, as 1 ride we did said 40minutes, we didn't get on the ride for a further 100minutes.

Best theme based rides and best place to have fun with friends and family. It's very crowded on weekends and each ride would have a wait time of 1 to 2 hours. Would recommend to take express pass if you could afford the same to skip the long queues.

Nice amusement park. I don't know the big one in Orlando, but let's just say we're in a sort of Disney Studios Paris version. Two thrilling rides: Cylone and Human, with a special mention for Cylone . Transformers is also a must-do, an intense 3D adventure . Less of a fan, but the rest of the family loved: Mummy's Revenge. Otherwise, a lovely park atmosphere with legendary universes: Shrek, Jurassic Park, Transformers... and the Minions sliding everywhere! The outdoor scenery suffers from the weather, but everything inside is impeccable. During our visit, the entire Madagascar universe was under construction, so we'll have to go back... A short day is more than enough. Wait times can be very long, and flow isn't always optimal. Food is at the heart of the concept, as in all parks! We ate a family meal for four at Loui's NY Pizza Parlor. The food and prices were very reasonable. Enjoy!
Great park with lots of fun filled rides and activities. The different themed zones are also amazing. It brings joy to all ages alike. It's worth the visit.

Visited in August 2022. Attending guests from Japan. Since I visited on a weekday, it wasn't as crowded as on Saturdays and Sundays, and I was able to ride most attractions with a maximum wait time of about 40 minutes. I definitely recommend Revenge of Mommy! It was really fun to run through the darkness like Indiana Jones at Disney in Japan There is a line for people who ride alone at the boarding area, but if you choose this option, you will be able to ride the attraction with a great shortcut. You can. I was able to get on the train in 3 minutes while everyone else was waiting for 40 minutes (lol)

An Exhilarating Experience to have for any visitor to this wonderland. The rides, especially Cylon, Human, Transformers, Rapids and Revenge of the Mummy were Outstanding! The Hollywood theme, character meetings, various shows, infrastructure, locker provisions and tourist amenities were top notch. Only improvement needed is the Food quality and healthy food variety available within the park. No outside food is allowed and there are long queues for food too.

Had a worst experience visiting . All you can experience 3-4 good rides that too 1.5-2 min each . No GoPro or any such devices allowed to film while in rides . Over expensive food inside . Racist staffs . You have some better places to visit in Singapore.

Don't waste your money or time. Half of the attractions are closed and huge ques for the rides and food . Very slow service and stone cold expensive food. We went to the diner at 3 thinking the rush is over. 1 hour wait for cold rubbish burger and chips.

Visited on 16th Sept 2022. So not worth it. Open late and close early. Many attractions were closed. F&B options were also very limited. Long queue at one of the food courts because that was the only one operating. Staff were all wearing a long face. Some of them dont even check your express pass properly. Honestly don't waste time getting the unlimited express pass. Not only that many of them dont check, they also dont scan. You still get "unlimited" rides with normal express pass. If you plan to visit, i would strongly suggest that you don't waste your time and money here until they are operating like pre-covid. waste of time and money.

Totally dissapointing... We visited on a Monday. Nevertheless, at Transaformers, 90 minutes waiting time was written. Yes, you *could* buy the express for double or tripled up cost (we paid 300 S for 2 parents, 1 teanager and 1 child). In reality, we waited over 120 minutes. With that, we were afraid, that we wont finish the attractions, as the park opens at 11AM and closes 6PM. But no worries guys. Madagascar theme park is closed. So was Tresure hunting, Jurrasic world beside the carousel for 5 years old. Waterworld is non existing too, and nothing else provided. Waiting time at battle star galactica 140 (!!!) minutes. Not because too much people, but because every 10 minutes a car was started. Add on the disappointed faces from all the peoples as practically only Transformers and Battlestar were open for grown peoples. The meet and greets just an obligation, the shops providing nothing what you cannot buy at amazon or Ali. Save your 300 dollar for 4 persons and visit something else. (not to mention that Universal Studio provided the same attractions already for the Transformers 5 years ago)
So many of the rides are shut for no reason. The management team hasn't even posted it on their website. Total waste of money, time and energy.

Rides here are alright, but the park is a bit small. Went on a Saturday morning, and could have be done by about 8 hours or so including queueing and so forth. Most rides are for kids, with only few rides being exciting. However, Mel's burger is really good, though it may be more pricey due to it being in the park. Tip: bring in your food and drinks as no one seems to be checking for it. Can save you a whole lot of money as food isn't cheap. Note: if you have visited any other Universal Studios before, this place is probably worth only a 3 stars, and is definitely not worth your time going to in Singapore.

Some rides were closed when we visited (ie. the water rides) but most were open. Recommended to come late morning as queues get worse from afternoon onwards. Expect to queue up to 2 - 3h for a single ride but then get rejected due to technical difficulties. Not all rides have indoor queueing areas so do bring water and a portable fan if needed. Rides like "The Revenge of The Mummy" were quite good and worth the queueing time in our opinion. Food and drinks within USS are also quite expensive so do bring your own snacks and drinks if you wish. Most rides have free lockers at the side for you to put your bags. One thing is that some staff working within the rides are quite impatient. I understand some visitors may be quite unreasonable, but some level of professionalism is expected and the tone which a few used to shout at visitors were quite aggressive and could scare kids.
Long waiting times which ease towards the afternoon. A few rides were closed. Prices were ok, staff was friendly.

Some attractions closed, definitely a park for children and families (for whom it's fine) and for teenagers or adults. Small, I expected it to be bigger, Gardaland is huge in comparison. It didn't excite me at all, in 2 hours and a little more I did everything (no Human and the other one, the 2 rollercoasters with over 1 hour of waiting, for the rest super slim and well organized lines). However clean and tidy and very kind staff.

Very small amusement park and most of restaurants and snack places are closed. Therefore there a huge lines in front of the few open ones. We were in line for an hour for lunch. (On the other hand there was tons of restaurants and snacks on the outside of the park) Some of the rides really needs paint and some craftsmen attention- the look worn down. Very few rides for small children. Weird that there isnt some kind of shade over the walking paths. Singapore is hot! You can do the whole thing in 3-4 hours.

I honestly love this place so much. Feels like home, the staff at extremely friendly. I was there to ask them if they could help print out the tickets for the Halloween Horror Nights event and they responded so nicely and quickly. An experience Ill never ever forget

In south Asia there is no comparison with universal studios Singapore. It's a perfect one. But after the corona situation, few rides are still under construction. Very beautiful park. I visited 3 times whenever I visited Singapore. I just love this place.
Great experience though water world and Jurassic park are not open. It is worth the visit. The transformer is amazing.
Incredible theme park! Has amazing studios attraction. Perhaps they have to extend their operational time . Overall impressive
Excellent rides & well maintained. Value for money for the food. It could get crowded during peak hours.

If you had been at Universal in the USA, don't visit this one in Singapore. You will be disappointed. Not worth the money. And some areas where even closed. Queue managent is bad and slow. Lack of staff makes process very inefficient. The park needs quality checks.

Too crowded and with numerous rides not operating including the water world show, a nightmare with waiting time over 90 mins in most cases. Staffing appeared inadequate and many food and drink venues were not open . Perhaps universal studios SG should cap the numbers in the park and make it more worthwhile for the people paying 74 per person. Not recommended under these current conditions
We waited in queue for more than 40 mins. And at the end they said the ride has some issue. This happend multiple times and the whole day was a waste of time. And guess what? No refunds.
All the rides were closed when we visited. Waste of money. Rude staff. All the rides had technical problems. Please don't visit this place and lose your money.

The rides are less than 3 mins, but the waiting times are horrendous. I waited 1.5 hours for a ride (3D Transformer) that lasted probably about 3-4 mins. Then while I was waiting for the Human Vs Cylone ride, it was announced the ride had closed. Also, I'm certain there was an "accident" on the line, and it had not been cleaned up properly. It smelled foul, and I even saw traces of it in the pathway. The waiting time is awful. Don't think about coming here without an express ticket. (However, even that is only limited to some of the rides.) Also, other rides and attraction sites have been closed. Universal Studios was one of biggest reason I came to the Singapore. It's been a total let down. I wouldn't recommend it. I won't be coming here again unless there's been major changes.

It's starting to look a little tired and could do with some TLC. When I went quite a few rides, shows and shops were closed, but of course the ticket price remains the same. Many of the rides are pretty average for today's standards, and EXTREMELY short, especially for how long you may have to wait. I still had fun but I think it needs some improvements to keep up with parks of a similar calibre.

There are quite a lot of tourists. Waiting in line for each ride is quite long. The place is not wide, can walk around. The restaurant is quite adequate but doesn't accept cash. Various shows There is a clearly visible sign showing the show times. But you can view it through the theme park's app.
Nice but quite a number of rides not available. Also lockers lacking

We went to the park for a second time last weekend (first visit was in 2014). The Madagascar area is no longer there (gonna be replaced by a Minion area as per their website). Jurassic World's Rapid ride was down that day. Not all restaurants were open though which is ok as the crowd wasn't that big. We bought the express pass so the wait time wasn't too bad. Seems the park is well maintained but in some places you can see it has aged a little. Otherwise a fun filled day for the kids.

Good experience. Loved the rides. Transformers have been nice. I loved the sound studio demonstration. Never knew how it's done in the real world. It was cool should not miss it apart from the rides. Food outlets have been bit of a back step. They have offers which are way too complex and takes time to decide at the counter. Food is not very good either. The options I had I mean. They got some restaurant options that should be better. Pls be mindful of this. One development point for Universal to try and get it fixed. After all ppl need some reasonably good food as they enjoy the rides.

I had an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! The rides were so much fun and I loved the themed areas. The staff were all so friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great day out.

Absolutely amazing day! Definitely recommend coming here for a good adventure. I do recommend coming at opening time as the queue for the rides are less. The ride queues does get long quickly, so expect some long wait times. The Transformers ride is much more quite at the end of the day.

Had a phenomenal time with my family here. The rides are great, each one giving you a rush of adrenaline. The entire place had an immersive atmosphere, that really made you feel as if you were right there in that world. The waiting lines were tedious, as even the express pass queue was long
Amazing rides and amazing atmosphere. But waiting time for each ride is killing. Try to go there on weekdays . But most rides are amazing.

Went to USS for the Halloween horror night 10 event love what they have done with this place. The horror aesthetic is amazing, the mood is so well set. Only comments is if you're coming here for the first time please get the priority pass or else the queue for everything is almost 1 hour some that are more popular takes up to 2 hours

Very poor price/quality ratio as 4 main attractions were closed without any notification. Express tickets were not valid for 2 other attractions so we still had to wait a long time. For a family a 5 this was a very expensive disappointing day. After filing this as a complaint, the response from the service desk was far below our expectations as no effort was done to cheer us up.

1/3 of park (Madagascar) was under construction!! The most popular part of park. Rides kept stopping due to technical faults! This causes very long waiting time, even cancelled! Food was terrible! I could not finish my burgers! This park is very old! With these incidents Im concern about the safety of rides as well. To sum up, its a waste!

Seriously ? Jurassic park closed, waterworld closed, Madagascar closed. Went into the galactic and it was written 15 mn wait. We waited 1h30 mn. Not because there was a long queue but bchasse those with express pass were constantly passing over. This is crazy!!!! At the end the locker wanted us to pay 8. The management should seriously review the express pass numbers and quotas per day and how to insert them in the queue. This is not acceptable and at the end I still paid my ticket didnt I Dont go there it has become a huge mess.
Worst experience. 1h long lines. Especially transformer. Buy skip the line ticket. Visited on Friday.

It sucks! ! ! The ticket office took half an hour to deal with a group of people getting stuck! Let everyone enter at 1:30! The park closes at 6:00! Ive been to Universal Studios and Disney all over the world and Ive never had this problem before! Never encountered such service!

Not a fan of this Universal Studios. Its a bit run down, most shows and a few of my fav attractions are closed down. The Shrek 4D ride didnt have good sound and motion effects, it was either really delayed or wasnt there at all. Im vegetarian and they barely had any available vegetarian/vegan items. I was probably able to find just 3 vegetarian meals in the whole park (one of them being pizza). They need to start being more inclusive. Overall though its alright. Some of the rides are really fun. The only reason I would consider going back is because I had fond memories of there from when I was a teen.

It's always nice to visit USS, it's always frustrating to queue up for hours, especially when the express pass would cost more than the admission. Don't fret - eat first. The lines get lighter around two hours after opening. Take pictures with the characters and just take a round before heading to the rides.

I enjoyed a day here but I have few things I did not like. First thing is locker system. To get on a ride, we had to keep our belongings inside the locker. The price of locker is expensive and I did not find any meanings of putting things inside. In total we spent aound 5 just for locker. This is hidden cost of Universal Studios Singapore. I have been to Universal Studio Japan, it was not like this. The price of water is extremely expensive. Over all, they are slow. It took time to change from the guests finished the ride to new coming guests. I liked the ride Mummy. I did not reget to came here but they need some improvements. I prefer Universal Studio Japan in terms of service, ride, and price. You have to keep in your mind that their operation hour is quite short from 12 to 7.

A compact theme park - perhaps could do with another big coaster, the human version of the battle star galactica coaster wasnt great! But the theming of the park was really impressive and we were able to do all the rides by about 2pm after arriving at opening.
The waiting time for this popular attraction was around 2 hours and the indoor air quality was very bad.

222 Christmas at Universal Studio Singapore Is the most Wonderful time of the Year Upon entering, you parade thru the walk of fame for the Christmas shows on stage. I felt like a NewYorker when I saw subway station entrance like the ones I been to on the streets of NewYork Followed by SciFi zone greeted by Transformers, the Mummys at Ancient Eygpt, dinosaur of Lost world and as I brave the strong afternoon sun to reach the far far far away fairytale land Waiting time for rides are average 30min on weekday early noon when I visited. Restaurants were pack during lunch time (I tried the butter chicken Briyani at Oasis resturant SGD 16 on average, small portion thus I ended up snacking on 6 corndog and 7 coconut drinks from the pushcart) Gift shop was so attractive that I bought some items thou Im a local Size of theme park is not big compared to Usa Australia Korea Japan themepark that I been to However, the performance was great and most importantly good experience. Highly recommended when you visit Sentosa Island. 22 Halloween at Universal Studio Many great rides n fun place for the family Insta ju.rine
Amazing place long queues for rides in the weekend. Reccomend buying the queue skip ticket or you can be in queues up to 90 minutes long

Yesterday was A perfect even its on the weekend. Probably because of the halloween most of them going for a night horror. So less crowded in a day. Suggested for you guys purchased the tickets online on its own website. Its super easy. Print it then just heading straight away to the entrance. Then you good to go. Even though they have few rides and shows that's unavailable right now but mostly other rides still opened and still can enjoy it. Overall we are very enjoy every moment there.

A very nice place to visit. A smaller copy of the one in the states. Many roller coasters there and good themes to watch and play in. It has Madagascar, dream work, Egyptian, sci-if and far away sections. The place is organized but a bit crowded. I do recommend buying the express tickets as they make you fly through queues.
Very fun place to visit! Minimum queue times on all attractions (When we visited) so we were able to ride most of them. Highly recommended!

Really disappointed. After visiting Disneyland in Japan a couple of years ago we were looking forward to Universal Singapore. It was a huge disappointment. Too many people let in - even the fast pass was slow. 2 hour waits at all rides. The food line was ridiculous and the food revolting!!

Was a very disappointing experience. Property is very old, lack of maintenance. All the rides badly short handed. Only 3 food outlets were open, served Pre-prepared burgers, hotdogs etc which were awful and highly priced. We paid 19 for a burger at the diner which tasted terrible.

Pathetic conduct of shows. Over crowded and waiting for each show is more then two hours. A big disappointment specially during festival season when they should have catered for rush. Also in Transformer show dekay and que was more then three hours and no support from the staff. Very disappointing.

The place was horrible, the wait for everything was long, the queue was unorganised for rows and restaurants. Mostly, the predicted time wait was incredibly inaccurate and pathetic. The restaurants was overly crowded without enough seating and service was extremely bad. Dont ever go!!! WASTE OF MONEY!!!!

The express card system at Universal Studios Singapore make people who can hardly afford a ticket to enter universal studio and their young kids waiting in line for several hours, while 15 years old whose rich parents could afford express ticket just pass by and get to go 10 times while the majority of the people is waiting. The express system also makes the estimated "waiting line" unpredictable. 40 minutes can easily become 2 hours, as almost nobody is allowed in besides the express card holders. You get the poor children crying and sleeping tired into their parents arms, while the 15 year old rich laugh about the poor mass waiting, and stating that these poor people in the waiting line are crazy (and they are right...). Fortunately Universal Studios in Singapore is almost the only entertainment park with such a horrible discriminating system. It is better to go somewhere else, so everybody can enjoy their time, and not only the "rich".

I was in Universal Park on a Saturday but in the low season (November). So there were few waiting times. The longest was 30 minutes. That's why I would also advise against an express ticket. Practical are the lockers in front of the main entrance. They are a bit expensive, but so it's more practical if you want to drop off your luggage. The park is definitely much smaller than that in Japan. Nevertheless, you can have a lot of fun. The most potential is still in the shows. They can still be improved.

Attractions are great! Revenge of the Mummy TRANSFORMERS the ride Battlestar Galactica:SYLON Battlestar Galactica:HUMAN The roller coaster will be lined up in a row after depositing luggage in a locker in advance The waiting time of the official app is a reference level The Christmas season is full of people and the capacity of restaurants is insufficient USJ

Good place if you are NOT A SENIOR CITIZEN. Waiting time is much much more than the action on rides etc. Look at the wait time display before you enter each ride. Rating is done from a Senior perspective only.
Beautiful place to visit however too much of crowd ....waited for 1 -1.5 hrs for rides.must visit in Singapore.

Visiting on Boxing Day , busy as expected , services slow , even Starbucks seems to be at crawling pace .rides are average and you have to wait a while , seems like we spent more time waiting then enjoying . A fantasy theme park for the deluded .

Everyone only has negative things to say about this park but it's really amazing and you have about 7 hours of activity with the rides, plus the meet and greets and shows. I would definitely consider an annual membership.
Amazing!!!! Great rides, amazing staff and very organised!!
Great roller coaster theme park. It's really worth the wait for an hour queue. Definitely coming back. You need to consider using queue pass so you can have more attractions in one day.

Buying tickets online was a breeze. Although I got it from the sentosa website instead of the resorts world one. It's been awhile since i went to USS for the daytime fun as past few years have only been attending the HHN instead. So it was some awesome time spent with loved ones. We got there about noon and still managed to get on the major rides and some of the lesser known ones. So for those who wants to cover all the rides, it's best to come early from their opening hours at 11am. And if you have the budget, get the express entry for all these rides. Of all the major rides, i loved the Cylon (Battlestar Galactica), Revenge of the Mummy, Transformers and the jurassic park rapids adventure. The jurassic park one is slightly different from the one at universal hollywood. From the size of the boat to some parts of the ride itself. But it is still a thrilling one nonetheless. The cylon was such a crazy one. The adrenaline rush is mind blowing. Likewise for the mummy and transformers too. For those who are more on the timid side, they can try the treasure hunter or the accelerator. For quite the movie experience, visit the lights, camera, action to feel the wrath of a cat 4 typhoon but be careful as you may get wet. Or for quite the "ride" shrek 4d is another favourite. I didn't get to ride some of the other rides due to time constrained and also was getting tired and just wanna hang out at the beach after that. While some parts are closed for renovation/upgrades. And for those who are still afraid to experience the rides m all (although it's a waste if u do), there are several instagrammable places to take pics.
Amazing place to hang... have full day time to enjoy all ride as waiting time is 20-60 mins.

Ques were not aligned with posted durations, (all were / 25% from posted times). Minimal food vending sitrs, available ones were overwhelmed by number of guests Food quality was low, based on Singapore high standards Rides quality was low compared to other parks (US & EU) Personnel was burdened by amount of guests' relative to available support Be patient and try to enjoy yourselves, skip it and enjoy other atractions in Singapore instead.

I don't want to sound mean but there are some things I have to say. The experience of visiting Universal Studios Singapore in 2022 was somewhat poor. I must tell the truth. The main problems are as follows: 1. It is obvious that USSG laid off too many staff at the beginning of the epidemic, and currently the playground is facing a serious staff shortage. The staff lacks training and there is a serious shortage of labor. Although every staff member works hard, their fatigue can be clearly felt. There is no staff to manage the team, and some rides (The Mummy, Galactica, etc.) must be stored, but no one informed them in advance. Staff can only perform management at the project entrance, and there will be no extra staff to maintain order during this period. 2. There are insufficient restaurants, insufficient mobile vendors, insufficient vending machines, and insufficient direct drinking water points. There are too few staff at the catering sales points to serve the large number of tourists, and the speed is very slow, resulting in long queues. 3. The park area is too small and there are too many maintenance projects. Some projects, such as the jeep-riding parent-child project, can be completely stopped. 4. Transformers The Ride: The Ultimate 3D Battle, a projector was damaged during New Years Day! ! ! ! ! Resulting in dark and heavy shadows in the image. This is a serious performance accident, and it is an irresponsible behavior for the project to continue operating despite such problems! ! ! ! ! ! ! 5. Due to its lack of operational capabilities, Battlestar Galactica completely failed to reflect its design intentions, and it was also an irresponsible behavior towards tourists. One of the selling points of the Battlestar Galactica project is that the two roller coasters stagger forward and backward, which requires the two trains to cooperate in the departure time, but currently due to lack of manpower, this has not been reflected at all. 6. The useless Fast Pass. The official website states that the pass is only valid for 2 hours after the start of operation, but there is no time limit on actual sale and use, and unclear information can cause many problems. At the same time, not all Fast Pass locations can be used, and the sales quantity is not controlled. At certain times, there may be more Fast Pass players than normal queue players. 7. The attitude of the restaurant staff is extremely bad. There is no one to manage the queue. The staff who pre-registered the order made a driving gesture to us for no reason, intending to make us go to another queue. This is extremely insulting and reflects the extremely low level of park management, because I believe the staffs intention is not to insult tourists but they are obviously not trained. 8. The store SKU is too old and all IPs are not competitive. If the selling point of usj Japan is Harry Potter, then ussg has no idea. 9. The maintenance time of Water World is too long, and it has not been repaired for how long. It took such a long time to repair a project in such a large area in such a small park. 10. Entry into the park was also quite chaotic. Tourists queued up spontaneously at first without any guidance from staff, but in the end, the number of queues became more than a dozen, and no one guided the queue in advance. US SG's evaluation should be benchmarked against amusement parks. If usj's overall evaluation is 5 points, then ussg can only score 3 points, which is too much. If Tokyo Disney has an overall score of 5, then ussg can only give 2 points. Tourists and staff are full of fatigue. The operational level of ussg is not comparable to that of Happy Valley. I think it is a pity. For the Chinese, most of the first batch of Chinese people to learn modern management knowledge came through the window of Singapore, but I dont know why the current management is like this.

Poor management of opening hours makes this park congested and frustrating to visit. I don't understand why, although the park opens at 11am, some attractions inside are only active from 2pm. This obviously has repercussions on the fact that thousands of people flock together into the only open activities, creating queues of no less than 60-70 minutes. In 5 hours we only managed to do 4 attractions lasting a few minutes. If it is true that time is money, it is absolutely worth taking the express pass together with the entrance ticket to skip (part of) the queues.

Most awful place I ever been. Small park that can't handle all people. You are in line for 1 to 2 hrs and can't make more than 4 rides on a whole day because of the que. Almost no restaurant and the one there is sell garbage to high place. I nearly vomit on a Cafe that sell food because it's so bad and overpriced. I don't recommend to spend time here except you want to waste time.

Disappointing period. Only open for 7 hours, from 11am till 6pm. Couldn't enjoy much due to covid, i.e. no live show, Madagascar park is closed, queue will take way over 1 hour each, they allow unlimited passes for express now (thus expect 2 to 3 times from each customer and longer queue for normal pass)

I arrived at the 11 o'clock entrance, but there were a lot of people waiting. Transformers was a really good attraction, and Shrek 4D was okay, but the other attractions weren't as good. I was especially disappointed with Mummy. When there are a lot of people, it's really a continuous wait. At Disneyland, there are a lot of people, so there are a lot of fun things to do even if you wait or don't have to ride the attractions, but Universal Studios O seems to be a bit weak in that aspect. Still, Transformers was so much fun. So much so that I want to visit again to ride this.

I went to USS ON 4th Jan 2023 with a 7year old. Waiting time was around 60mins for each ride on average. Rides conclude at 6pm even though the rides open at 11am/12pm depending on the ride. With at least Waterworld closed, I was still not able to enjoy all the rides I wished to get onto due to the lengthy waiting times. 60mins easily feel like 3hours when you're with an impatient and grumpy 7year old. I missed out on the "big" ones( high speed roller coaster etc) which I really wanted to get onto due to their long waiting times of at least 90mins each. The day I went was not a public holiday/Christmas day/New Year's day. Food queues are lengthy as well. With that said, rides/attractions were mostly enjoyable once you get onto them (with a few exceptions). Will I go there soon? No. Did I enjoy myself? Neutral. The takesaway for me is to go there after the "post COVID release" novelty wears off if I were to do it again.
It was one of the main attractions to visit during this trip to Singapore. Unfortunately, the weather was not kind and it rained heavily. Indians love to jump in line

The attractions are good but there are not that many games. As in all parks there were many people, long waiting lines. When we bought the ticket online because we were foreigners, we did not get the fast pass anywhere, but it is essential to get it, if you find the option. Since the park's hours are from 11am to 6pm and it was very busy. I recommend it but the California Universal is much better, in terms of attractions and atmosphere.

The park is quite large and has many things to do. As a reminder, if you want to have more fun, be sure to purchase a fast pass ticket. Because there are too many tourists, there are basically a bunch of people queuing up for each event. If you dont buy a quick pass, you will have to queue for an average of two or three hours for each event. Your legs will become weak when you stand. When its your turn to play, you will no longer be in the mood. Quick pass is similar to jumping in line. Although it is more expensive, you still have to buy it if you have no choice.

Pls book your ticket online The queue here is crazy Also the best experience ever Theres so much to do The roller coaster as nerve wrecking but the best I waited 2 hrs in queue for the ride Also try the lights,camera action studio by Steve. Spielberg It felt like I was in a real movie set It was surreal The popcorn was so delicious too Always get express ticket It will make your experience better Its the best place to take your kids

What can I say, you must be there to have a great day. Lots of rides, fun, suitable for all ages lots of walking so be prepared. Must spend one full day and must go for express pass as there are always long queues.
Really good theme park. Recommended - Transformers, Revenge of the mummy (Waiting time could be long, but worth the wait)

The place was exquisite and amazing. The rides there were incredible. The best was the Egyptian ghost mummy ride the hotel facilities were the best I even ate whole day meal there. Inside universal studios I felt like in cinematic mood. It was really amazing and I enjoyed a lot. I am eagerly waiting to go again another time. I recommend for people to go there and live their enjoyable time.

Amazing setup and joyful environment. Will take whole day to cover all attraction points. Among rides, Transformer & Mummy are amazing. Just reach here at the earliest otherwise will have to wait long in queues on entry and in rides.

Website tickets purchase is not working. Machines self service not working properly. Super long ques to customer service counter. Experience ruined even before we entered the park. In total, trying online multiple times, lining to costumer service spent maybe 2 hours to pay them 263. And even no simple sorry. Probably they need to hire new IT and customer service directors.

Used to be great. Currently in Feb 2023, so many rides are closed. The restaurants are all terrible and overpriced with horrible service. Whenever it rains, out comes a lighting warning which closes all outdoor rides - i.e. most of the fun ones - and mamagement will keep these closed even if the rain stops and no lightning at all. This completely ruins the experience and is probably being lazy / an excuse, and not caring about the customer experience. Very poor vs any other comparables globally. Do not bother visiting until they fix the above issues - the rating is completely misleading.

Most employees entertain consumers/tourists with an attitude of not wanting to go to work, making consumers feel like they are rushing to get off work. When we arrived on the day, the facilities were damaged on the way. Customers who bought express tickets just took them with them, while those who didn't buy express tickets were given free express tickets for the day. It is strongly not recommended to buy unlimited express because it is too small. Very disappointed with this journey

I encountered rude staff in USS , black face , no manners! I visited in 2022 encountered once,but i choose to peace and didn't argue back, this time2023, again! Buying food i paying by 100cash note , the staff told me that,she can refuse to sell , black face blaming me because i paying 100dollars note , Rws Uss are u sure this kind of bad attitude can bring happiness or your staff just want to passed the stress around?

What a disappointment! On a Monday... about 60% of the park was closed / under renovation or under construction. Both restaurants and attractions. I mainly saw "CLOSED" on the doors, or sails over the buildings or there are walls on entire parts of the park for renovations (which, by the way, have been dormant for a long time). What did work looked only moderately to poorly maintained. High time that the park was thoroughly renovated and updated. Worst Universal Studios park I ever visited. I have been going to Orlando for several years, but Singapore is not worthy of the name. It feels chaotic (you have no idea where you are and/or where to go) and it lacks a soul. The park is CURRENTLY not recommended at all. Tickets are expensive for what you get (as are the food and drinks).
