You are better off doing all the other attractions on all of Sentosa Island for the same rate, but at least you get value for your money.

Visited 3 times before, and it was still great. The queues for famous rides were still long as usual. Would recommend getting an express pass if you can afford it. If you have good patience, it was OK. The queue went by quite fast as the staffs were quite good in their job. However, this time, there were much fewer costumes walking around. The only one that we saw was the Cat during the opening of the gate. Food choices were also fewer than few years ago.

Good fun but as always tickets, food, drinks, and merchandise was overpriced. Expect to queue for hours for certain rides. Jurassic river rapids ride especially had an insane queue and malfunctions throughout causing delays. Wasnt worth waiting for.
We always have a fun time whenever we visit USS. Waiting times for popular rides are okay and bearable. Food in restaurants are okay. Place is a bit small, though.

Enjoyed my time at Universal Studio Singapore, despite long queues and high prices. USS was a mixed experience. While the CYLON and HUMAN roller-coasters were great. The HUMAN roller-coaster was only open for half a day during my visit, and then queue was very long. Unfortunately, we didn't have a chance to ride it. Some attractions required lockers, which were either limited or costly. I recommend planning what to bring beforehand as one day is not enough to explore everything.
Place is good and fun... i just wished all attractions were open. When my family went, 3 attractions were close. But over all our ti.e there was still good.

Had a fantastic day at Universal Studios Singapore with my family! The setup was fantastic, including the gift shop, the food stands, and the many themes across the entire area! The lines for the rides were absurdly long, and each ride required at least an hour of waiting. But the wait was totally worthwhile! The staff was helpful and polite, and they did not tolerate customers who didn't line up or tried to skip the line. I'd want to express my gratitude to Melinda for her excellent assistance to my family and I. She went above and beyond to guide us through the theme park. I had an absolutely wonderful time here altogether, and I will definitely come back!

Best theme based rides and best place to have fun with friends and family. It's very crowded on weekends and each ride would have a wait time of 1 to 2 hours, but it's worth it! Would recommend to take express pass if you could afford to skip the long queues. Much recommended for everyone and also tourist to come to Universal Studio Singapore!

Plan ahead it got plenty of themes and ride to explore which won't be able to cover in single day. So go for express ticket or they have waiting time displayed/announced on every ride...so you can plan accordingly. This place is worth visiting

Thanks for the tips from people on the internet. Make it play until it's complete. (It is recommended to come early in the morning and walk around on the left first. And having all day is the best) and getting to meet and greet all the cute mascots that you want! Bought a collar for over 600 baht, soft, licensed, very pleased.

An amazing theme park.But the problem is there is huge waiting for every ride.If you want experience all the rides go for the fast ride.Or else you should wait for 1-2 hours for every 2-5 mins ride.The mummy ride was unexpected that was the best ride.And transformers was also good.

Visited in March 2023! negative impression! There are only four attractions for adults in the entire park! Terribly long lines, I had to wait 20-40 minutes in line! an advertised place that actually doesnt even qualify for economy class in the province!

Pretty disappointing experience. As others have outlined everything is VERY outdated, there is lack of communication with ride wait times, there are unexplained closures on significant rides. Staff were riding the roller coasters even though they said they were closed. Most of the shows were cancelled due to bad weather however it was not even raining and it was not communicated until the show was due to start. I would not recommend wasting your money.

Very small park with only a few rides. Left after two hours. Waiting times aren't too bad if you come at 11am. No need to get the express pass if you go early or are a single rider. Corndog was terrible. Not worth coming here tbh.
Bad weather ruined an already unpleasant experience. Too many hassles, right from not being allowed handbags to the very curt borderline impolite staff, no veg food options

extremely long quene, extremely long waiting time for all games, poor signage for waiting time. always trap you into the long quene for games, and no exit in the middle of quene even u want to leave the game. Ruining my day in Santosa.

Place was not bad, but weather is too crazy to actually enjoy the rides Everyone is just hot and sweaty, and smells once u start queuing. (especially the indoor rides) Some rides definitely needs maintanence as the power just shuts off suddenly.

There are some good attractions, that's for sure. But the customer is considerably neglected, given the price of entry, and even more so the fast pass. I hesitated a lot to buy it (family of 5, it's a budget!), and I ultimately didn't take it because we came on a weekday outside of school holidays. (Please note that you can buy it once there if necessary if you are hesitant). There are quite a few people but it's manageable (up to 50 minutes for certain attractions, or even a little more at the end of the day). You should carefully check the waiting times for attractions with the park app throughout the day. Times can vary quite a bit from one attraction to another throughout the day. So adapt your program accordingly. The most disappointing thing is that they don't always put wait times correctly. Sometimes it's right, sometimes it's not. Avoid backpacks as much as possible because some attractions (especially thrill rides) prohibit it and you will have to waste time putting your bags in lockboxes which may be chargeable depending on the time and/or the attraction you are doing. I would have avoided taking one if I had known. Overall, on a day like today (3/16/23), you can do almost all the interesting attractions (by which I mean either thrill rides if that's your thing, or softer ones, especially for young children). It's difficult, however, to do everything without the fastpass, even without a lunch break). If you don't have much time, or you prefer to pay the price to get the most out of it, don't hesitate to take the fastpass unlimited. Wifi is much appreciated to help pass the time in queues. The food there is quite expensive and not particularly good quality. (It is normally forbidden to bring food). For thrill rides, I recommend in order: Transformers, Battle Stars Cyclone, Revenge of the Mummy, Jurrassic Park Rapid Adventure. Shrek 4d and adventures airways aren't bad either. Enjoy!

So the place is basically themed the same as the other parks in Florida, but when I visited there were many malfunctioning rides , third of the park is closed for renovation, so you miss out on a lot , but if the park was open in its entirety it would be fun, one day is enough

It's a very famous place. Although it is not large, it is cute and the vehicles are of a high standard. Although the waiting time is long and tiring, there is plenty to enjoy. Please note that Transformers is busier in the late afternoon. The Mummy was fun.
Nice theme parks enjoyed a lot. But some theme parks long queue on week end so need to wait more than a hour for one attraction
Amazing place. There is always a que for each rides so patience is necessary. Ticket prices are expensive. But overall an amazing experience

One of the best day i ever had! The queue for Transformers were insane though! Almost spent 2 hrs in queue only for this ride. But it was worth the wait! Although i couldn't feel my feet after that LOL. The Mummy are also awesome, rode that twice since the queue were not long. Battlestar Galactica are also a must when you're at this park!

A very good park with good rides. We went on a day when it started raining and they closed the outdoor roller coasters, but they reopened them later because the rain was light. It's a park with many rain-adapted rides and has indoor roller coasters that are very fun. I recommend the Mummy Coaster and the Shrek 4D and Lights, Camera, Action theaters, which featured special effects that mimicked a storm in a port. The staff was very friendly and helpful. You can buy tickets at the door from vending machines. I loved it.

This is a wonderful amazingly built amusement park. Must visit rides - Cylon, Mummy, Transformer, Jurassic Adventure. Download the Universal Studios App- it shows wait time at each ride which is very helpful in planning the day. The wait time shown in the app are accurate. Usually late afternoon Mummy and Transformers are empty.

The best theme park i have ever visited.the rides were amazing especially transformers and mummy.try to complete outdoor rides first because they will pause the operation of outdoor rides if it rains.better to take express pass because there won't be any wait for the people who have express pass.the maximum time we waited for each ride with express pass is less than 5 minutes.carry a poncho slong with you if possible because we will get soaked for one of the ride at Jurassic park theme.

I find this very frustrating experience. Manny rides was not working. Also many attractions are not in the working condition. We stand in line for almost 56 hours in a single day. Still was not able to finish all the rides. I think they are intentionally keeping people waiting just to sell express pass. It was a very frustrating experience when we ask for some concessions for the closed rights, they simply reject other request and told us there is nothing they can do. I shared the same experience from many people. They faced the same issue. So I think they are doing this intentionally to save some money.

I strongly recommend not to go. After waiting two queues for more than 60 minutes, the personnel announced the attraction is out of order. If you plan to visit singapore, definitely do not waste your time to go here.

A little chaotic, many people were cutting in line, and there's no one from the park near to avoid that. We were on the line for jurassic Park attraction and after 40 minutes in it the announced closing of it due to weather conditions in the vicinity, which it's something you can announce before or close it before too many people goes inside and waste time in the line. The cost of entry is ridiculous (81) and if you want the express pass it's 61 more ... not worth it at all....

Worst experience. There is no limit to the entry crowd. What a rip off. They just want to dump people inside. Not worth the money. Few rides are closed. The wait time for each ride is 60 to 90 mins. You can only enjoy like 2 to 3 rides if you have kids. After a wait time of nearly 1.30 hrs the rides(Battlestar Galactica) was closed due to technical issues. And another ride was stopped due to rain after a wait of 40mins.

Only come here if you have younger kids (8 and below) or have the patience to wait in line for 80 minutes for most rides. We went on a Friday thinking that queues would not be too bad but was not prepared for the 60-80 min wait times. They are only open from 11-5pm so do the math - you can really only ride a couple of times if you factor in meal time (food is overpriced). Many parts of the park were closed and it was the same with the food shops, so choices are limited. With an 82SGD entry ticket for adults and SGD61 for kids, consider carefully if that us where you want to spend your tourist money. I should have read the reddit reviews - they are all there. Don't make the mistake, even the locals do not think it is value for money.
It is good but not so good, the ticket bit expensive. Some rides where not open. Online tickets are cheap rather buying from cash windows. Some shows are very nice like Hollywood, 3D etc.

It could be a really nice place to visit but you are spending most of your time waiting in line. For some of the nicest roller coasters you can't have anything in your pockets. You first need to go to the lockers which are free for a certain time. Then you need to go to the correct waiting line. I really dislike their system with the Universal Express tickets. Not only because you make people willing/able to spend more money more important, it also slows down the whole process as the staff first need to check those tickets, mark them, count the people they let in first before allowing the normal people waiting in line... it annoyed me more and more during the day. I know I can complain but there are a lot of people with enough money, seeing the number of people using it, so they never going to change this system We didn't see a lot of the rest of the park because there was no time for it. So spend your time wisely. We really liked the Battlestar Galactica, the Mummy and the Shrek movie.

It is undoubtedly a super fun plan for the whole family but some of the attractions were out of service, the entire area of Madagascar for example. I think this affected the waiting time since the lines to get in were on average 50 to 80 minutes.
It is pretty good park, just little disappointed that water world not open and the queue is far too long.

As SG has limited theme park options, it became one of the top here. Rides are okay, with options catered for adults and kids. F&B are below expectations. Staff hospitality quite inconsistent. Need for more cooling fans around the premises on hot days. Wish the operating hours to be longer, with more entertainment other than the rides (which are limited and long wait time). Just refer to your global competitors pls. I also personally think that US Jpn has more value for money compared to USS.

Had an amazing experience here, it beyond my expectation. We purchased priority access and admission tickets via klook. Priority access is totally worth it I suggest you get one, we never fall in line. The Revenge of the Mummy is the best ride for me. I also enjoyed the Jurassic ride, though we got wet at the end of ride. The theme park overall is great and well comeback if I visit Singapore again

I love this place. Go here around the time the place opens as the crowd will be lesser to begin with. Both the roller coasters Human and Cyclone are an absolute treat. Sit in the front row to have a more crazy immersive experience. The other shows and 4D things are also very nicely done. Also getting the express tickets will help save a lot of waiting time
Amazing place! Pro tip - Enjoy the outdoor rides when it's not raining. The outdoor rides shut down once it starts raining. Best rides - Cyclone, Human, Transformers, Revenge of the mummy
Great variety of rides and food to eat. Not a long wait in the lines. Staff all very friendly. Lockers for bags great but have to pay in the Jurassic area. You will get wet on the Jurassic water ride

This is a must visit. Has something for all ages. Thrill-Seekers & Animation Lovers..don't miss this place. Dont miss these rides. 1. Transformers 2. Mummy Theme 5. Human & cyclon Long queues on most rides so we took express pass.(but we went on a public holiday) Overall experience was great & i highly recommend .
Worst place in the world to visit. Pay 80 dollar to be in the queue for many hours. 3 hours queue for a ride ????? Dont have any other things to do in singapore ???.

I'm seriously not recommending this place, this has just become a business. First of all no matter which pass you buy, You will not enjoy, because almost every ride has a waiting of nearly 1 to 2 hours minimum. Secondly if it rains which is very common in Singapore, the money you spent is a total waste. As they shut all the rides. They have locker system, which they give for 40 mins free, but since every ride has a waiting of nearly 2 hours. You end up paying the fees after 40 mins. Which makes no sense. Rides aren't that great. The one's that are mostly shut all time. If the park is flooded like this, none can enjoy. A sheer waste of money. There are barely any cafes serving veg options.

The amusement facilities were out of order and the queues took a long time. The only announcement was to advise tourists to experience other facilities first. Please follow the instructions of the staff when going to the exit. As a result, the staff were hiding inside and could not guide the exit route. If you wanted to go out, you had to push forward and ask how to get out. I had no idea how long it would take, and I wasted all my time waiting in line. It was such a bad experience. I couldnt understand how an advanced country could have such a bad crisis management model.

Over-rated... waste of money, time, and energy. management simply sells tickets to ennumber of people and makes profits. Any activity waiting period was more than 3 hours... least bother about visitors. if possible, I would have given a minus rating....no professionalism at all

This place has seriously gone downhills in recent times. With an entire section under renovation for the next year, the size of the park is equivalent to Malaysias legoland. Perhaps even smaller. A lot of the shows arent even available. The ticket price is not justified. Most of the park staff seem pretty rude and makes me feel like they do not want to even be working there. Perhaps the park is not paying them enough. I do feel like theres a lot of cost cutting everywhere. I recommend spending your time and money at other parts of Sentosa. Universal Studio Singapore is not worth it. A real shame.

Fun place to visit. There are many things to see and a good atmosphere in the park. Some wild rides, but the waiting time was enormously long. In one of the rides we stood in line for about 2 hours, so that was a bit of a shame

Park was okay. Lots of renovations are taking place. No more Madagascar. And a majority of far far away is closed. Signage in the park still remains that now points to closed toilets. They provide free Wifi. I would try and hold off too renovations are completed or come during the week.

A good day, staff are friendly and helpful. However, half of the attractions and food places were closed and the park was at capacity, so anywhere you go to get food is completely full so there is nowhere to sit, we purchased express tickets so our wait times weren't so bad but if you buy normal tickets, expect to wait up to 2 hours per ride. A very expensive and frustrating day out, overall an average experience.

This place is good for adventure rides! A place to visit with full family. Though we find it smaller as compared to Universal Studio USA. When we visited waterfront and some other rides were closed, which is very disappointing. Also we realised on week day also there was minimum 20 minutes waiting, for some rides the wait time goes even for 100 minutes, so we were forced to buy purchase express line ticket. Human and Cylon rides are for those who likes the roller coaster rides. Specially the Cylon is not for faint hearted people. Return of Mummy is also very good ride. At 6'00pm the park is closed and so all the eateries inside the park. So it's bit inconvenient, specially when you need food after the tiring day you have to walk all the way to the exit gates. The Steven Spielberg show is good, but there is no seating arrangements, you have to stand for 15 minutes. It's a not bad experience, but definitely not great!

Good selection of rides. A couple of rides were closed and a section of the park but there was plenty still to do. Decent food selection to choose from, friendly staff through out. Many rides had a single rider queue. Longest queue was 60 minutes through out the day.

Loved everything about this place... my family and I had a blast here. We loved the transformers ride the most. I would advise people to go vip to enjoy the park better as you jump all the ques. Also I would recommend buying toys there as the quality of them is really good.
Wow experience.. First visit there and it's amazing rides to food, shopping to shows loved every thing . Clean, hygienic lockers and washrooms. Whole dday passed like ZUPPPPP..

My first roller coaster ride was Cylon! Thats an achievement for me . The mummy ride was scary yet amazing. I was a solo riders, so it was great exploring the place alone. Except even on weekdays, it had a wait time of around 70-90 minutes. Even the express ticket wasnt much helpful for me and it was expensive at the studios than in online. Also the Minions are tooo cute . Met the Dinosaurs and watched movie making. Boated through the Sesame Street and took amazing photos!

Worth a visit if this is your first time coming to Singapore. Prepare to spend an entire day here. They open at 11am and queues stop at 6pm. You still can walk around the park to take pictures after 6pm. My issue is that queues are too long for the rides. I arrived at 12pm and left at 630pm and only had 4 rides, namely Mummy, Jurassic Waterfalls, Transformers and junior roller coaster. This was on a weekday. Each ride probably lasted at best 5 minutes. Transformers was also not updated and it was exactly the same thing I experienced 5 years ago. Hence, don't recommend it if you have come before. That aside, the vibes of the park were good and enjoyable. Definitely a must if you are coming with kids
Must vist place if u visiting singapore. Not to miss the Trasformer ride- 45mins wait time. Overall all rides were amazing . We enjoyed to the fullest. Wide variety of food options.

I visited Universal Studios Singapore today, and unfortunately, my experience was disappointing. The park is quite small, and the entrance fee is quite expensive, especially considering the limited number of attractions. Even on a Monday outside of the school holidays, the wait times for all the rides were long, ranging from 50 to 120 minutes. One major issue I noticed was the poor maintenance of the park. The exterior paintwork was faded, and many attractions had broken elements, from minor things like malfunctioning TV screens in the queues to more significant issues like the broken robot dinosaurs in the Jurassic Park ride. Furthermore, all the attractions in this park felt like inferior versions of similar rides in other parks worldwide. It seemed like little effort was made to provide something unique. Additionally, the toilets were unclean, and the food was expensive. The staff seemed to put minimal effort into ensuring efficient queue management. Platforms were overcrowded, and the staff was unfriendly on multiple occasions. It felt like they were simply going through the motions. One aspect that added to the frustration was the necessity to purchase an express pass. The regular queue lines moved at an excruciatingly slow pace, making it feel almost mandatory to buy an express pass to avoid spending the entire day waiting in line. Overall, I got the impression that little attention was given to visitor experience. Hopefully, the park can make improvements in the future to meet visitor expectations and enhance the overall quality of attractions and service. Please feel free to make any further adjustments to the text if desired.

Many of the staff here are unfriendly Also, you are forced to use paid lockers when playing the rides in the Jurassic area (for Chinese and Indians). Foreigners do not have to use it. The experience is very poor. I still prefer Disney

Refund My money! A Disappointing Journey: Universal Studios Singapore fails to live up to its once enchanting reputation. Unforeseen Ride cancellations like mummy and sphagetti space chase without Lack o Prior Notice Leaft us Frustrated. Poor Guest Treatment: Staff Rudely Chased Visitors After Ride Cancellations, instead of being apologetic. Saving grace was Jurassic park ride, but it is not worth 82sgd.

If Disneyland is is the happiest place on earth. Then Universal Studios Singapore is the a cash grab he'll for kids on earth. The absolute worst. Rude staff. Long lines. Treated like second class citizens. The absolute worst part of our family trip in Singapore. Can't believe we choose to spend my wife's birthday in this hell hole

This is a terrible place. It used to be better. Now its dilapidated. A lot of rides are closed, the few open ones have queues as long as 2 hours. The hours are 11-6 which gives you barely enough time to go on 3 rides. Dont waste time, give it a miss.

Overall, it's quite cheerful. Some of the service staff look tired and world-weary. 3-4 of the rides are super exciting and fun. The food in the restaurant is OK. The service staff is short-staffed and it's hard, so the tables are a bit dirty and you have to use wet wipes. Organize your desktop. There are few things in the souvenir area.

It was an ok experience. I would have started with a poor rating but eventually with the time spend and realization how to navigate the experience improved a bit. A few suggestion to improve anyone's experience here- 1. Better go alone or with people who are of the same age, so that if you have a bad time it is a social experiment. 2. If you are going with kids and spending substantial money to get in, spend a bit more always get a express ticket to cut short the line time for the rides.(coz a kid would not understand that one needs to wait in queue to get a spot on the ride) 3. Always get the universal studios Singapore app as it keeps you posted about the ride time in different regions of the park. It also tell you about your real time position and relative distance to a nearest ride. 4. Better to go the park as early as it open. It gets hot and humid so be prepared for that.

Came here on a weekday but it was really busy and the weather was really hot, there were times when I had to wait 30 minutes to get on the rides and because it was cloudy some of the rides were closed. It was quite late in the afternoon and many of the rides were operating again

Changing my rating from 5 stars to 3. It seems like the owner really hasn't been keept up... Animatronic mummies in The Mummy were only working on the left side, the 3D (4D) video in The Transformers rice where unfocused, especially on the larger screens, the cafe at Jurassic Park was closed without notice, Waterworld is permanently (?) closed... It's sad really.

Well, that's not what I expected, it's very clear. Very small leisure park. Rides were ok but there weren't enough good ones, what was extremely good was Transformers in 4D, that was awesome. I think we rode it at least 5 times, that was the highlight of the park for us.

As soon as I hopped into my taxi from the hotel, it started raining cats and dogs. It doesnt rain where Im from; the desert . I was worried but to my surprise, it was a wonderful day with 5 raincoat and how the park is designed to block the rain and you can easily walk around with minimal getting wet incidents. I got here at 12:30 pm and managed to get on all the rides by 3:30 pm with the Express pass. The food options arent that great. The staff is amazing both at the rides and the shops. My first time in Singapore and I came to Universal just two hours after arriving to the airport. Love it

My visit to universal was awesome. I didnt had to wait much to enter as I was attending a private event, however there were queues for the rides. Overall great place to hangout with friends and colleagues. Had a lovely experience.
Loved the place, those who love the thrilling rides are must go. I bought an express ticket which helped in less waiting time and short queues due to which I enjoyed more rides in less time.
Amazing place just very packed these days since it's one of the most popular tourist spot. So a long time goes in the queues rather than on the ride itself still quite magical in itself.

Have visited Universal Studios for a couple of times with friends. I have purchased the annual pass so we can go anytime. I love the atmosphere in the park with the minion and character shops around. It is definitely a fun place for both adults and kids. We like the Sesame Street ride, Transformers, Madagascar and boat ride. However, have to queue for quite long during weekends. There is characters performance and photo taking at certain times. We like to sit at the Starbucks to relax and drink coffee. Will definitely come back visit again.

Worst experience ever.. So so long queue for a single activity. You end up with standing in queue for two to three hours for a single ride. Like transformer, 4D. Jurassic world. Don't like the arrangement and management for crowd control... Poor very poor..

I had the worst experience at Universal studios Singapore ! It was over crowded to the extent that every other ride had a wait time of 1.5-2.5 hours ! The arrangements for the wait areas were pathetic, if they expect these many people they should atleast make the whole waiting area air conditioned ! It was hot & humid in the queuing areas with a very few fans and people were literally dying of heat ! The park should limit the number of people allowed so everyone can enjoy who has paid this much amount to get a ticket. The people with express ticket obv had an edge at the expense of people with regular tickets, but the express ticket prices are ridiculous ! We were only able to get on 2-3 rides in the whole day and kids were exhausted and bored due to long queues. Many food courts were closed and the ones that were available had average food, out of stock and priced at a level of fine dine ! It was supposed to be a fun day but turned out to be a torture !

24/7 that day. I bought a ticket and came in, but something broke down not long after queuing. Then it was repaired until 5 pm, a full 3 hours. It was a complete waste of tickets. The staff didn't know what to ask and had a perfunctory attitude. I had such a psychological shadow when I came here for the first time. The price and service are really not equivalent. The result is a complete waste of time and a disappointment. The refund service is also very negative. Just treat tourists like leeks and take advantage of them!

I recently visited Universal Studios in Singapore with my family and close family members with high hopes of an unforgettable day filled with excitement and adventure. Unfortunately, my experience was marred by one glaring issue: the absurdly long queues. It's disheartening to say that my overall impression of Universal Studios was one of frustration and disappointment. Upon arrival, it was immediately evident that the park was overcrowded. The lines for popular attractions stretched endlessly, resembling a never-ending labyrinth of waiting. It felt like the park management had completely overlooked the importance of efficient crowd control and guest satisfaction. Even with a carefully planned itinerary, I found myself spending the majority of my time (more than one or 2 hours)standing in lines rather than enjoying the attractions. It was disheartening to see families and children growing increasingly tired and restless while waiting for their turn, dampening the excitement that should have been synonymous with a theme park visit. To make matters worse, the queuing experience was poorly managed, resulting in excessive wait times that far exceeded any reasonable expectation. I understand that popular attractions will naturally attract larger crowds, but the sheer lack of organization and inefficiency at Universal Studios was astounding. As a paying customer, I expected a more seamless experience. I had eagerly anticipated immersing myself in the magical world of Universal Studios, but instead, I spent most of my time standing in line, growing increasingly disillusioned by the minute. I sincerely hope that Universal Studios addresses this significant issue and takes steps to improve their crowd management system. The park's reputation and the satisfaction of its visitors are at stake. Until then, I cannot recommend Universal Studios to anyone seeking a hassle-free and enjoyable theme park experience. In conclusion, my visit to Universal Studios was marred by interminable queues, overcrowding, and a lack of organization. The park failed to deliver on its promise of a thrilling and magical adventure, leaving me and my family with a sense of regret and frustration. Unless significant improvements are made, I would caution others against wasting their time and money at Universal Studios.
Worst place.. For every ride waiting time would be 40 to 100 mins. Very less number of rides are there and water area got closed. It's waste of your time and money.

I have very mixed feelings about this place. On the one hand, it is a well-made amusement park where you can spend a nice day. On the other hand, you must remember that to use a given rollercoaster you have to stand in the scorching sun for at least an hour. When it's our turn, the person is so drenched in sweat that there is no pleasure in the ride. In my opinion, it's worth coming here, but don't expect a crazy day in queues.

Decent sized newish looking universal with some fun rides and decore. The queues on a Tuesday were herendous. Picked up express single use passes in morning and there was surge pricing at 90 a ticket. (Was 70 a few days earlier). Went on about 7 rides, and altho we did manage to save a lot of time in queues, wasn't sure is it's worth that kind of premium. I think maybe 50 is more reasonable for the single use express and maybe double that foe the unlimited as I don't see how they police it from being shared around groups of friends. Didn't see a single character all day. And it bucketed down in rain 3 times for extended periods. We got soaking wet. Even after buying an umbrella there. There is some cute merchandise at the shops. The meals we had there is at least double the cost of normal restaurants outside and not very tasty. Was it fun yes. But it is an expensive day out. It is also super hot. Well singapore is in general. Guess the rain was good for cooling it down. The metro line to get out of sentosa was super long as well if u leave around park close.

I came with very high expectations thinking this would be a wonderfully new experience but most of the rides were pretty much variations of standard rides one sees in almost any amusement park. The rides that stand out are the Transformers ride and the cylon rollercoaster. Don't get me wrong - most kids will still like this place but I felt like the experience could have been a tad bit better. The only reason I gave two stars was because i enjoyed doing the roller coasters again and again and one of them has a couple of inversions which stand out. The Transformers ride does have a thrilling feel to it. The mummy ride was nice but too short. In fact most rides just feel really short Overall the park is a small place. There aren't too many rides. A few are meant for the very young (3-6), but more could have been done to make them more exciting. For the price, I wish they had made better rides with more options. The food options are terrible. Mostly junk food like burgers and fries, which I guess is staple food for most children but I'd like to feed my children real food which is not loads of fat and salt. Very few options for vegetarians. The express pass is worth it. The crowds are just too much. If you like waiting in long queues, then don't buy the express pass but if that's too expensive, I'd say just don't come.

A theme park full of stories!! Business hours are from 11 am to 6 pm, which is a bit short compared to my country... and that's during the hottest time;; Anyway, please be prepared for the heat and sunlight. It is advantageous to purchase tickets in advance, watch the entrance carefully (the staff did not guide you well, so you were lined up to one side), and wait in line in an area with relatively few people (VIP waiting room area)... really!! I was roaming, but I had a hard time because the internet suddenly stopped working, perhaps because there were so many people at the entrance. Because I couldnt show the voucher;; And because we were both busy and competitors(?), it was often difficult to ask people to take pictures due to the atmosphere. I should have brought a selfie stick... haha With so many people, I rode about 10 of them. without express

Actually, its okay. Its really not big inside, but there are so many people. Every facility has to be queued for a long time, and prices in Singapore are really higher than in Taipei... quite a lot I feel that Universal in Osaka is better, at least the park is bigger, even if I dont want to Queue up and sit on the street. There are parades or performances of characters on the street to watch. However, there are no parades on Global Street in Singapore. There are only sultry weather, huge crowds and traffic jams
Great experience! Trained and helpful staff. Long queues that consumed half of our time there. Overall good value for money and time spent.

Awesome! I had so much fun. Buy tickets online in advance and you won't wait to enter. Some tips to make the best of your day: research what rides are and which ones you want to do, GO EARLY and during the week. Go early to the busiest rides (roller coasters, transformers). Download the app of the park to see the waiting times. I had a great time did all the rides, didn't wait any longer than 20min. Some rides they do offer single rider, great way to go fast. Variety of food options, good prices too.

A relatively small park. Lots and lots of people, a 45-minute line just to get in (for those who ordered a ticket in advance). Very long queues for all facilities. It is highly recommended to book a ticket in advance online and if possible then also express because this is the most popular attraction in Sentosa.

detailed in design. came in saturday morning and the crowd is very busy - no joke. queue for transformer the ride takes 2 hours but still recommended to try after the mummy & rapids adventure. better buy add ons unlimited express ticket to shorten the queue or coming in week day. Tried Mels restaurant, delicious food & it super fast serving. gelato nasty monsters in a booth cookie monsters also worth to try.

I loooved this place so much, core memory forever. The rides are incredibly crowded in the morning, with over one hour wait times for most of the rides, but after lunch time the wait time significantly decreases and the overall experience becomes more enjoyable. some rides I enjoyed were: -Mummy ride -Shrek 4d adventure -Transformers ride (my favourite fs) -Elmo spaghetti space adventure (for children) If you're thinking of going, have the time of your life, make memories, and have fun !!

Worst place in Singapore. Need to wait 2 hrs for each attraction. No sitting places, mismanagement, no good facilities and exorbitant prices of everything. More than 5 hrs into the park and managed only 2 rides. Total waste of money and time.
Worst experience.. long queues . Rides breakdown after long long waiting . Bad management .. wastage of money ...

Worst experience for my relatives from overseas. Recommended to them USS as it is one of Singapore main attractions. But what happened was my niece and nephews got stuck in the rides and under the rain. This is super unacceptable and disappointing

Very disappointed. Place is overcrowded. Most attractions require about 3 hours wait and the express line is already sold. Worst experience in Singapore so far. The park is very disorganized overall. I do not recommend it.

Money making industry that exploits customers to the max. Repeat last minute cancellations of rides after long waits. Long waits which are exhausting for children most rides had an hour to 3 hour wait time and this was at no particular peak time. No forewarning regarding cancellation or wait times. Do not waste your moneys theres plenty more to do in Singapore go to the zoo, water parks, temples, restaurants, shopping malls that have epic parks. The biggest waste of money and can barely an experience.

Nice theme park where you can find attractions for every age. The express package seems a bit of a rip off because you still have to wait in line for up to an hour at some rides... . I would have also liked to have some wait time milestones at the waiting lines. Also it would have been nice to have a separate line if one wished to ride in the first row. Also I don't understand why one has to use the lockers (for phone, wallet, bag) instead of using the shelves at the ride start. Other than that, all is nice, you can have drinks and there is a good variety of food available.

Main attraction closed, transformer ride under maintenance, park time reduced and long Q every where for a 5 min ride more than 1 hour waiting , with a bit of drizzle outdoor Rides are shut down for safety reasons. Main food hall closed, need new attractions and maintenance its looks old a bit now. However 1st timer found it always a super fun place

Likes: 1. Ambience 2. Thrilling rides and shows Severe dislikes: 1. Wait time at most rides on a weekend/public hoiliday is around 90 -100 mins. It feels like a punishment to stand in the queues everywhere for such long periods of time to enjoy the attractions if one doesn't have an Express pass. Suggestion: Proper seating arrangements should definitely be made in the waiting areas. 2. Due to this, even if one has reached early at 11 am at the opening time, it will be impossible to cover everything on a hoiliday by 6 pm when the Studios closes. 3. Entry passes are fixed to a single date. Anything can go wrong with anyone anytime and it is fully likely that due to those circumstances, one cannot make it on that particular day when the tickets are purchased. Suggestion: Passes should be open for 6 months or atleast a month. Tourists can then go to enjoy the attractions at their convenience in that time frame. 4. Express passes are not available online. Also, the price of those passes is more than the entry pass cost. Overall, after our visit to The Universal Studios, we remember our legs aching by standing in long queues MUCH MORE than the fun we got from the rides and the shows. It seems fun comes at a huge punishment - that too after paying through our pockets. Highly disappointed. Hence, the 2 star rating.

Went during the weekday in off season. The hot weather didnt help but it was little disappointing due to the rides being 1-2hours long and express sold out within first 90min of opening?? Hopefully they will re access there structure/more rides/ride times etc and make it more accessible and enjoyable

Visited on a weekday, arrived before 11 - but still couldnt do more than a few rides because of the insanely long wait times. Theyre only open 11-6, and with an upto 2 hour wait time for a 2-5 minute ride - you can do 4-5 rides at max. They really need to extend their times at the prices they charge. To deal with the insane wait times, they expect you to buy an Express pass which costs more than the ticket itself. -Prepare to wait upto 2 hours for each ride -If you get your ticket from Sentosa, youll have to wait in other line and redeem them before you get in -Food is rather expensive -The transformers ride was quite nice, and the Shrek show was good too. Overall, I wouldnt recommend USS to anyone visiting - its just too exhausting having to wait hours for a quick ride

Absolutely like the place, the sets of each theme are immaculate, the details are exquisite, didnt go on the roller coasters because waiting time is too long, but i'd still recommend to go even only outside on the park, from the entrance the aisle is very pretty and once you enter the studios you feel the happy energy and all the characters doing shows, food is very creative, they have amazing topics. You must try the monster cookies from Sesame Street. Price is high but so I guess in all attraction parks. Favorite set one is far far away (from shrek)

The park is clean and spacious. Wish they could add more attractions. Restrooms are clean. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. (Book your ticket with Klook ahead of time to avoid long lines and for an extra 5%discount). I really enjoyed the Mummy and Transformers attractions.
Amazing place and amazing rides. Core memory indeed. There were some smelly inconviences (if you know what I mean) but thats about it.

So many joyrides. Many joyful places for family. Wonderful place. Students can join. Family can visit. Also, couples can visit. Also tge old age people will have fun with this place. But It's next to impossible to complete all rides within a day. Opens at 11am. So crowded so all have to wait. But you have to choice what would you like to ride or see. There are lot's of things to br visited. Food park is also available within the place. One of the most important thing is to keep it clean and clear.

It is an incredible place to go visit, the ticket prices are reasonable as theyre less expensive than other amusement parks like Disneyworld. The rides are fast and amazing, but also slow and relaxing, a mix of action and of chill vibes. As any amusement park, its busy, quite busy, even on weekdays, and the waiting lines can get long, but thats part of the amusement park experience. My one recommendation to anyone the wishes to go is to bring outside food, make your own or buy outside, the food there is very expensive for little portions and its not really good, tho a little desert is nice after a while. Bring water and snacks as well as both are over the market price, so its better to buy some beforehand at a 7-Eleven for example. A great place and a must if you have money to spend for the tickets, would def recommend.

Obviously oversold on the day we went there. We were there for 5 hours and only got to take 2 rides, the rest of the time was spent waiting in a queue. Ride wait times were nearly 3 times what was shown at the entrance, even express pass holders were waiting for an extended period of time. Food was expensive and poor quality. I have visited previously last year and 2017 and didn't face this issue but this visit to Universal Studios was a total waste of money and I wouldn't recommend the park to anyone until the overselling of tickets issue is resolved.
Our experience. My wife is disable. Their staff treat us poorly. We were being discriminated as senior and disable. We will never go back again. Extremely mis-managed park. Sad

This place doesn't have enough attractions for the amount of visitors it gets. Most attractions are at least 1-1.5hr long queues and there's about 10 of them? We were stuck waiting in one because the ride was down. Close to the beginning of the queue and we just left after 30mins of further waiting. They did give us the option of waiting or leaving but we should have gotten an express pass to another ride imo Whole ticketing thing was stupid too. We bought tickets at the train station going to sentosa island. Got lined up at the gates, 1hr goes by and we're told these aren't tickets to enter, they're tickets to get entry tickets so we had to line up at a different place again for about 1hr. Frustrating to say the least. If you want to actually enjoy this place then an express pass is a must. It's actually funny that a taxi driver we had a couple of days later told us Sentosa Island sucks. He and all the other drivers had an acronym for Sentosa

Absolutely the worst theme park experience i have ever had. The posted waiting times for rides have always been wrong by AT LEAST 2 fold, up to 12 times the official waiting time even on a monday morning. Have to rent a locker even for items stored in zipped up pockets. There are some many more exciting things to do in singapore. I strongly suggest to skip this park and use your time for experiences souch as zoo park with water and bird parts, i fly or just some luge runs. There are way better theme parks in other cities.

10 years ago this place was awesome, now its overcrowded with unfriendly staff and so many rides that we looked forward to were either no there or closed. You wait for 20 to 40 minutes to get on a ride which is less than 60 seconds

Hmm, its a tricky review to write as I was really looking forward to visiting universal studios at sentosa island. However, I felt a bit underwhelmed by the experience for what is quite a small park. Ive visited many attractions like Thorpe park, Alton towers, Chessington in the UK, but Universal just felt super crowded with very little to offer. I was fine with the idea of spending a whole day at the park, but the queues for the rides were just unrealistic. 150 minutes for Cylon, 120 minutes for transformers, 100 minutes for revenge of the mummy and 60 minutes for both canopy flyer and rapids adventure. The express pass is an ABSOLUTE MUST to get anywhere near doing these rides in one day especially as the park is only open from 11-6. Food was good which was a plus point although drinks were on the tad expensive, generally a very expensive resort which I felt was not value for money.

You spend more time queuing than playing but I guess that is normal for amusement parks. Tickets are expensive, limited and expensive food. Merchandise are expensive too. Most underwhelming thing would be the size of USS, it's minuscule. Since it is the only amusement park in Singapore, I guess I have to rate it at least 3/5 stars.

Nice place, unfortunately a lot of the rides and attractions are closed or under construction and the price is a little steep Definitely bring a packed lunch, they don't check and the price of things here is super expensive (aka. 7 for a small cone of chips)

Visited the theme park on Monday and it was super packed! Transformer ride was not open. Other main rides has to wait for 1.5hrs per ride. They got to improve the condition of the waiting queue line. It was too narrow and uncomfortable. Shoulder to shoulder with strangers is very unpleasant. Especially when you are queueing with someone that talk loudly non-stop. I hope there won't be any incidents of stampede if something went wrong. The cylon ride queue you have to queue on the narrow and tight steep stairs. You can buy food from the many stalls available but no place to sit to eat. Super limited seating. The park is quite well maintained and clean. If you are driving, just peaking at the basement. Parking fee is reasonable.

Be sure to use express. Since there aren't many attractions, there was usually a wait of about 50 minutes for popular attractions. I'm so tired of waiting but it's so much fun Water World was also good.

My visit to Universal Studios in Singapore was an exhilarating experience filled with thrills and excitement. The park offers a wide array of attractions that cater to various tastes and age groups. One standout attraction was the phenomenal Transformer ride, an absolute must-try for any visitor. The attention to detail and immersive experience truly brought the Transformers world to life. On the positive side, the park's themed zones were brilliantly designed, immersing visitors in different universes, from Hollywood to Sci-Fi City. The entertainment shows and live performances were engaging, adding to the overall festive atmosphere. Additionally, the convenience of booking tickets online and utilizing the express counter significantly reduced waiting times, ensuring more time to enjoy the attractions. However, the only downside was the occasional long queues, which is quite common for popular attractions. To make the most of your visit, I highly recommend booking tickets online in advance and opting for the express counter to bypass long queues. This allows you to maximize your time and enjoy a seamless experience at Universal Studios. Overall, a thrilling adventure that's perfect for fans of movies and theme park enthusiasts alike!
incredible place, there is no way to finish all places there in one day.. i enjoyed all games. Queueing for some games were 180 mins. try to not to go on weekends or public holiday ;)

UNIVERSAL STUDIOS is a world in itself amazing rides and shows!! Lots of shopping centres and best place for adventure fun and games!! Very well maintained and equipped!! MUST VISIT! Dont miss any rides as everything is unique and exciting! Only problem was long queues and express pass was sold out!

We had the best time at universal exceeded my expectations - great theming and atmosphere across the sections. Went on a weekday and got round every ride and went on our favourites several times which is a bonus. Locker system is a bit annoying on the main rides but I see why they do it. Would recommend to all. Sci-Fi city and Jurassic rapids the best

Great experience and had so much fun !! very clean and staff also friendly. Clean rest rooms. Its better if you can purchase tickets online before you go there, Enjoyed most of the rides and loved it. Definitely ill visit next time for sure.

Honestly the staff needs some training. Extremely rude staff. One guy from water world and a guy name Iran from jurassic Park. Seriously we are paying alot of money to have fun and last thing we need is attitude. To the moron at water world who said shut the umbrella.. idiot was there a sign no umbrella.. would gave him a earful but could not find him ... there is no need to be rude... BTW I'm 4th generation singaporean.. and this suck

Super bad organization for Halloween! Queued non stop for the shows and no drink no sit, very very bad and windy queues. There is no need to make such winding queues actually so people can know how many people actually. Queued 2 hours per haunted house. In the end paid 79 and 99 dollars per pax see 2 attraction. Super upset can do better. This is 12 am & the queue still utterly long. Worse than work Apparently the 50 minutes is told by the manager to put onto the board! Why do they want to lie? In the end we queue for 1 hour 45 mins.!!!! This is deception. Mgmt please refund the tickets!

Wow. Super shocked by the overall attitude from the staff. Rude, not smiley, arrogant. This is a shame. Especially at the Dino Soarin. The staff was so rude and unfriendly that 2 arguments with guests happened (23 Oct morning). That's the last time we will come here, the Universal Studio at Osaka was wayyyy better.

Waste of time. We waited for 40 minutes for a 5 min Jurassic ride. When our turn came, they announced that due to technical reasons the ride is postponed, you may wait in queue or leave the queue voluntarily. After 20 min we have to leave as dont want to miss other rides. We paid for locker also. We asked the security person that since we already waited for 40 min, please allow us from express entry next time. When we came back the security person changed and he hasnt allowed and said since you voluntarily left, you have come from normal queue which is again 40 minutes long. We tried explaining that it was not our fault as your ride went in to technical problem also that we are with kids and cant go for 40 min again standing, but they didnt listened. He asked to check with guest service which is 20 min from here at the entrance. Frustrated but I went there, the lady was kind and gave me 4 express pass, but now I already waisted 40 min. Any ways, I did the ride of 5 min and waisted 80 minutes. Almost similar story with all other rides. I strongly recommend to not to go to Universal studio as its total waste. You will waist your money as well as time. Mummy rides we cant do as there were hight restrictions for our kids and even though I got express pass, few rides are not allowing express entry. They close all rides at 4:30 even though the timing is 5PM.

It was the worst amusement park i have been to so far. We visited on a weekday in Oct 2023 when the park was hosting Halloween night in the evening. As such, they had changed It's timing to 10am - 5 pm so that it could sell separate tickets for Halloween of the same park from 6 pm. There are only about 15 rides including children's rides as such queue for each ride was huge. The average waiting time for each ride was nearly 60 minutes for general tickets (costing about 5,000/- INR) and 20 minutes for express pass (about 10k INR). The ride time was between 40 seconds to 2 minutes max. So we had to wait for an hour for a minute long ride. By 5:30 pm the staff started forcing people who didn't have Halloween tickets out of the park. Their entire focus was only on money unlike rest of singapore. Would never visit again.

On my second visit to Universal Studios Singapore, I finally had the chance to fully enjoy the various rides and attractions within the park. Although the theme park isn't very large, some of the rides and performances were truly spectacular, leaving me wanting more. The most impressive experience was the Waterworld show, with its captivating atmosphere and remarkable sound effects. Of course, the 4D movies were also quite exciting. However, the only downside was the disappointing attitude of some of the park's staff. In a place filled with joy and laughter, it was strange to encounter staff members who appeared expressionless, lacking any smiles, and maintaining a stern demeanor. In fact, the behavior of some of the employees made visitors feel uncomfortable, which was truly regrettable.

We had the opportunity to visit this theme park during our vacation. A very nice surprise from an originality and decoration point of view. The decorations are magnificent and impressive, particularly the Egyptian part... The attractions offered are relatively calm except for the two flagship thrill attractions... which also see their queues very long... The attractions present are new, not seen in any case at DisneyLand Paris. 3 stars because despite this environment, there are many negative points. Firstly, the opening hours of the park, it only opens at 10 a.m. and closes very early (6 p.m.)... when you want to enjoy the two most popular attractions, you have to wait 1h30 on average... which means that there is little time left to explore the park when you spend 3 hours waiting for two attractions. As a result, this makes the cost of entry quite significant: 82 Singapore dollars for an adult... you have the option of taking a VIP PASS, allowing you not to have to queue for the attractions, price per person in addition to the ticket: 80 dollars... help!!! Finally, the last black point, the lockers. The attractions cannot be taken with your bags and personal belongings, mobile phones are also prohibited in the attractions and in queues, so very few souvenirs... Lockers are then positioned for each of the attractions for a maximum period of use and then paying for it... which means that it is almost impossible not to have to reach into your wallet if you want to do the main attractions.

Its fun and has many various attractions though with short opening hours and having to wait say one attraction for say one hour so you do not have sufficient time to play most of the attractions. I think we queued at Transformers for over 1.5hours alone. I personally feel this place is not quite suitable for senior citizens due to the need to walk a lot and limited seating options with the crowd (we went around 11am on a Monday in October btw) as well as the long standing needed in queues.

Some areas of the park are under renovation. You probably only enjoyed 3/4 of the park. Unlike the USS in US or Japan, Singapore USS needs to improve alot. I have visited USS in Japan and US, they have the characters mascot seen everywhere and children enjoyed seeing and taking photographs. Singapore USS is so boring where I finished the whole park within 2 hours. I feel they should reduced the price since some attractions are under maintenance and some areas undergoing renovation. Very disappointing.
The Transformers attraction is one if the best rides in the world. The rest of the parc nice but not very special. Needs an update

- one of the best places to visit in Singapore - lot of adventure rides - best rides were BG human , BG cyclone , Revenge of the mummy and Transformers - cleanliness was observed everywhere - personally recommend for people above 10 years - waiting time is long for regular pass - Express pass recommended to enjoy the rides frequently - some rides were closed due maintenance - food quality average and less options for vegetarian - lockers are provided to keep your belongings - Start for universal studio early/on time - easily accessible by MRT from any part of Singapore

Really good place if you want to have fun , this place is super fun but the queue is always long.The ticket is reasonable and there is alot of nice shops there. I rode on one of the roller coaster, Amazing!
Best day.. Go on a weekday to avoid long queues. Weekends have long waiting hours and won't be able to make all the best rides. Can carry food and drinks inside.

Such a fun amusement park! We visited on a Sunday in September (with forecasted rain) and we were very lucky since the park wasnt crowded at all and we didnt have to wait in any of the attractions! I absolutely loved Shrek World and just that made the visit absolutely worth it! Perhaps the theme food options can be a little bit improved but we had lunch at Mels Drive-In and it was delicious!!
Amazing theme park so much fun and great rides and meets and greets! My favourite ride was Cylon shame its so much better than Human! Also Megatron insulted me!! :)

Awful experience. 1/4 - 1/3 of the park is closed Probably due to the new Minion attraction which would only be completed in 2024. Yet we are being charged full price for only 2/3 of the service. And speaking of service, Terrible customer service!! i'm ashamed to find out the attitude of the staff is so bad. I would assume the staff being Singaporean would have been be better educated. it really shames me being a Singaporean. what happens to "Excuse me Sir/Mdm"? the 1 ride that really piss me, was at Sesame street, apparently there's a booster seat on 1 of the back row seat of the cart, i try to remove it, unaware that i wasn't suppose to do so . no staff usher me to the cart nor advised me not to do so. then 1 of the attending staff, tall, lanky and bespectacled , actually told me off in a stern and rude manner" don't remove it!, don't touch that, move to the front row". i'm old enough to be his dad, where's the basic courtesy? Management of Universal Studio, you seriously have to relook at the coaching of the staff. On a general note, I observed that 70% of the staff displayed poor customer service. They portrayed a aura of being disgruntled and have no sense of belonging to Universal Studio. I feel really bad as a Singaporean as this isn't the Singapore experience that I would like our foreign visitors to witness. Genting RWS, I understand that you are expanding but before that, pehaps relook to the education of the staff and more walking of the gound by management. 2 stars for the remaining staff which didn't makes it a total disappointment for my family and me.

Today my second time to USS . And Today 13 november 2023 . Around 11am in dinosaur show , there is 2 girl staff is really really worst 1 girl wear braces , another one indian . Sorry i dont know their name . Waaaah really seems like they dont get attitude briefing ! Super super rude they are ignore me with their thumbs down ! . . I only i begging to take photo in last minute with my baby . I carry my baby they give change last change to another people not priority one . Hahaha Thats so bad experience . I come here for my birthday with my baby ! I swear i will never come back again to universal studio singapore ! I promise . !

This is absolutely over hyped place and for SG82 is not worth at all. This is extremely so small and long queues for each and every ride. For most of the rides we have to wait for 60 to 90 minutes and for some rides wait time is 120 minutes. And the timings for this is 11am to 6pm. Most of the time will go on waiting in queues. If we need to avoid the queues, They sell express entry tickets which we have to purchase additionally which is another SG60 to SG90 which is not worth at all.
Honestly, never ever come to this Place without Express Pass. I come when Non Peak Season on Tuesday, still wait for more than 45 minutes on every Rides. Very bad experience

visited Universal Studios Singapore today and I have to admit, I was left more disappointed than content. The themes and activities were very well planned, and as parents, my partner I were impressed with everything there was to see and do for us and our 3-year-old. However, the relentless humidity and heat made waiting in the long queues quite unpleasant. On a positive note, the staff were excellent and very helpful; we didn't encounter any unhelpful staff throughout the park. Our biggest disappointment came when we tried to grab some food. Unfortunately, all the food outlets had a technical issue and couldn't accept card payments. We didn't have any cash on hand, and without food, both our toddler and we couldn't fully enjoy all the rides and attractions. It's disheartening to know that a massive establishment like Universal Studios couldn't resolve a technical issue or organize an alternative for its visitors. At this point, I'm not sure if we'll be returning. It's frustrating that such an issue could significantly impact our experience. I hope that Universal Studios Singapore takes steps to address these kinds of technical glitches in the future to provide a more seamless and enjoyable experience for its visitors.

When in Singapore and you are a tourist with kids then this place has to be on the top list to visit. Came here on a Monday so it was not as packed. The lines for the attractions and rides wait was only 15 minutes in the beginning but went to 50 mins at its peak then by the afternoon went down to 10 mins. Got soaked on the Jurassic Park ride. The roller coasters were the best. But managed to ride about 10 rides from 11am to 5pm. Its smaller on the smaller side for Universal studios but well worth the price for the thrills. Went here 10 years ago and it still doesnt fill run down.

This is a nice theme park. It's quite small compared to Universal Studios Orlando but still nice. A big chunk of the park is currently closed as they're converting the area to Minionland. My family loves the Minions and is really looking forward to seeing it when I opens. Most of the park is well maintained, but some of it looks a little run down....especially the Shrek area (Far Far Away). There are a few really good rides here. I especially like the Revenge of the Mummy and the Human/Cylon rollercoasters. You need to empty your pockets for those rides and there are nearby lockers that are free for 90 minutes. Overall, I like Universal Studios Singapore, but mostly go here because of a lack of options in the area. This park is nicer than Legoland Malaysia, but also quite a bit more expensive. Our annual passes for Legoland expired recently, but at some point we're going to sign up again and probably won't visit Universal Studios until those passes expire again. Hopefully Minionland will be open by our next visit.

Three is a stretch, since many activities did not work. We bought tickets through AGODA, I recommend booking them 2 days in advance so that they arrive in your email on time. By the way, a visit to the aquarium and park in one place for squirrels through AGODA was a good discount. Visited on a weekday. There weren't many people, but it was boring. My 3 year old worker really liked it.

Place is good, no matter how you try time flies here and you cannot enjoy all the things in a single visit... Specially for us since it was weekend it was bit crowded... So people better try visit this place on weekdays
Service quality is quite good with many adventure games. But perhaps Vietnam is almost equal
Love all the ride, to avoid crowd please go on weekdays as you w8ll be satisfied with wait8ng list and able to repeat the enjoyable rides and shows

Universal Studios offers an exhilarating experience for all. As a student, I used to enjoy the perk of a pass for six months with unlimited entries. It was my go-to place for both joy and stress relief. Whether I craved the thrill of roller coasters like Battlestar Galactica and Mummy, or the adventure of the Jurassic Park River Ride, Universal Studios had it all. It's a place where you can find happiness in the clouds and release stress with a scream. But be ready to wait superrrrr longggg queue if you are not holding express entry

Had an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore. Though there are not many rides, there is a good selection, and the wait time was not that long, considering it was the Halloween weekend! I would 100% recommend visiting anyone who is within the vicinity or visiting Singapore for the first time.

Went for Halloween horror night, it was amazing. Highly recommend purchasing the fast pass as the queues can be up to an hour and because of all the covered spaces it can get pretty hot. Food is pretty expensive inside as to be expected. About half the rides are open at night and the lines aren't as long as during the day.

I think it worths the price although the park was not as huge as others. Entering the park was just SIMPLE. I pre purchased my tickets through Klook, and Klook issued me the ticket with QR code. All I need to do was to scan the ticket QR code at the entrance, done! There were minimum crowds during my visit on a Tuesday during a non peak season. Although the opening hours was 11-6pm compared to 10-8pm (peak seasons), I still managed to finish playing all the attractions before 4:30pm (I enter the park at 11:30am). The wait time for popular attractions were up to 30-45 minutes during peak hours of the day (12-3pm). The crowds got less towards late afternoon, and there was almost no wait time at all for most attractions after 4pm. Most of the attractions (expect for kids ones) were very exciting!! Make sure you have a strong/fearless heart!! HAHAHA Everything was fantastic, but the weather - Its HOT!! Like seriously, that wasnt a very nice experience for me, and the sun ,could be overwhelming during a sunny day. You dont want to get a heat stroke, so make sure you stay hydrated, stay indoor while you can, and get your skin well protected from the sun!!

I went to this park about 2 weeks ago, super excited because I had already been to Universal in Orlando, and it was simply enchanting. To my disappointment, the visit to the park was horrible, the first ride I queued for almost 2 hours, when I got close, I saw that the instructors weren't filling the carts, letting it go empty, without 2 or 3 people... Total negligence with whoever was in line... When leaving I thought about buying the fast-pass, when I went to buy it it started raining, and the park was closed for a whole 3 hours, no rides were working anymore. After 1 hour with nothing to do, a waterworld show was about to start and we decided to watch it, to our surprise, right at the beginning of the show, an employee had an accident and the show was canceled and they told us to leave the place... As if that wasn't enough, I went to try to buy an ice cream, I was the first in line, and I only went close to the counter to the side to look at the flavors, to get started and the attendant was super rude to me saying that I was missing the line, I I tried to explain what happened to him, he didn't even want to listen to me, super ignorant. I was so upset with everything about the park, service, attractions, lack of preparation of the staff... Anyway, I didn't like it and I don't recommend it...

Visited the park on a Tuesday with family. We knew it was rainy season and came well prepared as we know there are no refunds offered for bad weather. But we were disappointed that almost all the meet & greets were cancelled due to the rain. If we as guests are supposed to continue around the park, why cant the park live up to the same? We do not expect a refund, but paying for entry plus express tickets doesnt seem worth if we dont get to experience the parks attractions in its entirety. Furthermore, we paid 70 for unlimited soft copies of our pictures taken around the park. We were encouraged to pay earlier for ease of collection at the end of the day. To our horror, half of the pictures we took around the park was not given to us! The kids were so disappointed as their pictures with the transformer robots are missing! To add to it all, the customer service is horrible. First your staff was rude to us, and dared to use the excuse that this is how Singaporeans talk. We are Singaporean ourselves and we completely disagree with such a statement. Emails go unanswered and theres no contact number for us to request for our pictures which we have PAID for. Utterly disappointed.

No rides will work Poor maintenance if the rain comes. Waited for 3 hours for the Zurrasic park ride but later they will convey sorry technical issues Waited for 2 hours to the transformer ride, later they'll say technical issues, apologize, etc Useless and waste if times !

Tickets can be bought on the spot, waiting in line takes about 5 minutes. Inside, however, 30-50 minutes everywhere!!! Horrible!! They shower you in several places and you can dry yourself for money?!! Does the park close if it rains??! The staff is just there, unmotivated. There are many people, it is not organized. This could be done better. Expensive so not fun rather disappointing!

This is just an amusement park, Much of a hype created, We have similar or better in INDIA, must visit Imagica mumbai for better experience. In Universla studio it is long queues and basic rides. Everything un-necessary chargeable, be it lockers etc etc. Only ride which is worth is transformers. Not recommended place, waste of time and money.

Visited the theme park on a Sunday. Although the park is small, there are quite a number of attractions and rides. However, on a weekend there is a large crowd so do come earlier so that the waiting times are shorter. There were quite a few shows and meet and greets. Currently there is a troll show at the on pantages theatre. Do bring a fan to cool down because on sunny days it can get quite warm. I did not expect the park to close so early at 5pm but overall it was a great day of excitement!

I visited again after 10 years. I arrived leisurely on a Friday at the end of December without an open run, and the line for the rides wasn't long, so I was able to get on all the rides within 20 minutes. It's smaller than other universals, so it's a bit disappointing for the price, but it was good to be able to ride all the rides quickly.
Nice but nothing more, a little cheap compared to other amusement parks especially for the price

Since it was my first theme park, I was mismerised. Most of the shows were open when I went, some rides likes canopy flyer and treasure hunt were really boring, but others like the rollercoasters and revenge of the mummy were great. Food is nice too and the characters roaming around gave many memories.

Good for a whole day. We were lucky because there wasn't much going on. If it's crowded I would advise against it as there aren't that many attractions. When the rain comes, the outdoor activities are closed, which was the case for us from 1700 onwards. Normally it is open until 2000. If you go in early in the morning and take the train, the gondola is very expensive. Food is not too expensive. You get very wet during the whitewater action. Also in the front rows at Waterworld

I recently had the pleasure of visiting USS, it was an absolutely fantastic experience. I recommend to visit at least once in a lifetime. Its not so big, but for me it deserved as world-class theme park that combines entertainment, thrills, and magical moments into a truly unforgettable experience.

Had an awesome time here as always. I dont think its quite as fun as the Universal in Osaka, but its smaller size allows you to easily do the park in one day at a slower pace. It is also not nearly as crowded and wait times are rarely over 20-30 minutes. I would definitely recommend if you visit Singapore because we had a great time.

Indeed, a beautiful and happy place. We all enjoyed our day there. The movie-themed park is enjoyable, and the rides are all amazing. The place is clean and there are staff roaming at the park. I suggest buying tickets in advance so you won't have to wait long.

Happy happy happy park day with friends!! Tried out roller coaster for the first time and they were actually pretty fun and not scary. HUMANs drop made me feel a bit uncomfortable but CYLON was pretty smooth, even though it looks a lot scarier (hanging seats, 360 rotation etc). Would recommend! CYLON had almost no queue so we got in real fast. Some other attractions had slightly longer queues but mostly within 20mins
Most fun I've had in many years at a themed park. Very short wait times. Experienced 10 different attractions in 3.5 hours. Totally not possible in U.S Highly recommended for all ages
Don't come here without an express ticket , people with general ticket are no better than cattle , long queues , gross mismanagement , a pitiful sight for a operarion of that scale in singapore.

We went on a weekday on 1/24, thinking there would be less people, but it turned out there were still a lot of people. When we lined up for the rafting facilities, we had been queuing for almost an hour and finally it was our turn. It turned out that there was something wrong with the equipment and it was over. There was no compensation plan at all. , the child was so disappointed that he burst into tears on the spot. It was really bad. My friend also encountered the same problem when he went to queue for Transformers, and there was no compensation. The company can issue priority passes to those of us who have worked hard to queue for a long time! Just for this facility, wouldnt such a simple treatment be enough? There are no staff to manage the queuing area. There are a lot of people jumping in line. Are the people who line up obediently all idiots? What a bunch of substandard adults. I will never go there again, nor will I recommend it to my friends. It was an expensive and unpalatable lunch!

It's rotten, rotten, rotten... there is machine maintenance and no signage is put up, so the family keeps waiting outside! ! ! The child waited inside for a long time, and the adults outside thought the child was missing! ! ! Can you handle things? ! !
When I went every ride was closed due to technical issues. All money wasted. Dont waste your money coming here

Very rude admission office employee Talking with tough language She asked for a physical passport What a park will ask a tourist for physical passport We went back to the hotel to bring our passports At the end the experience is not that much worth it

Mixed Experience at Universal Studios Singapore I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore, and while the overall experience was enjoyable, there were a few drawbacks that need attention. I would recommend everyone to get the tickets via their website as it offers 1 hour early access. The park offers a thrilling array of rides and attractions, creating a captivating atmosphere for visitors. However, my excitement took an unexpected turn when we got stuck on one of the rides (the Transformers). The staff kept us updated and we were given an express pass as compensation. This hiccup slightly dampened the experience, highlighting a need for better maintenance and operational efficiency.
