Another ride went again into maintenance after we reached the front of the queue after waiting half n hour, another disappointment (The chase of the mummy) On the culinary front, the variety of food options was commendable, but I couldn't ignore the steep prices. The expensive food choices were a drawback, making it less budget-friendly for visitors. It would be beneficial for the park management to reconsider pricing strategies to enhance the overall value for guests. Additionally, while most staff members were helpful, I encountered instances where a bit more politeness could have made a difference. Improving staff interactions would undoubtedly contribute to a more positive and memorable visitor experience. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore offers a fantastic time with its attractions, but addressing issues like ride maintenance, food pricing, and staff politeness would elevate the overall guest satisfaction.

Good attractions, some exclusive to Singapore like the Sesame Street ride, the Puss in Boots rollercoaster, or the Battlestar Galactica coasters. But the service is quite bad. We were there on a very slow day, with most of the park empty, and the Battlestar Galactica coasters were operating with only one train - which brought waiting time to 30, 40 minutes when the other attractions had a maximum waiting time of 10. Felt like they were slowing down operations to sell more Express Passes. Service is very slow in restaurants as well, and most photo stands for the attractions were not working. Theres also no nighttime show, neither a lot of street entertainment. The major show in the park - Waterworld - happens once a day only. Its the smallest Universal park in the world, and it couldve been so much better if operations were good, and if there was more entertainment and showtimes.
Its ok but very small. 2 attraction excellent transformers and revenge of the mummy, other 2 good, rest really average. More expected from Universal Studios name
Although it is small, you can enjoy it enough. Waiting times for attractions vary depending on popularity. On the day I went, the wait was about an hour at most. It was fun! !

Good theme park with nicely themed rides. The rollercoasters are not that good, except Mummy the ride. All dark rides are well done and fun. Compared to other universal studios, this one is the weakest.

It was a great place to celebrate your new year, mine was my birthday this year. I love theme park, and having to experience all the attraction in one day it was just perfect celebration. You may want to come here during a week after new year, less people but full of fun. Best ride goes to Galactica the human and cyclon entrances. You can buy entrance ticket on the spot, but if you want to buy the free pass ticket, i suggest you to buy it in advance from the official website, or apps like traveloka
Great park! We were there on January 1st in the afternoon. It was comfortable. We went through all the rides without queues. The rides are great, some of them get the adrenaline pumping!

A great day out with plenty of rides. Not being able to take your own food and drinks is a big downside but we managed to get a voucher online which made it much more reasonable. Also, they didn't actually check our bags so you could risk it! They have lockers which you have to use for some rides which are free for 45 minutes and they extend the free time when the queues are really long so we avoided paying extra there.
Top attractions! I recommend them all. But of course like everywhere, you have to be very patient to access the attractions.

Had a blast during our last visit. Even its raining we are lucky that all the ride is open. Crowded on a rainy Thursday. Friendly staffs especially the one at Transformer photo booth. Long Q was manage well.

We came here with great anticipation and were looking forward to an exciting and eventful day. What we got was a total of hours of waiting in confusing rooms at the individual attractions and ultimately a cancellation on our part because we simply couldn't stand anymore. You're not a young 30-year-old who can stand the endless waiting and standing. At Transformers, at Battlestar Galaktika and in the Temple of the Mummy we queued for well over 3 hours and ultimately saw nothing!!! With such a hefty entrance fee, this was the most expensive wait and the biggest disappointment we have ever experienced. What I found particularly bad was that there was no indication of waiting times in the morning hours. Only when we left the studios in the afternoon, deeply disappointed and pissed off, did we see waiting times (45-80 minutes). I also have to mention that you can and probably should buy express entry (extra entry with shortened waiting times) for 100 SGD per person if you want to experience anything at all in this park and dont want to spend almost the entire time of your stay waiting. Two people 246 SGD for Cable Car and Universal Studios entrance 200 SGD Express 446 SGD Too Much!!!
Particularly in Singapore there is no issue of service, but in this place there is not even education, very bad experience. All the game boys very rude!!!
The staff of attractions, too much unkind and rude.. even they didnt answer simple question. may they need to hire educated ppl.
Some stalls only accept small banknotes and do not accept credit cards. I was told that I couldn't pay for 50 SGD. I couldn't pay after queuing up. It was a very bad experience.

I am tourist. For two adults when I bought the tickets at the Kiosk outside the entrance my forex card got charged twice (2 ticket payments of S176 each) with a receipt for only obe payment of S176. When I checked with the customer care inside the studio they say only one payment is received. I checked with my bank and they say they did not get any response yet for the details of the second payment charged to the card with a receipt nor a refund. They asked me to wait for 30 days to know the final status and am still waiting for the 30 day period to elapse which is around end of this month. My recommendation is not to use those Kiosks.

My recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore left me with mixed feelings. Having previously visited the Orlando location, I couldn't help but compare the two. While Universal Studios Singapore offers some enjoyable rides, many felt mediocre compared to Orlando's offerings. For first-time visitors, it's worth a try, especially if you're excited about a new experience. Wait times are generally short (10-15 mins), but consider an express pass on weekends. Overall, it's a decent outing, but not quite on par with Orlando.
This was ok. Honestly enjoyed this much less than the theme parks in South Korea and Dubai. Maybe we went on a very crowded national holiday. Hence was much less fun vs other days

Visited the place on a Wednesday expecting a smaller footfall. Went early. Found it as busy as it probably can be, with long lines at main attractions (wait times upto 75 mins). Although things eased up a bit by late afternoon. Not sure how the weekend would be like. A better crowd management at certain attractions (like at Far Far Away) & along certain segments, shall certainly be helpful. Place has everything to cater to all ages & tastes, so, a pre-visit 'homework' is recommended. Ideally, the place is a whole day's visit.

It's a whole new level of experience coming here. I'm referring to the rides of course but not the level of service. The crew as much as possible are juggling a lot. So their level of services are not that great as expected for an international brand of theme park. Nonetheless it wasn't horrible (far from it in fact) but maybe as guests we are expecting a friendlier service.

The ice cream served in the park is good, but the strawberry milkshake is ordinary (lower middle). If you have more time, you can also consider wearing an armband at the door and dining outside the park. However, dining in Sentosa is generally high-priced and crowded. Therefore, you can evaluate whether you should eat a full breakfast before entering the park (it doesnt open until 10 oclock anyway), eat lunch later to avoid the crowds, or simply eat ice cream. The Shrek movie was fun and worthwhile, and some of the more thrilling (scary) attractions had very few lines at 4pm.

This is my second time to come here for the Universal in Singapore! I really love to enjoy this place. I chose to come the weekday and got the normal ticket and not add for the express ticket so why I had to wait some players almost two hours. Moreover, I knew if I came during Jan that I obtained the a brith day treat because my brith days month. Its worth it to spend my time to get more the positive energy here. My target that I will go every Universal around the world and hopefully I will achieve my target in future

Even the smallest Universal Studios in the world is worth visiting If you enter the park early, you can basically enjoy all the rides. However, the queues on national holidays are really scary. Even if I have to take the MRT back to VivoCity on my way back, I have to wait in a very long queue!!! What I enjoyed most this time was taking photos with various characters. Especially Madagascar is super energetic!! Big heart to the staff

The first time you go to USS, my advice is that you should download the USS application so you can find out how long the queue is at each ride. I explored from behind and started at 11am. The rides at the back are still empty and still busy at the front. There are plenty of toilets and tap water so bring your own tumbler. The games are all fun but the best in my opinion are Jurassic Park, Ancient Mummy and Battle Galactica

Universal Studios Singapore! ! When I went there during the summer vacation, the queue to get in was super long! ! But once you get into the park, its fine (because the crowds dispersed), and you must queue up for a fast pass before playing the rides! After getting the fast pass, you will have to wait for about 1 to 2 hours depending on the situation. You can go play other things, take photos, or visit souvenir shops first. The roller coaster was super super fun. I thought I would have to queue for a long time but it only took 30 minutes. We rode the one where our feet were in the air (the other one had a floor to step on, but we didnt get to ride that). It was really fun and you must queue up for it! ! The most exciting roller coaster I've ever ridden!
I went there on Chinese New Year's Day. Experienced some great decoration and thrilling rides. Don't forget to buy Express ticket otherwise you will have to wait in long queue for almost every ride.

Every facilities is nice but Very bad experience in USS with impatient ,being to arrogant and very rude and not even a basic respect to tourism. The workers there like treat people like there pets just call us here and there. Please focus more on staff training. It ruin my whole day !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Went one one ride which had a sign up saying 20 minute wait. Ended up taking 1 hour 20 , and nothing is worth queuing this long. Unfortunately you don't realise that there are different chambers of the que, so keep hoping you are near the front only to find out you're not. It ruined the day. If you are going here and want to do rides, you should really pay for the express pass - or don't go.

everything are closed and broken, waiting lane is crazy. if you want to ride need to pay locker 4, what happened to me, I paid for the locker and waiting for about 2 hours and suddenly they said its out of service so funny. never going back again I guess.
A very unpleasant experience. Literally waited for so long for the rides then got told that its closed. Paid for the locker for nothing. Staff were very rude. Such a waste of money.
Now waiting in cuw more than one hour and not even informing about the reason of such long waiting time, bad service for such expensive ticket!

A bit disappointed by the Universal Studio in Singapore, after doing both in the US. The organization is a bit messy, having to lock your backpack in a locker beforehand, with the penalty of an extra 4 if you're late doesn't help you enjoy the hour wait for the ride for the galaxy. We finished the day with 2 ride malfunctions, after a 45 minutes wait, so not ideal to finish a long day. Expensive 19 hot dog for a quick lunch break. Just a big plus for the Waterworld show, the same as in the US, but still very nice for special effects and choreography.

Universal Studios Singapore falls short in comparison to USJ, Disney parks Tokyo, or Hong Kong when it comes to creating a lively atmosphere. The staff appeared discontent and lacked smiles, diminishing the overall experience. Moreover, extensive renovation work limited the available attractions, making the already small park feel even smaller. Nevertheless, it's crucial for the park to undergo upgrades, including improvements to staff demeanor, to enhance its appeal and attract more visitors.

It's smaller than Japan and easier to get around. Since it was a weekday, I thought I wouldn't need the express bus, but it was fine at first, but by the afternoon it was getting pretty crowded, so I had to buy an extra bus inside the park.

We went on a weekday and the weather was sunny all throughout. No rain showers and the waiting time was fairly reasonable. We queued for less than an hour for the Transformers and the Mummy ride. The restaurants also had lots of seats available. I expected more people to be visiting USS since it was The Eras Tour week but I guess people visited elsewhere instead.

I have never seen a theme park this empty. I was there on a Wednesday but there were so few people there that I oftentimes could walk right to the coaster and get in without waiting. However, the park is very small when compared to the other Universal Studios and therefore the ticket price feels a bit expensive. There are 3 rollercoaster that are fast paced, namely the two battlestar galactica and the return of the mummy coaster. Besides that there are multiple shows and smaller things like rafting. Also lots of character meets which I would highly recommend doing because there were usually just a crowd. At the character meets there is staff that will take a picture with your smartphone for you.

Universal Studios Singapore exceeded all my expectations! From thrilling rides to captivating shows, every moment was filled with excitement. The attention to detail in the park's design truly transported me to different worlds. The friendly staff ensured a seamless experience, adding to the overall enjoyment. A must-visit destination for anyone seeking unforgettable entertainment
Very fun day at USS! The queues are short, the rides were kept clean and the staffs were very nice & friendly especially the elder staffs. Cant wait for the minion land to open this year

Have been here twice and feel so lucky because both visit don't have any queue, even I can ride some attraction twice.. the Minion and Nintendo land still not open yet, maybe next time I will visit USS again after it's open.. I'm really having a great time here!

The Transformer attractions are lit. The queue for the water raft adventure was annoyingly long during my visit, and one can get really wet, so gotta take the get wet warnings seriously. The Egyptian theme is amazing, incredible giant statues. Galactica roller coaster was quick but exhilarating enough. It looked safe and well maintained. Enough places to dine. Not a lot of unique drinks. Coconut juices werent very great imo. Locker system can be paid with credit card! https://fb.watch/qBzqqLJ12i/?mibextidv7YzmG

Amazing service. Jessica and Amanda from That's a Wrap, and Hwee Hwee and Neth from Guests Services really went all out to help me find the elusive Unicorn I wanted to get for my grand daughter. Really appreciate all your kindness. You make Universal Studios proud.

Most commercialized place in Singapore. Very crowded even for express pass. Hardly any rides for kid. Avoid it if you have 2 to 5 years of kid. Avoid it if you don't like to wait for more than half an hour for simple and useless ride. Had worst experience here

More than 1 hour wait time at almost every ride. Not worth the effort of standing in queue for so long. Management should only allow the right number of visitors that they can manage. Absolutely pathetic experience. I would not recommend this place even if tickets are offered for free.

WORST THEME PARK EXPERIENCE EVER No notice on website or social media regarding the closure of the Mummy ride except for a mere Instagram story stating the maintenance? I think that is very unprofessional and intentional. Ticket prices increased despite having an entire section closed for renovations is one thing, but closing off one of the most popular rides there without prominent notices especially on platforms where people would get their tickets from is really too much. I doubt a big organisation like RWS will have such an incompetent marketing team so higher possibility that this is the management's decision to intentionally withhold important information like this so as to not affect their profits. Dishonest business calls for a CASE report. And a staple theme park snack: turkey leg, is not available at USS. Used to be available across multiple food stands within USS but seems like it has been reduced to only one but don't bother because it's out of stock for god knows how long. They've also replaced some of the classic theme park foods to more "localised" food from other countries. Vadai was available at possibly every food stand there is. Every restaurant has a menu item with some form of Indian cuisine fused in them. Not what youd expect from a theme park. Been here a few times, this might be my last visit. The standards of RWS and USS has dropped so much I wonder why tourists still visit. Utterly disappointed. The only good thing I have to point out is the staffs. Good service but horribly managed. The park facilities seem badly maintained. If youve been on the Cylon ride youll get what Im talking about. Same for all the other rides, seat belts, harness, the whole place needs some deep cleaning. Gross.

Be v careful when you plan a visit to this place esp if u have infants, children or senior citizens 1. The long que at transformers ride was around 90minutes and u don't realise it at all until mid way. There is no staff around to guide u for emergency. Its Absolutely unorganized 2. There is no or less seating across the area or even for attractions with long distance making it worst and painful 3. Most of the staff are rude with you esp if you belong to different community or are a tourist and not a localite. They shout at u for no reason. 4. The parade is only done on Sundays and most characters are not available on weekdays. We met the puss cat who was equally rude with us in behavior. Why even act like a character if u cnt handle your role humbly? 5. After the entire days hectic walk when we left, the train que was again huge, trains run v v slow with bad cooling and suffocates you as it's so packed. Taxi stop is v far so making it difficult. As usual no place to sit so u have to kill yourself. 6. It was so tiring that my 5yrs old slept and we had to carry her in our arms waiting in this exit que to get the express train. The escalators to climb up to board the train were not functional so we had to take huge staircase with her and our bags with other child. There was no priority given to us despite having a child in arms. All in all, worst experience for huge amount with no facilities to make you comfortable as a guest. They only need your money to make business but give a damn to you or your comfort.

We were really looking forward to visiting USS and unfortunately it was hugely disappointing and we ended up leaving early. Feels like weve wasted a precious day from our trip to Singapore on being hot tired sweaty frustrated and hugely out of pocket. Even though we went early and on a Monday there were such long lines, far longer than the stated time, the ride operators were so slow at each round of the ride they fill it up with like 70% of the people with fast track tickets so felt really unfair. The fast track ticket was nearly as expensive as the main ticket and you have to buy it at the same time as the main ticket. We had a one year old baby and it was very frustrating to just have to carry him in a 40 minute plus queue, we ended up leaving most queues. Even the free shows, you have to get to them in advance otherwise you just miss them and have to wait another two hours for the next show. The meet and greet was so boring, unlike other theme parks where you can interact with the characters, here they just stand behind a rope and people queue up in the heat to take a quick photo and leave. The food again was also majorly disappointing, the cheapest thing you could get was water for 4 and soda for 5 everything else is double restaurant price too and not many great options, mainly just junk food and only 3 are halal. On a positive note the decor in the park was really nice but unfortunately just nothing interactive that you can enjoy without having to queue up for. At the very least they should make all queuing areas air conditioned and properly shaded, not just some far away fans and plastic canopy. There arent even benches to just sit outside to have a rest people just sit in the pavement or have to sit in a restaurant and pay for food. Just overall really not worth the price, came home so deflated unfortunately and wanting a refund as we did not enjoy it. I wouldnt recommend or return - particularly to people with young families.

I came here because the tickets were bought faster online. I can compare it because I was once in a similar park in Bilund, Denmark. Despite the middle of the week and early hours, there were a lot of people and few attractions. Big queues for the roller skates, the water roller skater, the one with mummies and the biggest one, it takes almost an hour to stand there the fun is probably only really for children aged 3-15 I was a bit disappointed because the photos seem to show big attractions but that's not really the case.
Its a nice place, too but there are some attractions that were closed off. What a bad timing. What i liked the most are the rides. Careful though some are not fitted for others who has a weak heart

For sure it's a place to spend many hour having rides on the adventure parks. Prefer to visit it during weakdays because it isn't so crowded. If you visit it during weekends may you prefer the universal express ticket otherwise you are going to wait for more that an hour on each ride. For sure to visit the transformers, the galaxy roller , the 3D move of Shrek (far far away castle) The food is expensive (as expected). So, you avoid to have a full lunch, and prefer to have a byte. When you finish and move out of the studios you should enjoy a nice meal on restaurant.

The roller coaster was fun. The decoration is cute and all, good vibes. However, the weather was hot, some indoor queuing had poor ventilation, and it was hard to breathe. The sweat smell, ew, please shower people
There are queues, but once you get there, it's OK

A visit to Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute must if you're in Singapore! Be sure to set aside a full day for this adventure, especially if you're planning to visit on a weekend. My friend and I went on a Saturday and, yes, some rides did have queues longer than 30 minutes, but trust me, it's all worth it! The rides are incredibly exciting and packed with fun. To make the most of your visit, I highly recommend downloading the Universal Studios app. It helps you keep track of waiting times for each ride and the show timings, ensuring you can plan your day efficiently. Two experiences that stood out for us were the Transformers ride and the Water World show absolutely thrilling! Overall, Universal Studios Singapore offers an amazing day out for all ages. Highly recommended for an unforgettable adventure in Singapore!
I've been to USJ in Japan and USS is far different from Japanese one. USS's attractions were thrilling and fantastic. You can enjoy there only in 5 hours or so.
Best to visit during Weekdays. Long queue will be there on weekends and will need to wait for hours.
Francis, a staff at the minion store, are very friendly and professional. Waterworld show is spectacular and amazing. We enjoyed a lot! Wonderful place to spend a day with kids.

BOOKING: We visited it on a Friday after booking tickets 1 week in advance through the app KLOOK. To enter, we simply scanned the QR code in the ticket. There was no checking of our bags. ENVIRONMENT: The roads are spacious and full of greenery. The shops and rides look new and clean, and the decor is adorable. Most rides have canopies/coverage with plentiful fans when lining up. RIDES: One land was closed for renovation when I went, so there were 12 rides and 8 shows in the park. My personal favourites are: - Mummy Ride: A roller coaster with a great balance between storyline, atmosphere and simply a good rollercoaster. - Shrek 4D Adventure: A 4D movie whose storyline happens after the SHREK 1 movie. The aircon and chairs are very comfortable and great for relaxing after walking around in the heat. - MELS: A 3-person performance of the greatest pop hits in history. A small scale show on the streets but very fun and energetic. FOOD: There are 8 restaurants and some food carts scattered around the park. Most sell fast food, noodles and some local dishes. Snacks and drinks cost around 8-10 SDG, AND dishes cost around 15-20 SDG. MY OPINION: A fun park with great theming. Its kept clean and safe, and I especially appreciate the enthusiastic attitudes of the staff working there. However, it is a relatively small park (we went on 90% of the rides in one day on a Friday). I think adding more large-scale dance performances would make it more fun.

Alot of ride in renovation and maintenance, only 70% of rides and restaurant are in business. Paid full price for it, what a deal breaker. All visitors become packed to available restaurant / ride that are open. Was raining heavily half day, not enough accommodation for shelter, and most of the ride become offline due to rain. Tough luck, but bad management, shouldnt charge full price for 70% operational theme park. To us, this is the worst univ. std weve ever been to. Never going back. Better spend your money elsewhere.

The last time I went pretty much all the adult rides were either under maintenance or not built. I went to service counter to ask for a refund at least on the express pass and was greeted with attitude and a Sorry. Just not good enough. They should tell you prior to purchase whats working. Im an adult and dont do kiddie rides. Im back in September so Ill be checking and I hope anyone reading this also checks before wasting their money or entry into this place.

Went on a Thursday and managed to get the early entry ticket so the crowd was not too crazy yet. I managed to enjoy the rides on sesame street and Transformers. Afterwards i went to Battlestar Galactica. i was already waiting my turn at the gate but everyone was suddenly asked to return to the queue. As all of us were waiting, there wasnt any information or explanation given. We waited for a good 10-15 mins before an announcement was made that there were technical difficulties and the rides are delayed. Waited for 10 mins and no updates were given how long. Slowly everyone started leaving. A man asked the staff what is happening and the staff only said we have technical difficulties and unfortunately we dont exactly know what is causing it. You can stay but we dont know how long it will take or you can leave. I waited for about 15 mins and they still said they did not know what the issue was. There wont be much they would do for service recovery either. So i feel like the early entry ticket was wasted or useless as i didnt get to ride at all afterwards. The ride was only working about 30 mins after i left which is about the same time that more crowds were forming. When i wanted to ride, the wait time was more than 2 hours. Not only did i not get to ride it, when i waited for the transformer photo taking, it also delayed for 10-15 mins. Now i understand as it might be difficult to wear the costume but it was kinda frustrating as the queue was under the hot sun. We were not allowed to wait under the shelter either as it is considered to be entering the staffs zone. USS used to be fun and enjoyable, now just seems to be full of delays and issues without any service recovery. If you were to complain, they wont do anything much either and probably wont do anything when i write this review too. So just take note of this if you plan on going USS.

Long time repeat visitor. Recent return visit post Covid was poor. No shelter, expensive lockers, poor queue lines and several rides were being rebuilt (despite same entrance price). The express pass was more expensive than the ticket, why cant they align to Disneys genie pass and pre-booking system that works great and cost half as much.

We went there and bought the general admission ticket for 8085 per person. Then, when we went inside, it was overcrowded. When we went for a ride, it was a 100-minute waityes, over 1 hour just for 1 ride out of 16 attractions. So, to overcome this, the park offers you an express ticket for 100 per person. The ticket counter will sell you a ticket, but most of the attractions are not suitable for kids under 122 cm. So it was a waste of money for us. Altogether, we spent 600 plus 100 for the cable car. By spending 100 on express tickets you will feel like VIP (Very Important Person) as normal crowd is waiting for hours an hours while you can come in and out very quickly. I should have left my feeling at home in Australia that everyone is equal as the park doesn't treat you like that. My question is when they can accommodate large express ticket crowd why not others or make 1 price ticket and only let limited crowd in and out like in Night Safari where you have to pre book. Or else increase the staff or attractions facility. Surely if the business is making money then investing in impoverment won't be a issue. It lacks simple management solutions even though it Universal Studios. The park is overcrowded with Indians tourist mainly. Please mind I am an Indian Australian too. Not against any race, but the park staff was not able to control the crowd. My family and I were pushed 3-4 times while waiting for the attractions. I was elbowed twice. My wife and kid was pushed back by a man so he could break the queue and come to the front of the queue. Also, by the way, most of the time, no one was following the queue. The park will keep selling tickets to make more money; it's like quantity but not quality. I would not recommend it to families with young children or infants and toddlers as it's a waste of time and money. It will probably be okay with children over 6 -7 years plus, not for 3-4 years or below. If you have never being to Universal Studios then go for it. After the experience from Universal Studios we decided to cancel all other plan to water world and rest of the sentosa as I rather have relax holiday in the hotel pool relax and enjoy with kids rather then get pushed around, elbowed or rush around. Probably I would choose Thailand as it got everything to offer to everyone and the management on venue's is way better.

It is a small theme park with relatively high price with it. If you visit on a weekday, one day is enough for the most of rides. Some of the rides (I.e. Mummy and Transformer) were quite interesting. But the most annoying part was the locker system. If you want to get on a few of the roller-coasters, you need to keep all your stuff including your phone and water bottles in the locker cost at list 4.

The park is nice and the atmosphere is pleasant. The reason why I am giving a score 3 is because the park is very much in disregard to food allergies. There are many many places to eat but not one did have anything gluten free to offer. I ate only potato wedges all day when I was threre.

Good experience but not as good as other universals like LA. Rides and attractions are lesser in Singapore as compared to other universals. Queue was terrible and at some places wait was as high as 80 mins. Their VIP price is too high. some rides were really good.

I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore and had an overall great time, but my experience was somewhat mixed. The rides were fantastic, with my favorites being the Transformers ride, Battlestar Galactica, and The Mummy. These rides were thrilling and well worth the visit. However, I encountered a significant issue with the line management. There were often no staff present to guide the lines or monitor the crowd, which led to many people cutting in line. A specific group (and race) was particularly disrespectful, blatantly cutting lines and even applauding themselves for doing so. They were in large groups, which made the situation even more frustrating and disrupted the overall experience. Additionally, in such a closed environment, the lack of proper ventilation became quite apparent, making it uncomfortable with the poor smell lingering around. Sadly, the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure was closed during my visit, which was disappointing as I was looking forward to it. Despite these issues, I would still recommend visiting Universal Studios Singapore. The rides and attractions are top-notch, but I would advise against going on weekends to avoid the large crowds. Also, be vigilant for line cutters to ensure a more enjoyable experience.
Rides are ok. Lack of good F&B options

Had a blast at Universal Studios Singapore despite the scorching weather. The park is filled with thrilling rides and attractions, keeping us entertained throughout the day. The staff were fantastic and always ready to assist. While the hot weather was a bit challenging, especially when waiting in long queues, the overall experience was still fantastic. A definite must-visit destination for families and adventure enthusiasts

WE BOTH LOVED OUR DAY HERE!!! We spent the day at universal on a Friday and it was so so good! Got there at opening time and spent around 10-15 queuing to get in. Once we were in the rides hardly had any queue throughout the whole day apart from one which took around 30-40 minutes! Other than that it was very smooth and quick to get on each ride? CYLON, HUMAN and (The ancient one, dont remember the name) were by far the best rides which had queues up to 5 minutes so definitely worth the short wait! The park its self was so nostalgic to walk around and so cool to see all the different sections including: THE LOST WORLD, transformers, Far Far Away and the rest!! We are travellers but just wanted a bit of fun for a day and honestly it was so worth it!!

This is my second time to Universal Singapore. We got the early entry tickets which is highly recommended. By 10:15 we had done Transformers, Sesame Street and both Battlestar Galactica rides - I thought the Cylon version was one of the best rides Ive ever done - amazing. My only gripe is that as I type this it is 12pm and I have gone on every single ride apart from 2 kid friendly ones - so 12 rides in 3 hours - on a Sunday! Wouldnt recommend the express pass as it is not worth it if you arrive early. We are going home as basically done everything, granted there are a couple of shows which we could watch but not for over an hour. They are building a new Minions area so perhaps there is less than there would normally be, but for 50 I feel like there should be at least a whole days worth of activities, not a half day. Would recommend for first timers though.
Love the park!! Spent a really nice day here. The rides can be quite a long wait, but worth to try all of them! I loved the mummy ride and the 4d shrek movie

I go to Universal Studio during Chinese new year. There are crowed people. However, Rides and show delivered the great experience. Dont forget to have Gelato edition both ice cream and cookie which is the best part for me on that day.

I am a local SG. My expectation was high for SG USS after visiting Japan USS. SG USS lost out in terms of the lack of energy level and customer service attitude of the theme park staff. One of the USS staff ignored me when I asked him some questions, yet when a Caucasian guy asked him, the same staff smiled politely and entertained him. This is unfair treatment and racism in SG from our local staff.

Terrible experience with my family. For the amount we paid for tickets, Id at least expect all the rides to be functioning but at least 2 were down. Every ride was manned by only 1 person. These lone rangers were clearly overwhelmed and stopped scanning express passes so pretty much everyone was cutting the line. Queue times were at a ridiculous 60-80 mins on average. There were actual employees walking around with expresses passes for sale here signs to entice people to pay a ridiculous 100 more for the ability to stand in a line. USS is a tourist trap and for suckers who cant entertain their children any other way.
If you sell more tickets than your capacity, you will make people wait for 1 hour for each activity. A business that does not respect people. Don't come here if possible.

Service staff didn't help in crowd control during meet and greet with Minions. The staff who helped in photo taking for visitors with our handphone also did not help to ensure photos are clear. Just hurried everyone off. The people dresses up as Characters are also not friendly towards the kids. Need more training. Very little entertainment for kids below 6yo. Timing of Trolls show on Friday was changed from 12noon to 2pm at short notice. The park was hot, with limited dining options or resting place for young kids. There is also no re entry allowed. We left at 12.30pm 2 hrs after entry, very disappointed and waste of time. Not recommended for families with children less than 6 years old.

Cannot really give them a negetive rating ,so the single star. Reached at around 10 am ,took 80 min for the transformers ride,no place to sit while we wait,no option of rest rooms too. Next got on line for the roller coaster,the most sought after ride,after waiting for 2 hours and reaching just about the line where we enter the ride there was a technical issue and the ride was delayed,very unprofessional behaviour by the staff,no information was been shared ,they spoke very rudely and they sure do have a sense of superiority in them and for sure they are not service oriented,any which ways went around the whole park waiting for hours for very average rides,paying a bomb of food and water(almost 4times). Got back to the roller coaster,waited another 90min and still could not ride due to the same technical issue.same pathetic behaviour by the staff. Not bothered about their clients. Worst day of my life. Guys don't come here . These studio staff guys are only licking the soles of people who buy the super expensive express passes. Not bothered about the comment people who have also paid quite a lot for the regular ticket. Overhyped and over priced and pathetic services Avoid And if you must go always but that expensive express pass, never the regular tickets.

Quite a nice theme park to visit. The queues can be really long though, with rides averaging nearly 1h of waiting time during peak periods. The food is generally of average quality, and can be really expensive for the quality and portions offered.

The good: Very clean and well laid out. Rides were very fun, but some are aging. Waterworld show was the highlight of the day. The bad: Food prices are a bit high for what you get, but the quality was decent. The ugly: The wait time for rides was incredibly long. We would not return based on this criteria. The park/staff are very slow on turn around times for rides (60-110mins for each).
It was an OK theme park 3/5. Was raining when we went, so less people around, and we were able to ride the popular attractions like transformers and roller coaster without waiting in line.

Was an interesting time. Once at Santosa we were surprised at how very little Signage there was to show what direction Universal Studios was. Once we actually found it, the place was bustling with lots of people. We had VIp ticketing so we jump the queue . Rides are ok. Some were not operating and most were very tired . Food pretty good and not too expensive . The Cable over to Santosa was pretty good however it is not Air-conditioned so take a fan . We spent every haf hour going into food courts as the Air-conditioned areas were always the best place to work out were to go next . You will need about 6 hours if you want to see most of the area.

Although its a quite famous place, but the service and equipment need to get improved. Can not imagine that the park just let people stand under super strong sunshine for an hour never come unless it improves the service.

We book our tickets from Klook and Im glad we did because its hassle-free. We went here on a weekend and there were a lot of people (locals and tourists as well). We had a wonderful time exploring and experiencing the rides. Even adults like us will definitely enjoy this place. Some rides you will wait in the line for about 30mins but thats okay the rides are really cool and enjoyable. Make sure to wear comfy clothes and shoes that is good for walking coz you'll be doing a lot of that for sure. I recommend going to Universal Studios whenever you're in Singapore.
Universal Studios Singapore was a blast! Booking tickets through the Klook app was seamless, and the park experience was unforgettable. Highly recommend for a fun-filled day out.

Very nice place to visit with friends and family, only thing is each ride wait time is upto 40 to 60 minutes. Buy Express Pass tickets to skip the queue and don't miss the TRANSFORMERS, MUMMY & JURRASIC PARK rides, those were amazing. Food was also the best. I recommend the food court in the jurrasic park.

I went to uss recently and am definitely happy with the warm gesture and delightful welcome service from all of the staff there, especially coming from aa staff named Ridzuan from the Fairy Godmother store. I believe he should receive an extend appreciation for his sincere services as it would make more people be excited to come here and enjoy their visits :)

It's simply amazing. There are multiple zones and each zone has multiple rides. The ones which should not be missed are roller coaster rides Battlestar Galactica and Human, bunch of rides in Jurassic park like Canopy Flyer, JP rapids adventure, And revenge of the mummy. Also not to forget Transformers. It has a single pass entry to the entire park and enjoy unlimited rides. If you want VIP entry to each ride and not to wait in the long queue then you buy an Express pass by paying an additional SGD100 per person. Generally the park has a max crowd between 12pm to 5pm. Post 5pm, you will have very less rush and the waiting at each ride would be 10-15mins. There are multiple performances as well in the Evening to relax. Also there are good shops for kids like Hershey's, Lego, Candylicious etc. Overall 5 star from my side for excellent crowd management, neat and clean and very well maintained amusement park

First their staff behaviour was damn worst Simply they treat u like goats .. Next they keep wait time 60-200 min almost 3h.20 min y ? without planning taking too much admission just earn money right?! until 7 pm suddenly they reduced the wait time.. no where u find a chair to sit even u sit some place their staff scold u get away as if they are landlords .. exactly 8 pm they close & they keep open all the sales counters alone y ? To make money ? next food Water bottle(200 ml )-4 Singapore dollar Baby food - 14 Singapore dollars which is worst Food minimum 16 Singapore dollars which is so expensive..! I prefer dont waste ur time money & dignity In between they stop entry ride dont know y? Shows at specific time only so u need to go there

Not a great experience for us. We waited over 2hrs to get on 1 ride only to be told it had broken down and that we should leave the queue and find another ride to go on. We walked around the park looking at more rides but the wait times were all 1.5-2.5hrs long. There are too many people jammed in one space, that you feel as though you are constantly bumping into people. We left without going on a single ride, with strict instruction that a refund was not possible. Overall very disappointing.

Worst place to go its too over crowded there must be a limit of number of people. Every ride has minimum 2 hours queue waiting for normal and 30 minutes queue for express. I visited on Thursday July 25 2024. Such long queues in sunny day cannot give a good experience

If you want to waste your time and money, go to this park! It's a big mess. It's okay that you have to wait a long time at attractions, but the employees are very unfriendly and shouty. We waited a long time at one of the attractions and when it was finally our turn, we were told that the attraction was broken. We have experienced crowds in Universal Studios LA and Universal Studios Orlando. But somehow those parks are more structured than this park. Never again this park!! It's a waste of time. It's a shame that the employees are so ill-mannered. It did ruin our day! If you still choose to go to this park, a tip: buy your express tickets in advance. That saves a lot of money.

Some rides were not working the reason was maintenance given by staff... Long ques and not proper management. In the transformer ride we were stuck in a ride due to a mechanical issue for 10 min. Do not visit sea world waste of time and money. All plastic... Rest all have fun... Time pass

It's about half the size of USJ and has attractions that aren't found in Japan, so it's pretty nice. However, it is difficult because there are quite a lot of lines depending on the item. However, there are places where you can ride as a single rider, so if you use this, it will be faster. I played for 8 hours from 12:00 to 20:00, and I felt like I was able to go to all the places I particularly wanted to go.

It's smaller than Japan, so if there weren't many people, you could easily visit it in one day, but on the day it was so crowded that there were many attractions that had to wait for 90 minutes, so I couldn't ride much. Fastpasses are expensive, just like in Japan, so it's a matter of whether you want to spend time or money. However, there are attractions that are not found in Japan, so you can enjoy a completely different atmosphere.

Although it is not as big as Universal Studios Japan, it still has everything you need. It takes a whole day to visit. Food in the park is a bit expensive. It is my second visit. The Madagascar park has been updated to the Little Soldiers Park (under construction). expect......
It's okay, but the queue time is much longer than the play time
Good park. Nice rides but ........... Minion land is still under construction. So sad ....

Amazing theme park in Southeast Asia. Love the design, atmosphere, and many attractions to enjoy. Like almost everything else in Singapore, the operations are very efficient and HighTech. The waiting at the opening gate was usually crowded, especially during the Holidays or weekend on peak season, but rest assured that the lines are moving very quickly and to save more time, I suggest you buy the ticket online (I used Klook). The line to any attractions is quite long though, so if you want to save some times, you can buy the Universal Express Pass. The attractions, went through almost every one of them and enjoy it so much. The staffs are also very courteous, saw a few people trying to cut the line but the staffs handled it very professionally so kudos to them. Love everything here and would be a great place to enjoy your day with your partner or love ones. With many attractions are currently on the way, I hope to visit there again one day.

Loved it!! Wait times were pretty good. Longest queue was for Jurassic park water ride and was around 45 mins, but all the rest were much less. Just work around wait times as the park gets super quiet around 6pm, so we queued 5 mins for a lot of the rides later in the day, stay till later! Met shrek, Fiona, puss in boots and kitty long paws. And we met Optimus prime! The show they had on in the waterland was amazing too. Really good theming. Great experience, deffo recommend!
I love the rollercoasters there. It is a thrilling experience. However, wait times can go up to 150 mins. Even the express queue was quite long. OVERAL: it was great place!!!!

Amazing experience (must do if youre visiting here with friends/family)! There are so many exhilarating rides to go on and even if you dont like high speed intense rollercoasters (if you do go to 1. Cylon/Human, 2. Mummy), there are many chill relaxing rides and everywhere is a great place to take photos and create memories. There are also live performances / meet&greets with some fictional characters. There are many places to eat and rest (snacks or lunch/dinner) throughout the amusement park. This will be needed as it can get pretty hot However, the only downside is that most of the time when youre visiting (weekends/public holidays), you will HAVE to wait in a long line (20-60 minutes) for a single ride with the normal tickets. As a regular visitor here, I recommend purchasing the Universal Express Pass (S193) for optimal enjoyment and minimal wait time (you can go 8-10 times on a ride while people still wait in a line). I also recommend going on a less busy day like the weekdays and making full use of the entry time at 11:00am and exit at 6:00pm,
Amazing place for all age groups. Try to be there early and on weekdays, also try to but the express pass as the queues can be really long. Every theme is beautifully done.

On August 1st of 2024 my family and I went to universal studio Singapore, we got the express pass but no priority was felt. We waited for more than 30 minutes per ride on average, with one ride (Jurassic Park) that exceeded an hour of wait. The roller coasters were 40 mins more on average, it was truly a horrible experience. In the shrek theater, one woman yelled at all of us for trying to enter when she opened the door with no clear instructions with what we should do. One person who was in charge of the bumblebee ride (turning cups) was incredibly rude to an Indian woman as he wrongly miscalculated the number of tickets that was given to him. The overall experience was terrible and avoid this amusement park at all costs. If it wasnt for the google system, Id give this place a -100 stars for being overcrowded, bad service attitude, and horrible ride experiences. This park is not worth visiting and should reflect on their operation and service. They should also consider making the fast pass actually fast as opposed to us throwing worthless money into a pass that made us wait for 60 mins with the worst service possible.

Worst experience I have ever had!! The waiting time is horribly so long (about 2 hours per attraction!!!) Really does Not worth it, We regret our monday passed overthere! They should limit the number Of tickets in order to better manage the waiting time.

It was really disappointed. The place was overcrowded never see in any park, what a rubbish Waiting time for some activity will take up to 2 hours. The experience was waste of time and money.We got soaked due to continues rainy weather and left back to hotel.
The worst theme park ever : at least 1h of queue for any attraction, everything is ridiculously pricy, attractions feel like a 2015 thing I would not recommend
Poor service, no guidance from staff, many dead ends in the park, poor attitude of staff

Good place to spend a day. Mummy ride and roller coaster is nice. Transformers is ok. Not as good as the hype created. The wait time for few rides gets reduced during the evening. Can use this trick instead of spending hours in the morning.

Nice and well set up park, but too small and with few attractions for too many visitors, but things will certainly improve with the arrival of Minions land in 2025, even if unfortunately they had to eliminate the Madagascar area which was very beautiful. Good price, but the queues at the attractions are too long and the price of the express pass (it costs more than the ticket and not available online) is too high, same in the shops. Recommended for those who like the Universal world, because otherwise it's not worth it.
Enjoyable and good experience but the weather is way to hot and long queuing is a big minus. Maybe it a small park, or maybe it a holiday, slit crowded.

I have been to USJ several times before. This is my first time to visit USS. The first impression is good. I will go again if I have the opportunity. The campus is much smaller than USJ, but there are some differences in facilities. Buy the admission tickets in advance at klook on the same day, it is much cheaper and more convenient, and there is no need to wait for admission Unfortunately, it happened to rain heavily, and the outdoor amusement rides were stopped for a while. As a result, it took nearly 3 hours for me to wait in line for the indoor rides. It was a long wait, but it was really fun and exciting. I stayed for about 7 hours this time. I didnt play a lot of games, but I also took a lot of photos and had a pleasant day
We got early access with breakfast ticket so there is no queue. But there are only three attractions open. The shops are all closed. So it goods for those who wanna take photos with stars.

The best time in singapore. Everything was just perfect. Fantastic rides, Long queues, well organised, if you got money to spare express pass helps to shorten the line of wait. Main rides are usually 60 to 90 minutes of wait time. Overall a pleasant experience with family and friends.

Amazing place and amazing help staff! Needed help with our tickets and Sharafina in particular (forgive me if i got that a bit wrong) was so so lovely and sweet and helpful and a credit to the whole guest service front. Helped so much with us yesterday with our ticketing issue and i want her to know how much we appreciate it! 3

Been here 3 times. Best amusement park for me. I love the transformers ride and roller coaster. Had to buy the express pass to skip queue so that I can play over and over many times. Or else will have to wait 3-4 hours long for one ride.
Great Place, the only downside is the price of foods and the queues at certain rides. But otherwise a fantastic experience.
It was an amazing experience. Thoroughly enjoyed it. Queues for rides are shorter in the afternoon.

The attraction was great, but I had a very unpleasant experience waiting outside for "Meet the Transformers" with my Transformer child. We were waiting outside the established control line when an employee asked us to move in a different direction, so we moved to the location she requested. An employee wearing a nametag named Hafiz came back angrily and asked me to go somewhere else. I didn't think it was my fault because I followed the location requested by the staff when I initially requested a move. And since I followed the staff's instructions and stayed outside the clearly established control line, if my location was an issue, the control line was wrong or it was the staff's fault who asked me to move first, not mine. So, if necessary, I think it is something to kindly explain and provide guidance to, and not something to get angry at and throw a tantrum at my 8-year-old child and me. I hope your company reflects on whether holding an event that makes visitors angry is in line with your vision and mission statement. Thanks to Hafiz, my child and I were in a very good mood after coming here to freshen up. Thank you for giving me the worst experience(?)

It is not as worthwhile as its hype. They need to work a lot on their management and staff. The staff is quite rude. Bought a universal pass, but not all rides have a queue for universal pass entry, so we have to wait in the regular pass queue. Friday but still roller coaster were closed. And aahhh the heat . They only let some people to take pictures with characters. We can't touch the transformer and can only take photos with family, no single ones. Again, the staff was rude and immature. I think the people of Sentosa are quite rude compared to other areas of singapore. Never gonna visit again Will go for disney land and florida studio. Expensive but not worth it.
2 biggest rides closed on the same day no notice, no refund. Very disappointed
You could not buy VIP.tickets . long ques . Wait times not accurate. Universal studios in other countries are better.
Many attractions were closed, there were only around ten available. The waiting time indicated on each attraction is not the real time it is in fact much longer.

Having been to Florida a few times I was excited to visit Universal Singapore however that initial excitement quickly disappeared when I saw the queue for the first ride Cyclon (battlestar galactic rollercoaster) which was 90 minutes. First off they are militant about not having your phone or any bag on you and check prior to entering the queue meaning you can't even try and plan your day whilst waiting. And also basically no ride set up and amusement when waiting in line makes for a rather long and boring wait. Even the 1st class citizens who pay more than the price of the park ticket again to get the 'priority pass' had to wait about 30 minutes for the ride. Absolutely detest this scummy system parks seem to use but it seems to be standard and not normally too much of an issue if regular queue times are reasonable and rides have single rides options (of which I only seen this option for the transformer 4d coaster at Singapore universal) Eventually we managed to get on the coaster and it was pretty mid, the hulk or velocicoaster from Florida this is not. Anyway this set the scene for the rest of the day. Huge lines for pretty much all rides / shows and pretty average when you actually got to experience it. Also this was a Monday so I don't know if that makes a difference but I wouldn't want to see this park on a busy weekend. The water world show was ok. Probably the best thing there... And actually managed to see it without a massive wait which was a bonus. Overall I would avoid this park, it would make for an ok day out if they let about half of the people in on a daily basis but that would not line their coffers I guess....
A pretty good themepark. It is a bit dated, and could use som new and big attractions. But the rides they have are well done and amuzing. It is a half day park, as it is pretty small.
Nice park, but long waiting times and few attractions

Known for some amazing rides like roller coasters, movie theme rides, kids pleasure cinema, souvenir shops and snack shops, this place is a museum of entertainment. We purposely went on a weekday as weekends are very crowded. I was surprised to see the kind of rush here. The entry time for normal ticket was 10AM but I myself entered around 9.45AM as the gates were open. It was mind boggling to see that they have just provided tickets without any sense of whats happening inside. Sadly, the wait time for every ride for a Normal Ticket was 120 mins, even the people who had taken VIP tickets which has line free access to swings were waiting 35-45 mins for their turn. It was a low-key experience to see such kind of management at a place like this. Overall my experience was pretty bad just because of the Ticket price & kind of wait time they had given for every ride that just lasted fraction of seconds. They should really improve the management to understand headcount vs wait time/ride.

Universal Studios Singapore offers a truly immersive experience with its attention to detail across all themed areas. The cleanliness of the park deserves special mention, as it significantly enhances the experience for visitors of all ages. The variety of rides caters well to both kids and adults, ensuring that every family member has something to enjoy. However, the waiting times for attractions are generally acceptable, though peak times can see longer waits, which is typical for a popular theme park. One area for improvement would be the addition of more resting areas, particularly for the elderly and young children. Incorporating more shaded or indoor rest spots could make the park even more accommodating for all age groups, reinforcing its status as a family-friendly destination.

Amazing park with amazing attractions! If you like movies and cartoons, this is the place to visit. :) The only downside are the never-ending lines for the rides. You'll wait up to 2 hours to go on a single ride.

Amazing experience here. Worth spending the whole day here. Kids will really have a blast. Actually the place is suitable for people of all ages. Just have to come prepared for a day of walking and putting up with the swealtering heat. The rides are well maintained. On most occasions there are waiting times unless your take a VIP pass. I think the clue is to go for finish to end. The more popular rides like the transformers and mummy and roller coasters are at the start. I noticed that post lunch, ie around 2 pm those rides didnt have that much of a wait time. Hope that helps.

Went during the covid period where USS was operating at a reduced capacity. Fun rides, minimal crowds and wait times, super awesome character cast who were dedicated to bringing a smile to our faces! Exorbitant F&B prices though and Battlestar wasn't open (again) when we visited. Visited again after 4 months during the Christmas period with new Christmas-themed elements! For a more detailed review with photos, check out my blog by searching for "Daniaexperiences Singapore".

My first visit to the park! Loved the shows and rides. Food choice was surprising vast and varied. Losing one point only because the park closes early! Wish they had evening activities (light shows etc). Cant wait to be back when Minion Land is ready!
Amazing place ! Visit on weekdays for lesser wait times !

I have been to the universal studios in Hollywood, orlando and singapore and found the one in singapore to be really messy. It was the worst experience. The entire place was over crowded with each ride having a wait time of over 2 hours. We could try about 4 rides before my 6 year old ran out of patience and we left. It's really not worth going to this place on a holiday. Do not go here without an express pass. Else It's a waste of time.
This is the worst service of universal studios I have ever seen. The express ticket doesn't make any difference in most rides. The staff is very rude. The worst experience in years for the money.

Horribly hot weather in Singapore and the park does not have much shade or misting fans to help with that. 2 rides had technical issues and people were stuck queuing for an extra 15 minutes. Horrible experience coz of the weather and wait time. The weather made every visitor sweaty and queuing with the body odour of everyone made the wait even more like a nightmare. Like most theme parks in the world, everything in the park is overpriced. So that isn't new. Wouldn't visit the USS again unless it snows in Singapore or they can aircondition at least 70% of the park

Went with my family today 4/10/24. Waiting time was 60-70min per ride. Was very busy and also a lot of people pushing. It was totally over crowded. Truth be said.. we did have fun.. managing only to go on 3 rides. However I am giving a 1 star.. reason being ..for 1 young very rude security worker.. verbally pushing me and my kids to exit the site without my wife. Even though I had mentioned it to him .. (my kids and I , had just exited the toilet and was waiting for my wife to exit the toilets). He was totally rude and ruined the whole day. We paid over 400 and at the end we got chased and pushed out by the security .. because they had some halloween event after 5pm.

Very bad experience in uss , the theme park already closing early at 5pm to serve the Halloween horror night customers. Staff starts to chase the day customers out at 4.30pm . The queuing time for every rides are 80-90 mins long . The wait is very torturing . However , the Waterworld show is very recommended to catch , the actors acted well . Lastly, the management of the exiting of the day customers is very very bad. 500 pax forced to exit through a small narrow path as shown in the picture.

A compact theme park that you're quite able to go around in one day. The waiting times were reasonable during my visit.. ranging from 20 to 40 mins. Some of the ques were deceptively short from the outside because there is quite an extended queuing line inside the building. Transformers, the Mummy, Jurassic park, Shrek 4D cinema were worth the wait. The rides whilst thrilling were too short especially considering the que times. Food as expected was overpriced. Tip 1 : get your souvenirs at the main shop near the entrance as they have the full range so you can enjoy them throughout your visit. Tip 2 : be aware that the park may close early on some days. Tip 3 : your day will suck as outdoor rides will not operate if it rains heavily. Tip 4 : Ask the operator if the ride shakes you about to check suitability for those who may not like it. Overall (if weather gods are kind).. enjoyable day out.

Really overrated. Rides were good, the place was good and clean, but overall very few rides. I find some of the rides I went in India was more thrilling. I mean in number. Maybe if it's named as a Mini Universal studio I would have given it a 5. Wheel chair lines , restroom facility, drinking water, service provided , shade lines were all top notch. Overall infrastructure was great but that's the entire Singapore.

It was ok. It was clean and well ventilated. We were lucky to have a good weather. It was small compared to other Universal Studios. Wait time for transformers 80mins. The mummy 15mins. Lights camera 40 mins. Shrek 4d 20mins. We were able to do all rides we wanted even without express pass. A lot of water fountain even available while in line. Food and drinks were really expensive but acceptable. Sandwich 16usd. Slushy 8sgd. Rootbeer in can 4sgd. Just wear comfy shoes because youll be on your feet for hours. Staff very polite and kind. Some of the visitors really smell and not following rules but not the parks fault. Ok to go once and able to finish in a day. We did the shrek 4d twice. Its my favorite attraction.

The rides were okay. However, the long wait times were highly abundant. Making the experience tiring and honestly stressful. Visited only 2 Rides, the Battlestar Galatica (Human), which the wait was extremely long (3 hours), and the ancient Egyptian ride located in the pyramid, which was decently quick but don't be fooled as you think you might've reached the end of the line, No. There's an even bigger line stairs.

We went on a Friday (no bank Holiday or school holidays). It was still so full that the queues we're 30-60min on every ride (and including the food stalls...). And the rides are super short. Fast track pass is pretty expensive imo but if you want a good experience without having to stand in line everywhere you're almost pressured to buy it. That might have even been the reason the queues were so long, cause people with a fast track pass kept being let through. It's very pay to win. However the park is pretty but very small. Not a lot of rides (but therefore an awful lot of people, even on a weekday). For us this was the most overpriced and most easy to skip experience when visiting singapore and probably the amusement park we enjoyed the least so far. The "universal" globe is outside the park, so if you just want to take a picture of that and skip actually buying a ticket and going in you're not missing out on too much imo.

Park is great. Fantasticly themed and great selection of rides and food. All of the staff I encountered were very friendly and happy to help. Would recommend taking the train here from anywhere. Its about 2 and very quick. Beat all the traffic.

Universal Studios offers an exciting experience with a variety of rides, beautiful themed areas, and much more to explore. There are different ticket options: the normal ticket and the Express ticket. With the Express ticket, you dont have to wait in long queues for the rides, while the normal ticket usually means a 30-40 minute wait per ride. Although the Express ticket is a bit pricier, I highly recommend it for a smoother experience. Make sure to try all the ridestheyre fun and thrilling! The park operates from 10 AM to 5 PM, so plan your time accordingly. There are also themed events like Halloween and Minions that add extra entertainment throughout your visit
Amazing experience, 4D effects are great. Must visit, but pls plan the entire day and book your tickets in advance. Visit on weekdays to avoid huge crowds and long queues for rides.
Amazing place in SG...bought ticket in Agoda less expensive .We have rides and it was amazing.. however we were not able to explore much as they closed early on Sunday till 5 pm pnly

singapore universal studio we went there around 11am and its full busy on weekend saturday but you have a chance to cover all the activities when managed as a round trip, first install the universal studio singapore app and check all their activities and how long you are there A queue shows whether there is. Don't go to the roller coaster first, keep to do it for last.. It's not busy in the evening. I went to both roller coasters twice and we covered all the activities before 8 pm.

Service sucks. NONE of the staffs are smiling and talked like we owe them money. Then closed at 5pm. Is ok. But the staffs scolded and rushed tourists to go out like they are dogs. Worst experience ever.
I found this really disappointing. Park is very loud, seems very dated, rides poor, and long queues everywhere. Food outlets of poor quality. Adults and kids; we were all happy to leave.

Unfortunately not the greatest experience. This is the only theme park in the world where it seems the staff go out of their way to be rude and arrogant. All customer service goes out the window upon entry. Also don't buy the express passes as it was the biggest rip off, only allowing to use once per ride without stating this in the terms and conditions of the express pass. They hide this term and condition because u wouldn't buy it if they made it clear in the terms and conditions. We were there on a busy wet day most of the rides close if raining so steer clear of rainy days there's not much to do. This is my first ever bad review of any business because I prefer to try to highlight the positives out there. However the experience was too bad to ignore and hopefully I can't help others with their expectations of Universal Studios Singapore.

We had an extremely disappointing and horrifying experience at USS Halloween Horror Nights. Unfortunately, I booked our tickets through a sponsored link on Headout, unaware of the complexities involved. The ticketing process was confusing; in the past, there used to be one entrance ticket for the whole day entry, but now there are separate day and night passes. Misled by Headout's website, we unknowingly purchased day passes instead of night passes, spending 366 with express passes included for 2 persons only. When we arrived at the entrance, we hoped the staff would be understanding and allow us to switch to night passes with a willingness to pay the difference. However, we were denied entry with no flexibility shown. It felt unnecessarily harsh, especially since we had already paid for entry and the company had profited from it. The refusal to accommodate or show empathy was deeply disappointing. We were told to buy new tickets if we wanted to enterwe were reluctant to spend a total of 600-800 for just a few hours at a small and overcrowded theme park. In the end, we left and spent the money at VivoCity on some nice shoes instead. This experience taught us a hard lesson, spending 366 to return home upon arrival was really an upsetting experience and we doubt we will be returning to USS anytime soon.

It was the worst experience the rides got closed for the Halloween night and it was not at all mentioned on the tickets tht d rides will closed by 5pm....and moreover the transformer ride was closed for some issues for 1hr and v wasted all our money...my guests who visited us from USA were disappointed by dis experience

Nice theme park and PLEASE GET EXPRESS PASS IF YOU VISIT WITH FAMILY AND ON WEEKEND OR HOLIDAY. THE QUEUES ARE INSANE. The theme park food is so expensive but expected lah. I will explain some rides rating below. PLEASE BRING UMBRELLA SG WEATHER UNPREDICTABLE. and bring ur own water becoz got water station,Water 4 sgd leh. Many giftshops around so many souvenirs available. Please don't bring young kids onto rollercoaster rides like transformers or mummy they keep crying summore its a literal drop rollercoaster. I recommend kt grill and goldilocks for food. Some ride need to pay for locker, pls use locker or else mafan need to put belongings somewhere when on a ride. 1. Revenge of the mummy. The queues are long. My entire family was flabbergasted and almost vomited. Vigorous spinning, dropping and speeding up. Do not recommend for young kids and weak people, older kids maybe can lah based on if they are ok with it 2. Transformers 4d movie. It was also rollercoaster with spinning and speeding up, its kinda nice but queue is long 3. Seasame street spaghetti space chase. Great for seniors and younger children but no thrill at all it's so slow 4. Raptor rapids. My favourite ride so far. Guy at entrance was funny. The ride itself was exciting and there was a drop at the end. Others clothes were all soaked but only my converse was drenched. I thought the trex would spray water at us 5. Trolls hug time jubilee. Relaxing and fun for young families with bubbles and confetti. 6. Waterworld show. It was quite funny and exciting but not rlly for young kids becoz got gunfire, fireworks, fire and explosions. Don't sit at blue seats because you WILL get wet. The show itself 20 minutes long.

Some staff rush you with the picture taking sessions (Minions) even though we paid to experience that in Universal studios and waited just like everyone else in the long queue under the heat. Some others are not even good at taking the photos (Transformers). If you won't let someone else in our group take our photos, be at least a better photographer. The rides were good because there were little to none waiting times, but they closed early today because of a bit of rain, so be wary of that because then it won't be worth it otherwise. The shows are okay. Best thing about the park is probably the use of 3D because they were really good quality and the buildings for picture taking.
The ambiance is good, but the attractions are average

Timing was not good on our part b/c of weather (rain and lightning). Couple nearby lightning strikes put a real damper (literally and figuratively) as all the outside rides shutdown for safety. The indoor rides are dated, and overall look of the place needs upgrading. Staff and operators were friendly and helpful, but the place needs a face lift. Disney needn't worry...

Maybe you shouldn't come here in the summer, it's very crowded and I don't like queuing for too long to play a certain game. When taking photos of the iconic globe, you'll have to watch the time and take photos in a deserted corner. There's carnival ice cream. ngonnwill come back someday to experience it more fully

I had an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! The parks themed zones, thrilling rides, and live shows make it a truly magical experience. Unfortunately, some rides were closed due to rain, but the staff handled it well and kept us informed. Despite the weather, there was still so much to enjoy. Id definitely recommend visiting, rain or shineUniversal Studios Singapore is a must for anyone looking for a day filled with fun and excitement!
Fantastic day out! Park was half empty on a Sunday, got on all the rides straight away far far away is amazing, felt like you were in the shrek 2 movie lockers to rent could be cheaper though...

I completed all the rides in 3 hours. Transformers, mummy and Battlestar galactica rides are really great. I will recommend the lunch time also because most of people go for lunch so you will get lesser queues. Also recommend to carry raincoat for jurassic park ride
This place is great! Lots of merchandise from a variety of shows and movies. Went on the transformers ride and it was great. Lots of attractions and rides.
Had loads of fun. The best way is to get there early and complete all the fun rides because once the crowd comes in, you'll need to wait for 30-40 mins even on weekdays.

Don't go to Universal Studios Singapore on holidays if you don't want to be miserable. Each ride has to wait more than 1 hour. The waiting time displayed on the information board is not accurate. The toilets are not clean because there are no cleaning staff on duty to guard against the influx of visitors. If the waiting time is so long and the queue is so long, it would be better for USS to improve by providing attractions in the queue or thinking about how to provide entertainment for waiting visitors. Very bad and unpleasant experience.

The worst experience of my life. The place is so crowded with visitors that you can't even walk here. Ticket 85 dollars and express pass 140 dollars. Queue 3 hours for 1 attraction and with express pass it is only 1 hour! Queues for food and drink minimum 30 minutes and maximum 3 hours. I don't recommend anyone to go here. It's a money factory for the park owners and people come last here. There is nowhere to sit. People are sitting on the street and on the steps. People are stupid sheep.

Very worst... We almost stood in a queue for 3 hours for a one ride inspite of us booking in advance. Not worth the spend and wait long for single entertainment.. should have organised much much better.

Worst experience ever. Long queues 60 mins for fews minutes ride. and most rides not even working. Overcrowded, overpriced and its just money making now, no customer satisfaction considered. Will definitely never visit.
Horrible wait times and crowd management, not worth the money... There are way better things in Singapore than Universal studio. It is just overhyped , just could do 4-5 rides in whole day

This is really good place to explore, but guys as per price you might not cover more than 3 rides. In weekdays the waiting time is more than 1hr . To explore all the attraction u need to come 3 times. Food is very limited. All locker are paid system, some buffer time is there but due to waiting time it will surpass.

Universal Studios Singapore offers a smooth experience with inexpensive traffic to the park and very easy entry, often with little to no wait times. The Fast Pass is highly recommended, as it typically saves around an hour per ride queue. However, a frustrating policy prevents re-entry to the park after leaving, which can be tough on families whove spent significant amounts on tickets and might need a break at their hotel. While the rides are fun, the park lacks variety compared to other Universal destinations. Interesting fact: this is the only Universal park not owned by Universal Studios, making it unique in its operation.
