If youre visiting Singapore specifically for Universal, you may want to consider other Universal locations instead.

Everything was fine but it is very difficult for older people to get around since it is huge. The authorities should consider buggy service or some sort of transportation service to go from point A to B
It is relatively small. Liked the Egypt themed area but not many rides and food queues are huge Can be completed in half a day Lake fireworks were underwhelming
It was very fun, but when I went on holiday, there were a lot of people and I had to wait to play the attractions. There is a luggage locker service. Very convenient and safe

I visited USS recently and noticed that the crowd was significantly smaller compared to previous visits, which made it much easier to get on the rides. This was definitely a positive as we didnt have to spend too much time waiting. The Transformers and Mummy ride remains my absolute favorite its always a thrilling experience! Overall, its a great place to spend some time and enjoy the variety of themed areas, which add to the fun and atmosphere.
Great time with family. Great staff and fun rides. Food is expensive as expected. Long wait times

Dear Universal Studios Singapore Team, Thank you for the memorable experience. My children had an amazing time! However, I noticed several issues: Guests jumping queues by climbing under barriers from the regular line to the Express Lane. People cutting queues shamelessly in the Single Rider line. Multiple instances of queue jumping at food store at Ancient Egypts to reach the cashier. Hope you can make some improvement to nsure a fair experience for all visitors. Thank you

Such a wonderful day here at Universal Studios. There a many many rides. Be warned, do not compare Universal Studios to Dinseyland - they are both amazing in their own ways. Universal studios have some great rides! Prices are very fair!

I really liked it. Best amusement park I've ever been to. Even if there are not too many extreme slides. But there are quite a lot of interactive attractions, complete immersion. Topchik. The price is quite reasonable for such a number of attractions. You can ride without limits all day. There are few queues at the beginning of the opening and at the end. In the middle of the day you can stand in line for about an hour. I recommend visiting

Universal Studios in the world is the worst in Singapore. We had to wait in line for a long time. When we complained about technical issues, the rides were stopped without any compensation at all. If consumers are fools, the Genting Group will be delisted sooner or later. garbage company

Worst theme park I have been to out of 5. 2 hour queues for rides. Spent 160SPD for 2 normal tickets to ride two rides. Looked at express which was another 160SPD. They are letting far too many people in for the number of rides. Basically a classic Singaporean money making endeavour. 4SPD for a mandatory locker for the rides then charges you again on return due to the queues being so long. AVOID THIS PLACE!
Very very worst experience I ever had. Almost all the rides have technical issues on same day. Very worst maintenance.

I waited for over an hour to get on the rollercoaster. It was my turn and the rollercoaster broke down. I had to go back. I paid 6 for the locker for nothing. I decided to buy an express ticket. I went to Jurassic Park first. I quickly passed without waiting. We sat down and fastened our seat belts and guess what happened. They let us off again because of technical problem and after waiting for a while the problem was fixed. I wanted to get on The Mummy but the staff at the door refused me because they said there was a technical problem again. It is not nice to have so many technical problems in such an expensive place.
Terrible queues, it is unacceptable that for 83 you have to wait 1h just for a 2 minutes ride, they should not admit so many people.

Disneyland Singapore was a bit disappointing as many major rides were shut during my visit. However, the shows were still enjoyable and offered some magic. Id recommend checking in advance to ensure the rides youre excited about are operational to make the most of your visit.

A few very good roller coasters (Mummys Revenge, Battlestar Galactica) and a few good ones for people who arent into the big rides. However you *must* factor in the cost of an Express Pass (we bought ours after entering) when coming here, otherwise you will be standing in lines for an hour or so for each ride (and this was on a not particular busy day). Some simple rides would have gone much faster if theyd had more than one employee running the entire thing. Its a reasonably small park and not that many rides, its a good day but not great from a value perspective.

This park looks so tired. It is the smallest out of all the Universals but it also has some unique and familiar rides. I love the Ancient Egypt and Sci-fi sections, the Spaghetti Chase and puss in boots are all awesome. Canopy flyer is way to short and the cue can be up to a 120 minute wait and I miss the Madagascar ride. It would be nice to have a How to train your dragon ride- something like Disneys Soarin. All it has is a Merch shop and a statue of Toothless. There isnt a Harry Potter world or Jaws ride, no Fast and Furious. Basically it needs more rides to ease the wait times. Food is very limited, I usually bring my own as I am Gluten Intolerant. I recently visited the park and went to Mels Diner and I told the server that I would like a burger but cant eat wheat or gluten, I even explained it in Malay and my burger came with a slice of meat with cheese stuck to the paper, sauce everywhere and very little lettuce ( a lettuce wrap would have fixed it), the whole thing was a disaster and messy. New York section- needs a Bagel shop with gluten free bagels on offer......It just needs a major shake up all over.

Good rides although I feel that it's more male targeted. Transformers ride and Mummy ride was a long wait, but otherwise it was pretty fast waiting in my opinion compared to other theme parks e.g disneyland or other universals. LOTS of rollercoasters in this park, if youre looking for a more easy one then I recommend the Shrek 4D adventure.

While Universal Studios Singapore offers a variety of attractions, its maintenance and aesthetic presentation fall short compared to other major theme parks. Visitors have reported frequent ride closures due to maintenance issues, which can significantly impact the overall experience. Express pass is a nice to have but not a must (at least at NY eve during the day)
One of the best place for thrill and fantasy lovers, cylone, transformer are simply. Wow Do not visit in holidays, tickets and express pass will so pricy.

The facilities are great. There are many attractions to enjoy. The queue is depending on the time and the weather. I bought the ice cream near the Cyclon and transformer attraction. The cashier is nice and so helpful patiently. The restaurang inside, they provide a good food with reasonable price.
Most visited theme park, with a great experience. Cyclone, transformers, and the mummy are the best
Amazing rides, little longer wait time when busy but overall good experience

Great experience on New Years Eve. We were worried about going on a holiday but this was a perfect day. They opened the gates 15 minutes early and we hit all of the rides with no more than a 10 minute wait fur any ride. The trolls show was also entertaining and a great way to cool off from the heat. The slice of pizza from the NY pizza place was also good.

On February 24, 2025, at 12:45 PM, we experienced poor customer service from a staff member at the Mummy ride. Unfortunately, the staff member, Shafini, was extremely rude. I would like to request that the management review the CCTV footage at the gate where the incident occurred, if available. Please look into it. We paid for the tickets and we expect kind service. Thank you

The experience was horrendous. Wait times for every single ride was at least 45 mins. This was during off peak season on a weekday. Express pass js such a scam. Charging 120 per person to only get 1 express ride per ride? Which is on top of the already expensive entry ticket. And for this price you would expect the staff to be more than decent. But no, staffs at the rides were showing attitude and yelling at customers as if they own the place. Seriously? Im paying this much to come into a mediocre place thats been not very well maintained and still get treated with rudeness, its just ridiculous.

Cannot compare with universal studio or even Disneyland at Japan. Restaurant crew are rude, may be there too many people queue for food. Games keep broken down and line keep open for fast ticket only. 8 out 10 persons all is for fast ticket only. So be mindful that you are paying to be torture by their staff.

First 2 rides were a waste of time! 1st ride queued for half an hour, then there was a technical issue. They simply gave u a choice to continue waiting INDEFINITELY or leave the queue. There was no service recovery at all. They should give visitors, at least the 1st 20 or so in the queue a food or express voucher. 2nd ride, the same thing happened AGAIN. This time, my group were supposed to be the next batch but there were technical difficulties too. While we were thankful that we weren't left hanging in the air like the batch before us, it was definitely very unpleasant. Again, there was no initiative for service recovery at all! I had to request for express tickets while explaining my situation of having about 2 hrs wasted in between these 2 rides. It's difficult to get the staff attention too. They avoided eye contact, walked away from me. They ALL were deemed bz 'helping' with the situation. Even though 1 or 2 was just looking 'bz'. An art which was frustrating to witness. There was another ride that was slightly delayed with technical issues again, but thankful, it was simply just a short 10min delay. Surprisingly, it wasn't crowded on a CNY Sunday afternoon. Not much tourists. I guessed for local visitors, not many will visit again if they have the same experience like me. Don't think I will visit for the next 5 years.

The staff at the jurassic park wet ride at 17:30 24 Feb 2025are so rude, the rest of the park has really nice staff but this one is so rude its ruining the whole experience. Hes a young Chinese guy no glasses. Please train your staff. I dont care is not a way to respond a customer when they politely ask a questions.

Nicely done. Still far too long queues for moderately good attractions. In addition, there are not that many attractions/the park is very small for the entrance fee. If you come from Europe or the USA, you should have a nice day at the theme parks there (which offer more and better attractions for the same price)!

A fantastic place to enjoy with plenty of rides that take a full day to experience. However, some staff seemed frustrated, and despite my child meeting the requirements for certain rides, they were not allowed on without any clear explanation. There are many options available, and the food is decent but slightly overpriced within the studio.

If you know a lot of theme parks, you won't be particularly overwhelmed. It is more of a smaller park that is arranged around a lake without becoming confusing. The attractions and rides are nice but not great either. The entrance fee is also a bit too expensive for the size. But still, if you have time to queue, this is a pretty nice amusement park to have fun at.
Cool experience. Ok with short queues. They could have had a little more activity with characters from the movies in the streets.

Food was fine.Portions were huge, and apparently costly compared to local food outside USS. Rides were fun, we went during cloudy day, which was good to avoid crowds. There were still long queues, but managed to cover most of the areas. Went out of the USS around 6ish. Disney is much bigger in comparison.
Today i went to the Goldilocks.There was amazing services ive been through.Eventhough got long queue but the services they provide was extremely good and satisfied.
minion land was very fun & it was an amazing experience. me and my friends went to the gift shop at minionland and we were served by a very friendly staff, francis :)

I really love this Theme Park! Ive been there twice every year and always enjoyed it a lot! Although I would recommend only going with an Expresstickets as the Lines for every attraction are very long. The Food is at a medium price! Love it there

It is truly wonderful all those fun rides was a Marvelous idea! I am impressed! It is a place for people to enjoy their time there! I highly encourage you to go there! 5 STARS!The waiting time was definitely worth it.
A successful amusement park includes facilities for all ages. It is recommended to arrive at the opening time of 10:00

Overpriced. Long Wait times (45 - 60 Mins) as inadequate staff on rides, one staff is handling queue, exit, entrance, operation hence turnaround time is low. Very Limited options for Vegetarian or Indian Food.

I'm in Universal Park right now and I'm pretty disillusioned and disappointed. First of all, I'm used to German theme parks. The roller coasters are poorly organized, the route is ridiculous and, with the exception of one, simply not worth the time. Maybe I'm just not the target group. The entire park organization is also deficient in many areas. On a rainy day, the air conditioning runs so cold that it becomes uncomfortable to go indoors in wet clothes. The milkshakes are so cold that you're more likely to chew ice crystals. In terms of price/performance: The food is simply not worth the money. Especially for Singapore conditions. This was the worst meal of my entire trip so far. So, onto the good things: The decoration is really well done. The facades in the streets are lovingly and detailed. The best ride in my opinion was Revenge of the Mummy. Good storytelling. I can completely advise against Puss in Boots. This is an absolute stop and go ride with no flow. The park has real potential that it is wasting in so many places, so it's a real shame. I'm leaving again after about 3 hours. I was really looking, I was really looking forward to the park but all in all it's more of a 3 classic park with a name

We visited Universal Studios on March 14, 2025, with our eight-year-old daughter, hoping to recreate the wonderful experience we had in 2014. Unfortunately, a disappointing incident at the Puss in Boots show at 4:25 PM ruined our day. After watching the show, my daughter, who loves Puss in Boots, was excited to take a photo with the characters. She patiently stood in line, but when it was nearly her turn, a couple skipped ahead of her. As she approached the stage, a staff member unfairly stopped her, claiming she wasnt in the queue, despite her waiting the whole time. He didnt let us explain, acted rudely, and even prevented her from rejoining the queue, saying the photo session was over. This upset my daughter deeply, and it hurt us to see her first Universal Studios experience end with such a bad memory. We feel very disappointed by this rude behavior and hope appropriate action is taken to prevent such incidents in the future. Sharing the photo herewith a shot captured in my phone while we are waiting in the queue

We were excited to visit Universal Studios Singapore last October, but it turned out to be a huge disappointment. The park was overcrowded, and the overall experience felt underwhelming. There was nothing particularly special about it, and it lacked the magic and excitement we expected from a major theme park. To make things worse, the park closes around 7 PM, with no night shows or special eventsjust a dull and abrupt ending to the day. The heat was also unbearable, reaching at least 40C, and there was no air conditioning in indoor areas. Instead of offering a break from the extreme temperatures, the enclosed spaces felt suffocating. Navigating through the packed crowds in these conditions made the visit exhausting rather than enjoyable. Compared to Disneylandwhich weve visited three times and loved every timeUSS doesnt even come close. The lack of proper facilities, entertainment, and overall mediocre experience make it completely overrated and not worth the visit.

The park seems big, with beautiful scenery. But there is a huge BUT. The queues are huge everywhere, and the rides themselves take 2 minutes. You stand in line for 40-60 minutes, 1.5-2 minutes of pleasure. Yes, and this pleasure is dubious. For adults, the attractions are very simple, but for families with children it will be torture - try standing for 40 minutes at each attraction with your child. It's complicated. We stood for 40 minutes on one attraction, and it closed right in front of us! For inexplicable reasons. The other attraction had almost the same thing, but they still opened it. Overall the impression is very bad, especially for the money. The food is tasteless, everything is not budget, the attractions are boring and not extreme (except for one). Terrible, don't recommend!

The waiting time for entertainment items is generally very long, and some are exposed to the sun, which makes people uncomfortable. If you don't buy VIP tickets, the entertainment experience is not proportional to the waiting time. All in all, it was a relatively satisfactory experience.

Went on a Thursday, was medium crowded. 83 for a normal ticket . Waited upto 30-40 minutes on some rides but some ride it was just 5 minutes. Sadly the waterworld is closed for maintenance, which they could've mentioned in their website. Beer is 13 inside, so plan your food & beverages budget accordingly. Was so hot climate, would suggest a cap and glass . Some rides you can keep the loose items in locker for 1 hour for free. Mummy and Cyclone rollercoaster was good. Jurassic park ride you may get slightly wet but not much. You don't have to carry extra cloth for that.

Pros: The park has a low visitor volume, making it a great experience for tourists. Even on weekends, most attractionsexcept for the roller coastersdont require long wait times. Its also easy to take photos without waiting for a good spot. The newly opened Minion Land is a nice addition; though small, its well-designed and adds some freshness to USS. Cons: A large portion of the park is occupied by outdated attractions that are no longer as popular, taking up space and resources. Additionally, some attractions, like WaterWorld, remain closed indefinitelyIve visited multiple times and never seen it open. This space could be used for newer, more appealing attractions. The merchandise selection is uninspired, with inconsistent quality.
A nice location to explore and enjoy with family, but when I go there, I feel a bit unfortunate as the Despicable Me attraction is not open yet.

Been there for the 8th time, this time to check out Minions, but were a little disappointed because it was not a ride, and just 3D simlulator. Everything else are pretty much the same as last times, so no excitement

An Unforgettable Experience at Universal Studios Singapore! My visit to Universal Studios Singapore was absolutely amazing! From thrilling rides to spectacular shows, every moment was filled with excitement and fun. The park is well-organized, clean, and offers a great mix of attractions for all ages. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, ensuring a smooth and enjoyable experience. The attention to detail in the themed zones made me feel like I had stepped into another world! The Transformers and Battlestar Galactica rides were definite highlights, and the live performances added an extra touch of magic to the day. A big thank you to the team at USS for creating such a fantastic and memorable experience. I cant wait to visit again!

If you're here by 10am, the wait isn't long for the rides. The queues build up around midday and the wait can take upto 60 minutes if the ride is popular. If you are happy to join the singles queue, you can get in quicker. A wonderful, fun way to spend the day and a must visit while in Singapore.
Had a great time at Universal Studios. Visited on a weekday so the wait times were on the shorter side. The mummy ride is one if the best here.
Great place for fun and amusement. Would recommend transformers attraction, shrek attraction. They were fun and no stress.
best themepark in asia, clean restroom and many facilities
Disappointing park! Too many technical problems... we're queuing for nothing! Management doesn't work! It's horrible.. thank you goodbye never again

The first mistake is to divide the audience into two. It is also wrong to treat Express customers as first class and treat other customers as if they were "whatever". And everywhere is crowded. Keeping that much time for each ride is absolutely wrong. An artificial waiting queue appears to have been created. And everything is expensive. Tourists should definitely avoid this place.

poor management of ride and arrangement, overworked staff with bad attitude. Especially poor is their locker arrangement which causes confusion by the staff. You need to get allocated a locker from their control screen, then put the things in the locker and close it, for the next person to use it. However, when putting things in the locker, other people may try to change your screen. Even worse, the staff come and cancel the screen, so the original person can't close their locker and need to queue again. Total chaos and nightmare, with bad staff attitude (kept yelling at people to put what sized bags into the locker first). Please note that a lot of the rides need to use lockers as they don't allow bags. Not interested in trying all the rides.

Had a horrible experience after spending that much money. Waiting time in each rides were pretty and high. I am not sure it's our badluck or regular operating way in universal studios. We waited almost 45 min in despicable me and transformers, but in mid of line they cancelled it due to technical issues.. All my waiting vent in vain.. Only if you have priority passes you can finish it in a day..else it's impossible

I spend two days on this Universal Studio. Both day not all of the ride open, some on the full-day maintanaince. Some on the maintainance for few hours. The worst part is that I and my kid stuck in the Canopy Flyer for more than 30 min. (Now, I'm typing while stucking in the ride) *edit: They give us the one-time express as compensation for the delay *edit 2: After that, we go to Shrek 4D adventure. And guess what happen? It delay for more than 30 min again!!! All of this happen on 14 April 2025, around 11am to 1:30pm I WILL NOT COMEBACK HERE AGAIN!

Been here 2 times already, this time i didnt come on holiday season so it wasnt too busy. The wait time was pretty good. My favorite attractions was the movie simulation and transformer. Its very fun and i had a great time with my gf overall. However there were so many people from india, pretty much 50% if the tourist there is from india. I dont have a problem with that, but a lot of them have really terrible body odor, so maybe it would be great to install some fragrance and air con during in the attraction line area. Its can be very unpleasant to smell during the wait
The experience was okay. Nothing too special but also nothing too bad about it. Everything was clean, the queueign system was smooth. But when compared to USJ, it's just okay.

Universal Studios Singapore has a good mix of attractions, but the long lines can take away from the experience. If you dont get an Express Pass, expect to wait quite a bit. The park layout is easy to follow, though some rides feel dated. Food is average and expensive, so planning ahead helps.

It was ok, easy to get around, lots of food and shopping options. We visited one week before Easter during school Holidays and before going I debated the express tickets over and over, in the end we didnt take them and I was super happy with my choice, i dont think the express tickets would be worth the cost. It was my first visit to a Universal studios and to be honest I left pretty uninspired to visit any others in the future

Universal Studios Singapore has some truly enjoyable attractions, and I did have fun thanks to the Express Pass I purchased. But its difficult to overlook the lack of organization and indifference shown by staff during our visit, especially at the very start of the day. Upon arriving at the park entrance, I witnessed a frustrating incident in the Express lane: a few individuals were standing in line without tickets, claiming their friends were buying them. Staff allowed them to hold a place, and soon after, a large groupmore than ten people cut the line to join them. Only a few individuals were initially holding the spot, and none of them had even purchased entry tickets when they started queuing. When the rest of the group arrived, a staff member briefly told them to go to the back of the line, but then stood by and allowed them to stay once they pushed their way in. To make matters worse, I was asked to move aside to make room for them, even though I had followed all the rules and had a valid Express Pass. The handling was unfair, inconsistent, and felt like the louder you were, the more you got away with. I later sent a formal complaint via email, only to receive a generic and dismissive response that read more like a script than a genuine reply. The tone was cold and impersonal, showing no willingness to acknowledge the staffs mishandling or take any meaningful responsibility. It felt less like an effort to resolve a guest concern, and more like a gesture to defend their staff while avoiding accountability. I want to be fair: I did enjoy many parts of the park and appreciated the efficiency of the Express system itself. But much of the experience was tainted by what felt like an unwelcoming, mechanical attitude among staff. Id estimate that at least 60% of the employees I encountered looked visibly unhappy or disengaged with their work. The park has potential to deliver a great experience, but they seriously need to address crowd control, staff morale, and basic guest fairness. Without the Express Pass, this wouldve been a very different and likely much more frustrating day.

Staff were rude and unhelpful throughout our visit. The queuing area was a complete messsomeone had removed a barrier, and none of the staff noticed. As a result, many people were cutting into the express line from the standard line without any control or intervention. Instead of fixing the issue, staff repeatedly asked us (six times, by six different people) in a very rude tone: If you dont have an express pass, leave this queue and go to the standard line. It felt like we were being blamed for their own lack of crowd control. To make things worse, one staff member even falsely accused me of removing the barrier myselfan extremely unfair and unacceptable allegation. I was shocked and offended by the accusation, especially as I had done nothing wrong and was just following the crowd like everyone else. This is not how guests should be treated. Extremely disappointing and a complete waste of time. Universal, is this really how you train your staff?
Terrible queues. Some attractions are not included in the ticket price. Very bad experience

Universal Studios Singapore SHAMEFUL SCAM. Total Waste of Time, Money & Energy. Let me begin with the reality this place is overhyped, overpriced, overcrowded, and completely mismanaged. 3 HOURS of standing in line for a single ride, and the same story repeated at every attraction. Queues are deliberately hidden behind walls and turns to deceive visitors. From the outside, they look short but once youre in, youre stuck in a never-ending maze. Most rides had huge wait times, and some were just CLOSED without any discounts in tickets or compensation. There are ZERO places to sit along the queues not a bench in sight. For families, kids, or elderly people, its pure torture. Staff were clueless, communication was nonexistent, and there was no system to manage the crowd. The place was in absolute chaos. We paid 208 SGD (12,800 INR) for entry (2 adults 1 child). Thinking Express Pass would help, we paid another 380 SGD (23,400 INR) for that. Total: 588 SGD (36,200 INR). And what did we get? Just 2 or 3 rides after hours of queuing, even with the Express Pass which turned out to be a complete SCAM. Express lines were also painfully slow and overcrowded. It was a joke. This is not entertainment its a money-sucking machine targeting tourists with big promises and delivering nothing but exhaustion and frustration. Universal Studios Singapore should be ashamed. This is fraud in the name of fun, and they have no business charging premium prices for such a pathetic, mismanaged experience. Strong warning: AVOID this place. There are far better ways to spend your money in Singapore. Dont fall for the hype like we did.

My experience was on 17 May 2025 (Saturday) Some Issues I Faced: -The roller coaster seat smelled like sweat and it honestly made me feel like throwing up. I was one of the earliest people to get on too. -The ticket price was still full price even though some major attractions like Transformers: The Ride and Waterworld were closed. No discounts offered. -Waiting time not accurate. -Some rides, like Canopy Flyer, suddenly broke down and we had to wait ages for them to fix it. The staff didnt take the initiative to explain things. -The park closed early at 7PM. The lights had just turned on and everything looked so nice for photos, but we had to leave. No light show, water show, or fireworks either. -The Q system was ok la.. but there were no chairs. Standing for so long was exhausting! -The restaurant was too crowded and the food was just ok. Tips if Youre Planning to Go: -Get there before 8.30AM to avoid the crowds and long queues. -Bring your own water bottlethere are refill stations. -Check the Sentosa website for maintenance updates, opening hours and etc. -Hit the popular rides first, and then pick ones with shorter waiting time as you go. -Always check the weather forecast beforehand, even if its not 100% accurate. -Do some research and read reviews or other peoples experiences before buying tickets and planning your day. -Go on weekdays and avoid peak months and public holidays. Overall: This is my first theme park, but I think it might be average compared to others. Thankfully, I didnt run into any really serious problems like some others did. Despite the issues, I still managed to enjoy myself but i'm still sad that Transformers: The Ride was closed that day (i can't changed my fixed date ticket) y

Just to clear things up, this park is not owned or operated by Universal Parks & Entertainment. Instead, the park uses Universal licenses and has a mix of familiar and unfamiliar attractions based on Universal franchises. I mention this because the park looks very much like the other Universal Studios parks but feels a little cheaper. Even identical attractions had corners cut so the magic isn't quite the same. If you are familiar with the typical Universal experience, set your expectations accordingly. That said, the park is fun. Is it the best Universal Studios themed park? Not even close but that doesn't mean it is horrible. The most unique standout attraction is Battlestar Galactica. This is a pair of roller coasters, one a calmer sit down coaster and the other a thrilling inverted coaster, that intertwine with each other. It feels like a cross between Dueling Dragons and Incredible Hulk. I wouldn't prioritize Universal Studios Singapore as a top thing to do in Singapore but if you are looking for something to do, it is worth a visit.

A Magical First Visit to Universal Studios Singapore Fun, Thrilling, but Be Prepared for Long Waits! I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore for the first time, and overall, it was a fantastic experience filled with excitement, nostalgia, and adventure. As someone who has never been to a Universal Studios park before, I was genuinely impressed by the vibrant atmosphere, the immersive themes, and the sheer scale of the park. It truly brings your favorite movies and characters to life in a way that feels magical. Theming & Attractions: From the moment you step in, the level of detail in the parks design is jaw-dropping. Each zoneHollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away, and Madagascaris beautifully themed and transports you into a completely different world. I particularly enjoyed the Revenge of the Mummy ride in Ancient Egypt and the Transformers 3D ride in Sci-Fi Cityboth were thrilling and well worth the hype! Shows & Entertainment: The live shows and street performances were also a pleasant surprise. The WaterWorld stunt show was incredibly well-executed, with amazing effects and high energy. There were also plenty of characters walking around for photos, which added to the experience. Food & Facilities: Food options were decent, with a variety of choices catering to different tastes, though a bit on the pricier side (as expected in theme parks). The park was clean, well-maintained, and had plenty of rest areas, shaded spots, and clean restrooms. Crowds & Waiting Times: This was the only downside to my visit. While I anticipated some waiting, I was a bit overwhelmed by the length of the queuesespecially for the popular rides. Even with a weekday visit, some lines were over an hour long, which really ate into the time we had to explore everything. I highly recommend arriving early and possibly investing in the Universal Express Pass if your budget allowsit makes a big difference. Staff & Service: The staff throughout the park were friendly, helpful, and very professional. They did a great job managing the crowds and keeping the lines moving as efficiently as possible. Final Thoughts: Universal Studios Singapore is absolutely worth a visit, especially if youre a fan of movie-themed attractions. Its a great mix of thrill rides, shows, and immersive environments that appeal to all ages. Just go in preparedwear comfortable shoes, stay hydrated, and if youre not a fan of long waits, consider the Express Pass. Despite the lines, the overall experience was memorable and fun, and I would definitely come back again!

A great time! I highly recommend arriving 30 to 45 minutes early to make the most of the day. Remember to bring a small bag with water, a cap, sunscreen and light clothing, especially if it is hot. As soon as it opens, head to the right of the park to do the three best attractions without waiting: Transformers, Revenge of the Mummy (the Egyptian roller coaster, incredible!) and the Roller Coaster park, with the two space roller coasters (battlestar galactica Human & Cylon). These are the most intense and definitely worth the detour! The park is very large, well decorated and super pleasant to visit. The atmosphere is immersive, the decorations are neat, and there is fun for all ages. From midday onwards, the queues start to fill up, so it's best to get the big hits first. A great experience, well organized, fun and exotic. I highly recommend!

Amazing place. I came here with my nephews and they really enjoyed the time here. Staffs are so nice and friendly to kids. Highly recommended for parents living in Asia. Location: you can take MRT to Harbour Front station and then take Sentosa Gateway to Universal Studio gate (Google Map, as the time I wrote this review, is not really accurate for the route from downtown) Environment: all facilities are tailored to serve kids well so nothing to worry about Price: a ticket for an adult 76 SGD, a pack of popcorn 9 SGD, a cup of smoothie 6 SGD, not cheap but still ok during summer time. The ticket price is arbitrary depending on seasons. Service: Service and user experience are all impressive. The only problem is you need to line up for more than 1-2 hours for each attraction unless you buy Universal Express. Best practice for new comers( me have visited in California, Osaka and Singapore) 1. Sandals, shorts, and t-shirts are best dress code for enjoying universal studio. Singapore is hot in most of time so the dress code will help. (And sandals will keep your feet dry after playing Jurassic World boat) 2. Buy tickets online to save your time from hours line-up. For example, klook. 3. Go hot attractions first when getting in. They will take most of your time. Googling some suggestions from internet beforehand will help - my suggestion is Transformer - Jurassic World - Water World (fixed schedule) - and the rest. 4. During summer time, even weekdays are full of people. However, its still better than coming here in weekends. This place is awesome and sincerely hope everyone have a good time here!

The queue might seem longer but it moves fast. Take a day or two to cover everything! They have amazing stalls for food as well. Must visit with your families. I recommend wearing comfortable clothing and shoes since you would be walking all day. Located at Resort World Sentosa, Universal Studios Singapore hosts 24 rides, plenty of entertaining shows, and seven different thematic zones. There are also character meet-up schedules when you can take photos with your lovable characters. The Hollywood Dreams Parade is a must-see when at the park. You'll also find a variety of dining options within the park from snacks, to local delicacies, as well as international cuisines. Birthday parties can be organized at the park, as well as wedding photography. The park offers fun for the entire family, whether young or elderly.

Singapore's very own Universal Studios, situated at the heart of Sentosa Island is an amazing place to bring your family for a day of fun filled activities. USS is a massive theme park that has rides of all speed and sizes, shows for the kids that even adults can enjoy, wide array of F&B outlets and plenty of souvenir shops. Word of advice is to avoid the weekends! Waiting time for rides can stretch out to more than an hour unless you squeeze that pocket to buy Express Passes to get into the express line which gets you onto the rides 50% faster! And bring some tanning lotion and a hat coz it can get pretty hot in the day. Much sought after rides would be Revenge of the Mummy, and the most exciting roller coaster rides, Human Cyclone and Battlestar Galactica which runs at a speed of 82km/h at a height of 40m.... Turns any stomach inside out. So have a light one before you take these monsters for a ride. Highly recommended to visit if you are a tourist.

The whole family arrived before the opening at 9 o'clock on Monday and decided to take a family photo at the Universal Studios symbol and wait to enter. While I was waiting, a Universal employee invited me to the first family customer celebration event. As the first family customer that day, we started the gate opening with a comment from our family. It was a very special experience for the children as they received a free family photo and a ticket for three express rides as a gift. Because it was a weekday, there weren't many people, and you could experience most things you wanted after waiting for about 10 minutes. I don't really recommend the Universal restaurant. The more you go out, the better it is to eat out. It's cheaper and tastes better. Since it closed at 6 o'clock, I tried out most of the rides. Compared to the United States and Japan, there are not many people, so you can enjoy it much more leisurely.

Must visit with kids 4 years and above so that they can enjoy along with u.. Pram is a must as the place is huge n iys very difficult fr kids to walk that long.. Awsome and best place so far visited in Singapore.. Carry umbrella as it gets very hot and something to fan the kids whn in line as u can get really sweaty

We loved spending time here on our holiday to singapore. There was so much to see and do that 3 days was still not enough for us to do it all. We remted strollers for the kids, took photos with our favourite characters and watched many live shows as well. Donkey from shrek was a highlight for the kids as he was interactive. we did get to repeat some of the activities we had done before. We were lucky to buy a 6 month pass online that seamed to be a cheaper option than purchasing entry tickets for 4 for 3 seperate days. The kids had such an amazing time and we the adults enjoyed ourselves so much. Long queues but they move fast. Must visit when im singapore
Amazing place for the kids and elders too... Do not miss going to this place if you are in Singapore. Absolutely an awesome tourist destination.
Best places i've ever go with my family

A phenomenal place for families visiting Singapore on vacation. Takes an entire day. If short on time would recommend buying the express pass along with the entrance ticket since most of the rides can have long queues especially on weekends.
Must spend with kids
There are too many people, compared to those in China. You can watch it with your children, but many of the programs are not new.

If you go during Chinese New Year, it will be very crowded, so go on a normal day. Also, be careful when opening and closing your locker, and when locking, choose a password system rather than fingerprint authentication. In case of trouble, ask for help from the staff wearing orange polo shirts.
Family outing.
Good variety of rides. Mainly targeted at children. Queues shorter later in the afternoon
Fun for the family but not for younger kids cause most rides have height restriction.

Good for families and couples. If you are going in weekend or holiday, it is better to buy express ticket to skip queues or it would take hours for you to be able to play a few attractions. Otherwise great place to spend time with your family.

Good place to be at with family and kids. My advise would be to take an Express Pass otherwise you would end up being in the queues more than being on the rides. Usually the wait time is around 1hr for some popular rides. There's a separate queue for Express Pass holders and Single Riders
There are no scary attractions, but it's good to hang out innocently. As the afternoon approaches, the line gets shorter as people leave, so taking the express is meaningless.
The best part of Singapore's universal studio is according to me are the rides cylon,tranformers.overall a superb place to enjoy with family n friends.kids will love this place for sure.

Universal Studios is an amazing Getaway for families and friends or even solo. We savored each and every ride, Transformers ride was the best. And even brought many memories to carry with us. Even after months of visiting there the moment is still paused in our hearts. Get there early to get away with all the rides. One whole day should be consecrated to the place. A place must to visit on your Singapore Trip.

If you have come to Singapore for holidays than this place is must. You should spare one full day for universal studio. You will find lots of rides and rides for every age group. This is a perfect place for family holiday. You have to plan days of your visit as this place is very very crowdy especially on weekends. I will suggest from Tuesday to Thursday as there are less crowds on these days. They do not allow any outside foods so be careful. Please purchase ticket online or from travel agent as it will save time in waiting lines. Make sure you are there on gate open time. Make sure to pick map of universal studio as it will help you in finding rides. Lots of meal options are also available though prices are on higher side. But it is fun place. Enjoy
One of the best place to have fun with family especially children. All rides are very very adventurous. Liked the place very much.
Amazing world. Expensive entry ticket but worthy to go especially with kids. Ideal place for family activities.
Once you go in just experience everything you see. But please avoid 'treasure Hunt' ride as it is a waste of time. That is suitable only for children bellow 3-4 years
Must try experience in Singapore. However, Infants might not be suitable for most of the activities here.
Many choices suitable for all ages. But it's better to set a goal first where you want to go!!!
Many rides for children and adults too !!

It was small but fun I like that there are simple descriptions of rides on the map. When you go out to eat, be sure to get a stamp. You can go out once. It's a bit quiet around 3-4 o'clock, so I think that's fine as long as you don't go for the opening time. It's hot, so bringing a portable fan can be useful.

Though it is considered the smallest Universal Studios in the world, it does provide an interesting experience such as the thrilling Space Galatica and The Mummy Roller Coasters. For a more family friendly rides, do consider the Madagascar Boat Adventure or Puss in Boots Coaster ride. I would gladly skip the Donkey Show, as it lacks the interactive elements as well as engagement to the crowd.
Good place to bring kids. Still upgrading...
Good for young crowd..
Fun for the young! Need at least half a day if not more here!

Best place in Singapore. All types of rides..many things for kids also..best arrangements for all rides..water taps are available... washroom were clean. all types of food available.great experience....
Perfect place for your kids adventure. Great food choices and has a world class amenities. If you are at Singapore, this place is a must visit for the young and young at heart

For anyone staying in Singapore with children it is simply a must to go there, as an adult I was there without children and I enjoyed it very much so I'm sure children will really fall in love with the place.

Enjoyed a lot...first experience in any theme park with kids aged 7 & 4. They enjoyed to the fullest and my family made memories for life. Lots to do and enjoy for all ages. Value for money. Queues can be longer and wait can get tiring, also dress according to weather, Singapore usually have humid weather.
Absolutely Amazing!!!! We went on a week day so didn't find the queues bad at all. My 3 year old enjoyed it, we took a stroller with and they have place to leave the strollers.
But not for kids below 10
Want to bring children?
there are lots of acts for children especially for fans of Disney.
A places for kids, not very exciting.....very fabricated
Park for young people! Those with weak health should visit, there are many thrilling games!
rides was good fpor family but need more food options inside.
Nice place for family outing especially for kids and teenagers. One day is not enough to cover all places due to long Q

It was fun as we had our 1.5 year old with us and it had lots that appealed to her i.e. sesame street characters etc. If you've been to the Universal in LA you might find this one a little bit disappointing as it's much smaller and less rides etc
For Koreans, it may vary depending on the individual, but if you look at the type and number of rides, Everland is smaller.. (Each)
Nice if you are taking rides. Otherwise, only fireworks is good.
Best place in Singapore for children and all.
If you are going to Singapore and looking for adventure I will recommend to visit Universal Studios. The rides are grt. I enjoyed the water world show. Must visit for family with kids

This attraction is definitely a must-visit attraction in Singapore. The amusement facilities and all the shows inside are very suitable for families to travel together. In particular, the Transformer 3D adventure is definitely one of the must-see amusement facilities. The show at Water World is a must-see and wonderful performance. However, many of the amusement facilities here have height restrictions, which is more suitable for children over 125 cm. The time of each show can also be arranged well, and every show can be participated. It is recommended that everyone check the map and the time of each show before coming. With some arrangement, you can have a lot of fun and the children will have a great time. Many facilities are not available in our country, Taiwan. The little ones will have a great and unforgettable memory!

Place to dream and remember incredible UNIVERSAL moments. You become a child again, and you discover that magical side that they offer you to know, touch, taste, laugh. Incredible facilities, a luxury of technology, aesthetics, SECURITY, quality in the attractions and cuisine. Always friendly staff, and a store to buy everything.
Awesome place.. specially with kids
A place to spend time together
a tips from me. if you wanna ride bumblebee, should do it on the evening because there are not that many people.
Place for entertainment. There have for Child & Baby also
It's good to go and play with kids, but if you go with adults, it's smaller than expected and the rides can be a bit boring.

Family friendly. Fun attractions. However, the rides need an update especially with newer and hit franchises. Minions should have a ride of their own (not just gift shops)! A reason of its own to visit Singapore.
Most like is The Mummy Rider & 3D Transformers Rider. Can spend all day time with my family member. But the food inside is a bit expensive.
Some rides mind boggling but rest average. Good for kids below 15
Rides are good ,but vegetarian food options is very limited.i wish a few more options would help

A must go place of you are in Singapore, superb experience. The rides are all great and few are not for faint hearted especially the Battlestar Galactica having a dual roller coaster. It's fun for kids and adults both. I would also recommend to take photo packages wherein you can get yourself clicked at every location and can collect them online, so you don't need to carry a camera. Be free and relaxed and enjoy full day of being a kid again.

A wonderful place to go to for a vacation/ holiday! Lots of different things to do, my favourite are the roller coasters! There are many restaurants, food stalls too, if you get hungry, feel free to grab a delicious snack at the stalls or have a wonderful meal at the restaurants! There are tons of rises just for kids, and I guarantee they will love it!

A great place to hang out with the kids. A well maintained place with sufficient variety of food choices within the campus. Do not miss the transformers 3D ride. Totally worth the wait in line. The kids have a wide variety of rides. A must visit for anyone visiting Singapore with family

One of the best Amusement Parks in all of Singapore if not the world. The best rides and attractions for younger kinds are: Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase , Elmo's TV Time[SHOW ACCORDING TO TINES] Meet the Minions Madagascar : A Crate Ride King Julian's beach party-go-round Madagascar Boogie![SHOW] Happily Ever After [Character Meet And Greet (from 12:40 AM to 08:30 PM) Magic Potion Spin [Inside "Fairy Godmother's Potion Shop" (opens at 11:00 AM)] SHREK 4D Adventure Donkey Live [Show acc.to times] The Dance For the Magical Beans [Show acc. to times] Sesame Street Meet and Greet The Accelerator Autobots Roll Out! [Transformers Meet and Greet] Treasure Hunters Meet the Egyptian Royalty [meet and greet] Dino-soarin' Hatched! Ft. Dr. Rodney Look Out! The Velociraptors Have Escaped in Jurassic Park! While the adults and older kids may enjoy: Enchanted Airways [Rollercoaster] Transformers Ultimate 3D Battle [3D/4D ride] BattleStar Galactica :HUMAN -[seated] BattleStar Galactica :CYCLON-[hung] Revenge of the Mummy -[SUPER FAST ROLLERCOASTER(not recommended for children , expecting mothers , old people)] Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure Canopy Flyer THANK YOU READING :-D

Oh my God, what a beautiful place, an excellent experience. There are so many options for toys and interactions, adults might get tired soon, but there are plenty of options for children and teenagers to let off steam. Be careful because the food is expensive, it's worth bringing a snack. There are also water toys, so if you can bring a bathing suit and towel, it's worth it too. BUY YOUR TICKET IN ADVANCE!
If you have kids or one yourself, you should go
Nice for families with small kids. I think its better to go there after 16:00, then alout of people left, and the line its quickly.

It's a place where you need to spend a good part of the day to cover all the attractions. There is something for all ages. Starting early, as soon as the gates open is a good way to begin.The crowd at night is less though. A map of the park, is a necessity, to plan out your trip. The three best rides are the cylon, mummy and transformer rides, which attract the longest queues. Some of the rides need you to be empty handed and with empty pockets. Locker facilities are available at various point, in case you don't have someone waiting outside. During my last visit, frequent failures of rides occurred, some where people had to wait in the rides to be retrieved..... Probably a one off. Nothing new added over the years. Good for one visit, nothing to come back to except the cylon rides. Good idea to take an express pass to reduce the wait time in queues. The express passes are available at most shops within Universal studios, but a few attractions are excluded from the express pass. Photographs are available at each ride and cost about 20SGD a piece. The restaurants are crowded at meal times, so it's a good idea to eat a little early if you want to avoid a long wait to order and get seating. The small food and beverage stalls don't accept cards but only cash. It can get dehydrating during the day, especially in summer, so these are usually the stalls where you can top up. The parades are entertaining for young children and those young at heart, so you can time your rides and visit based on the parade timings.
Although it is small, it was nice that the travel route was short because the weather was hot. There are more attractions than just thrilling rides.
Singapore's main tourist destination for children and teenagers.

Always going to have a good time at Universal, although it doesn't have the same charm as the American counterparts. Also seems to be considerably smaller so a few hours is all you need on a normal day.

Universal Studios Singapore is one of the best places for family trip on Holidays or weekend. Off-peak season is during Monday to Thursday while on-peak season is during Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, Public Holidays and June and December. USS is definitely fun for the whole family and thrill-seekers. This theme park is built for all ages. The little kids will be fascinated and delighted to see alot of famous movie characters. They have alot of shows for kids and rides for them. Adults can try doing the roller coaster Battlestar Gallactica, indoor coaster Revenge of the Mummy, Jurassic Park Ride on the boat and Transformer 3D Ride. Restrooms, coffeeshops, food shops and resort's staffs are everywhere. This is a must visit resort in Singapore. Come hurry and enjoy the show and ride. To top all of these, the resort is actually clean! That is what Singapore is known for right? Cleanliness. Entrance fee - 75SGD if you buy here at USS. But dont forget to check Klook for lower prices and discounts. When entering Sentosa, dont buy tickets first because you can use your EZ link card. Thats my mistake. So dont be like me. Haha. per Meal budgets should be 10Sgd above. Dont forget to bring coins. They also offer single ride options if you dont mind riding solo or separated from your group. This is actually works fine for me because the queue here is alot shorter than the regular or group one. If you dont want queueing for an hour or two, you can check express tickets online, maybe 60Sgd. Im not sure about this but you can check online.

Awesome place to visit with family...transformer and mummy is the best ride to enjoy with family. Don't miss it and go as soon as you get into universal studio because this is the one you can't miss. Also make sure you take express pass regardless when you go. It's worth spending on express if you are visiting from other county and not visiting so often.
Awesome place. Carry a stroller if you have baby less than 4 years. Exploring full, might take time.

Great place to have the family time.. well maintained.. Lot of rides.. simple Medagasker to Sci-fi roller coaster..Lots of enjoyment.. Amazing Transformers Ride.. All kinds of food is available.. Amenities are good.. Must visit place in Singapore

Every time I go to Singapore, my kids definitely come to Universal Studio. The rides are complete. If you want to go there, it's best not to go there on weekends or during holidays. Because the queue is very long and long.

It is an amusement park that is smaller than Universal Studios in Japan and is not suitable for adults. I would like to discourage you from purchasing an express ticket here. Basically, I don't know much about Transformers and its name, but if you ride a roller coaster and then ride a Mummy, I think most adults will enjoy it. If you are traveling with children, there are quite a few rides that children will enjoy, so I think it is not a bad idea to purchase an express ticket only if you are traveling with children. If you have belongings or bags, you can leave them in the lockers for the roller coaster and Mummy and use the attractions. It is free for about 2 hours at a time and you have to pay after that, so if you are visiting with a group of people, you can keep using the lockers for free if you take turns using them, so make good use of them. Uniquely, in the case of Singapore Universal, you can only leave and re-enter once, so if you need to eat, we recommend going out to Vivo City, eating there, and then coming back. The food at Universal was truly terrible. It's not that wide, so even if you move around a lot, you can enjoy it in half a day. One thing that was disappointing was that there were a few times when we had to wait to ride the attractions, but many people from India would cut in line with people of all ages, so it was very frowned upon.

Don't bring your child if under 6 years old, waste of money. most of the rides contain heights, dark rooms, jump scare, 4 & 5 D cinema. if you want those kind of excitements, it's very very very entertaining.
Kids don't tire of this place.
Good,but take time and decide which rides you want to take. Not all rides are good, though kids might enjoy them.
Suitable for traveling with young children. Rides are so so. It's not very spacious so I looked around 3 times. the weather is too humid
Good theme park but Need more new ride n attraction for the younger kids.

Good rides ,definetlty not on the scale of the u.s ,good starter for first timers or young kids.the heat and humidity is full on and most rides are 1hr waits so a express past is a must .check operating times and weather prior.
Lots of public convenient & facilities
A must visit place, if you are in Singapore. A heaven for kids. Highly recommended.
It is an amazing place for family fun. Must go with friends and family One of the best attractions in singapore
Universal Studios one of the best place in Singapore, because lots of adventures and kids entertainment. This place is great for everyone.
Best day out for families
Our family had a great time. Our 3-year-old son loved it. The eTickets that we booked online helped us enter the park straightforward and quickly.
Very crowded and not very suitable for young children
More adults than children on toddler rides so the young ones have to wait too long. Not enough staff to keep things moving; it is pedestrian.
Unexpectedly, kindergarten children are also suitable to come
Wonderfull entertainment sites for kids and adult

For those who like amusement parks, it is a good option. There are games and attractions for children, family and extremes. There are locks to leave bags free for a short time and others that are paid. Many restaurants, character shops, outdoor performances and much more.
It is nice to enjoy holiday with people. But after looked around all, i said to my friends, is it all? .. i mean quite small better than i thought haha. But transfomer is really nice

Because the weather was a bit hot... it was a pity that I couldn't come back to see everything... I actually liked it more... when I grow up, I plan on walking around alone... Since the kids are young... I quickly returned to the resort... but it was Universal, which I found a lot of regrets... Next time, I should come alone. Maybe I should come with my friends haha.
A little too crowded and pricey. Fun for the kids stressful for parents. Other than that place is nice

Quite small compared to others country Universal Studios. But, we managed to take some of the major ride which is The Mummy, Jurassic Park Boat ride, Transformers car ride which is the best in my opinion, and Two roller coaster. Steven Spielbergs film Gallery is quite nice though. Outside food are strictly not allow. Do buy tickets in KLOOK website for cheaper tickets compare to their counter and to avoid queue. Recommend to take The Mummy ride around 7pm as there is only 15 minutes waiting compare to 3hours of waiting at 2pm which is crazy.
Another wonderland of Singapore. Best place for kids and family

Wonderful, interesting and nice place to visit as a family outing. The place is very well kept, clean. The roller coasters ride are interesting i wanted to ride but I have to miss it.Wish I was 20 years younger. The transformer ride is nice and exciting. So are the Sesame Street and Madagasxar rides. The shows Sesame Street and Shrek are very nice. Don't miss them. I didn't know The Universal Studio can be so fun even for people my age. Plenty of food stores with different types of food to choose and eat. For souvenirs plenty to shop, see and buy Service staff are kind, patient, courteous and knowledgeable Easy to get there, with both public transportation and your own car. There's plenty of car parks Would recommend you visit the studio at least once if you can afford it with your family. It will be a memorable day and event that they will find hard to forget.
A very family oriented place. Great place to spend the day. The kids will love it definitely!!
A fun holiday spot for the family, clean place, delicious food, very supportive for a holiday with the family
Best family time place
Small children are not suitable
The park is not big and is suitable for bringing small children to play.
A garden suitable for adults and children, and it contains many games that are suitable for adults and children, in addition to the presence of many restaurants and kiosks.

Well maintained theme park in Sentosa island in Singapore. Rides are generally fun and well kept. Staff are ok. Major issue is the extremely hot weather in Singapore. Rides are more suitable for older kids (7 years old above) who are more than 122cm. Not much rides for younger kids especially those who are afraid of loud sounds and heights.

Not for the theme park enthusiast . However a reasonably good day for children or older kids. Food is expensive around 15 for a meal and they don't allow food from outside. There is a prayer room and plenty of wash rooms
It was fun, but there were some things that were just for kids.
It's not crowded, but adults may not be able to enjoy the rides. It's my personal opinion
Nice place for family. Many rides for while family and food options. Though a bit expensive.
The best place to go with the kids! Best visit Monday-Thursday and not much wait for the ride.

AWESOME DAY.... The best place to spend your day with friends... Reach earliest to enjoy the maximum rides.... You will feel very active and stress free after the day #UNIVERSALSTUDIO #BattlestarGalactica #TransformerRide #RevengeOFMummy #JurassicparkRapidAdventure #MadgascarAdventure #Sesamechase #LightCameraAction #Shrek4d #WaterWorld #Pussinboots
Rides are great for kids. Absolutely loved it. Crazy long queues. Express pass is a bit pricey but well worth it to beat the queues.

Awesome place for a fun day. Lots for shows and rides, for kids and adults alike. Transformer ride is the best, followed by Mummy Returns. Most of the rides are indoors, away from the heat. They also provide free lockers and drinking water at each rides entrance. Reach early, to avoid long queues.
Great park for family fun..lots to do ..beautiful surroundings at the Resort...a must if in Singapore
Don't take your child for a year, the parents won't be happy for sure. Ahahahaha

The theme park is compact and can be done in one day. Get there before the gates open, and line up for the Cylon and Mummy as the wait times are over 1 hour later in the day. There are not a lot of rides if you have young children - best suited for teenagers. The Halloween nights and Express (Fast Pass) are all extras. The food prices are ridiculous and security check all bags with a bamboo prod to make sure you are not packing any contraband (they force you to eat any edible items). Mels Diner which is air conditioned have a burger and chips for S15 and Starbucks have cheaper food options.
Kids paradise.one day is not enough
Don't go with kids under 10 otherwise would be great
Travel with family to Singapore

We went there with toddlers and it's not recommended. They only have like 5 activities that you can do with kids. Also, you have to wait for 40 mins or more for a 3-minute activity. The length of waiting is fine. It's the activity's duration that is not. It's better that all activities will at least be 10 minutes.

It was great and all, but please can you add more rides for children under 92cm? My son couldn't even get to the Elmo spaghetti ride, and I remember years ago that the ride actually was meant for kids as it wasn't speedy or scary at all. He was quite disapointed though. (He is 90cm tall) I've come to this place for probably 4 times already. Since I was single until I have my son. It was great for young adults and adults, but there wasn't many rides for toddler (especially those under 92cm). But hey, they can go in for free.
Good but too time consuming if you are willing to go in all ride.. queues are super long and waits can take as long as 2-3hrs. Can get very tiring especially if you with under 5yr old kids.

Clean hot, small but well run. Limited choice of adrenalin rides, so more suited to smaller kids. Partly shaded, but tending to be super hot. A water bottle, refilled as often as possible is a good idea.
ITS A GREAT PLACE FOR ENTERTAINMENT. IT'S FOR EVERYONE OF ANY AGE. RIDES, SHOWS, MEET AND GREET WITH CARTOON CHARACTERS ALL ARE VERY GOOD.

Can't miss this place if you visit Singapore. A day is less for this amazing place. Don't visit if you have kids below 10 years as you will not be able to enjoy. Don't visit during summers as it gets quite hot.
The rides, hotels, and everything just awesome. So simple to state that it is the best place of enjoyment in SG for both kids and adults.

Loved it. Absolutely amazing place. My kids totally enjoyed and I received thumbs up from them which made my day. Although it is very crowded but must visit and do pre planning about activities in studio. Focus on what your kids like and spend time there. The waiting time for rides is more therefore approach them with prior planning. On weekends it is extremely crowded. I went on week day and even than at some ride wait time was about 60 minutes. Despite this a worth visiting place. Highly recommended

Great for bringing my children to visit and have some fun at the merry go round with Madagascar and Jurrasic Park, mini ferris wheel with Shrek, roller coaster with dragon, transformers virtual reality movie, and mummy car driving. Other than that, I went to the mummy's roller coaster ride with my wife.
Love the overall experience and the entire Sentosa area. Great for family to stay for holidays for several days. Halloween Horror Nights is pretty awesome also but definitely not for young kids.

Be mindful of public holidays when visiting as the ride wait times get cruelly long. I wouldn't recommend buying express passes as they aren't value for money. Take a weekday off with your kids and you'll truly discover the charm of this place
I don't know what kind of rating to give this place... This is a place that my child really dreams of coming to visit here
The alternate attraction for family in the Asia. Lack of halal food compare to previous year.

Though it might be small compared to the original one in the United States it still has quite a bit to offer in terms of themes and rides. The Transformers and Waterworks shows are quite popular. Be prepared for queues or consider getting a express ticket if you're in a rush. There is an attraction for everyone in the family right from young kids to the not so young.

A good place for people of all ages. Transformers is the ride most in demand. Decent food options though a little pricey. Also don't forget to download the app, it tells you the waiting time for each ride and can help you plan the visit well.
Had a good time however its more for kids. Also nothing compared to Orlando universal studios.
Nice place for hanging around for a half day. Specially for children but you have to wait a while to enjoy the rides there.

The rides there are so fun even though the waiting time for the rides might be very long depending on when you go there. For the food, i recommend the fish soup sold in the Jurassic Park food court if you want something light and for the kids, i recommend the kids meal as it has cute dinosaur potato chips. If you are not that hungry, there are some snacks sold at the shops like corn dogs, slushies or churros.

Great place. If you are visiting Singapore with or without family you should keep one whole day for this place. Every one in your group will get things of their interest from kids to old. Rides, movi making, games, best locations to take picture, food, dance, shows and fun.Awsome.

Great theme park for kids and adults alike. Singapore Slings very reasonably priced near the entrance. Fantastic at Christmas and even better if you can get an express pass so you don't have to queue!

Best to visit with children. Full day fun. Rollercoasters are amazing especially the Mummy Returns rollercoaster. Souvenir shops are a bit expensive which is justifiable. Look out for minion meet and greet.
The best place to take your kids and yourself in Singapore.

This place is amazing and perfect to have fun in for kids and grownups. Go during the week to avoid the hustle and bustle of the crowd. Queues will be short and you will get to enjoy the shows and attractions.

If you are with children, then yes it will be fun, but not cheap. My wife and I got here for 18,000 rubles with express lines, we went through all the attractions, more or less Egypt, and the awesome Cylon. Water World did not work, many do not have an express line, only a general queue. We didn't like it. This park is not worth the money. But if you go with regular tickets, you wont have enough time to do everything, and youll have nerves.

It's better to plan properly before visiting. Utilize the whole day only for Universal studios so that you can go for every ride. If you can't wait in long queues better get express entry. Kids below 102 cms are not allowed for most of rides.

Having visited other Universal studios globally the Singaporean studios is pretty small and not as exciting. Theres probably 3 rides worth a mention and thats the two roller coasters and the Transfomers ride. I guess smaller children would also like some of the themed children rides like Shrek and Jurassic Park. I suggest booking your tickets online as the ticket purchasing at site is pretty slow. We went both times early morning and in the evening. All the rides were working from 7pm onwards and surprisingly not as crowded compared to the morning openings. If youre finding Singapore a little boring as we did then give this place some consideration.
Good place to bring your kids.. But this theme park should have a brochure with timing for all the shows, so that we can plan ahead... So much time spend on queueing for the rides..
Good place for children but not for senior citizen
Quite a few rides are outdated. A few good Rollercoasters and great if you haven't been to any other theme parks or with young kids but otherwise hmmm...
Good, suitable for a family holiday, although expensive by Indonesian standards, it's worth a try if you're on Sentosa Island, don't forget the foro in front of the universal globe
Amazing place in Singapore. Best experience with my GF at last few week ago. Having a lot of different theme in playground, you can reach to your favor childhood cartoon at there, nice one!
One of the best spots to have fun with the whole family. Best value for money. Kids are love it madly.
Amazing place, you should wear comfortable shoes and comfortable clothes. The place is organized, clean and suitable for families.

A guide on how to enjoy USS with kids below 4 years old . First, kids below 4 get free entry. There are a few rides and places you must visit. 1) Start with Madagascar. Everything here is suited for kids above 80cm. 2)Take the Crate adventure ride, it is a relaxing and fun ride to warm the kids up to the place. Next, hop on to King Julien's Beach Party go round with is a simple carousel ride that parents can accompany. Most stuff at Madagascar are weather proof so even if it rains, u can go for these. 3) Next, go forth to to visit Far Far away cos that is where shrek lives haha. Up the challenge by taking the kids on the Enchanted Airways. Kids need to be 92 cm to take this gentle (not really for some, our girl hated this ride) roller coaster ride. It is exciting and SHORT. Less than 2 mins and it is over. Some boys may love this. So worth a try. 4) Go watch shrek 4D adventure. long queue but moves fast and for the time you queue, u get to spend at least 15mins seated down in a cool and comfy environment. Whn you exit, u will end up at the Fair God Mother potion factory, there is a tiny ferris ride here which u can q for. Tons of stuff to buy and u can have food at friars cafe opposite. Do remember to check out timings for meet and greet. 5)Next visit The lost world. Not all rides are suited for your toddlers and preschoolers. Just queue for the Dino soaring another very gentle ride which all will love. 6)hop over to canopy flyer to up the excitement again. Minimum ht here is 92cm. 7)Shop at Jurassic store if your boy or man love dinosaurs. Ask for promotion. In Dec 2019, get 10 percent off when u pay with MasterCard. 8)End the day with a visit to Elmo at New York which is near to the entrance/exit. Plenty of areas for toilet breaks and you can rent prams if u need. Have fun!

Universal studios is an amazing and adventurous place for children and adults alike.They have very good range of adventure rides and sports alike. We loved their show of water world which had all the elements of drama , adventure and acrobatics.The rides are extremely good , my favorite was the mummy ride and cylone. The only off-putting thing is it gets very crowded during the holidays and have lot of wait time. Instead they could put a time band to all the enthusiast so that they can get maximum out of their highly priced tickets.

Quite fun! Its just that for children, there are too many entertainment facilities that are excluded, which is very disappointing There is obviously a charge (the age should be raised to 6 years old before charging, because the facilities inside are restricted to children with a height of 4 to 5 years old) Its hard to meet the standard) _
lots of rides. but don't. bring children under 8 to 10 years old. It's a loss not being able to play everything
an exciting place, it would be a shame if you brought toddlers under 2 years old because there are few rides that can be ridden
Avoid peak season... 1st week of Jan, before school is better than end year..

Its an amazing place, dont miss the mummy & transformers ride. Children below 4 years will not be charged They have strollers available for rent. Every ride will have an approx 30 to 45 minutes waiting period so opt for express enty pass if needed at an additional cost of 120 S per head. Over all its an experience & worth it.

Not only for children but all ages. Need at least two days if you want to enjoy all the rides. Nice restaurants and clean rest rooms are present in every section. Though the rides are kind a repetation but dont miss the Ezyptian one...
For a holiday for children and parents, it's okay...
Indoor and outdoor theme park...many rides for adult or kids...nice place to visit when in singapore..Holiday Springbed Comfort sleep for smart People..
Pretty small but good for kids. Very popular so better get the express pass if you want to do every rides.

If you carefully play each facility, you will find new surprises. However, because it is much smaller than the American park in Singapore, the excitement of the facilities is average, so most of them can be easily tried by all young people
Best for activities with the family

Best place for a day out with family and loved ones ! Great accessibility...good food and thrilling rides ! New year and Christmas was completely decorated and had a fire show which was like cherry on cake !
The best place for energetic youngsters and young hearted elders.. It's has everything for any age group... Best attraction in singapore ... Cyclone coster is must try thing

Beautiful place. Definitely one of the places in Singapore to put on your bucket list. Perfect for kids and kids at heart. My top three rides are Galactica, Revenge of the mummy and Transformers. However, they may have a very long queue. So, be patient or you may purchase an express pass if you like.

We had a wonderful tour in this place.. My kids loves the attractions and it was a nice family bonding for us. There's this boy band singing in the middle of the road and we can't help ourselves not to dance while they sing. Truly a happy moment

I didn't pick the right date, so I bought Unlimit Express at a very expensive price, but my child didn't like it, so we left early... It's a waste of money. My child, but I also didn't find it very exciting or fun. I think Legoland or Disney are better.
I recommend visiting with children under 14 years old, we have already been twice
A paradise for children. And an opportunity for an adult to feel like a child. Themed attractions, transformers, the mummy, Madagascar, Shrek are all here. A must visit
There are a lot of people and children will like it.
It's ok place to visit
Nice place to visit. Specially for kids...no. of exciting rides. Whole day is not enough to experience everything especially on crowded weekends
Good theme park, not very busy with some generally fun rides for adults and older kids. Could do with more undercover areas and hawker food type not bland generic and overpriced affair.

It's been several times. But it's still interesting nonetheless. Especially if you are with family. It's also good for photos. Family recreation area. There is a play area for children. There are places to eat. There are also some for photos. The food is also delicious. There is a buffet. Next time, if I have money, I want to come here again with my family. Who knows, there might be a family gathering from the office
Its not big, but you can play all day long. Its fun. There arent many people here on weekdays. You wont have to wait too long to take photos of the rides.
