Universal studios Singapore is an ultimate package of fun, thrill, enjoyment and some quality time with both family and your loved ones...A well packed day one can experience there from the morning till the end of the day... Surely visit this to experience all...
Very Nice place to spend the whole day with the family. experience thrilling rides and wonderful shows. A must place to go to when in Singapore.
super amazing this place..your kids will surely love it and you parents as well will enjoy the place it's one of the breath taking place I've been..
Awesome amusement park with a lot of options for kids and adults of all ages. Must visit in Singapore.

Universal studios is always good value wherever you find it in the world and this one is no exception. Well worth a day if you have 3 or more days in Singapore. Substantially different at least to the Australian one. A great variety of rides and shows for all ages. The dragon ride is good if you are not a fan of super hardcover rollercoasters ... you kids will credit you with going on a proper ride without you suffering too much stress
If you go to Singapore with children, you must come to Universal Studios. Guaranteed to leave a deep impression and memory on children.

A step backwards in terms of ecology. I was pleased to read a small sign in Universal's restaurant that states that the restaurant does not provide straws in order to better preserve marine life; it's very good. However, I don't understand why the restaurant, rather than serving drinks in cardboard glasses (like in most fast food restaurants), serves them in large plastic glasses with integrated straws (shaker style). At a time when we are talking about ecology, it is shocking. If the idea is to provide a "reusable" cup, it should be reconsidered given the number of cups thrown away after the first and only use.
Fun! Foods are okay, rides are mostly fun, lots of gift shops

I went during Tet, and the longest line was 50 minutes. (Single rider) It's generally less crowded than USJ in Japan, so if you're considering staying all day, why not buy an early pass? I think so. Many of the meals include curry, but it's spicy so be careful with children. If your child is less than 80cm tall, you won't be able to ride many of the rides, but there are some attractions that have no height restrictions, so it's okay. I highly recommend the Elmo show.

Good place to go with children. My child enjoyed there a lot. Although it's tiring. Make sure to take your stroller with you or you can also take it on rent there. Watched donkey show which was not liked by my 3 year old son. Shows done by cartoon characters are much more fun. Street shows were eye candy.

For families and teenagers, it's a must do, but can be very crowded with long waiting between rides.For tourists try Monday to Friday as weekends the locals add to the numbers and this limits the ability to access the number of adventures you can physically get into. For the oldies like us 60 plus it's a commercial enterprise aiming at extracting every possible dollar on movie based souvenirs that children and grandchildren crave.

We were lucky; we arrived early for the opening and enjoyed the most extreme rides. If I had to stand on these rides for 30 minutes or more, I would be very disappointed, they seem to be rather weak, they are very far from the American ones. With kids 2-3 years old it will not be boring, there are quite a lot of attractions available, but it is better to check the height restrictions in advance, even before purchasing tickets. Getting to the city from the island is very easy.
A place you can't miss while in Singapore An absolute delight for kids with amazing rides. Though you won't find a variety of vegetarian food options at the eateries here.
Very cool and excellent theme park. Best for family and children
Fantastic Park! lots of fun for the whole family! there's a variety of rides, from motion simulators to top-notch coasters such as revenge of the mummy and battlestar galactica!

Adventure packed, awesome rides will lead one to grand young age. Flawless arrangements, well mannered staffs and well placed wash rooms are really helpful. Fantastics ideas are made reality. If not visited Universal Studio, Singapore tour would have been incomplete.
Fantastic place where i spent 5 hrs with my 2 young toddlers! They enjoyed themselves and requested for me to bring them again! Great kids friendly place!
It is suitable for families and children to travel together. Buying pp coupons can travel smoothly. It is worth exchanging money for time.

Great place for kids, family & friends. Rides for all age people from kids to senior citizens. Most of rides are outdoor. Climate is sunny and sometimes raining also. Avoid visits during weekend or public holiday. You can get fast pass to avoid queue. My favourite rides are 1. Transformer (Ride) 2. Water world ( Show) 3. Jurrasic park ( Wear pauncho chances of getting wet) 4. Shrek 5. Mummy ( On your risk as ride come backward also) Many more uploaded map also for better guidance. Whole day you can enjoy. Food is not that great taste compared to Universal studios US.
A truly magnificent place for children to play on Sentosa Island
I had a memorable time with my family here. Many thing to enjoy, must-visit place
A great place to spend a day with children - the attractions are mainly designed for children.
A good theme park, especially if you like movies like Transformers or Jurassic Park. Though in my opinion, there should be more attractions.

Always longing to be able to return to visit Universal Studio Singapore, the place is good, lots of rides for children and adults, there is no entrance fee to Universal Studio, except for those who want to enjoy the rides in USS, there is another fee.
Best experience ever! With or without kids, this is true singapore experience

Best in Singapore to enjoy a day outing with friends, family and kids. It's designed for all :) During weekends rush will be unbelievable and queues for every damn ride will be super long. So, if you are single rider you can take advantage of going in a separate queue. I was a single rider so I could make use of this facility so well and ended up doing many rides repeatedly. :) Ticket isn't very expensive or it is maybe. Price is about 75 for a day which includes rides :)
It is a very nice place to visit with friends and family. There are many rides for younger people. All the rides are very enjoyable. I loved it.
Enjoy the weekend.Suitable for family, kids, and friends
tmp good recreation for families
My kids enjoyed the full day in this themed park. A lots of rides, restaurants and shops to choose from.
Must go. My 6 year old daughter enjoyed every bit of it. On average, wait time for ride was 40 mins. Rent a stroller as soon as you enter the park and Get the express ticket if you can afford it.
OMG, one of the kids' favourite place

Would recommend the Battlestar Galactica, Cyclone and Human. The Mummy ride, Transformers ride, Jurassic Park water adventure and canopy. A good place to spend a fun and memorable day. Tourist attraction tho so prices are Abit on the high side.
Safe distancing like an urchin
Best hangout to build, memories, with your loved ones
Super love this place and their rides!! My son enjoyed it very much
Only theme park in Singapore, USS makes clever use of its space to deliver entertainment and fun to Singaporean families and tourists. Definitely worth a visit.
If it makes my kids happy then any money is good money spent. So is it worth the annual pass with express. Yes. Will it make sense? Yes if your kids are between 4to12 years old.
Fun times. Even if social distancing is enforced, the rides are smooth and the wait times are bearable.

Fun place to play. Visit with the office group. Unfortunately, the only time I spent with my family was taking photos in front of the gate. Hopefully you will be given the opportunity to come here again with the children
Best outing with family with kids

An Awesome Experience For All Ages! Each zone has a age suitable ride for everyone! I recommend riding The Transformers The 4D Ride and Jurrasic Park Rapids Adventure. Enjoy! Recommended For 5 and above.

A DAY FULL OF ADVENTURE. Universal studio has so much to offer all through the day. I would suggest guyz reach early to the place around 10am. Check in for the Transformers ride amazing and then immediately next switch too BattleStar Galactica, as these attract maximum people across all age group. After these have lunch at your favourite theme park restaurant . After these go for smaller rides in Jurassic world/ Madagascar and catch the Hollywood action packed sequence . At the end there's a parade from group of amazing dancer circling the whole studious and taking crowd along with it for fun times. Wait till the sunset and Universal studious gets alive in its own magical colours. Visit it to feel it.
The World best amusement park for all ages!!! It's a great way to have a day out!! Really loved the place!!

Another great place to bring kids to have some fun since we can't travel. They took care of the hygiene quite well. Before every rides the staff will sanitize the seat and handles. And has to make booking before you go so the crowd is a lot better compare to before. Each rides didn't take long to queue as well, but I will suggest to put on hat and bring a small fan.
Great time to go now as you won't have to wait long for the rides! Lost the atmosphere a little but focusing on the positives.

The universal studios park is a MUST on your Singapore stay :-) We have been plenty of times with the kids. The rides are full of excitement- the battlestar rollercoasters are the fast favorites, mummy is the story and environment favorite- Transfomers have been a "one-time-only", because the story is told quite fast. Because of the weather conditions you should definitely plan to get wet and soaked on the water attractions! We usually shifted frequently to these to get " cooled down". The stunt shows are worth to visit as well- if you liked the storyboard of waterworld :-) The experience with the team have been all positive - you really feel welcomed everywhere in the park! The foodoffer is nothing for foodies, better to take advantage of the variousness of the city instead.
It's just the best of all ....a very perfect place to visit, kids enjoy very much...best place for visitors!!!! Loved it....! The rides are very fun n the best
Amazing place for kids as well as for adults. Try to visit on weekdays to avoid long queues. On weekends take the express pass.

The staff here are absolutely wonderful. I've been here numerous times but today was my first time since covid. The staff have managed very well since reopening and despite having a much lesser crowd, having to remind everyone to social distance, everyone has been super cheerful and positive about the situation! Especially the team at the Transformers Meet and Greet (including the professional photographer) absolutely made my nephew's day. He was here to celebrate his 4th birthday, (gotta abuse the free entry for children under the age of 4), and they were so friendly and accommodating to him. One of the staff told him to tell Optimus it was his birthday and we all got such a kick out of the interaction between the two of them. Thanks for making his special day out super special! Huge thanks to the photographer team at the store near the entrance too. You've made a little boy who loves Transformers super happy! He was showing off his photo to his mum as soon as he got home! :)
It was my first time traveling with my family way back in 2018 and its with Singapore. Very nice placr to have a short vacation.
Is a waste that there are not many rides for the small kids. If they can add in a few stations for the kids that will be lovely. I love the shows like minions, Elmo etc dancing.

This is a fun place to go for rides and amusement. Like any such place, you can spend a lot more than just for the tickets. One caution: they don't really label the rides that well if they might be scary, so take care with younger kids (the Transformers ride freaked out our 4-year-old). And lines can be long. But it's definitely fun, with Sesame Street characters and a New York City scene etc.
Good place to bring ur kids to enjoy aft their exam over..
Theme was changed to christmas deco. Very nice esp 2020 not much attractions. Glad that USS has made us feel abit more christmassy
Many attractions for all age, good entertainment venue for family

2nd time at USS and still as awesome. The last time I visited was in 2010 and some of the rides have been updated. Battlestar Galactica is still the must take ride. Other highly recommended rides are The Mummy and Jurassic Park River Rapids ride. Food in the park is expensive though, so it would be better to have your meals at Vivocity before entering.
Excellent Amusement park for kids and young people
During COVID period is the best time to go as less crowded
Nice place for relax and enjoying times with family and friends. I always bring my kids there.
The place is full with fun and enjoyment.Very good place to visit with family and friends......

I think it's an okay place with a few interesting rides. More suitable for children of age 5-18. Long waiting times are extremely boring and tiring. Interesting architecture and designs though. If you have nothing better to do on a holiday, you can do it. For tourists, it can be a one timer.
Its fun place to bring children and adults during the school holidays. I enjoy it myself. Its kinda hard to find halal food here in uss. But still a good place to hang out with friends.
Same rides, but of course one usually goes once in a long while, hence the place doesn't feel that boring. Try to bring your own snacks to not make too big a hole in your wallet.
a fun place to be to bond with your kids and kids at heart.. unfortunately with long que all the time
Still crowded.. but great social distancing measure
Best Place For Family And Tourist

Like a magical place, especially for children who love disney...there are cartoon characters like minion, hello kitty, dinosaurs, shrek...lots of fun..not forgetting castle and lots of fun rides...roller coaster, merry go rounds....
Christmas Feels Amongst Covid! A great place to spend the whole day for all ages!
Universal Studios Singapore is the nice place to visit with family.
Today weather was very nice. Cool and windy and no sun . Child liked the place so much.
It's always at USS. However the queue is always long, so need lots of patience & time. Those with young kids or teenagers they enjoy the most. It's always crowded.

The Universal Studios Singapore is a great place to spend your entire day. The rides are great but the waiting times can be from 20 minutes to three hours! It can get really long, so if you're particular of getting to the most rides, it may be worth buying the express pass which lets you go thru a different queue, which most often has zero to few people waiting. Most rides has a height eligibility, so if you're going with kids, research on which rides will be allowed. I like the live performances and the setup... The tickets are expensive, so will visit, but after a while. Oh, avoid days with possibility of rain as that really messes up things and wouldn't allow you to get to all the rides.
Qs are mostly 10 to 15 mins. Lots of personal spaces.

One of the most beautiful and dream come true place in Singapore. It stays true to its promise of bringing you more closer to your favorite characters from the Universal Studio movies. You become a kid yourself and the kids, they just have a blast. Extremely clean and well maintained. Transports you to another world itself.

Universal Stuido was awesome place for childrens as well as adult there are so many play station to have a lot fun and you not complete it by in one day. That many game will find in Singapore universal studio. I my self take a ride of roll costa of transformer, mummy & shriek etc. good place to visit.

A place that will not fail to make everyone happy, a place with rides with extraordinary experiences, If you bring children, bring a stroller because it will be very helpful, even though USS provides strollers, it's better to bring your own. Thank you USS
Nice.Now only Iam experiencing in roller coaster (Cylon,human and mummy).These rides are good. This is my Wonderful achievement for me and my daughter.
Wentvto USS on Boxing Day. Still a great place to bring the kids. The express passes had helped a lot as the park was at full-capacity due to the holiday.
Decent variety of fun rides, and it's compact enough for you to navigate around easily. Highly recommend going during off-peak, otherwise you'd be spending 90% of your time just queueing.
Excellent Place for outing & controlled, safe Adventure
Suitable for children. There is no admission fee for children under three years old. Admission is required for those aged four years old. Children can walk around.
Universal Studio in Singapore is kinda boring if is only rides but no shows for kids. Because of covid19 many restaurants is not open.

Unless you or your kids are a fan of Micky Mouse, it's definitely better than Disneyland. First there are only 4 Universal Studios in the whole world so it's a pretty special place. And second it's less crowded and also less childish with slightly mature attractions like Jurassic Park, Waterworld, The Mummy, Shrek etc. Theme of this theme park is of course based on the movies they have produced. Apart from the rides, they have different zones of famous movie sets, Hollywood, New York, Madagascar etc. And like any other amusement park, there's so much to see and do so just one fun filled day is not gonna cut it.
what more kind i say? its a place for all in the family...
a great family day out! lots of things to see and do

Nothing beats the sound of the theme park. Youre in for a treat once you're there! Thoroughly enjoyed the entire day with the family! Also it was my first time bringing my dad to a theme park. Dad had so much fun! So cute!!!
Singapore's iconic world famous theme parks. Great for the very young and young at heart...a must visit
Enjoyed the rides with family. Smaller crowds and the app really helps in planning where to go next.
Full day fun with rides, activity, house. Worth to go once atleast.
Good place for some family fun. If possible go on weekdays to avoid the crowd
Excellent place to go wif families...

Loved it! My first visit to the place. Staffwere helpful. We went on a Sunday afternoon and were grateful for the good weather and the relatively short queues at the rides. There is something to people of all ages. We are a group of people in our 20s.
Good place for kids and adults. Really love it. Due to covid there were safe distancing measure. But still great overall

I loved the fact that I could spend time with my family and enjoy ourselves. I was only concerned with the safety of plump people like me. During the mummy ride and the transformers ride I was afraid if being thrown out because I could not push down the safety bar all the way down due to the tummy's hindrance. Though it may be just my imagination or fear but it seemed so real during the ride. Otherwise I had a great time with my family. Thank you USS.
Great place to spend the day with your family even for local Singaporeans. Not just tourists, locals also get to enjoy all the themed rides as well.

Very enjoyable trip, with some rides being so dated (Jurassic Park) they work, but others (when was the last time anyone watched Battlestar Galactica?!) too dated. However, the rides are very good. Their Covid measures are very useful too - limited park numbers, no reduction of capacity on the main rides. Now with the rule of twos I'd encourage you to get a ticket as no families will be there. Do get the Universal Express pass - best 40 you will spend, as you reduce your queue time from 30-60 sweaty minutes to about 60 seconds. You can buy these all over the park. Don't go on the Transformers ride last, it will really turn your stomach something rotten...
It is a fun place for youngsters to hang out. Too much might end up giving you a headache but I guess that would be for an older age group of 40's
Great place for family with Covid19 restriction.

Fun and free thanks to the rediscover vouchers! Entry is smooth, show the barcode in the pdf file attached in the email sent to you. Re-entry is allowed, so you can head to the 7-11 outside to get refreshments that are much cheaper. Lots of families will flock to the transformers ride at the start which made it a 1.5hr wait, so avoid that and instead go to the other rides (mummy, human, cylon) in the beginning which have almost no wait times. It gets really hot so bring a fan or something.
COVID review. Come on a week day, the lines are so short you can ride each ride multiple times!
It's really good park! All attractions were working. My daughter 10 y.o. and I mostly love Nest and Galactic. There are almost restaurants were cloused cause of covid-19 regulations
Good theme park for family trip but a little small if compared to other Universal Studios

The first time was fun but our second time in Universal Studios Singapore is the most memorable and more fun because now we're with our kids. We meet lots of character like Shrek, Minions , etc., we also enjoy the rides. Hoping for the third visit.
Great place to visit in Singapore, for those who know Universal in other countries it is a small copy, but it is the best in Singapore, it is worth taking the children.
Friendly and helpful staff!
Fun-fulled. Thrilling! Good activities for all from young to young at heart.
staggered rides during covid (12-5,1-6,2-7) would recommend going either 12-6 or 2-7 to spend less time on queuing.
Must visit, specially for kids
Lovely place to spend the whole day.. kids really loved this place .. so much to do... the rides are excellent For adrenaline rush try the Mummy and Human and Cylone...

Was at the Universal Studios of Singapore Today 3rd July 2021-4:30pm. We had a wonderful family time, enjoying the rides and taking pictures... One thing we missed is seeing Elmo... My Sweetheart Clara and my Children were sad because we missed the time to see the Sesame's Street Character last Appearance at 5.30pm. It was a stress relief outing, we were all shut at home for too long, sometimes we need to get out there to pamper ourselves but within our means... In this case, we only paid 12 for all of us under the KLOOK app, as we fully use our SRV 1003300 We book the Adult and Child package prices at 114.00. -SRV 100 -10 Discount for Child and paid only 4.00 for each package. We booked 3 package under my Wife and my Daughter and me, well... do the mathWe only paid 4312.00. That is a ultimate saverThank you Jesus, All Glory to you Lord. Amen Amen Amen. Overall, we enjoyed each others company and thank our Father God, Jesus and His Holy Spirit for being there with us and Protecting us from all Dangers. Amen Amen Amen
The place is really fun and suitable for kids, teens, and adults. The staff there are also very friendly. They offer to help you.
Had a good time with my family here ! Even it rained a little, it didnt spoil the fun.Had a day of thrilling rides, delicious meals and wonderful sights.

There are a lot of roller coaster here and me and my friends had a great time here. It has also many activities that are suitable for family and children. It is a great place to go to for family activities. It is wise to set a whole day aside as the queue can be quite long. Overall a good experience here.
It's nice to travel to many places to eat. A pleasant place to spend time.
Really clean and fun! There are less shows because its covid times but also less people so the wait times ok! Definitely worth it to go if youre in SG.
Small but compact with exciting rides and adventures

A fun place to spend with your loved ones! Especially kids! This is their paradise. It is also a paradise for roller coaster lover! If you're just looking for a place to getaway with friends, here is also perfect for you! The attractions are fun and exciting! My favorite ride is definitely Revenge Of The Mummy. 100% recommend!!!
If you go to Singapore you must and must go to USS. The place is clean, comfortable, lots of rides to try. Very pleasant.
Awesome place according to my child..
Great place to have fun for the youngs and the olds. Definitely will add some spice in your life during this Covid situation

Recommended viewing of the water show between 1:30 and 4:45 p.m. The front seat is a VVIP. It's a good place to get children's character toys. It's hot but it's fun. It's the best playground for children. A place where children sit in the front and get hit by water. After the performance, a photo party with the actors
All the indoor shows are closed due to covid. That's practically almost half the activities unavailable. So its kinda boring if you have kids that can take limited rides without all the shows..
Small theme park but with a good variety of rides. Great place to take kids (if I had any)
Is a good experience for kids .. just don't have a lot shelter for sun and raining day.
1 of the best day for my kids during thier school holiday except rollercoaster was down sadly
Place for both young and old, never short of fun.
Best for family outing.
Went there last weekend and the experience was sooo great ! Kiddos would absolutely love this place!

Had a blast! We went during the week & the lines for rides were taking 5minutes so it was great. The kids just kept going back onto the rides over & over again. All staff throughout the park were great. Street characters were fun & engaging. We would recommend an annual pass for locals.
Nice night outing at universal studio sentosa with some of the rides operating n people donning Halloween outfits. There should be options of snacks redeemable. Good night out for children.
The best experience with my son... will definitely go back to that place as soon as lockdown ceases. The rides, the shows, the programmes are all worth it...
Uss singapore is one of the best attractions in Singapore. Friendly staff, a wide variety of rides for adults and kids
Great rides. There are student discounts on souvenirs, f&b and tickets available. Definitely check out the Transformers and The Mummy rides.
Family bonding time
It is just awesome place for family tour. Full on entertainment pack for kids as well as teenagers. Loved it!
My kids have lovely time here, i just wish i got the express ticket because the queue kinda long. If you with kids i advice to get the express one, safe much time.

A fun place for all age groups to spend the day. If rides don't excite you one has lot of other things. We have been there several times and love it every time. This time we went for the Halloween Horror nights and just loved the whole experience.
Enjoy the Madagascar boat ride n sesame street space ride. The Transformers ride is very thrilling .
Fun rides and good food
Its just that many of them are not suitable for three-year-olds!
Family day out, lesser crowd compare to our previous visit. Manage to go on more rides, we skipped a few fides. But overall, good day & clear skies. The kids enjoyed the day.

Needs no introduction, as singaporeans wouldve visited this theme park. Good way to spend the holidays, with rides for all ages. Highlights include Cylon, Mummys Adventure and Jurassic Park. However, food options are not the cheapest, you might consider settling your meal at Vivo before heading over. It gets really warm from 12-2pm so best to put on sunblock.
Waiting time is too long, but still good for kids
One of the best places to have fun with your family. Although some events are closed due to covid19, still can enjoy the happiest time.
Our family went for a full day enjoyment of rides! It was definitely a place for kids and adults
Great for family outing with kids

Today we had our family outing to USS with our 6 and 7yo boys. It was the first time they explored USS, they definitely had great fun; left with a big satisfaction smile. Some tips 1- unfortunately its a rainy day.. pls do urself a favor to check weather forecast; bring ur own rain coat; inside sells 5/each and only on adult size. 2- go download the USS apps, and plan ya route, check child height constrains; this really save our legs :) 3- bring some snacks and water, so u don hv to waste time to Q and buy snacks. 4-eat before u arrive the park, so don hv to q for the restaurants, especially with all the safe distancing in place.. Hope its useful )
very enjoyable with rides for the whole family. the way they handled the pandemic is very good and left me with no fear of infection.
Suitable for taking children from primary and secondary schools to play
Looking foreward for a lovley familyday at Universal studios Sentosa, Singapore

The best place for youngsters as well as adventure lovers. It has all theme related rides. From roller coasters to dinasaurs to mummies you will see all rides as well as different region foods and products. The best ride over there are transformers, mummy ride , pirate show and roller coasters. Do try dinasaur ride too . But the above mentioned rides are must. And tip for money savers is that eat food outside the universal studios as the food inside is expensive as well as doesn't tastes that good
Family fun @USS.
Weekdays n non peek period it's a dead place.. so go on holidays weekends.. maybe excitement welcomes you
Nice place to go but for my age is cant have Finn like young people but I like to going too Sentosa universal studio Singapore
This place is superb for a family visit. Awesome rides and really enjoyable place for all the age groups. A must visit place in Singapore
Great experience especially going with loved one

There are many kids attractions and things to play. It is recommended to go early to explore the place and enjoy yourselves. Will be better to cater more drinks and healthy snacks inside the attractions. Thank you.
Super enjoyed this day as I managed to go to my fav rides. Love it. Organize and friendly staffs will welcome you.

Fun place to visit in Singapore for kids of all ages. Surprisingly good value, with food and souvenirs not too over priced. Starting to show its age, with the ride themes dating from the 2000s, franchises that are no longer current.

In Singapore and then to Universal Studio? Yes! Definitely, don't miss it. Super well done and there is something for every age group :) The waiting times were reasonable, the staff were very friendly and it's best to buy a "fast ticket" if possible. It was totally worth it!
Many of the rides at Universal Studios Singapore are suitable for little ones, and adults also have a great time.

Ooon ho ... What a lovely world it is. Forgot about my kids .. i guess my wife and I enjoyed even more than anybody. Universal Studio is for them, who likes Universal Characters like... Madagascar, Minions, Jurassic park...etc. Best 3 things ..don't dare to miss... 1. Take selfie or pic infront of the Universal Globe. 2. Attend maximum meet and greet by these Universal Characters. 3. Go ride...almost all rides are fun and memorable one. I have never seen these kind of rides in my entire life .
Good place to spend your day out with family or friends. Recommend to try the Transformer and Mummy rollercoaster.

Not worth the money for young kids. I took my 5 year old and there was hardly anything suitable, also, why does everything have to be so loud. More suitable for older kids, teenagers and above. Singapore zoo was a lot more value for money and time spent without the queues.
It's good . It's fun for kids but most of the attractions is closed due to covid restrictions and they are opening slowly and gradually. Good luck Singapore loving it. Wow.

Coming here during the pandemic is a mix of emotions. Seeing a few closed stores, you can't dismiss the effects Covid has made to everyone. But at the same time, seeing the kids finally be kids, it was heartwarming!
Universal Studio is one of the best iconic tourists location in Singapore. Bring your kids. They will really enjoy it.
Ultimate place for kids. Loved it. Few water dispensers around the places will be highly appreciated.
Wonderful place to bring your kids and your kid mind too
Always a fun place for family and children to have bonding time
It's a great experience.... transformer ride was the best...but there should be available vegetarian food that was only thing

Drinking water is not available in the entire USS. Only have to buy (that too water is very cold). With small kids, it is very difficult to manage in such big parks without water. Administration team of Universal Studios Singapore, please consider reopening those water points.
It's a good for kids. Not many rides for adults and very few options for vegetarian.

Many rides are closed due to covid..transformees is 3 min experience with one hr long line. If you are a couple with a kid..then there might be a problem...kids below 4 feet are not allowed in some of the adventrous rides. Otherwise good atmosphere..nice outing overall.
Nice Park but not for under 3 years children or under 122 cm tall
Quite a few shows and rides still suspended post covid, but makes for a fun day out with the kids
It's not too big, so it's perfect for bringing the kids along. There were scenes where the rain caused by squalls made me drenched more than I expected

amazing place for all types of age groups. everyone will get lots of fun here. if u going with little one than you have to ready for heavy CC bill. after Covid 19 so many rides and restaurants and shops still yet not opened. i like transformers and dino rides very much. my little one tried all rides whenever he applicable. some of ride requires certain height of child. most dangerous part of it is Lego toy stop on staring. really great place for fun with ur family and friends. u will definitely get tied after leaving studio. before entering u should check ur phone memory bcoz it may be full and u will be nervous. after leaving it u should go candilious shop for all types of candy and chocolate for ur dear ones.
Universal studios is magical for all ages. Entertaining from the start to finish it is a must visit in Singapore. Paradise for kids

Universal Studio Singapore... always busy... a refreshing place with the family, it's hot, you have to bring a hat/umbrella. If you have funds, it's best to buy express tickets, especially holiday tickets.
A wonderful and happy place to visit. Lots of game attractions to play and enjoy. My favorit is the shrek and the jurassic world.
All rides giving wonderful experience specially mummy ride
Must go for family and kids.
Wide variety of attractions to visit and things for kids to see, especially the iconic Sesame Street!

It is one of best places to vist in Singapore, both for adults and kids. I went in May 22, when there was not too much crowd here ( probably due to covid restrictions), so I did not took an express pass and still had to wait for uptob30 mins in few rides. You get the feel of universal the moment you enter the arena. 360roller coaster was best one there closely followed by Egypt themed roller coaster ( not 360 though ). Not too many activities for kids below 3 feet though. If you have small kids, I suggest you rent a stroller available there with (15 to 30 sgd rent). Do take you hats and glasses and do not carry too much loose articles/items with you as many rides not allow you to carry them with you.
Good place for family.... lots of attractions for my kids....
Nice place for kids to enjoy rides....
Recreation area , good for family. Shoukd prepare deep pocket

It was an amazing experience with family there. One of the best places to be visited in Singapore. The minimum age for kids to ride is 4 but few rides allow them based on their height too. Kids above 4 years are chargeable so make sure you take a ticket for them. And have FUN.
It's the best experience any parent can give to a child. Amazing rides! My favourites were Transformers and Revenge of the Mummy.
Just Wow, your children and family will definitely love the place, Transformer, Mummy, Dinosaurs, Madagascar and Water world are must visit theme park.
Best place to spend time with friends and family. This place is a 10/10,would recommend to other to go here

Best for all ages. Must go is big rides and mummy ride. Transformer is best ride. Only Negative thing is lot of restaurants closed and big queues on most of restaurants. Free coupon in grovey summer ticket is waste. You can spend them as no popcorn counter was open and line for food was endless.
The rides are ok. The weather is very hot so it would be good to prepare a hat or umbrella as well.

Okay-ish Universal Studios out of all. Compared to Orlando one, this one doesnt have Harry Potter theme park (and rides) and overall it is smaller in size as well. You can easily cover the whole park within the given park timings of 12pm to 7pm.

Superb park not as big as the one in Florida. You have around ten attractions that are great for medium and small children. Lots of characters. And its easy to meet them. The prices are not too expensive. Just avoid eating in the retro restaurant at the entrance to the park because the meal is not good at all, cold and very expensive. They reheated our nuggets in the microwave. The park is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays, please note. It was a Saturday and frankly it was manageable. Go there for a day with the family, there are lots of candy and chocolate stores near Universal
Be careful, there are a lot of ride where you can't keep your belongings but there are lockers. They are mostly free for a certain amount of time, depending on the ride.
Even though some of the rides are closed, having a holiday here with children is still fun.
One of the must go places in Singapore. Full of fun experiences. A family friendly place.

As a fan of transformers , minions , fast and furious and other movie that's why I had visited these place .Each zone features its own themed rides, shows, shops, restaurants and street entertainment. We have visited the Singapore Universal Studios several times and the whole family has had an absolute blast every time. There is a lot of fun to be had here, and you are pretty much guaranteed to have a great family day out.
Best for kids and we have a Wonderful time and happiness

Its amazing day out, absolutely fantastic. The universal studio has something to offer for every age group. A variety of rides to accomodate all audience, good for family outing, good with friends and good even if you alone. There are good food options as well, and lods of place to rest and refresh
A wonderful theme park. It is one of kind. Very beautiful interiors. The rides were jaw dropping. It's just so fantastic . Kids to adults to everyone will just enjoy themselves. It's a must visit
This is place consists of Rides..not recommended for older and kids..the people who doesnt go for rides like roller coaster type rides are not recommended to take up this
School holidays and weekends are really crowded. Overall we are here for the same reason.

Ideal for children aged 4 to 10. The attractions are great for small children, for adults I think it must be quite limited, apart from the 3 big ones. Fair value for money, too bad the park is not open longer during the day from 12 p.m. to 7 p.m. Be careful the times change depending on the day, check before going there, the time indicated on min ticket (get your guide) and on the site was not the same. Fortunately we had seen it before. The park is small but for a day it's good!
Price is little on the higher side and limited shows. Good for teens , not worth it for elderly or parents. Indian food options are not there so would recommend to pack something for lunch.

A whole day's entertainment. Needless to say, Universal studios is the best place to visit if you are in Singapore. It's perfect for people of all age groups. From the rides like The return of the mummy, Transformers to the meet and greet with the Transformers this place is action and entertainment packed. The only downside is the waiting time as we had to wait close to 1.5 hours to be able to experience the transformers ride but it was absolutely worth it.

Had a great time with family,rides are safe and good.mummy ride was really good.overall it was Fun and had good experience there.restrooms are clean, also they have locker rooms so that you can keep your belongings inside before going for a ride... universal studios is closed on Monday and Tuesday, open from Wednesday to Sunday,time 12.00 to 7.00 pm
Must visit destination, good trip for family, young people, wonderful time.
Fun place... Your kids will be crazy... The best one is the transformer ride, mummy ride, lost world and move set spacial effect one

Lovely place to be with family and friends, especially your children will love this place. Decent budget, but the rides and theatres are awesome. Transformers, mummy, etc. But the only issue is HUGE QUES. Waited for 1.5 hours to enter transformers arena but it was worth it. Must visit place for all with family.

If it's your first time visiting or you don't have kids, there's a lot to enjoy, but as someone who's been there dozens of times... I went with my kids, but there were no shows, no parades, and Madagascar was under construction. I went there after 3 years due to Corona, but the prices seem to have gone up even more and there is nothing to see or do, so I was completely disappointed. There is nothing to do with children under 5 years old. I was satisfied with just watching the Sesimi show, but it was completely gone. I don't think I'll ever go again unless I get an annual membership again.

It's nice, but the waiting is disgusting and very exhausting, even with an express ticket. The waiting is long. It is good for adults... Young children have limited options, and one day is not enough. Children aged 4 years and under are better off.

There are many corners to take photos. Various types of play equipment There are both suitable for children and suitable for adults. But the area is quite dirty. The walkway inside the building leading to the play equipment has trash, glasses, and water bottles left behind. Including a lot of dirt.

Rides are suitable for adults but for the children under age 14 this place is a no go.People having trouble with High BP and back injuries barred from most of the rides, before buying tickets check for the promotions.
Some rides are still closed but 80% things are now open. If you have small kid you may not be able to do many rides due to height limit but otherwise it never bores. Mummy ride is my personal fav!
One of the best place to go to with family or even a friends! Cant wait to be back here really soon.. from Surabaya to Singapore!

Awesome experience for kids. My 8 year old was able to go on all rides, 4 year old couldn't due to height restrictions but there were a lot of options available for him too. Our family favourite was the transformers ride.
Loved the place. Ambience, rides, facilities... everything outstanding. Amazing experience with my toddler. Totally loved it.

Had one of the best days ever!! Great place for kids and universal movie lovers. The rollercoaster rides were amazing. The transformer and the mummy returns rides were mind blowing. The only con I found was that the food options were quite limited and most of the shops were closed the day we visited. A wonderful experience overall.

Great adventure with superb rides... Must try Transformers, Thr Mummy, Jurassic World rides for adults... For children also there are many rides... The whole family package... Enjoyed to the fullest...

Kids would love the rides. Just that many rides are no longer available (post covid) and there are only a handful left. They make you wait for hours for every ride and that way you wouldnt notice that you arent doing as many rides as you could have on a single day.
Nice for kids, some attractions are getting busy.
The rides where very fun and the food was ok the best part was the fireworks and if you are bringing a kid you should try out the Elmo or the transformer ride

Nice place for visiting mostly kid 10 for many ride experience. Security are not at per incident with me purchased Baby Stroller & kept to designated stroller parking place but stolen as usual by an Indian (hindi speaking). Anticipated the person but struggling to get security guard help to catch red handed. Though provided a new stroller. By felt very shame being Indian

Ques were way to long and we went on a school day post holidays. Rides were good but we only went on 2 rides, 3rd being lights camera action. The transformer ride was really good but wasted over an hour of our day. By the time we finished that it was lunch time and then all the ques were over 45 minutes. If you have smaller kids go to legoland
If you want to go universal studio then buy tickets online because there is discount on online booking. Yes its joy-full day but if you already seen Disneyland then this one is ok ok for you .

Go straight to Sentosa Island and enjoy a day inside Universal Studios if you have limited vacation time in Singapore. A very well spent day for families with kids and kids-at-heart. Food is amazing and lots of benches under trees to relax the day away. The rides are super fun and exciting, the characters walking around are so nice and friendly. It's a wonderful experience to have and make happy memories from.

Superb place to visit with family. Some tips to follow Wear light clothes Carry water and easy to carry food Carry pram for small kids Reach as early as possible, even 1 day is not enough for this amazing place Check weather forecast, no rain, as it may play spoilsport Avoid weekend And if going on weekends then buy express tickets.
Awesome! Love Their rides! Mummy the best!
Universal Park in Singapore is beautiful. Can't get enough of going back with the whole family.

Perfect place to spend your full day of fun activities. I love the transformer most and many other attractions. It's way smaller compared to Disneyland but still consists lots of fun. Recommended for everyone above 5 yr. Btw your phone will not work properly while you're there so probably you should have backup plan should you take different route with your friends.
Suitable for families, many interesting attractions for children and adults. Long queues on weekends, quite tiring.
A fun studio for the kids to happily peek around and have a snack, like a weekend trip bt. That's it. Nothing special.
It's a nice place for families more than only adults, and its crowded in weekdays as well as the weekend, I waited one hour four each attraction .
Came here for the universal studio vibes, the sesame street show was super cute, they really brightened up the atmosphere, do not order milkshakes its too sweet...
A family friendly place to spend time together with family, friends, or any loved ones! Highly recommend

Amazing place and breathtaking place for families and friends. 1 day ticket can enjoy everything inside there. Please keep in mind weekdays are more crowded.. I enjoyed Cylon, Transformers in 3D, Mummy that was fantastic.
Fantastic place to go with family and friends! Theme park activities are great but most of them are same (rollercoasters) and just the stories are different.
Perfect place to enjoy with family. They should have open until 9 to 10 PM
child's happiness
People under age of 30 could enjoy more.
The child within

The place is nice and worth a visit, there are certain hacks one can do to have a more comfortable visit If you are foreigner, buying an express pass could accelerate your ability to explore and ride more substantially, if you want to remain frugal go for individual rider line (ride alone) which is mostly 50 percent faster. Recommended rides ( From my experience) 1. Mummy (Animated roller coaster) 2. Jurassic park ( Canopy Flyer) 3. Transformer ( Soft and Simple yet fun) 4. Cylone and Human ( Hardest ones) Dont go for mummy safari its slow and mostly for toddlers There are many more but you need a lot of time, for maximum enjoyment visit during non rush season like January or April

It really is worth the hype. There are many rides for different age groups, however it is more suitable for children aged over 7 since most rides have age/height restrictions. Some queues can be very long (up to 2 hours of waiting time on weekends and public holidays) There are attached photos and descriptions of some areas in the park. (Do note that these are not all of the areas of the park)

Overall a good place for family. Rides are dated. However, avoid KT'S Grill. All the staff their were Grumpy and Moody. Especially the indian girl in front with a rude attitude. The place was empty but for some unknown reason was told only permitted to sit at the booths. Family felt uncomfortable with the situation and left. Ironically, all the other cafes was full except here. It's probably because of the great welcoming attitude shown.
Went during the Christmas festival and the ticket fee was a bit expensive. But if the kids like it, it's worth it.
Good activities and interesting
Very nice place for a family vacation. Awesome experience. The services are first class and friendly, safe and clean.

So much fun!! Feeling like a child again. Bring your kids and have fun filled day with your family..There are so many rides surely you must..It brings so much laughter and happiness. Off course don't forget your souvenirs

Its been a wonderful experience at Universal Studios today.. its a very good go-to place with kids as its stroller friendly throughout the place. Waiting time for some of the famous rides like Transformers, Sesame Street, Mummy, Dino park etc are little high and express tickets may help in these cases. Overall a great experience for the family

Amazing, awesome fun experience. Full day can be spent here and a must go in the list. Organises so many activities during the day and kids love to see Madagascar, Minions, Shrek, etc and loves to get a chance to click photos with. Rides are great too. So many themes like Jurassic Park, Hollywood, Sci-fi city, Far far away, etc. Only one critic the food is not so great inside, but you are allowed to get your own food if you want.
We were here for the annual PUB Family Day. The park was exclusive for PUB families from 7pm to 11 pm. Great rides. Love the Cyclone and Transformer rides. Awesome

A disappointment if you go with kid younger than 10. Most place is closed. Not much to do with younger kid. Works on main heat hours. We arrver at 11 and finished everything till 14. Not recommended especially it cost a lot money and not worth it

This place is cool to look at. But bringing young kids isn't ideal. The queues cab get long. Age group more suitable would probably be 6 and older. It's a waste of money for taking younger kids because 1 adult adult can only accompany 1 child if they were smaller.

Not that great...Just couple of exciting land games. Kids will love it but not an exciting place for teens and adults. Please go on weekends. If not, it will be more boring. Not worth the ticket price. Fast track entry is just a means of money waste. Over-all a good place to spend 5 hours and decent 5 restuarants with different cuisines.
Come before 11 o'clock and not when the children are on school holidays.
Good place to visit with Family, kids will enjoy the theme parks, rides are ok.

Good for kids but do check the minimum height requirements for the rides to be sure. Check the USS site but a 120cm tall kid should be able to ride a lot of the rides, just depends how game they are. If they've never ridden a roller coaster before, the Jurassic Park's Canopy Flyer is a good introduction. My 6yo at the time of writing, who was excited to try "roller coasters", told me that's scary enough. Worth buying the express tickets too especially if you arrive some time after it opens. Note there are rides that you can't use it on, so do check the USS website. When we went, the Canopy Flyer was one of them, but we got in at the start of the day so there was no queue. Photos with the movie characters were ok but disappointed when they didn't turn up when it was raining. The photo taking place was under cover.... Food was meh and expensive, but expected of a theme park I guess.
The place is ok There is entertainment for children & adults
The Transformers ride remains the highlight ..worth visiting for this ride alone ..food options are limited inside so thats a bit of a downer ..great place for families

I bet it's smaller but just nice for a trip day. Must try: Mummy ride, Transformer ride, Jurassic canopy and Jurassic splash. Can't recall the actual name.. but you'll know when you visit. Of course, human n cyclone if you are game. For citizen, buy online it's cheaper. I bought using phone just before going in.

I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore and it was an amazing experience. The park offers a wide variety of thrilling rides and attractions that are suitable for all ages. On the day we visited the fast pass was definitely worth it, if you can get it, it pays for itself after a number of rides. The park is well-maintained and the staff were friendly and helpful. The food options were also great and there's a wide variety of dining options available. The park also offers a wide variety of entertainment shows and live performances that are definitely worth checking out. I highly recommend Universal Studios Singapore to anyone visiting the island, it's a must-see attraction that offers a fun and memorable experience.

Last December we visited Universal Studios Singapore and had an incredible time. The park was well-maintained and had a great variety of rides and attractions. The highlights for me were the roller coasters such as Battlestar Galactica and Revenge of the Mummy. The shows were also amazing, especially the Waterworld and Lights, Camera, Action! The park was crowded but manageable. The food options were also good and reasonably priced. Overall, I highly recommend Universal Studios Singapore for anyone looking for a fun and exciting day out. It's a perfect place for families and friends to spend the day.
Universal Studios, "where an Adult can be a kid!" Best ride, hands down, at Universal Studios Singapore is The Mummy! Don't matter me there, beat me!
A lovely place for family Fun and thrill. All rides are must go.
Take advantage of 2023 to bring your family to play! Very happy
A moderately sized park, its a lot of fun to bring children! It won't be too tiring either. Downloading the Global App in advance can arrange the order of attractions more efficiently.
It's not as big as I thought. If you go on a weekday, there won't be a long line and you can use everything, which is nice.
Nice place especially for kids, with the rides and shows on their favorite characters. You can easily spend a whole day there. Food and other amenities also available.
Good for a one time experience, major thing for kids, doesnt excite you much if you are more of a serious or a logical person. The place is great for a certain age!

So much fun I visited this place before I had a kid. A few years later when I brought my son, he was veeery bored while waiting in line for some of the popular games. I think it's better to buy express tickets for those who bring children rather they won't get bored waiting

Brought my family to Universal Studios over the weekend, my kids love most the Jurassic park, of course and other rides as well. The food is nice and good variety, and reasonable price as well. Will definitely come again.
Great place for adults and children, highly recommend for tourist to have fun with different rides and activities! Built with different structures of themes and best for photography session!
Superb experience with family
The best place to bring your kids for holidays. We had very good time.
Its a nice place to visit with loved ones especially with children, Highly recommended.
This is a must visit place with family and dear once specially with the children's. So don't waste more time and visit the place soon.

Unfortunately, with the current renovation project, we couldn't enjoy all of the rides. But overall, it is an enjoyable place to be with your kids. Don't forget to try the turkey legs, the corn dog was a bit different than what I'm expecting
Decent budget, the rides and theatres are awesome. Transformers, mummy, etc
For holidays it's okay..

Enjoyed our family visit to USS alot. It is truly a place which brings a smile to everybody. Some rides are not suitable for children who are too young as there is minimum height limit - do check before making a beeline queue! Food is expensive but decent. Will be back again.

It's not big, so there's no need to open run or run counterclockwise. It's also very hot. Transformers wasn't what I expected, but Mummy was rather bitter. When it's too hot, it's okay to watch a Shrek 4D movie. A must-visit if you're in Singapore! !!
Love the place as it's family friendly with lots of options rides for all ages. Best to go during non-peak period to save queuing time for any rides.

I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore and had an absolutely amazing time! The park is incredibly well-designed and offers a wide variety of attractions for all ages. From thrilling roller coasters to interactive shows, there's something for everyone. The staff at the park were all friendly and helpful, making the experience even more enjoyable. The theming throughout the park was spot-on, with each area feeling like a different world. I especially enjoyed the Hollywood and New York zones, which were incredibly detailed and immersive. The food and drinks available at the park were also delicious and reasonably priced, which was a nice surprise. Overall, I had a fantastic day at Universal Studios Singapore and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and exciting theme park experience.

USS was clean and well-maintained, with every attraction and ride in top-notch condition. The staff were friendly and helpful. They have thrilling roller coasters Battlestar Galactica "Human Vs. Cylon", and exciting simulators like the Tansformers, that made me feel like I was flying through the air. The lines were well-organized and moved rather quickly. In addition to the rides, the park offered a wide variety of entertainment options, including live shows, parades, and interactive exhibits. There were also plenty of food and drink options for you to choose from. Overall, I would highly recommend Universal Studios Singapore to anyone looking for a fun and exciting day out. It's the perfect destination for families, groups of friends, or anyone who wants to experience the thrill of a theme park. Can't wait to go back! Do note to go on a weekday if you would like to save some time queuing!
Best with your kids. My daughter loved her experience here

What a place to be in Singapore, being a 90s kid the place did remember me my childhood. I enjoyed this place and kids would do the same too. They got some awesome ambience to take pictures, and the rides are totally amazing

very limited activities for todlers. Many kids were unable to participate because of the hight issue. Some taff members are acting very rude (specially indied the shows, if your toldler scared and you want to go out you will face this.)

Not many activities (less than or equal to 5) for kids less than 5 yrs. Could have been more. Very less personnel to assist or provide information. No vegetarian in most of the hotels in Universal studios. Making it 3 star primarily due to the shrek 4 d show, sesame show, Egypt ride...

I went with my 1 year old child. There are few rides that you can ride with small children, The atmosphere was different from Japan, and the people were very lively! It's very hot, so don't forget to stay hydrated!
Ok, but it does feel a bit tired in places. Not a lot of rides, youd expect more. Good food options.

Super fun but crazy busy (as most theme parks are). Recommend doing the "single riders" option as much as possible otherwise you spend most of the time queuing (even with a fast pass). There are water fountains dotted throughout the park, so take an empty drink bottle if you don't mind carrying a bag. If I could change anything, I'd want the park to stay open until 8pm to allow for families with older children and adults to enjoy the park for longer.
Good for kids..much smaller..but enough to spend a good outing..usually crowded..start from the end to avoid queues..
Good for youths
Nice theme park for individuals and families to visit and enjoy.

USS is a fantastic place for the entire family! My kids love everything about this place. Its good to note that many of the rides have a height requirement so my kids couldnt ride most of them. Be sure to check out the show timings & schedule.

I recently visited Universal Studio Singapore and had a blast! The park is a paradise for movie fans and thrill-seekers alike. From the moment I entered, I was transported to a magical world filled with action-packed rides and stunning attractions. The park is also perfect for families with kids, with a wide range of child-friendly rides and shows. My personal favourite was the Revenge of the Mummy ride, which was a thrilling rollercoaster that took me through dark tunnels filled with fire, mummies, and sudden drops. I also loved the Hollywood Dreams Parade, which featured colourful floats and lively performances that left me dancing and singing along. Overall, I had an amazing experience at Universal Studio Singapore and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Singapore. It's a world-class theme park that is sure to leave you with unforgettable memories.

Live up to the recommendation. The services are well Organised. The rides are fun. The buildings are all nicely built and very instagramable. Overall we had an excellent experience. This is the place that you cannot miss to visit if you come to Singapore.
The place is really fun for both adults and children. I highly recommend the rollercoasters. Will definitely come back.
One of the best entertainment place for adults and kids in Singapore..
Recommended to buy Single Time Express Pass and also there are many height restrictions for kids for the rides in Universal Studio.
Only 3-4 major rides are good rest are for kids. Cyclone, mummy, transformers, jurrasic park. Can skip express pass. Que waiting time is general less in the evening. Plan accordingly.
It is ok for half day spend for kids.
Nice place for kids,must include in Singapore itinerary. Its in sentosa Iceland.
Like to visit with family
pleasant trip to brought along family members...
Good place to hang around with family. Enjoy the ride so much!
Great Experience. Superb Rides. Best place for kids to enjoy and friends day out.
best place to go in Singapore with Family Friends and lovedones

Amazing experience, so much fun not only for kids but also for adults as well. One of the must-visit places in Singapore. My picks were the Transformers ride, Jurassic Park Ride, mummy ride also Shrek 4D experience.

Amazing place with rides and fantasy world of kids. Its like a world made for kids. Huge area and a lot of walking needed and ifs best to carry water with you. Since basically you walk a lot so its best to carry a cap with you. Food joints are there inside but water is preferable to be carried along and you can refill it at various places as the water is good and can be drunk straight from tap

Great place for both kids and adults. The park was quite big and very clean, the attractions were great, loved the transformers. We came on a holiday term and rainy day, so either long queue or temporary closed attractions, but after rain the queue was actually ok and we managed to see most of them. Definitely will visit again one day we visit Singapore.

I am worried why this is rated 5 star. One of the worst experiences of my life. This is a total commercial thing, with no attention to families with kids. Stay away from here, else you'll definitely be irritated. Unnecessarily hyped up thing.

My family of 4 (with a girl 8yo and boy 5yo) went to USS ytd (29Jun2023) over the Public Holiday. As both my kids were first time riders of the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, both my wife and I assured them that we will sit with them separately on the ride and they can sit in the middle for added safety since they are dinosaurs fan, just not rides, but we thought we let them try and hopefully like it. For context, 2 yrs ago my girl was 6yo and she would freak out even taking the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase! She literally cried out loud during and after the ride! Nevertheless, we indicate to the staff at the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure that we are of 2pax each (My wife with my daughter, and myself with my son) so that both kids can sit in the middle. We were assigned a ride which already has a family of 3, so both my kids took the remaining middle seats and both my wife and I sat by their side. However there's an adult couple whom came over and told us that they are of 2pax and would like to sit together as two. Despite explaining to the staff our situation, eventually my daughter was made to sit at the other side of my son's, while I'm at the other end. And my wife had to extend herself to reach over to hold my girl's hand to calm her even before the ride began. I in the end tried to hold both my son's and daughter's hand throughout. Regardless of our best effort, both of my kids screamed and cried throughout the entire boat ride! No thanks to the staff's arrangement! Don't understand why we have to make such arrangement even though my family had already agreed and indicated to split up. They could have assigned single rider to sit on each of the other remaining sides. In any case, my kids decided not to come to USS anymore in future, no thanks to you USS! Lest to say, that was our last ride of the day, as we didn't take any further rides and cut short our day and left shortly after.

Revenge of the Mummy ride seat size is not for Western adults - they're made for short people. I'm 5 feet 10 and my legs felt uncomfortable in the narrow gap between seat and safety bar so I got out. This ride should be upgraded if overseas tourists will go.

Not Friendly for Disabled Wheelchair bound people / who can't walk. There's No lift from Car drop area to ground level. If you carry your own wheelchair then it's ok but shifting to Rides not easy. On rental manual wheelchair available Such an advance Country but No motorised wheelchair surprisingly
Nice theme park for the family, more suitable for adults and teenagers. Fun and exhilarating rides! Be prepared for queues!

Just leave your backpacks at home. On Galactica you are not even allowed to take your cell phone with you, no wallet or anything. Everything must be included. The lockers are free for 40 minutes only. Afterwards you have to pay a fine of four Singapore dollars. A little further away, when the mummy returns, the lockers are free for 60 minutes and later even for 90 minutes. You can even take your cell phone with you on the roller coaster. But neither are backpacks. When the mummy returns there is a single line. But if it is too full it will also be closed. I was there when the park opened and managed to ride Galactica seven times and the Mummy six times. After that the park became so full that queuing was no longer fun. I also really liked the 4D animation Shrek... all in all a very nicely laid out park but quite small. No comparison to Euro Disney Europapark or Parque Aventura in Spain... If you decide early, you can get cheaper tickets from some providers. You can also book at the park on the day itself
Universal Studios is not bad, suitable for bringing children to play
Not much for small kids.. its mainly for rides

Brought my little one to Universal Studios Singapore on a weekend and we managed to take amazing photos. I am thankful that USS Is child friendly and I could push her pram through the whole park. Will revisit again.

We had a good time in Universal in June 2023. However, some rides were not operating due to Cyclone prediction (in Jurassic Park), Jurassic Park Rapids, but a must try are- Battlestar Galactica (go only if u love adventure and if you are not scared of height), Revenge of the Mummy, Transformers-SD, Shrek show if you are Shrek lover like us:). Things to keep in mind- better to fix a meeting spot and time with your family, as you are not allowed to carry phone and other items with you, so, tracking becomes an issue. Take a locker, keep your belongings there, fix a meeting time & spot, so, that you all can meet after a few rides....full day is needed, so, better to start early, carry a water bottle as you need to walk alot, so, staying hydrated is must. Wear sneakers or comfortable shoes, in which you can walk more and more....wear a cap and sunglasses, wear lot of sunscreen, as it is sunny most of the time and everyone in the family, keep some cash, so, that, even if you are away from other members, you can enjoy the yum food in Universal. A must in your Singapore trip, though we had been to Ferrari world- Dubai, but this surely was fun. *Tips- You can take an express pass, if you do not like to wait much and ready to pay double the price, Express que is separate, but relatively less waiting. We took the normal ticket and had to wait for 30-45min per ride.

The universal studios is one of the most popular and unique place in Singapore. Children loved a lot. They are loving to often that place, bze of so many rides. I love that bze I want to see my daughter's smiling face , want hear loudly Lough while riding. All much go every year..

Looking for a fun and exciting way to bond with your colleagues? Look no further than USS (Universal Studios Singapore)! I recently had the pleasure of visiting the park with my colleagues and had a blast from start to finish. The rides and attractions at USS are truly top-notch - from thrilling roller coasters like Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON and exciting immersive experiences like Transformers: The Ride - The Ultimate 3D Battle. Whatever your preference, there's something for everyone to enjoy here. Overall, I would highly recommend USS to anyone looking for a fun and thrilling day out with their colleagues. The park is well-designed, well-maintained, and packed with fun and exciting attractions for all tastes and ages. Don't miss out on this incredible experience!
Its a wonderful place to go on vacation with family. Affordable price. Great tourist attraction. The rides are all fun for all ages. Would recommend and will come again.

Holidays with my children who are excited to try the rides available at Universal Studios Singapore, but because of the school holiday season the queues for tickets and entry to each ride are incredibly long, almost 1 hour more to queue. I suggest bringing an umbrella or raincoat because not all queues have a roof, and the season in Singapore is unpredictable, the hot heat can turn into heavy rain, there are several rides you should use waterproof footwear, or you will go back to the hotel with soaked shoes and socks
Was small compared to the Orlando Universal, but enough to keep your family occupied for the day. Would suggest to get the Express pass in advance
This is the smallest universal in the world One thing to remind everyone is that kid under 4 years old dont need a ticket or a fast pass to play here. Baby can come with parents for free.
Worth a visit especially for teenage kids, please take ticket in advance as they close the gate if the capacity is reached. One can take express pass on reaching the resort if there is a long lime
