Having lots of fun here. Enjoy the riding especially the Egypt one. More prefer come on non public holiday, otherwise you will not have enough time to line up all the attractions expect you brought the fast pass
Universal Studios Singapore offers a diverse range of themed attractions based on popular movies and TV shows, a really good place for family and friends to share moments
Spent a great half-day there. Was super fun but the rides are rather for kids. Organization and food supply was good.
Very busy. One ride can queue for a very long time. It's best to buy a VIP ticket. Lots of places to eat and bars. There are casinos etc. Kids will definitely love it here.
Best place for Kids and Family Need to reduce Line

You can enjoy the adventure with your family. We strongly recommend making an express reservation online in advance. Jurassic Adventure can be covered in water - it is a more intense adventure than in Korea.

Visiting Universal Studios was a dream come true for me. We had a fantastic time as we experienced almost all the rides, and each one was thoroughly enjoyable. The size of the park is impressive, and it truly requires a full day to explore everything it has to offer. The variety of rides cater to all age groups, and there are plenty of excellent dining options available as well. Among all the rides, the Transformer ride stood out as a personal favorite. Its excitement and thrill left a lasting impression on me. I'm already looking forward to the opportunity to visit Universal Studios again in the future.

One of the most favorite amusement parks for children There are many activities to do, there are 7 zones to enter. If you want to play hit rides such as Transformer, Mummy, Cylon, Human, you must hurry to get there before others. Because people are going to queue up a lot. The various shows were fun. The kids especially liked the minions. Make sure to download the USS app to view player information. and waiting time for playing each rides zone as well. I'm sure everyone love this place!!!
If your wanting too go on the bigger rides, I wouldn't go today as they pretty much all closed hahah waste of money I guess unless you have younger kids
Well, too small for so many people. Complicated to handle... just take a look at Phantasialand in Cologne... that's how it works with the backpacks. Sorry... nice job but not good enough...

I was super excited take my 3 kids to Universal studios in Singapore but I felt it was not worth the excitement. There weren't that many excting rides to go on just average rides with long waiting times. There are beautiful surroundings for pictures and shops to buy things but overall my experience was just average. I would recommend to buy tickets in advance and plan your trip in advance to avoid disspointment at the entrance. We experienced that on a Saturday. I think it is pretty crowded on weekends. So it's good if you can avoid a weekend.

If you want to take your children to play at last minute, it is recommended to buy tickets on travel platforms such as klook or kkday. The price difference is not big, but you may get meal vouchers when you buy tickets online. I have been to Universal Studios in Japan and the United States, and Singapore is really much smaller! If you are just taking your children and dont want to play any exciting rides, you dont necessarily need to buy a quick pass. Ps. The summer weather in Singapore is very hot all year round. You should drink more water and pay attention to the physical condition of yourself and your companions.
Nothing much changed, rides and attractions barely changed. Still fun nonetheless, very accommodating to seniors and pwds. Easy transportation to and from Food options need more diversity though
Good place to visit with kidz. Nice to have express pass if you want to cover all rides
Good facilities for family Huge place and area But some places not active!
The place is superb for kids. Lots of places to visit and the food from the restaurant is really good.

This place is for every age range ! Bring out your childhood energy and enjoy the atmosphere which full of joy and happiness. Cant want to see minion zone to open by 2024! Will go there again for sure! What a lovely place.
Great great great! Get fast track to not wait in the queue. Its always busy. But kids loved it!
Awesome fun and brilliant rides. Kid friendly too

Best for family travel! Came on Friday so I was satisfied playing here with the kids. Almost all the rides were tested, except for the outdoor ones, some failed to ride because it suddenly rained. Even though I've been dreaming of flying on the Battlestar Galactica. I can only walk when I'm tired, around 6am when I'm about to close. Next trip! The strategy remains, go from the furthest first and focus indoors first.

Avoid weekend and public holiday, manage to only go on 3 rides and if you have kids below 4 ensure to bring a stroller and carrier, Lastly do ensure to purchase the express pass in advance it was sold out on the day we went.
For normal entry at-least we have to wait 1hr to enter each ride. Better enter through single ride. Too hot. If u r planning to go with baby then it is a bad idea.
Its nice but quite expensive and small. If you avoid the weekend the waiting time is fine. You can do everything in a day. Food wise you can go outside, its a little cheaper
expect longer ques entering and rides on weekends, but the kids and kids at heart enjoyed the experience

Out of all universal parks in the world, this is not the best but still fun and what you make it We went knowing that after watching videos and reviews. I would give it a 6.5/10 for a day park. It's not a must do but great if you need to do something for the day in the Singapore area. Please note it is limited on attractions if it rains. I don't mean a sprinkle but downpour that an umbrella can't save you. (We loved it) The big rollar coaster takes forever to board compared to any roller coaster in the world and wins the worst smell on the b.o que. The mummy attraction is the best and a must do. Transformers was the popular attraction with a 50 min wait in September. The food was good and fresh for a theme park. (Keywords theme park) The cookie monster desserts were good. Other rides it was 10 to 30 min wait so not bad at all. Alot of cute photo ops. If you have kids, there is plenty to do. However, remember to plan around in case a surprise rain shower happens. Rain can be unpredictable in this climate and we knew that going in. Ladies, bring pads especially if you are late or think you skipped. They do not have anywhere or near the park. You will only be able to use toilet paper.
It's really nice here, it's a bit hot, bring an umbrella or hat... don't forget to bring a drink for your little one...
Good place to visit with family, it has many entertainment area to visit.

Beautiful Place in Singapore, Specially good for kids above 6 years, There is lot of walk while visiting universal studio, Lot of rides big & small, Beautiful live Street shows, Amazing 5D theatre, Great Animation, must visit place
Been here and the best ride that I will never forget is the Transformer. Looking forward to bring my kids on this awesome place.
Great Experience... Adventures, Beauty, Cleanliness, Delicious Food, and Everything you seek on Holidays & weekends. Enjoyed alott.

Universal studios Singapore is really good for families. Its not really big so is easy to ride all the atttactions. The best part is that most of the attraction wont have more than 20-30 minutes waiting time.

This place was just amazing!! I went there with my 2 kids (7 and 18) and they both had so much fun! There are lots of rides and stuff to do. The Queues are so short ( maximum 30 minutes). Both my kids loved the rollercoasters and were very sad to go home. There is a large variety of rides from slowly and small to extreme and fast which were perfect for kids any age. The food is so cheap and very tasty and we had lots of fun buying some souvenirs at the many shops. I hundred percent recommend this place and if you just read all of this: DO NOT GO THERE AND SAVE YOUR MONEY IT WAS THE WORST EXPERIENCE IVE EVER HAD!
Every one should go for visit, along with kids

Universal Studios is a hot attraction and by hot, I mean popular but also HOT! There isnt a lot of shady spots and if you know Singapore, the heat is a scorcher. That said, Universal is still great for thrill seekers and those that are 6 and above. Young kids will still enjoy the sights, meet n greets and the shows but there wont be as many rides for them. Ride lines can be long too, so if you dont have some patience, youll be in for a hell of a ride. If you have been to Japan and visited Universal Studios, Im led to believe this is a lot smaller, a bit more outdated and not as fun, so manage your expectations. Its also definitely no Disneyland but once again, manage those expectations and youll have fun!
Overall it was a fun day with family.Very less rides for kids . Need to wait in queue for long which is a boring thing over here.

It's the most happening place in Asia, I will recommend it you everyone , always pre-book tickets ...one day is not enough to cover everything , jurassic Park raide , mummy ride is awesome...ofcourse mummy ride not recommended for kids , stroller is needed for roaming with kids , it is advisable to bring drinking water bottle , we can refill, it's neat and clean everywhere, express pass tickets may be recommend in busy season

Wow such a nice place, visited twice last week. Enjoyed with rainy climate which made the trip most excited. We enjoyed all the rides there. Mummy was very scary, but i can never forget the experience. It is always better to visit along with same age category people. That makes more fun.

Lovely place! In the heart of Sentosa, the rides are all of good quality and has a good balance of children friendly and adult friendly rides! Overall, the staff are also effective and efficient! Great experience!

USS is a must visit place in Singapore. Many fun and adventure activities to do. Kids love this place . Weekend getaway spot for singaporean is sentosa island. Universal studios in sentosa is perfect place to spend quality time with family especially kids. This was an awesome experience for not just my kid but also for us. Be prepared to walk. Also if you are thinking about not getting the Universal Express pass, then my suggestion is to get it. We took the normal tickets and had to wait for 60 mins for some attractions in a weekday. With the pass, you'd have a different queue with little to no wait time. Do visit as early as you can do that you can enjoy all the shows as well as the different meet and greet. If you are visiting Singapore, then Universal Studios is a must visit attraction.
Fantastic family day out great rides and entertainment

A nice park to spend the day with children, if you like strong attractions I can tell you that there are only 2 in the park, the rest is for small children. If you have children it is ideal. The food inside the park is very expensive, a pizza with a drink 80.
It's a good place to visit at least once because there aren't many people and there are some rides that you can't ride at other Universal parks. Be sure to see Water World!
Nice to come and visit. Lots of activities for families with children. You should buy tickets quickly to avoid waiting.

Encourage to buy tickets prior, and if upgrade is necessary, we could do it in the counter. Went on a weekday and decided to risk it by not upgrading, but luckily, it wasn't crowded, so it didn't make a difference between all day, express, or vip tickets. Went in as early as 10 am. The map gained through scanning the qr code was a little help to plan to meet and greets, rides, and shows. Advised to bring ponchos or raincoats and a change so it saves cos not to buy a poncho and queue up for dryer. Sunscreen cream, if needed and water bottles, will be good. Kids below 122cm should always be accompanied by parents otherwise you can leave your little ones to have a little adventure. Enjoyed the rides especially the sci fi was my favourite and fortunate to go twice. Toilets were ample.and clean, ample.finger food though pricey and minion ride will be an added adventure in 2024 as its under construction.
Beautiful sets but not much for adults to do. Great for kids though. Really nice immersive experience if you love Jurassic Park, Shrek, Sesame Street etc but its a bit small for 50 per adult ticket

Awesome!!!! Great safety family friendly place to spend holyayyyy!!

It is an entertainment mecca. From blockbuster, thrill rides to shows that light up the night, there's something for everyone, and I would recommend going. Children under five are also not given much appreciation.

A super awesome place in Sentosa. Plenty of rides and shows. I highly recommend the place. Aware of the height restrictions if you are traveling with your child. And free entry for kids below 4 years old.

Kid-Friendly Magic at Universal Studios Singapore Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic playground for kids. The colorful and immersive environment, filled with beloved movie characters, kept my little ones wide-eyed with wonder. The variety of rides and attractions were well-suited for different age groups, providing endless excitement. From meeting favorite characters to thrilling rides, the park offers a delightful mix of entertainment. While some queues were inevitable, the overall experience was seamless, and the staff's friendliness added to the positive atmosphere. Family-friendly dining options made it easy to refuel between adventures. Universal Studios Singapore is undeniably a great place for kids, offering a magical day out that balances thrills with enchanting moments. A solid four-star experience for family fun!

I always wanted to visit a Universal studio and glad I did. Singapore studio is a fantastic place for young and old. As a lover of the Transformers franchise of movie I was hesitant to take the 3 D experience Ride, Eavan at the age of 63 I totally enjoyed the experience. From the replication of streets of Hollywood to the amazing and somewhat scary roller coster rides to the family friendly theatres and shows for kids this was a must for our trip to Singapore. Ticket prices are all inclusive and well worth 96 sg dollars for Adults. I would recommend setting aside a full day to be able to see and experience as much possible .
Great family time in Universal Studios. Transformers 4D ride is the best!

OK so I'm a 50 mum of two strapping boys, thought I'd be a bag-minder for the day BUT NO I went on quite a few of the rides and loved every minute! It's a fantastic day out, would recommend it to anyone. So well organised, clean, efficient and friendly - everything we know the Singaporeans do so very well! It's a quality theme park. Just go. Get the express pass and enjoy. It's really worth it.

There are too many facilities that children cannot play in. It is not recommended to bring children under elementary school. Some facilities that can be played inside may frighten children. Can I ride a small roller coaster that is 92 centimeters long? And no explanation of what a roller coaster is? (Is this a mainland term? Not all Chinese-speaking countries know the term), and there is no reference video? Universal Studios certification standards are so weird The child was so frightened that his entire trip abroad was disrupted. He woke up crying every day from nightmares and was so scared that he lost his mind... I was frightened twice when I returned to Taiwan...I was scared to death. I can only say dont go there again, and you cant play anything. Its a waste of money.

Place for young people to go and play

It is recommended to watch performances, 4D movies, Evil Cats, and Sesame Street, which are highly acceptable to children as young as 6 years old. It was okay, not too wow as only a few rides for adult thats exciting, the other half was mainly for kids. Now however, Starbucks experience was very bad!! We ordered ice americano but had to wait 30mins because they prioritised online app order.
fun area to go with kids or as a couple

We literally spent the entire day on this fun place. I like this better than Disneyland. Lots of fun ridea appropriate for age. Universal Studios Singapore has great organization, safety and really shows they care about the customer's welfare. Line could be long but have notice before getting in line. Food and beverage stalls are ubiquitous. Restaurants are great. Attractions are fun and good for families. Very friendly staff.
We have privilege of enjoying VIP experience, much recommended, the tour guide was excellent! Experiences and shows were great! Its a must visit specially if you have kids!

Universal Studios Singapore exceeded all my expectations ! The park is packed with thrilling rides, stunning shows, and immersive experiences that truly bring your favorite movies to life. The attention to detail is impeccable, and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Whether you're a thrill-seeker or just looking for a fun day out with the family or spouse, Universal Studios Singapore has something for everyone.

Universal Studios Singapore offers an exhilarating experience for visitors of all ages, boasting a diverse array of attractions that cater to both kids and adults alike. From thrilling rides to beloved character encounters, there's something for everyone to enjoy. For adrenaline-seeking adults, attractions like the Transformers Ride, The Mummy roller coaster, The Lost World and the sci-fi roller coaster provide heart-pounding excitement and immersive experiences. These rides offer a perfect blend of thrills and entertainment, leaving guests craving for more. Meanwhile, for the younger ones, Universal Studios Singapore offers an enchanting world filled with their favorite characters. From the whimsical world of Shrek to the mischievous antics of the Minions, kids are treated to memorable encounters and interactive experiences that ignite their imagination and spark joy. Among the standout attractions for kids are the Trolls, Shrek, and Minions experiences, which are not only entertaining but also educational and interactive. These attractions provide a perfect balance of fun and learning, ensuring that children have a truly magical and unforgettable time at Universal Studios Singapore. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore stands out as a must-visit destination for families, offering a thrilling and immersive experience that will create cherished memories for years to come. Whether you're a thrill-seeker or a young adventurer, there's no shortage of excitement and wonder to be found within its gates.
Superb to take kids along .. it's a amusement park .. Rides for kids, adults and both. Walking is too much there so need to carry sports shoes compulsory and food along.

Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute gem! The park's vibrant atmosphere, thrilling rides, and captivating shows make it a must-visit destination. From the jaw-dropping Transformers ride to the magical world of Shrek, every corner offers an immersive experience. The attention to detail is impeccable, and the friendly staff adds to the overall positive vibe. Whether you're a movie buff or just seeking a fun-filled day, Universal Studios Singapore delivers pure joy and excitement for visitors of all ages.

Universal studios Singapore is alright, though I felt like it is very small as compared with Universal studios LA. Nice place to spend a day with family.

I have a mixed opinion. Of course kids will enjoy Jurassik Park or Far far away areas. But the park is very small with not a lot of rides for small children (5 and under). A MUST VISIT WHEN YOU GO TO SINGAPORE. Universal studios has a wide range of rides including roller coasters & other shows that are fun to watch. There are rides and shows for every age group, right from the 5 year old to 85 years old. For kids under the age of 5, it may not be a great place to visit if rides is the purpose of visit. Most of the rides require a minimum height which mostly comes after the age of 5. Universal studios itself is a great place to check out if you have small kids and/or you are not so keen for rides. Do carry your caps and a water bottle (If you do not want to buy water after every ride LOL) to protect yourself from all the heat and to keep the body hydrated.

I remember it being difficult because there were so many people and it was so hot;; Although it is small, it seems like a worthwhile place. If you go diligently, you can try many different rides. The rides are definitely very fun, and the shows are of very high quality. If you work hard, you won't waste money I don't know if the kids are older, but it seems a bit difficult for younger kids. I think it's good that they put the express service in first

Went on March 19, 2024, arrived at 10:30 a.m., took a quick photo of the front and walked in immediately. How to take a bus to the USS from Vivocity. In front of the bus stop, walk to the right and there will be a RWS8 bus stop. Pay cash for 1 per person. It takes about 20 minutes (good savings, get to sit and watch the view on the side of the road). Park at the Casino, walk straight, turn left and go up the escalator to the USS. Price comparison card from Klook Trip and Agoda Klook had a 10% discount so I got it for 1,980 baht, for the child it was 1,480 baht, bought it close to the day of the trip. Check the waiting time for the ride in the Universal SG app. The waiting time is not long, so don't buy Express. There are very few people inside, so you can play Transformer without having to wait in long queues. Then go to Jurassic Ride inside first, there are few people as well. Bags must be deposited in a locker for 4. Bring a raincoat. In conclusion, I didn't wear it and it didn't get as wet as I thought. (But other people were very wet) Played a lot of things. There were hardly any queues. Walking was comfortable. The weather was very hot. Download the app and look at meet&greet times. It helps a lot. Come take photos with the mascots and meet a lot of dinosaurs. Which rides stop being renovated when the park opens? Download the app to check in advance. Last time I played Mummy and almost fainted. I didn't play anything further. This time, I'm taking a break. 555 Enter the Goldilocks restaurant next to Puss in Boots. They don't accept cash. Visa and Mastercard only. You can use youtrip and tap to pay. The food is very expensive, but you can refill soft drinks and unlimited drinks. Sit and fill up the whirlpool until it's worth it. because of the hot weather The cotton candy kiosk next to the mummy requires cards only, no cash accepted. We planned to stay until closing but the children and elderly couldn't handle it. We returned at 4:30 p.m.

I had so much fun visiting with my family. It is super busy on the weekend so I would suggest you getting the express lane pass. My son loved meeting the team from Seseme Street and getting a photo with them. The Grover Space ride was super fun and visiting Shrek in his castle was a highlight. I enjoyed the roller coasts too. Highly recommend visiting when you visit Sentosa Island during your stay in Singapore.

Universal Studios Singapore was the best experience we've ever had. We visited with our 2-year-old child, and from the entrance to the end, we had an incredible time. The theme park offers a variety of attractions and entertainment suitable for all ages, making it a perfect destination for families. We went on a Sunday, and while it was a bit crowded, the overall excitement and fun overshadowed the wait times, which sometimes reached up to 90 minutes. The park's design and attention to detail are impressive, creating an immersive experience that keeps you entertained throughout the day. Despite the crowds, the experience was well worth it. The staff were friendly and helpful, adding to the positive atmosphere. For anyone considering a visit, we highly recommend Universal Studios Singapore. Just be prepared for possible long lines, especially on weekends.
Very nice and beautiful place for family tour. Have a great enjoy in Singapore

Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute gem for anyone looking to have a fun-filled day! From the moment you step inside, youre transported to a world of excitement and adventure. The park is impeccably clean and well-maintained, making the experience even more enjoyable. The variety of rides and attractions is truly impressive. Whether youre a thrill-seeker looking for an adrenaline rush on the Battlestar Galactica roller coasters or prefer a more relaxed experience like the enchanting Madagascar: A Crate Adventure, theres something for everyone. The themed zones are incredibly immersive, and the attention to detail is top-notch. The live shows are another highlight, offering a great mix of entertainment and interactive fun. The WaterWorld show is a must-see, with its spectacular stunts and special effects. The character meet-and-greets are also a big hit, especially for families with young children. The staff at Universal Studios Singapore are friendly and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile. The food options are diverse and cater to various tastes, ensuring that no one goes hungry. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore offers a fantastic day out filled with fun, laughter, and unforgettable memories. Its a must-visit for both tourists and locals alike!

Universal Studios Singapore is hugely better than the Disney franchises that I have been to. Yes you are bombarded with every movie character, but at least there is choice and variety and not just a mouse with black ears! This theme park is incredibly clean and well run. I visited outside of the school holidays which definitely made the trip that much more pleasant and easy to navigate. Getting there via MRT was awesome. Another credit to the the super-efficient Singaporean government. And once you were in the Universal Studios park area, it seemed spacious, clean and lots to look at and do. There are so many rides (for all ages) and I have to say, I had a blast with my wife and seven year old son. One tip: pay for the premium ticket. Lines are long and it is worth every cent to not hang around and spend your time doing things. I ate at the Hawker's Market which was really inexpensive and actually pretty good. A great family day with so many good memories. Do it!

We visited Universal studios on Sunday afternoon. The place opens at 10:30am. We took a train ride from Harbour front station to Rivers World Station and purchased tickets. It's a short rail ride from there to reach Universal studios. The place was very crowded. They had many interesting adventure rides based on many themes such as Mummy, Transformers, Shrek, Jurassic park etc. If you have kids older than 7 yrs, they will absolutely love the place. Food options are also available. No matter your age, you must try Both roller coasters, mummy and transformers ride as they are worth every penny. On weekends rides have long wait times up to 70 mins, so please download the SG app and check wait time before getting in line.

Attention !!! Buy Express pass or go single - This place is Not recommended for family with kids below 4 years !!! My strong advise is to buy Express pass to avoid really really really long queues which may go from 60 mins upto 120 minutes in a intense humid day. Most rides are prioritised for Express pass holder which is really frustrating to wait and see them passing quickly and standard ticket holders being neglected and delayed almost in some rides. Pls be mindful that most of the big attractions are not for children below 4 years (height wise) so I dont recommend really to go with kids of that age as apart from gift shops, there is nothing really for them. For adults better buy a Express pass (allowed once per ride) or go alone in "Single" queue (incase allowed) as most of the time single queue is closed. One day is enough if u reach at 10am and come out at closing time. Overall the place is obviously great to be at. Rides to go for... 1. Jurassic Park Boat Ride 2. Revenge of Mummy Ride 3. Transformer Ride 4. Waterworld Hollywood Live show 5. Light Camera & Action Show
Frankly, it is very bad, crowded and tiring for the children

Universal Studios is a magical experience, offering a perfect blend of excitement, adventure, and immersive entertainment. It is filled with filmy entertainment, rides that give you adrenaline rush, truly fun activities for kids. Perfect for a day having fun with family and friends, this theme park has something special for everyone. The park is divided into various themed zones, each transporting you into a different cinematic universe. From the glitzy streets of Hollywood to the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City, the attention to detail is impeccable. Walking through these zones feels like stepping into the movies themselves. The vibrant colors, iconic landmarks, and thematic music all contribute to an immersive atmosphere that captivates visitors from the moment they step in. It offers a wide variety of rides that cater to different age groups and thrill levels. The twists, turns, and inversions deliver an adrenaline rush that is hard to match. The Transformers: The Ride is an absolute highlight. This 3D dark ride combines cutting-edge technology with immersive storytelling to create an exhilarating experience that leaves you on the edge of your seat. For families with younger children, the Madagascar: A Crate Adventure boat ride and Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase offer fun and excitement without being too intense. These rides are beautifully designed with vibrant characters and engaging storylines, making them enjoyable for both kids and adults. The live shows at Universal Studios Singapore are not to be missed. The WaterWorld show, in particular, is a spectacular performance filled with high-octane stunts, pyrotechnics, and special effects. The cast is incredibly talented, and the show is packed with action from start to finish. Its a thrilling experience that keeps you on the edge of your seat. In addition to the shows, the character meet-and-greets are a big hit, especially with the younger visitors. Meeting iconic characters like Shrek, the Minions, and the cast of Madagascar adds an extra layer of magic to the day. The food options within the park are diverse, catering to various tastes and dietary preferences. Whether youre in the mood for a quick snack or a sit-down meal, theres something for everyone. The themed restaurants, not only serve delicious food but also add to the overall immersive experience. Prices are what youd expect in a theme park, but the quality and variety make it worth it. The staff at Universal Studios Singapore are friendly, helpful, and go out of their way to ensure that visitors have a smooth and enjoyable experience. Even on busy days, they manage the crowds efficiently, and the queues for rides move at a reasonable pace. Tips: Get there early to utilise full day and enjoy all attractions. The Express Pass can be a good investment on busier days, helping you skip the lines and enjoy more attractions. Dont forget to bring sunscreen, as much of the park is outdoors. Also, bring a pair of fresh clothes if youre planning on enjoying all water rides or buy ponchos from nearby stores in the park to protect yourself from getting wet. Most likely you will which is another kind of fun. A fresh pair of clothes will come in handy in these situations or if it rains.
Great day out for the family , excellent rides affordable food choices . Go early and get on the rides easily.

Universal Studios is an absolute blast! The thrilling rides, immersive experiences, and detailed sets make you feel like you're stepping into your favorite movies. The Jurrasic world is a must-see, and the staff are incredibly friendly. A perfect day for all ages!

Universal Studios Singapore was an absolute blast! The rides were thrilling, especially the Transformers, and the themed zones were immersive and fun for all ages. My family and I had an incredible time with endless fun and excitement. Its a must-visit for an unforgettable day in Singapore!

Universal Studios Singapore is a favorite destination for both adults and children alike. The variety of rides cater to all ages, providing thrills and excitement for everyone. The park is also filled with souvenir shops and food stalls at every turn, making it the perfect place to shop and dine. Weekends at Universal Studios Singapore can get quite crowded, so it is advisable to arrive early to beat the queues. Waiting times for popular rides such as Battlestar Galactica and Transformers can be as long as an hour, especially if you have a standard ticket. Despite the crowds, the shows at Universal Studios Singapore are always spectacular and worth watching. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore offers a fun-filled day for the whole family. From heart-pounding rides to entertaining shows, there is something for everyone to enjoy. So grab your friends and family and head to Universal Studios Singapore for a day of fun and adventure.

Wow. You can't write in words. had a blast in here. Universal Studios had one of the best time. Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute gem and one of my favorite places to visit with my family. Each trip feels magical, with its immersive themed zones like Hollywood, Ancient Egypt, and Far Far Away, all beautifully designed. The rides cater to all ageswhether its the thrilling **Battlestar Galactica**, the immersive **Transformers: The Ride**, or family-friendly attractions like **Madagascar: A Crate Adventure**. The live shows, like **WaterWorld**, and the character meet-and-greets add so much fun to the day. Dining options are varied, and the themed restaurants are a treat. The park is clean, well-organized, and perfect for families looking for both excitement and relaxation. Every visit has been unforgettable, and I highly recommend this world-class destination to anyone visiting Singapore. Universal Studios Singapore truly brings movies and fun to life! Pro Tip: Arrive early and consider an express pass to skip long lines. Dont forget to catch the parades and shows!

Awesome place, well managed. Cylon ride, Jurassic Park ride and Transformer ride are must do. Do take stroller service for kids below 5 as it's a lot of walk. Very few options next to none for kids below 5 to enjoy.

I want to express my heartfelt thanks to Ms. Azeezah from Fossil Fuels at Jurassic Park for her exceptional help during my recent visit to USS. I lost my bag, which contained important items like my passports, and was feeling overwhelmed with my children. Ms. Azeezah noticed my distress and immediately stepped in to assist. Thanks to her quick thinking, she helped locate my bag, which had been moved by another family to make more space. Her caring and prompt assistance made all the difference, and Im incredibly grateful for her support. Shes truly an asset to USS! Moreover I had a wonderful day with my kids at USS. Few tips: 1. Go to rides with less than 20 min waiting. 2. Popular rides should be done at 2-4 pm when que is less 3. Water world is a must do along with Cyclone, Jurassic park and Transformers. Shrek 4D show is great if your kids have never been before.

If youre accustomed to theme parks in the USA, particularly the ones in Orlando, this park may feel quite small in comparison. As an adult, I wouldnt necessarily say its worth the visit unless youre here with children. For kids, however, its a different story. The park is very child-friendly, and all the rides, including the roller coasters, are designed specifically with younger visitors in mind. You wont find anything too extreme or thrilling, but the attractions are still engaging and fun for the little ones. What I did enjoy was the ambiance and how beautifully the park is built. The architecture and layout are thoughtfully designed, creating a charming and immersive atmosphere. The surrounding scenery adds to the overall experience, making it pleasant for a stroll even if you dont go on the rides. The pathways, landscaping, and themed areas really make the park feel magical, especially when taking your time to explore. In short, its definitely worth a visit if youre traveling with kids wholl appreciate the rides and attractions. As an adult, while the rides may not be the highlight, the overall setting and walkability of the park can still make it an enjoyable outing.
My kids enjoyed it. Waiting time per ride was ok.
It's better not to go on the weekend, extremely crowded and therefore long waiting times. But in itself very cool and you should do it if you are nearby.

This is a fun place!! Busy crowds but my 18 year old son and I enjoyed the bonus of utilizing the single rider lanes on quite a few of the rides, meaning we skipped past an hour's wait (or longer) and got to the front- it did mean we weren't always together on rides but we didn't mind! Would recommend this if you are 1-2or only 3 adults or less in your group- meant he got to ride some of the big rollercoaster rides multiple times in the afternoon! Bring an umbrella and a parka if you are traveling in the wet season.

Good experience for families with kids or anyone who likes theme parks and rides. One needs to dedicate a whole day and be prepared to walk a lot and wait in queues for all rides. The app was very user friendly and easy to navigate with accurate wait times for each ride. I think it's better to buy tickets on the day when you arrive just in case the weather is not good. Big tip: wear an outfit with zip up pocket so that you can keep your phone on you while queueing and zip it up for the ride. All loose belongings and bags have to be left in a locker outside the ride or with someone not riding. I wanted to buy a rain cover for the raft ride but didn't have anything on me to use the vending machine. Also wear shoes that don't fall off. I really enjoyed the Shrek pancake.

Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic theme park, especially for families and kids! The park is full of fun attractions, with many subtle Disney references scattered throughout, making it a magical experience for fans. My personal favorite was the lazy river ride in the Jurassic Park areait was relaxing and fun, offering a great way to cool off while enjoying the immersive theming. However, do keep in mind that food inside the park can be quite expensive. While there are plenty of dining options, the prices may be higher than expected. Despite that, the experience is definitely worth it, with exciting rides, shows, and themed zones to explore. Highly recommend it for a fun and memorable time!

Magical land for adults who are kids inside. Would recommend Jurassic and the transformers ride One of my favorite memories of Singapore, it's so well maintained. Queues are really long, even on weekdays (visited in Oct), so the priority pass is recommended, another way is to use single line for solo travellers.

"Amazing Experience at Universal Studios Singapore!" I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore with my wife and son, and we had an absolutely wonderful time! The park is full of thrilling rides, fantastic shows, and incredible themed areas. From the exciting roller coasters to the fun-filled attractions, there was something for everyone to enjoy.

Universal Studios Singapore offers a thrilling experience with diverse rides, immersive themed zones, and world-class entertainment. Highlights include the Transformers ride, Jurassic Park Rapids, and Hollywood attractions. Its well-organized, family-friendly, and perfect for all ages. Crowds can be heavy, so plan ahead for shorter wait times.

Buy express tickets really helps you cover all the rides with no or min wait.. the rides are much much more advanced when compared to Lego land.they do have a height limit, if not wrong 100 cm for kids to enjoy most of the rides probably will miss Egypt and roller roaster rides only. The rides are awesome, like rides of Egypt, the jurassic world, transformer, and roller coaster ride. Not to forget 4D movie..I bet you will have wonderful experience with it.. we as adult loved it too :D Good facility of restrooms and food courts (with limited veg options.) Plan your trip in December or January as these two months are comparatively less hotter Don't forget to carry portable fans, hats, tag for kids, some snacks for munching! All in all a wonderful experience if you enjoy good rides. They do have stroller available for kids just after you enter.
There is a Minions exhibition, so there are a lot of Minions everywhere. There are a lot of rides that young children can ride, so it's good to go with children.
Not very very many rides for adults, but still a fun time. Food options leave a bit to be desired, especially for the prices.

We have young children and they enjoyed it. I'm not sure that the rides (except the biggest two) are big enough for teenagers. Prices inside the park are expensive but you do expect that. They say you can't take food in but no one checks your bags.
Good place for kids Some expansions and maintenance currently

Carry packed eatables, empty water bottles with you. Do not miss the transformers, mummy and Jurassic park rides. Check the meet and greet timings and plan your walk accordingly. At the transformers meet and greet, ask a staff to take your photos in your phone and give the other phone to your partner to take videos a the bots will speak to you when you pose for pictures.

Our family had an amazing day at Universal Studios Singapore! Visiting with my wife and our two young kids was such a joy. The park is incredibly family-friendly, with plenty of attractions suited for little ones. We also appreciated how clean and well-organized the park was, making it easy to navigate with strollers. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially when we needed assistance with ride accessibility for our youngest. Dont miss the live showsthe *WaterWorld* stunt performance kept everyone entertained. Tip: Arrive early to maximize your time, and use the family restrooms near zones like Madagascar for convenience. A perfect spot for creating memories with kidswell definitely be back!"

We had such a great day at Universal Studios Singapore! We visited in June, and it was sunny and hot, so we highly recommend bringing a portable fan, especially for kids. We bought our tickets online through Klook, which was much cheaper and more convenient than buying on-site. Definitely recommend purchasing in advance to save time and money! To make the most of your visit, we highly recommend arriving as soon as the park opens, as there are so many rides and shows to enjoyso plan your time wisely! While there werent many halal food options, it wasnt a big issue for us. Also, keep in mind that the toilets dont have bidets, so bringing a portable bidet would be useful. Overall, we had an amazing time enjoying the rides and attractions. Definitely a must-visit for families and theme park lovers!

An unforgettable birthday celebration at USS! We had an amazing time celebrating my wife's birthday at Universal Studios Singapore. The thrilling rides, immersive attractions, and vibrant atmosphere made the day extra special. A pleasant surprise was receiving a birthday voucher from the USS officesuch a thoughtful touch! Some of the best rides we absolutely loved were Battlestar Galactica (both Cylon & Human), Transformers: The Ride, Revenge of the Mummy, and Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure. Each ride was a thrilling experience, and the excitement never stopped! A word of advicegetting the Express Pass (around SGD 120 more) is totally worth it. It saves you from the long queues, ensuring you get the most out of your visit. Without it, the wait times can be quite long, especially on weekends and holidays. Overall, it was a fantastic and memorable experience! **Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fun-filled day in Singapore!

We had an absolutely amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! The park is well-organised, clean, and packed with incredible rides and attractions. Minion Land was the highlight of our visitso much fun, vibrant, and full of energy! The rides were epic, and the attention to detail made us feel like we were right in the world of the Minions. The whole park offers a fantastic mix of thrills and family-friendly experiences, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Definitely a must-visit if youre in Singapore. We cant wait to go back!
Worth having an experience in the universal studio singapore, kids have definitely fun, recommended place to everyone

Long lines, so its better to get an express pass. Some areas were closed possibly for maintenance rotation but that just puts more pressure on the remaining attractions. There are attractions for adults only, but none specifically for kids. So, strangely enough, I wouldnt really recommend going with children. Youll end up waiting almost everywhere, which is really tough for kids. There are no charging stations, so make sure to charge your phones and bring a power bank. Otherwise, you might end up in a situation like we did: our express passes disappeared, and we couldnt order a taxi, so we had to walk back to the hotel about 5 km because we didnt have any cash on us. Out of all the attractions, we only really enjoyed a few the Shrek show, Transformers, and The Mummy.

Universal is not very extensive, but each ride creates its own experience. Each ride is well conceptualized and a memorable experience. Coming from daylight, it's better to prepare dark glasses, it's glare. The food inside is quite expensive. You don't need to buy mineral water, you can refill it at every restroom. Suitable for families and children over 4 years old.
Lovely way to spend the day, waiting times not long(attend mid march) food good quality

Universal Studios Singapore: Fun for Kids, But Expect Some Hiccups Universal Studios Singapore definitely offers a vibrant and exciting day out, particularly if you have kids in tow. The park is beautifully themed, and seeing characters like the Minions and Optimus Prime in real life brings a genuine sense of wonder to young faces. My children were absolutely thrilled by the Madagascar: A Crate Adventure boat ride and the Puss in Boots' Giant Journey suspended coaster when they were actually running. Unfortunately, our visit was significantly impacted by ride closures. The tropical climate of Singapore meant that several outdoor rides were temporarily shut down due to rain, which is understandable. However, we were also disappointed to find a noticeable number of attractions undergoing maintenance, further limiting our options. This was a real shame, especially for my kids who had been eagerly anticipating certain experiences. Despite the reduced ride availability, there was still enough to keep us occupied for a good portion of the day. The shows were entertaining, and the various themed zones offered plenty of photo opportunities and character meet-and-greets. The Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, even with the potential for getting soaked, was a definite highlight for the whole family. Food and beverage options within the park are plentiful, albeit on the pricier side, which is to be expected in a theme park. The staff were generally friendly and helpful, doing their best to manage the crowds and provide information about ride statuses. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a good experience, especially if your primary focus is entertaining younger children. The park has a unique charm and some genuinely fun attractions. However, the high likelihood of rain-related closures and the potential for maintenance disruptions mean it's not a guaranteed seamless experience. Would I say it's a must-visit in Singapore? Probably not. While we had a good time, the ride closures dampened the overall value proposition. If you have limited time in Singapore and prioritize must-see attractions, there might be other experiences that offer a more reliable and complete experience. However, if you have a few days, are traveling with kids who are big fans of the Universal franchises, and are prepared to be flexible with your itinerary due to potential ride disruptions, then Universal Studios Singapore can be a worthwhile one-time visit. Just be sure to check the park's website for any scheduled maintenance beforehand and be prepared to embrace the possibility of rain delays.

Quite nice for children. But the size leaves something to be desired. The attractions are quite short and unspectacular. 2-3 attractions visited were quite good. But for the money, you expect a lot more entertainment and fun! I hope to visit the studios in the USA.

Certainly not a bad Universal park, but it's very small and on a quiet day (like when we visited) you can do almost everything in 2 or 3 hours. I guess that's not bad as it allows you to get back to your time in Singapore, but it's a quick visit.
Good fun, smaller theme park but lots going on. It's suitable for small kids, lots on offer for them. I went on a week day and there were no lines. Very clean and the food was good value and tasty.
It was fun but I wouldn't go back again, it is very small. Luckily there's not that many ppl, we got to ride some big rides a few times and that's a pro of it.

A magical experience at Universal Studios Singapore! We had an unforgettable day, especially with our 4-year-old son. From the moment we entered, we were immersed in the world of beloved movies and characters. The park is incredibly well maintained, and the staff were friendly and welcoming, making our experience smooth and enjoyable. The rides were suitable for all ages, and my son had an absolute blast. He loved the Sesame Street characters, especially meeting Elmo and Big Bird, which was a dream come true for him. We also enjoyed the interactive play areas that were perfect for his age. The Jurassic Park area was another highlight, with exciting attractions that were thrilling for both adults and children. Although some of the larger rides might have been a bit too intense for younger kids, there were plenty of milder attractions like the Madagascar ride, which was a great fit for our little one. What really stood out was how family-friendly the park is. There are many child-friendly facilities, including spacious baby changing rooms and stroller rentals, which made it so convenient for us as parents. The food options were diverse, catering to all tastes and dietary preferences. The highlight of the day was the parades and shows, which kept my son entertained with vibrant costumes, music, and performances. Even if youre not a huge theme park fan, Universal Studios Singapore offers a full day of fun for the whole family.
Best and best place to visit with kids , friends and family highly recommended

Universal Studios Singapore truly lives up to its reputation as an exceptional theme park. From heart-pounding rides to captivating shows, it offers an unforgettable experience for all ages. Rides: The rides are simply awesome! I was particularly blown away by the Transformer ride a truly immersive and thrilling experience. The Minion and Shrek rides were also fantastic, providing a perfect blend of fun and entertainment. It's important to note that most rides require a minimum height of 102cm, so keep that in mind if you're traveling with young children. Shows: The shows are a major highlight! The outdoor dances, meet-and-greets, and other performances are incredibly engaging and well-executed. The Dinosaurs show is so realistic, it felt like we were witnessing actual prehistoric creatures! For children under 102cm, there are still plenty of opportunities to enjoy the shows from comfortable, stationary seating. Kid-Friendly Fun: My child absolutely adored the Minions and the meet-and-greet sessions. While the rides have height restrictions, the park offers a variety of shows and attractions suitable for younger children. Management and Amenities: The management of Universal Studios Singapore is truly commendable. Parking is well-organized, food options are diverse and delicious, and the park is impeccably clean. The overall organization and attention to detail are top-notch, making the entire experience seamless and enjoyable. The charges are fair for the level of entertainment provided. Overall: Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination. The combination of thrilling rides, captivating shows, and excellent management makes it an unforgettable experience for everyone. I highly recommend it to families, couples, and anyone looking for a day of pure fun and excitement.

Universal Studio Singapore has amazing theme rides and fund activities.It is smaller than I expected but we had a great time here.It is better to visit here during weekdays around 10 am because it is getting crowded later on.The rides are safe and highly recommended for family and couple bonding.There are lots of drinkable water fountains in most entrances of every ride.They also offer 45 minutes to 90 minutes free storage depending on the rides, like Human, Cyclone, the Mummy Returns. I highly recommend the Mummy Returns and the Transformers ride.

A Memorable Day at Universal Studios Singapore A Must-Visit for Families! As an Indonesian tourist visiting Singapore with my family, we were beyond excited for our Universal Studios Singapore adventure and let me tell you, it did not disappoint! From the moment we stepped into the park, the sheer excitement of the iconic movie sets and themed areas took our breath away. First up, we hopped into the world of Sesame Street with the Spaghetti Space Chase. My kids couldn't stop laughing as we joined Elmo and his friends on a fun and quirky space adventure. It was such a fantastic start to the day, setting the tone for all the thrilling rides ahead! Next, we zoomed into action with The Transformers Ride. WOW! The special effects and 3D action made us feel like we were right in the middle of a battle between Autobots and Decepticons. My heart was racing, and my kids were cheering every time Optimus Prime appeared on screen. A must-ride for any action movie fan! Then, we braved the darkness of Revenge of the Mummy, and let me tell you, this rollercoaster is not for the faint of heart! The combination of high-speed twists, turns, and eerie effects had us gripping the safety bars and screaming in excitement. Its a perfect mix of thrills and scares! We then took a more relaxed ride on Dino-Soarin', where my younger ones loved flying around in their very own pterodactyl while we marveled at the giant animatronic dinosaurs. It was a gentle and fun ride to catch our breath before diving into more action-packed experiences. For a moment of laughter, we jumped into the world of Shrek 4D Adventure. The movie was hilarious, and the 4D effects like water sprays and seat movements made us feel like we were part of the story. A great family-friendly experience! The Carousel was next, and we all enjoyed riding the beautifully crafted animals. It was a simple but nostalgic moment where even the adults had fun going around and around. The Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure was the highlight of the day. If you're looking for thrills and chills, this is the ride for you! The water splashes, the sudden drops, and the Jurassic creatures that pop up around every corner kept us on edge and soaked by the end of it! As fans of the adorable cat, we couldn't miss Puss in Boots' Giant Journey. It was a fun, whimsical ride, full of color, excitement, and of course, Puss in Boots' signature charm. Perfect for the whole family to enjoy together! Lastly, we ended the day in the vibrant and exciting Minion Land. My kids were ecstatic to meet their favorite Minions, and we all loved the fun, interactive rides. The bright colors, lively atmosphere, and Minion-themed attractions were simply a delight. Now, while we had an unforgettable time, there was one ride that didnt quite live up to the excitement of the others The Treasure Hunters. It was a slower-paced ride, and honestly, we found it a bit boring compared to the other more thrilling and immersive experiences. But with so many other fantastic attractions, this one small blip didnt take away from the overall fun! In the end, Universal Studios Singapore gave us a day full of thrills, laughter, and unforgettable moments. From heart-pounding rides to family-friendly fun, its an experience that will stay with us long after weve left. Whether youre a thrill-seeker or just looking for a day of joy with your loved ones, this park is the perfect destination. We left with our hearts full of memories and a promise to return. Trust me, this is one adventure you dont want to miss!
Made a mistake by visiting here with my 2 year old child.. most of the rides are for adults

Hmmm... nice place... But I don't know why I felt bore after an hour visiting this place.. Many rides and shows are there.. You will.need a whole day to explore this place. But other then 2or 3 Shows and 2 or 3 rides.. rest are for ages 3 to 9.. elders will easily get bored.
Not as big as expected, like Disneyland, with limited rides. Definitely try the Jurassic Park ride and Human vs. Cyclones ride. The shows were not good, even for children.

Must visit place. Better visit in week days. Also take express tickets if you re going to visit with your children. Because some of the rides have waiting time about one hour for normal tickets. (Dont ask me about the rides...)
Brought my 5 year daughter. Did a few kiddy rides as the other rides were not suitable for her, and she was not keen. Generally, had fun but was expensive.

Our first visit to Universal Studios Singapore was an unforgettable experience, especially for our three kids aged 12, 11, and 6. Right from the entrance, the parks energy pulled them ineach one found something they loved. The younger one was enchanted by the Madagascar zone and the gentle Crate Adventure boat ride, while the older two were all about the thrillzooming straight for Transformers: The Ride and the Revenge of the Mummy coaster. Far Far Away was a family favorite, with the Shrek 4-D Adventure and the impressive castle making everyone feel like part of a fairy tale. What made the day truly special was how the park managed to cater to all their ages so seamlessly. While the older kids got their adrenaline fix on rides like Battlestar Galactica and Canopy Flyer, there were plenty of fun, age-appropriate attractions for our youngest toolike King Juliens Beach Party-Go-Round and Dino-Soarin. We also appreciated the clean, family-friendly spaces, quick service, and the kindness of the staff. The kids didnt stop smiling all day, and we left with tired feet, full hearts, and a promise to come back again.

Fantastic amusement park for the whole family. If possible, it's best to visit on a weekday to avoid long queues for attractions. The cost is quite high but it is definitely worth it. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Singapore with their family
Best attraction in singapore. We can enjoy with family. My daughter enjoy minion land. Their parade is also good.

Just got back from an amazing day at Universal Studios Singapore with the fam and wow, what a blast! From the moment we walked in, the energy was just awesome. The park is super well-organized, clean, and full of fun vibes. We started off with the Transformers ride seriously one of the coolest 3D rides Ive ever been on. The kids were screaming (in a good way), and even the adults were hyped. Then we hit up Jurassic Park, got soaked on the river raft ride, and didnt even care because it was so much fun. One of the highlights? The Minion Mart and all the Despicable Me stuff my little cousin couldn't stop smiling. Oh, and dont miss the Revenge of the Mummy ride if you like a little thrill. Totally worth the wait! There are plenty of food options too from quick snacks to proper meals. We grabbed lunch at one of the themed diners and even found some halal choices, which was a plus for our family. Overall, it was such a wholesome day full of laughter, a bit of adrenaline, and tons of unforgettable memories. Whether you're with kids, teens, or just a bunch of fun-loving adults, Universal Studios Singapore is totally worth the trip!

An incredible park. Before opening, they had someone do an activity to keep everyone entertained. The rides are amazing! It is very kid and family friendly. I would recommend going on the Transformers 3d ride. Id you plan properly, you can have an amazing day with almost 0 wait time

Not bad to play! However, kindergarten children are more afraid of some facilities. You can visit all the rides in half a day with a quick pass!

If you're familiar with Universal Studios from the US, you'll be a bit disappointed, as the park is obviously much smaller. We weren't that impressed, except for two or three attractions. It's certainly great for children and teenagers, but not so much for adults without children. We had an express pass, which wasn't really necessary.

Spacious place But the temperature is reasonably hot. There isn't much shelter from the sun. Most of the rides are simulators and are not suitable for children. Not suitable for walking and relaxing, suitable for serious play.

It's being a child again, with the characters from your childhood. It is not an amusement park (except for the Galactica ones). It is more of a theme park, with small attractions from the different sagas. It's very good, there are usually not many people during the week and the places are very fun. If you download the park app it tells you the waiting times so you don't wait long.
It is only a small park, great if you take kids. A couple of roller coaster rides are good, but the lines are long. Get the fast pass.

We had an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! From thrilling rides to fantastic live shows and immersive themed zones, it was a full day of excitement and fun for the whole family. The park is well-organized, with a great mix of attractions for all agesfrom adrenaline-pumping roller coasters to family-friendly entertainment. One thing to note for future visitors: be sure to come prepared for the weather. While some areas offer shade and indoor attractions, a good portion of the park is outdoors and exposed to the sunespecially during peak hours in the afternoon. We highly recommend bringing a compact umbrella or poncho for sun protection (or sudden rain), and a portable fan to help beat the heat while walking between rides. Despite the warm weather, the experience was well worth it. The staff were friendly and efficient, helping to keep the lines moving smoothly, and the overall energy in the park was infectious. Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for anyone coming to Sentosabut a little planning for the weather will definitely make your visit more comfortable!

Universal Studios Singapore offers an unforgettable experience packed with excitement, adventure, and fun for all ages! From thrilling rides like Battlestar Galactica and Revenge of the Mummy to family-friendly attractions like Madagascar and Shrek 4D, theres something for everyone. The park is well-organized, clean, and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The attention to detail in each themed zonefrom Hollywood to Ancient Egyptis truly impressive. We especially enjoyed the WaterWorld showan action-packed performance that left us in awe. Queues can be long during peak hours, so getting the Express Pass is highly recommended. Dining options are varied and cater to different tastes, and the souvenir shops offer plenty of fun memorabilia. Overall, its a fantastic way to spend a day with family or friends, making memories that will last a lifetime. Highly recommended for tourists and locals alike!

Universal Studios Singapore was an amazing experience. Although the park is not as large as other Universal parks in the world, it is very well used, with spectacular attractions, very well-themed areas and high-quality shows. The organization is excellent and waiting times are reasonable, especially if you leave early. Highlights include attractions such as Battlestar Galactica, Transformers and The Mummy, which combine adrenaline and technology. Ideal for spending a full day full of fun on Sentosa Island. Highly recommended for all ages!

One of the best part to go I. Singapores Pretty cosy and easy to go around. If you can go to the off peak season, you do need to have to wait for a long time. Good for family, good for group of friends, good for couple, it is fun and good to be there.
family-friendly, wonderful experience.

Set against the backdrop of the vast ocean by the beach.. Very interesting..

This is a World Class Theme Park located in Singapore. We all know Universal Studios is a Theme Park based from Hollywood, so the ambience more likely same. A lot of attraction and ride can we try here.

Lots to do there. Don't miss character Parade and fireworks. Go one by one in rides so you cover them all. Must take at least one Souvenir.

If you have a family and small children, this is truly a wonderful tourist area. Here they bring cartoon characters into real life, which in my opinion, children love from meeting the animals in Madagascar, Shrek, Transformers... In addition to light activities such as taking a boat through a cave, going to see a 4D movie about Shrek (line up early, this is always crowded from morning to night)..., there are also roller coasters, entering the Transformers to participate in battles just like the movie (I didn't go because my brother had to line up for 2 hours to experience it). 5 minutes but I heard it's very good and only available here), visit "Mummy" in the Pharaon area, ... USS also renews its activities each season, real-life shows with guns and bombs like in the movies (Show WaterWorld), parades on weekends, Jurassic World reenactments or meetings with Minions, Gru, Optimus Prime... My ticket price is 1 million online, you can go straight in without buying a ticket. If you go for 2-3 days, after Marina Bay area, this is a place you should experience at least once when coming to Singapore.

Amazing, stunning and mind-blowing place! Each and every ride is so thrilling that you forget waiting in the long queues. It has so many attractions that you need an entire day to visit all. You got to visit this place at least once in your lifetime. It's extremely well maintained and has very good facilities for restrooms and drinking water. The best attraction in Singapore!

The Universal Studios Singapore are a very amazing place. We came there on a day when we didn't have to wait too long and also already had our ticket with the pre-bought Singapore pass (definitely recommended to get one!). The whole amusement park was very clean and organized. There are different theme worlds with breathtaking rides. Our favorites were the Transformers 4D adventure and a roller coaster called the Mummy. Even if a queue is long on some rides it is worth the wait, but I suggest to look for rides with short waiting times first so you can get the most of your experience as possible and go on more rides :) Another great thing was the Lights, Camera, Action!-Show, where you can see how all the effects on a real film set are done. If you are lucky you can meet a real dinosaur in the Jurassic Park environment ;) Our favorite show of that day was the Waterworld adventure, what was awesomely acted and constructed and even holds some nice surprises for you to see! But prepare to get wet, Another positive thing about the Universal Studios is that there are several water stations everywhere so you don't have to buy drinks all the time and can refill your bottles everywhere. If you are in Singapore take at least one day to visit the Universal Studios and get lots of fun!

Universal Studio is a must to do if you come to Singapore, but my advice is to avoid high season and weekends or you will be spend the whole day queueing and enjoying very few attractions. Also if you are staying in Singapore for a 1 week or more, may be you can add small amount of money and get the annual membership, so you can visit it as much as you can during your stay. Another advice, go very very early and try to go direct to the top attractions as after a while it will become crowded. Regarding Food, there is a Burger restaurant (Halal) which is moderate in price and their Burger is very delicious :) To get access to Universal Studio, there is a train from VivoCity, it was free but now I think it is 5SGD but not sure. There are free buses running in front of vivo city that take you to Sentosa Island. Really it is an amazing experience Really don't miss it

Very interesting considering that Universal Studios doesn't yet exist in Indonesia. So for us this is a special attraction when we want to visit USS. Very hot location in the USS area. The fairly expensive entrance ticket creates obstacles for backpackers who want to enter the USS

It was a lot of fun It's smaller than Universal in Japan, so you can enjoy almost all the attractions in one day, which makes you very satisfied! ! There are many areas that are not found in Japan, so even people who have been to USJ can enjoy it. Also, unlike other Universal parks, Jurassic Park in Singapore was a circular ride. Overall, it was more watery than in Japan, but when I sat in the seat, I was soaked from head to toe. There is a dryer outside the ride for a fee, and you can go inside to dry your whole body, but it's a good idea to bring your own towel. There are more types of roller coasters than at USJ, and they move in a different way (speeding up and running) than in Japan, so if you like roller coasters, you should give them a try. There were fewer shops than in Japan, and there were fewer souvenirs to hand out.
Probably more interesting than Disneyland in Shanghai. More attractions for adults. 1 day is absolutely enough. Virtually no queues, but on a weekday at the turn of August and September

Smaller than expected and most rides are quick to finished. However it's definitely worth a visit! Beautiful decorations all over. If you are into healthy food this is not the place. P.s. the transformers ride is beyond imagination and I would go here again only for that one! (It doesn't look like much from the outside)

One of the most visited tourist spots in Singapore...inevitably I must say this is the top visited spot in Singapore. US is such a wonderful place that each and everyone ie, all ages of people would love it and enjoy it. The entry to US is impressive one to all. Sometimes one can find the different Hollywoods characters on the road at different places in it. The event like 4D transformers,boat ride( dinosaurs roaring) is extremely breathtaking, adventures, thrilling so on, especially the last part and the dark place in the tunnel was really amazing.though it is forbidden to take pictures but many tourist like me tried to take pictures hidden way. The Water Works which is I think a live rare experience that can give us much more thrills than one can expect. I must say what a show!!!. The 4D show Shreak was spellbinding which was liked by all my family members especially my son. He just simply loved it as well as we. More attractive things that gave us a lifetime experience and memories that we never forget.

Just one word for this place awesome. You can spend a whole day having fun at this place. Superb. Totally in love with this place. What a technology amazing superb rides. Must visit on your travel to Singapore

Amazing, mind-blowing place. One of the best attractions in Singapore. It has so many attractions, rides,shows that you need an entire day to visit all. It's well maintained and has very good facilities for restrooms and drinking water.Great for kids and families.

A must visit place when you visit singapore. amazing, thirrling rides. you'll not even realize when the whole day passes away. Each & every roller coaster ride gives you a different kind of experience. what i'll recommend is if you are visiting there then do try each & every roller coaster ride. it's a must try. Don't miss to watch this place when you go to Singapore. Don't miss transformers, start action cut, water show (pirates splash show), Jurassic world, mummy ride, shrek, Madagascar. These are must watch shows. Other than these you have almost 15 more rides n attractions it seems. Do take one water bottle with you for sure. Meanwhile you can refill it. You got to walk much distance there in hot sun. You can see some dummy characters also there .. don't lose opportunity to click a photo with them. If possible don't forget to take express pass. It will take 30 min to 3 hours waiting for some shows in peak times. It will cost 50 more for each ticket. Start day early n see many shows. All the best. For lunch try one restaurant opposite to mummy ride. There you will get veg chicken mutton Biryanis. Even parathAs too. It will be around 800/- each plate.

A large amusement park on Sentosa Island in the south of Singapore. You can enjoy both roller coasters and various shows here. My recommendation: The indoor roller coaster The Mummy and the 4D ride Transformers. Waiting times can be avoided by purchasing so-called VIP passes for the individual rides. There is a single rider lane on the rides for single riders. Entry is discounted by paying with credit card (as of 2015). The Universal studios can be reached via the monorail from the Vivo City shopping center on level 3. Exit at Resortworld sentosa.

Well kept theme park and some of the attraction is unique which is only available in Singapore. Bring your own bottle as water station is conveniently available at many locations. Stroller rental is available.
It is very convenient to have food and accommodation in Sentosa. The island also has casinos, beaches, cable cars and the largest Merlion Tower.
Well like other theme park this is really good overall Sentosa is a good place to visit and you should give it a try.

The best place in Singapore. With all kinds of rides, food places, shopping places and a lot of live performances. A must visit for Singapore.

The Shreck should be chosen for the last minute rides. Try buying the express entry ticket although free rides like Canopy in the lost world doesn't have express entry. Here single rider is the preferred alternative.

It cost about 3000 yen to store my luggage. Just checking in two items was about the same as the entrance fee, so I recommend checking it in without carrying any luggage. The taxi ride from Marina Bay Sands was just over 1000 yen, so I don't think I have to take the train when going to Universal! The inside is smaller than the one in Japan, so it's a little more empty, so you don't have to line up from the beginning of the morning. It also felt like they were improving upon attractions in Japan. When I went, the attraction broke down and I had to wait for about an hour, but that's still a good memory lol

The location is on Sentosa Island, 1 location with Wings of Time and Ifly, Trick Eye Museum, Madam Tussaud's and several other tourist spots. It's not too big... And make sure to look at the schedule for each ride so that your time is effective.

The ticket price is a bit costly.. You can save 6 dollar by buying at Changi airport while you arrive. To reach this place you can either walk from the vivocity mall or take the sentosa monorail. Walking is cheaper as you can save 4 dollar per person. The rides are awesome. Need a full day for completing all the rides.. The most brilliant attraction in Singapore. The Universal studios. And anybody who makes it to Singapore will have this in their bucket list. With loads of expectations, we enter and man we aren't disappointed. My favorites here 1. Battlestar Galactica. The rollercoaster which is really one. Mind-blowing stuff. Experience it yourself. 2. Transformers Ride. Man. The details put into developing this rode is amazing and one would want to go for it again and again. 3.Mummy Ride. High paced nice ride for a small duration. Like a rollercoaster with attraction to keep you attentive. 4. The Jurassic park Lost world kingdom. Nice rides getting you through the demolished Jurassic park. And a canopy ride to have a overview or complete lost world 5. Shrek show in the Far Far away world. Amazing castle and nice details there. 6. Madagascar ride. Nice and calm ride to give you some light moments between Alex Marty Gloria and Melman along with the Penguins. More to give a detailed insight. Experience it yourself. Don't miss the show by Stephen Spielberg on Movie making. It's nicely rendered. Numerous shops selling merchandise. And Minions store. Everything is catchy and nice. Do not miss Shoot with stats where you get to meet all the stars of Universal studios at their respective areas.

The major thing that I love most about Singapore is its recreational spots. There are so many things that you can enjoy in Singapore. I have visited 3 times there but still my urge for visiting there never ends. Universal studios: What can I say about this place! It is clean, wide, gorgeous, colorful and safe place to visit. Here the rides are well maintained, different branded shops and food courts are well maintained. People can enjoy a perfect vacation here and meet new people, culture and charms! My advice is to keep two consequent days for visiting universal studios. Theres several hotel around it but they are bit costly. Rather you can stay in the city as you can easily get there within an hour. This is the beauty of Singapore! I have visited many countries but Singapore would always remain my first choice to enjoy my vacations. Hope to visit there soon again!

One of the best places which you must visit during your Singapore trip. I had an amazing experience here. The transformers ride was amazing.. the Jurassic park, and mummy was great too. Amazing experience in USS...not all rides are fun...few are very great...to mention transformers, Jurassic world, the mummy are worth experiencing...management has taken meticulous measures to ensure visitors have a great time in the uss...maps are available at the entrance for visitors to pick and start their tour according to their interests...eatouts and goodie shops are all around for visitors to shop and spend some money...if one is visiting Singapore this place is a must visit in the list...kudos to the entire team of uss in putting up such great show everyday and making their visitors smile...
