Be earlier, so that can complete all the rides. Despite fun the chocolate, candy and ice-cream were marvelous. Sure will enjoy every moment with family and friends.

I have applied for an annual pass at Universal Studios for 4 consecutive years. The last one expired in October last year. I applied for the annual pass at the travel agency on WeChat during the New Year of 2019. After entering the park, I applied for the annual pass. The staff said that tourist tickets can only be upgraded to the annual pass with a foreign passport. I am a Chinese citizen with permanent residence and can apply. My two Singaporean children are foreigners and cannot upgrade to annual passes. Let us buy new tickets. These tickets were also sold to travel agencies by Universal Studios. Why are foreigners not allowed to apply for annual passes? They all buy the same ticket to enter the park. How come foreigners can do it but locals cant. It doesn't matter where you buy the tickets, they are all issued by Resorts World. There should be no distinction between foreigners and locals

It is clear that Singapore is a famous tourist destination... If you were expecting a Japanese or American universal, you're out of luck. Even though it is small, it is too small. Still, if you plan to go, you must buy an express ticket. Waiting in line in the heat is... very difficult.
Why are the rides' safety notices only in Chinese and English? What about Tamil and Malay? Why is there the assumption that everyone's literate in Chinese and English?

A must place to go when in Singapore. Would suggest to get yourself an express pass as waiting in the queue would be tiring and would ruin the ride experience. Universal Studios is located on Sentosa Island, a short tram ride from Singapore, along with other attractions like the Aquarium and Water Park that are also part of the Sentosa Resort Complex. As the 4th Universal Studios theme park in the world, its the smallest but still has 24 attractions across seven themed zones built around a central lagoon. I show you all of these in this video and share tips on how to get the most of any visit here. The zones are: Hollywood, Madagascar, Far Far Away, The Lost World, Ancient Egypt, Sci-Fi City and New York. There are 30 restaurants and food carts across the park. A big plus is that over 70% of the park is covered to protect you from the Singapore heat and rain storms.
Main attraction in Singapore

I really like this ride... it's located on Sentosa Island... If you take the MRT the destination station is Harbourfront... From that station, if you want to take the Sentosa mono rail express, look for Vivo City on the top floor... (Go up stuck to the 3rd floor)... Buy a ticket once to visit all places in Sentosa until you return home to Vivo City. Uss opens at 10 am... For those who buy tickets from tourist agents (traveloka etc.) don't call and download the tickets because they don't accept them in the form of a screen shot Come early to be able to enjoy all the rides and still have time if you want to visit other objects on Sentosa Island...

Universal Studio Singapore Is the one of the place I love. Here's not a lot of people like Japan Or Orlando. If you come here in the morning you can finish it at 1-2 pm. This is a very lively place. Come for a day with your friends and family and you won't regret it... Just make sure not to go on weekends...you might die in crowd.. choose Monday for your visit and you will be happy with short queues and lesser crowd... Going to Singapore isn't complete if you don't go to the US. Was here all day to wander around. Come when it opens, so you can enjoy all the rides. As much as possible, don't come on the weekend, the queue for each ride is long, it can be up to 70 minutes. There is a time reminder at each entrance, so you can guess whether you will enter or not. You can buy tickets online or at the ticket window. But it's more profitable online because it's cheap and there are lots of promotions. Stay at a hotel in the Sentosa area, so it's not far to come here. It only took me 5 minutes to get here with the hotel shuttle bus which is ready every 30 minutes, and then back to the hotel. There are lots of souvenir shops and restaurants as well as food courts that you can stop by at any time if you're tired of walking.

Universal Studios Singapore is located in Singapore Southeast Asia's first Hollywood movie theme park, Universal Studios Singapore has attractions, rides, and entertainment that will attract even those who want to experience thrills! Of the 24 movie-themed rides, 18 are specially devised for Universal Studios Singapore. There are seven movie-themed zones. All of them are specially made.

The park is small, not as big as Osaka, but the crowds are less than in Osaka. You dont need to buy a quick pass if you come on weekdays. The weather in Singapore is very hot, so remember to bring water.

Universal Studios Singapore is a theme at Sentosa Island, Singapore. It features 28 rides, shows, and attractions in seven themed zones. Construction of the theme park and the rest of the resort started on 19 April 2007. It is the second Universal Studios theme park to open in Asia, and the first in Southeast Asia.

Definitely worth a visit when in Singapore. If you buy the admission ticket, be sure to also get the Fast Lane ticket - otherwise you will sometimes have to wait an hour in front of an attraction before you get your turn. The fast lane map also sometimes offers the option of sitting right at the front. I think there were only two attractions where this card wasn't valid - for whatever reason. You should definitely take a day to try everything there.

A must go place, if one is in Singapore even for a little while. So here it is, Universals is located on Sentosa island. One can go to Sentosa using a boardwalk (free of cost), by Mono Rail (2-4 approx) or by cable car as well. The roller coasters are the best thrill. The grey one (galactic x) was the best one I felt. I was such amazed to find Roller coaster with 4D effects (Transformers ride, though not a roller coaster but the cabin you sit in feels that it is actually moving, flying in sync with the actions) and the Mummy roller coaster with a haunting dark THE MUMMY experience. There are also these various cartoons which come out from time to time and you can have photos with your favorite one. The water world show ( A war in water ) is also a must attend, it is very realistic and feels like a real scene. I saw 5 pm show but there are also a couple more timings. There are also many other little shows/programs and you need to have a map and show planner to neatly plan out which ones to attend. To summarize the most important shows/rides. - Battlestar Galactica ( A red and a grey colour roller coaster ) - The Mummy ride - Transformers - Water World Also note there are two lines for any ride, normal one and exclusive (expensive ticket). Normal lines can even have hours of waiting time !! Also note some rides also have single riders, where if you are alone you can just get in single rider line ( ask for one at the gate itself ) and there is very less waiting time, and you are adjusted with others where the odd seats of the ride cabins are left out !

Universal Studios Singapore opened in January 2010, is the first Universal Studios amusement ride to open in the Southeast Asia region, and is the second in the Asia region after Universal Studios Japan. This amusement park themed on famous Hollywood films produced by Universal Studios is located on Sentosa Island, Singapore. There are several rides that have been opened, al. The Lost World, Far and Away, New York, Sci-Fi City, Hollywood Boulevard, Madagascar, Ancient Egypt. The park also features 30 restaurants and food counters, as well as 20 souvenir stalls. Ticket prices start from S 32 (for seniors), S 48 (children) S 66 (adult one day ticket) to S 118 (adults, for 2 days visit). Several hotel facilities, including the Hard Rock Hotel, are available around this world-class tourist location.

Where happiness lives. There is no more sincere laughter and happiness than in amusement parks anywhere The number 1 place for me in Singapore was Universal Studios I could easily refuse any other attractions except this one. The park is located on Sentosa Island and you can get there on foot from Harbourfront station, by monorail for 4 round trip or by cable car for 26. We are spoiled by cable cars, we decided to save our legs (god, no thanks for this idea) and went on the monorail. It runs frequently, the ride takes 5 minutes. I booked tickets to the park through the #klook app, its really much cheaper. Tickets cost us 104 for two for the whole day, if you buy in the park, then 140. The park is open every day from 10 to 18. I was afraid of the rain in the forecast and we went on Sunday, I thought if there were queues, wed buy an express train passage Madagascar, Faraway Kingdom (Shrek and the Cat), The Lost World (Jurassic), Egypt, Galactic Wars, Transformers and New York. The last one is the most useless. Each zone has themed attractions, restaurants, shops and shows. And the coolest attractions, in my opinion, were (from less cool to more cool): 4. Galactic. (Human) roller coaster 3. Transformers 3D with an awesome immersive effect 2. Revenge of the Mummy. Roller coaster in the dark. 1. Galactic. (Cylon) roller coaster with spirals, falls and flips. We rode three times until I was afraid that my head would be torn off if we climbed again.

It's very crowded, but if you use an Express Pass, you can ride any train with a wait time of about 5 minutes at most. With an Express Pass, you can ride one ride smartly, but only once. However, although it is a little expensive, I definitely recommend purchasing it. For popular attractions, there may be a wait of 2 to 3 hours. With the pass, you can ride all the attractions in the evening and have time to choose souvenirs! However, I was disappointed that some attractions ended at noon. Personally, I think the water show is very authentic and worth seeing! I didn't really worry about attractions that said "be careful not to get wet", but I ended up getting very wet (lol). Are the regulars wearing raincoats? I was wearing. The food may be average or not what you would expect. Don't you need to clean up after eating? It seems OK to leave the dishes on the table as is. (There is no return slot) Singapore is a beautiful country, and perhaps because of its thorough cleaning, there was no trash left and I was able to enjoy my stay very comfortably. It makes sense that prices are the highest in the world (lol) However, it is the number one country I would like to visit again!

One of the popular tourist destinations in Singapore, if you want to visit Universal Studios Singapore (USS) you can get off at Harbourfront MRT, this MRT is inside VivoCity mall. To get to the USS, the first option is to walk via the Sentosa Boardwalk. Apart from being able to enjoy the view, this road is open 24 hours... so that visitors don't get tired, a travelator (flat escalator) is provided, when I came here it was still being built so I haven't tried it yet... According to the source, the fee is 1, you can tap the ez link The second is the bus option, when I went there I tried to take the bus, the fare was 2, you looked for the RWS8 bus to Resort World Sentosa. The cost is around 2, you can use ezlink or exact change. Take the free shuttle bus, which is intended for tourists... this bus passes two routes, namely the marina and orchard which passes several hotels on the route. Don't forget to prepare your passport if you want to take the shuttle bus. The third option is to take the monorail, from VivoCity go up to the 3rd floor, the cost of the ride is 4, you can use ezlink The fourth option is to take the cable car, the location is near the Harbourfront MRT, btw, this is expensive, guys, around 15, if I'm not mistaken, exclude the Sentosa entry ticket, if you include the entrance ticket, it's around 35... hmmm... Another option is to take a grab or taxi to Sentosa...

Universal Studios Singapore is a theme park located within Resorts World Sentosa on Sentosa Island, Singapore. It features 28 rides, shows, and attractions in seven themed zones. The park has been marketed by Universal Parks & Resorts as a "one-of-its-kind theme park in Asia" and promised that the park would be the only one of its kind in Southeast Asia for the next 30 years.[
Awesome! Almost 3 times I went to Singapore just to be there

A famous amusement park with several branches around the world Its branches: Los Angeles - Orlando - Japan - Singapore . Singapore Branch: It is very beautiful and I recommend visiting it, but its only drawback is the high entry prices! Especially when purchasing express boarding tickets . Its location in Singapore: on Sentosa Island, specifically at Resorts World Sentosa . The amusement park is divided into seven parts (Hollywood, Ancient Egypt, New York, Madagascar, The Lost World, The Future, and Fantasy Movie Celebrities) . What are the activities at Universal? - It contains 15 games (if I am not disappointed) divided between children and adults. - It has live shows, the most beautiful of which is (The Water Show), which is a very beautiful live action comedy film through which you can see how action films are made - It has the Hollywood Walk of Fame - You can take pictures with characters such as (Shrek and Princess Fiona - Pussy in Boots - Madagascar characters - Minions - Sesame World - Transformers) - There are gift and souvenir shops - There are (halal) restaurants, and I repeat the word (halal) because before traveling I asked and they told me to take food with you, there are no halal restaurants!! I was surprised by three restaurants with the (Halal) logo, even though I was not careful to search and did not see the rest of the restaurants. Maybe they are all halal after all (The restaurants I saw were halal: one in the fantasy films section, one in the Madagascar section, and one in the ancient Egypt section) . Experienced advice when visiting Universal: - It is best to visit it on other weekends to avoid severe crowding - Attend at the beginning of the day so that all the games can be played - Buy an express boarding ticket in case there is crowding, because the wait at the games is very long, reaching from half an hour to a full hour sometimes. - Ask about show times when entering . Prices: Large: 74 Small: 54 Express Boarding: Add 30 to the ticket, whether large or small . Working hours 10am - 8pm . It's over For details of my trip to Singapore On my Instagram account asma116

Super. Located at sentosa Universal Studios Singapore is 20 hectares (49 acres) in size, occupying the easternmost part of the 49- hectare (120-acre) Resorts World Sentosa. There are a total of 24 attractions, of which 18 are original or specially adapted for the park. The park consists of seven themed zones surrounding a lagoon. Each zone is mostly based on movies and/or television, featuring their own attractions, meet and greet locations, over 30 restaurants and food carts, and 20 retail stores and carts located around the park.

Universal Studios Singapore occupies 49 acres of Resorts World Sentosa. The park is arranged thematically, with each area paying tribute to a location, film, or television show. Destinations include New York City, Hollywood, Madagascar, and a trip back to Ancient Egypt. Fiction-themed areas include Shrek's Far Far Away, Lost World, and Sci-Fi City, where Battlestar Galactica-themed dueling roller coasters and an indoor dark coaster, Revenge of the Mummy, dominate the thrill rides.

Universal studios is the dad of theme park. A must visit place in Singapore. I might say the first priority should be Universal studios. Few tips I would like to share which I knew earlier which helped me a lot. 1. Bring some food. I would say a lot . You would be a very very hungry during all the rides and the food inside is bit costly 2. Take a big bottle of water. Be hydrated all the time. There is dispenser and wash rooms all over the place 3. Check your locker timing. After 120 minutes it's chargeable. So what you can do is takeout your stuff and place again with different a locker 4. Go for rollercoaster first. It will remain busy until the end. So be sure you make it there within the first few. Then comeback and enjoy the rest 5. I will suggest you take an express pass. But I found it useless if you are travelling alone or you guys have the vibe of going to every rides alone then you can save around 60 to 70 SGD. There is a line for single riders which is pretty quicker than express pass. But keep in mind it will not work in rollercoaster. 6. I would suggest you allways take someone with you so that you have someone who can take pictures for you since there is a lot to click. Also take a selfie stick which cost hardly 3 SGD. This also gives you a good company. 7. If rank then my order would be rollercoaster, mummy ride, transformers ride, Jurassic park ride, pic with talking transformers, minions, etc, pics in hollywood, newyork, etc. All above are my personal views from my personal experience yours might differ. Verdict : A day full of fun

Universal Studios Singapore was opened in January 2010 by Genting Group from Malaysia, and is the first Universal Studios amusement ride to be opened in Southeast Asia, and is the second in Asia after Universal Studios Japan. This theme park for famous Hollywood films produced by Universal Studios is located on Sentosa Island, Singapore. There are several rides that have been opened, al. The Lost World, Far and Away, New York, Sci-Fi City, Hollywood Boulevard, Madagascar, Ancient Egypt. The park also features 30 restaurants and food counters, as well as 20 souvenir stalls. Ticket prices start from S 32 (for seniors), S 48 (children) S 66 (adult one day ticket) to S 118 (adults, for 2 days visit). Several hotel facilities, including the Hard Rock Hotel, are available around this world-class tourist location.

Such an amazing experience! The good points: 1) Its so easy to get there. Get to MRT station of Harbourfront and then a 5 minutes train directly to the park from Vivocity mall. 2) Price is just fair. 3) The park has a total of around 8 rides (some for kids and some for adults) in addition to some other activities (4D movies and etc.) 4) The park is convenient and quite small, so you can really have it covered in a full day. 5) The atmosphere and theme of the park are amazing. Everything is done really well and into the details. Some disadvantages: 1) Some of the rides might be closed randomly on days you come. You just have to find out(no worries though, the main ones are active) 2) I visited on a a moderately low day. In high season waiting can be over an hour and even longer for most rides. Honestly I dont think the most are worth waiting more than 45 minutes tops except for the top best rides. But thats a more personal thing. 3) The park is real fun, but having said point number 2, the best of the park really comes down to 3-4 rides (for those who love the adrenaline), which are always really busy and waiting is long. To sum up - Amazing experience, be prepared for some waiting on busy days. Dont miss it if you are in Singapore

Reaching Universal studios: Reach Harbour front station ( Which is in Vivo city mall) Take the sentosa monorail to Waterfront station. Tickets: Buy it at the Sentosa ticket counter on the top floor of Vivo city mall. ( There are usually discounts and not many people buy tickets here so there is less queue) Show the Coupon in the guest service which to the left of Universal globe , they will give you your entrance pass. ( If you buy tickets online, which is what 50% of the people do, you have to stand in a long queue to redeem the voucher and get an entry, same goes for buying tickets in the counter) When to go : If you are a tourist plan for this on Wednesday or Thursday. Never between Friday and Sunday. Food: The food here is pricey and not worth buying... Carry food with you , there is no checking done here. So no worries. ( But please don't litter) Water : Available everywhere, in the entrance of each attraction you have watertaps. Baggage: Two/ three rides require you to deposit even your phone and wallet in a locker which is free for upto 45 mins, which is near the ride itself. Make use of them. When you go on a weekday express pass is not needed. There are plenty of meet and greet in each part. Download Universal studios singapore app. It is very useful. DO NOT MISS VELOCIRAPTOR " BLUE" MEET AND GREET Pro tip: Take a body pain tablet before reaching Universal studios.

I have been wanting to come for a long time, and I finally made the pilgrimage today The first time I came here, I saw a long queue and walked into a tsukemen specialty store by mistake. It is really rare to have tsukemen in Taiwan. The first time I tried it, I really thought it was great. I both liked it spicy and numb. I chose the incremental line and added a portion of meat, but the meat was a bit deducted. Their barbecued pork is the three-layer fat type, but about half of the meat I got was a whole piece of fat... This is It's really a little disappointing, but the meat is very fragrant and delicious overall. It's just that I haven't eaten something so greasy in a long time. The dipping sauce is also on the oily side, and the meat is actually full of fat... I really feel like my femoral vessels are getting clogged after eating it. It feels like staying here, but fortunately the fried bean sprouts in the store are really delicious and not greasy. Otherwise, people who dont usually eat greasy food will have to think about it. Overall, the taste is very good, so you can come here. A store to try.

The place need no description. It's one of the important and must visit attractions in Singapore. It has attractions for almost all age groups and interests. While their entrance ticket gives entry to pretty much all the attractions, a special pass called Express Pass will help you skip the long waiting lines of upto 40-60 mins on some of the attractions, especially the fast moving rides. You can buy the Express Pass over the counter which costs SGD 50 for one time use for applicable shows but can cost lesser sometimes if booked online. Universal Studios Singapore is a theme park located on Sentosa Island in Singapore. It is one of the top tourist attractions in Singapore, offering visitors a wide range of rides, shows, and attractions based on popular movies and TV shows. The park is divided into several themed zones, including Hollywood, New York, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away, Madagascar, and Sci-Fi City. Each zone features its own unique attractions and experiences, such as roller coasters, water rides, 4D movies, and live shows. Some of the most popular attractions at Universal Studios Singapore include the Transformers: The Ride 3D, Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon roller coasters, the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, and the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase. Visitors can also enjoy a wide range of dining and shopping options within the park, as well as meet and greet sessions with popular characters from movies and TV shows. Universal Studios Singapore is a great destination for families and anyone looking for a fun and exciting day out in Singapore.

They say Singapore is smaller than you think, but when you walk around, it's not as small as you think. You would usually think about purchasing an Express Pass, but I think an Express Pass is a must. If you like rides, I recommend Unlimited. We purchased the regular express, but it was a bit disappointing because we wanted to ride it again later. It seems that rides often break down, and in the case of popular Transformers and Mummy rides, it seemed like it would be really hard to wait unless you took the express. For souvenirs, we recommend stopping by the souvenir shop before entering Universal to look through them and then make your selection. Surprisingly, there were souvenirs that were only found outside. Food is a bit expensive, but it's acceptable considering it's the cost of not going out in hot weather. Meet and Greet is a must! I recommend watching at least one when you have the time. It's a little clumsy, but it's more fun than I thought. It's a bit disappointing that the Madagascar area is currently being remodeled, but I'm looking forward to how it will change when it reopens later.

On a small piece of land, lies an amusement park completely packed with high quality attractions. 'Transformers The Ride' is the most innovative, 'Revenge of the Mummy' has the best theme, and the 'Battlestar Galactica' looks most iconic on the outside with its two intertwining tracks. Furthermore, I really liked the Shrek themed area, Far Far Away. Not so much because of the attractions, but mainly because of the atmosphere. Just like Singapore itself, every square meter of the park has its purpose. Every attraction is always within a few minutes walking distance. This makes the visit not as exhausting as visiting other amusement parks. Unlike Singapore, the food was expensive and did not look that good. Tip: go outside of the park to have lunch in the area just outside of Universal Studios. You can leave and come back for free, and the food outside is tastier and less expensive. The park is building new areas, which is needed because the current attractions might become a little outdated in the coming years. I will definitely come back once those areas are completed!

Universal Studios Singapore, the second largest Universal Studios in Asia and currently the smallest in the world (actually quite similar to Leofoo Village in Taiwan), is located in Resorts World Sentosa in Singapore. The newly built "Minion Park" is expected to be completed in phases by 2025. However, there are already many Minions in the park, but I personally feel that the characters from Sesame Street are still the main attraction. Universal Studios Singapore is divided into seven themed areas: Hollywood, New York, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away, and Madagascar... Before the trip, I read on the Internet that there were relatively few people and queues on weekdays, but when I arrived at the venue, I found out, yes! Sure enough, the Internet cant completely believe itBut maybe everyone is comparing it to the standard of Universal Studios Japan after the lockdown is lifted. If so, I still agree... There are indeed a lot less people However, there are still many things worth seeing inside. People who like to visit amusement parks in Singapore can still visit here!

USS is a good place to visit in Singapore. I've been there twice, once for Halloween Horror Night, and it was amazing! During Halloween, the park turns into a spooky wonderland with haunted houses and scary zones. The actors did a fantastic job at scaring people, and I had a blast. If you enjoy being scared and having a great time, I highly recommend going to USS during Halloween. It's an exciting experience that you don't want to miss!

Universal Studios Singapore is the second Universal Studios in Asia, second only to Universal Studios Osaka. It is also the smallest Universal Studios in the world with the cheapest tickets. Universal Studios Singapore covers an area of 20 hectares and took three years to build. It is the only movie theme park in Southeast Asia. It is no exaggeration to say that it is a dream-come-true paradise for adults and children. Universal Studios Singapore is located in Resorts World Sentosa, which cost SGD 7 billion (approximately NT 168.7 billion) to build. Travelers can take the Singapore MRT and get off at Harbourfront Station. After arriving at Vivo City, 01. Transfer to Sentosa Express: The fare is SD4 (about NT. 93), which can be paid with an Ez-link card. You can take it unlimited times without leaving Sentosa. It takes about 5 to 10 minutes and the operating hours are 07:00 to 24:00. You can take the Sentosa MRT on the 3rd floor (Lobby L) of VivoCity, and to Universal Studios, just take the Waterfront MRT Station. PS. If you are staying in Sentosa, you can exchange your free island entry ticket by showing your hotel check-in certificate to the light rail ticket counter staff. Take your ticket to the manual ticket checker and you can enter the island for free. The hotel will also give you a free ticket to enter the island, which means you can leave the island once and then enter Sentosa for free!

Universal Studios Singapore, 29 September 2023 Hiii, this is my first time playing far away from Singapore exploring alone in someone else's country. Starting from the accommodation at 10.00 Dunloop Street, walk towards Little India to take the MRT to Vivo City. Arriving at Vivo City we go straight to the bus stop, there is a special stop for Sentosa - HarbourFront Stn, about 30 minutes with views of the city across the bridge until we arrive at USS yeaaaaaa.. Alone on the USS? yup, explore on your own, (noted: you have previously ordered USS tickets on OTA, guys) so when you arrive at USS, take a photo first in front of the Universal Studios Singapore icon. Erm, because I was alone, I was brave enough to ask another tourist to take a photo, hehehe... armed with it, Hi miss, can you help me to take a picture here? Luckily they want to, or sometimes take photos instead. Wait, if you go to USS, your provider doesn't have a signal, don't worry. Because at USS there is public wifi that can be used. It's a good idea if you go to USS to download the Universal SG app, why? because with this application you can know the location of rides and waiting times in line. Very useful for those of us who want to try all the rides. Because I'm alone, I can really queue at Single Rider, a queue that complements the regular queue where they usually want to ride at the same time as friends or family, honestly this saves a lot of time. Yes, although not all rides can do it. Every certain time there is a show like that, you can check the app for the schedule, so we can take photos with several icons, come here Minnion tunes, transformers etc. There are several rides where it's best not to bring luggage (for example hats, glasses, cellphones) you can store them in a locker first, it's free within a certain time limit. You can try all the rides, the most impressive one is of course the Sci-Fi City ride on the Human Battlestar Galatica, I wanted to try the Cylon one but the queue was 80 minutes at that time, it was really long, The second ride that is a must try is in Ancient Egypt, you have to enter through a long corridor with a very mummy atmosphere, you get a really scary feel, riding a train in the dark. At the end there will be a photo of us taken while riding the ride, you can also ask for a print, hello. The third ride is at Lost World, Canopy Flyer and again it is great for single riders. Really like the Far Far Away location, the location is really beautiful.

If you want to go there by public transportation, we can go to Vivo Mall to take the monorail from Vivo to Sentosa Island. Because Universal Studio is on Sentosa Island. We were having so much fun there.. it was just really hot. If you go there, wear clothes that absorb sweat, wear a hat, sunglasses and sunscreen. The area is very wide and we walked here and there. If you bring small children, it's better to bring a trolley.

Universal Studios Singapore is an unparalleled theme park experience. From the moment you step foot inside, you're transported to a world of excitement and adventure. With seven themed zones, including Hollywood, New York, and Ancient Egypt, there's something for everyone. Thrill-seekers will love the adrenaline-pumping rides like Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon and Transformers: The Ride. Families can enjoy the whimsical attractions in Far Far Away and Madagascar zones. Don't forget to catch the spectacular live shows and parades that bring beloved characters to life. The attention to detail is impeccable, with stunning set designs and immersive storytelling around every corner. The park's cleanliness and organization ensure a seamless and enjoyable experience for all visitors. Food options abound, ranging from quick bites to themed restaurants serving delicious cuisines from around the world. And of course, no visit is complete without snapping a photo with your favorite movie characters or shopping for souvenirs to commemorate your unforgettable day. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking fun, thrills, and magic in one spectacular place. With its world-class attractions and immersive experiences, it's a theme park unlike any other.
It says don't go to Singapore if you don't go to this place.

Universal Singapore is a smaller version of Universal Orlando. Tickets are cheaper than Orlando's, which is justified by the smaller number of attractions. I found the park more geared toward children, but adults can also have fun. The outdoor areas are a very interesting experience and reflect the country's history well. When I was there in February 2024, there was a construction site for a new attraction. I faced a few lines, and in one of them there was a technical stoppage with no forecast for the ride to return. I found this frustrating, because they were encouraging people to give up. I was at the front, and if I gave up, I would have to wait in line when the rides started working again. The right thing to do would be to clear the line and close the ride. The best thing to do is to download the Universal app, where you can favorite the rides you want to go on, and in the app you can track the queue time. The problem is that you can't follow the route in sequence, and you go back and forth to places when the queue is shorter. The best time to avoid waiting in line is at the end of the day. Then the queues are much shorter. Just pay attention to the shows, which have limited times. As for food, there are some options that aren't so cheap, but I didn't think they were exorbitantly priced. I went there and came back using a ride-hailing app to save time, but on the way back the drivers don't accept rides, and it's more expensive than the outward journey. The island and the area near the park are also very beautiful attractions. If you have time on your trip and are traveling with young people and children, it's a good experience. We stayed there until the park closed.

The first time I came here with my husband, we came on a weekday and bought a Chinese New Year ticket package for 98 per person. Not bad because you can enter early, get a gift, food included, and shopping discount voucher. There are quite a lot of rides/attractions to choose from, even if you don't dare to go on an extreme ride like me, you can watch the attractions and ride the normal rides. Overall, it's really fun to come here all day, but the prices for the snacks are quite pricey, guys.

So much fun to have a lot variations of rides, shows and choices of restaurants and snacks. Souvenir outlets are also very exciting. This is the second time to USS. Will back again someday if I visit Singapore again.

A Comprehensive Review of Universal Studios Singapore Prepare yourself for an extensive exploration into the wondrous world of Universal Studios Singapore, a realm where fantasy and reality converge to create an unparalleled experience of joy, excitement, and unbridled entertainment. Strap in, dear reader, for this journey promises to be as exhilarating as a ride on the most thrilling roller coaster. First and foremost, let us delve into the sheer magnitude of attractions that Universal Studios Singapore has to offer. From the moment you step foot into this fantastical realm, you are greeted by a cornucopia of wonders that cater to every age, interest, and inclination. Whether you find yourself wandering through the enchanting streets of Hollywood, traversing the jungles of Jurassic Park, or exploring the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City, there is no shortage of adventures to embark upon and memories to be made. But it is not just the quantity of attractions that sets Universal Studios Singapore apartit is the impeccable quality and attention to detail that truly elevate the experience to new heights. Each themed zone is meticulously crafted to transport visitors to far-flung realms and immerse them in the magic of their favorite films and franchises. From the lifelike animatronics of Transformers: The Ride to the pulse-pounding thrills of Revenge of the Mummy, every attraction is a testament to the artistry and ingenuity of its creators. And let us not forget the spectacular shows and entertainment offerings that grace the stages of Universal Studios Singapore. Whether you find yourself swept away by the dazzling spectacle of the Hollywood Dreams Parade, mesmerized by the death-defying stunts of WaterWorld, or laughing until your sides ache at the antics of the Sesame Street characters, there is no shortage of entertainment to captivate and delight audiences of all ages. But perhaps the true pice de rsistance of Universal Studios Singapore lies in its unparalleled commitment to guest satisfaction and comfort. From the immaculate cleanliness of the park grounds to the courteous and attentive service of the staff, every aspect of the visitor experience is carefully curated to ensure maximum enjoyment and relaxation. Whether you find yourself indulging in a delectable meal at one of the park's many dining establishments, cooling off with a refreshing beverage at a themed kiosk, or simply taking a moment to rest and recharge in one of the shaded seating areas, you can rest assured that you are in the capable hands of professionals who take pride in their work. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore stands as a shining beacon of excellence in the realm of theme park entertainment. With its vast array of attractions, impeccable attention to detail, and unwavering commitment to guest satisfaction, it is no wonder that visitors from around the globe flock to its gates in search of adventure and excitement. So come one, come all, and embark on a journey of discovery and delight that will leave you breathless with wonder and longing for more. Universal Studios Singapore awaits, ready to whisk you away on the adventure of a lifetime.

I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore on June 19, 2024, and it was an absolutely incredible experience! From heart-pounding rides to delightful food options, USS truly knows how to deliver a memorable day. Here are some highlights: 1. Roller Coaster Cylon: This ride is an absolute must-try! Its the most thrilling roller coaster Ive ever been on. The twists, turns, and sheer speed will leave you breathless and wanting more. A definite highlight of the park! 2. Transformers 3D Ride: Prepare to be blown away! This ride is more than just a simulatorits an immersive experience. Wearing 3D glasses, youre thrust into the world of Transformers as your ride car moves and reacts to the action. It genuinely feels like youre part of the movie. Hands down, the best ride Ive ever been on! 3. Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure: If you love water rides, this is for you! Get ready to be soaked as you navigate through thrilling rapids. Pro tip: bring a poncho and an extra T-shirt and socks, because you will get wet. Its an absolute blast! 4. Halal Food Options: For my fellow Muslim visitors, you can enjoy delicious halal fried chicken at Goldilocks. Its not just convenient but also incredibly tasty! 5. Exceptional Staff: A massive shoutout to Hanafi and Boon from the USS team. Their friendliness and impeccable customer service made our visit even more enjoyable. Special thanks to Hanafi for going above and beyond by iron steaming my new KungFu Panda T-shirt. You guys are amazing! While my day at USS was fantastic, there are a few areas where the park could elevate the experience even further. Some rides and attractions could use a bit of upgrading and touch-ups to maintain their top-notch quality. Additionally, the Naruto Gallery currently showcasing at USS has a lot of untapped potential. Right now, it mostly features posters and background stories of beloved characters like Naruto, Sasuke, Jiraiya, and Orochimaru. Given the massive fanbase for Naruto both inside and outside of Singapore, introducing more interactive and engaging elements could make this gallery a major attraction. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a phenomenal theme park with an array of thrilling rides, great food options, and standout staff. Its a perfect destination for a fun-filled day. I highly recommend visiting and cant wait to see how USS continues to innovate and improve!

Universal Studios Singapore, located at Resorts World Sentosa, is one of the premier theme parks in Southeast Asia. The park offers a variety of rides and attractions suitable for all ages, from thrilling roller coasters to entertaining interactive shows. The park is divided into seven themed zones, including Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away, and Madagascar. Each zone features decorations and attractions that match its specific theme Universal Studios Singapore also features various live shows, such as "WaterWorld," a thrilling stunt show, and "Shrek 4-D Adventure," an interactive film that takes viewers into the world of Shrek. The park is well-equipped with amenities such as restaurants, souvenir shops, and comfortable rest areas. Visitors can enjoy a wide range of food, from local dishes to international cuisine, and take home exclusive souvenirs. To make the most of your visit, it's recommended to arrive early, use express passes to avoid long lines, and wear comfortable clothing. Don't forget to bring a camera to capture the exciting moments at the park. Universal Studios Singapore is a perfect destination for spending time with family and friends, offering an entertainment-filled experience and unforgettable memories.

Favor the fast pass if you don't want to wait 90 minutes in line for each attraction and above all buy them online in advance to get them cheaper Universal Studios Singapore is a theme park located on Sentosa Island in Singapore. Opened in March 2010, it is the first Universal Studios theme park in Southeast Asia and one of the most popular in the region. The park is divided into several themed areas, each inspired by famous films, TV shows and film genres. Here are some of the main areas and attractions: 1. **Hollywood**: This area recreates the glamorous atmosphere of Hollywood, with a replica of the famous Walk of Fame. There are shops, restaurants, and live shows. 2. **New York**: Inspired by New York City, this area offers attractions like the Lights, Camera, Action! show. produced by Steven Spielberg, which shows behind the scenes special effects in films. 3. **Sci-Fi City**: This futuristic area features attractions like Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON, an inverted roller coaster inspired by the Battlestar Galactica television series. 4. **Ancient Egypt**: Recreating ancient Egypt, this area is home to one of the park's most popular attractions, "Revenge of the Mummy", an indoor roller coaster with impressive special effects. 5. **The Lost World**: Inspired by the films Jurassic Park and Waterworld, this area offers water attractions and action shows. 6. **Far Far Away**: Based on the Shrek universe, this area offers attractions for families, such as the 4D show "Shrek 4-D Adventure". 7. **Madagascar**: Inspired by the animated film of the same name, this area is ideal for young children with gentle attractions like "Madagascar: A Crate Adventure." The park is also known for its shows, parades, and special events throughout the year. Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination for thrill-seekers, movie fans, and families looking for a day of fun.

We recently visited Universal Studios Singapore, and it was an exhilarating experience from start to finish! Nestled within the Resorts World Sentosa, this theme park offers an impressive array of attractions, shows, and dining options that cater to visitors of all ages. As soon as I entered the park, I was struck by the vibrant atmosphere and the detailed theming of each zone. From the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City to the enchanting streets of Far Far Away, every area is beautifully designed and immersive. The iconic Hollywood Boulevard sets the stage perfectly with its charming shops and street performances. One of the highlights of my visit was the rides. The **Transformers: The Ride** was a standout, combining cutting-edge technology with thrilling action that left me breathless. The **Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure** was another favorite, offering both excitement and a chance to cool off from the Singapore heat. For those seeking a more family-friendly experience, the **Shrek 4-D Adventure** was delightful, filled with humor and engaging visuals. The live shows were equally impressive. The **WaterWorld** stunt show was a thrilling spectacle with jaw-dropping stunts and pyrotechnics that captivated the audience. Its a must-see for anyone visiting the park! Dining options are plentiful, with various cuisines available. I enjoyed a delicious meal at Mel's Drive-In, which offered classic American fare in a retro setting. While the food was tasty, prices were a bit on the higher side, which is typical for theme parks. One thing to keep in mind is that the park can get quite crowded, especially on weekends and holidays. I recommend arriving early and considering an Express Pass to make the most of your day without long wait times. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination filled with fun, adventure, and unforgettable experiences. Whether youre a thrill-seeker or just looking to enjoy a day of entertainment, its a great choice. I left with wonderful memories and cant wait to return! Highly recommended for families and friends alike.
universal studio at singapore was so fun! the rides were thrilling and there were many options. i like the variety of food choices, the watermelon crush was my favourite, very refreshing!

The park is divided into exciting zones like, Sci-Fi City, and Ancient Egypt, each with immersive themes. The highlight for me was the Transformers 3D Ride, and Minion Store. Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute must-visit for anyone looking to experience world-class entertainment and thrills in the heart of Sentosa! This theme park may be compact compared to other Universal Studios parks, but its packed with top-tier attractions, exciting rides, and themed zones that bring beloved movies and characters to life. From the heart-pounding excitement of the Battlestar Galactica roller coasters to the immersive world of Transformers and the magical kingdom of Far Far Away, theres something for everyone, whether youre a thrill-seeker, a movie buff, or visiting with family. The special effects and attention to detail in each attraction are impressive, truly transporting you into the worlds of your favorite films. The character meet-and-greets are a big hit, especially for families with young kids, and the parades add a vibrant, joyful touch to the experience. The food options within the park cater to a variety of tastes, though they are a bit priceyas expected in a theme park. However, there are plenty of fun themed snacks worth trying. The staff here are friendly and efficient, keeping the lines moving and ensuring everyone has a great time. Plan ahead and consider getting an Express Pass, especially during peak hours, as some rides have long wait times. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore delivers an unforgettable day filled with excitement, laughter, and wonder. Its a fantastic escape into the world of movies and magic and well worth the visit for anyone in Singapore. Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone with a love for adventure!

Great place! If you go to Singapore, don't miss Universal Studios Singapore. If you like movie themed rides, roller coasters, cartoon mascots and all things silly yet wonderful, this is a must-visit place for you! We truly had fun here! are very exciting and you should try them.

Visited on 7th December 2024 Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute paradise for thrill-seekers and movie lovers alike! My wife and I spent a full day here, and it was hands down one of the most exhilarating experiences of our trip. We made it a mission to try all the rides, and each one was a unique adventure. The Battlestar Galactica roller coasters, both Human and Cylon, were pure adrenaline rushesfast, intense, and unforgettable. The Transformers 3D Ride was another standout, immersing us in a thrilling battle with incredible visuals and effects that made us feel like we were part of the action. For fans of Jurassic Park, the Water Rapids Adventure was a perfect mix of excitement and splashes. We also couldnt resist the charm of the Revenge of the Mummy, a dark, high-speed indoor coaster with a spooky yet fun vibe. Even the gentler rides, like Madagascar: A Crate Adventure, had us smiling ear to ear with their attention to detail and charm. The park itself is wonderfully designed, with each themed zonefrom Ancient Egypt to Hollywoodtransporting you to another world. The food options were diverse and delicious, and we appreciated the shaded areas and water fountains to stay cool in the tropical heat. The staff were friendly and efficient, ensuring that queues moved smoothly and adding to the overall positive vibe. While the tickets are a bit on the expensive side, the value you get from the rides, shows, and immersive experiences makes it totally worth it. Universal Studios Singapore is not just a theme parkits an unforgettable journey filled with fun, thrills, and a touch of magic. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Singapore!

One of the best events in Singapore, I highly recommend visiting it All the games are nice and take you between 4 and 6 hours There is a small chapel for men and women after the first train (the big train) on the right after the safety deposit boxes, shown in the map I added. I recommend wearing a hat or using an umbrella because of the sun and heat There is a fast pass feature for events and no waiting in queues, and it is added to the admission ticket, but I recommend purchasing the regular ticket (one time admission ticket) only because it was not crowded at my time. Its price is 83 Singapore dollars. Then, if you enter and see there is crowding, you can add the express pass feature and the addition price is 100 Singapore dollars from the guest service office inside the city and do not go to the office outside.

Best place on Singapore You will love to go multiple times Minions section is opening in February 2025 All the rides are awesome do try the Transformers, Galactica both rides, Mummy ride, Jurassic park and all shows Do install the app so that you can plan The rush is less after lunch for most of the rides Staff is super helpful Must visit if you are in Singapore Kids love it Lot of food options Indian food at Oasis restaurant Click photos in Meet and greet times

You can find a large gastronomic offer, there is a Starbucks where we went to cool off and have a drink, because it was terribly hot. I recommend visiting the Universal Studio store, you can find great souvenirs there, I bought a magnet there for 10 Singapore. The prices are high but it's like in all such places. In general, I highly recommend visiting this place, but you need at least 2 days to visit everything calmly. A minion zone is being built in the park, but from what I saw, the opening is planned for 2025

This was a huge highlight in Singapore! This is our first Universal Studios experience and now we want to do them all worldwide. We arrived here at 9.30am, got in at 9.45am and ran straight to the two Battlestar Galactica rides and within the first 30 minutes we went on these two rides as well as the mummy ride and got on straight away. We stayed here until 7.30pm and found it a hectic yet enjoyable day, we completed all the rides we wanted (which was most of them), we came here on Christmas Eve and the most time we had to wait for a ride was 1 hour, we just tried to go on the busier rides when shows were on to avoid big cues. The transformers ride was extremely busy but a must do and seeing the water world show was a highlight too!!! When it comes to the food, we found the food to not be the best and obviously expensive, we got some burgers from Mels Drive In, they were quite mediocre. A must in Singapore. Great for adults too. There is no need to buy tickets in advance. There are many kiosks at the entrance. You can buy it with a credit card without waiting. It is smaller than in California, but the best shows such as Waterworld are also available here. It's always crowded. I recommend getting a fast pass. You'll wait much less time at activities. Especially children get bored while waiting. Fast pass provides an advantage. Rollercosters are a lot of fun. The adrenaline level of the black one is very high. We went in the afternoon. The fast pass was sufficient for all activities from 2 o'clock until closing. If you want to travel comfortably, relax and do the activities we love over and over again, go in the morning. Otherwise, 6 hours is enough for everything. I draw particular attention to the Waterworld show. It happens twice. Be sure to check out the watches and don't miss it.

My trip to Universal Studios Singapore was the best experience of my life! I absolutely loved every moment of it. Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for anyone looking for fun, adventure, and unforgettable memories!

The first thing I would say is that you shouldn't bring expensive bags! I either put it in a locker when I get on a ride, or I put it on a shelf right before I get on a ride, and it's safe because it's safe, but everyone puts their Chanel bags on the shelf and rides... Well, I guess it's because it's safe that it's okay! ! I bought my ticket at Agoda the day before, and although there are buses available, I chose the monorail. I went to have breakfast at the mall near the monorail station! Meals in the park are park prices, but they are memorable so if you like them, go for it! It's hot, so if you don't want to buy drinks inside, I think it's better to bring some with you! It's a long time, from 10:00 to 20:00, but since many people stop by on the day they're heading back to the airport and leave early, it surprisingly starts to become empty in the evening. I was so excited that I decided to stay forever! Halfway through, the wait for the roller coaster series suddenly became 5 minutes, and I got carried away by riding the red Human (regular coaster), the black Cylon (twirl), and then I got drunk after twirling around Jurassic Park ( ;;) I rode most of the way, so I got home at 7pm. It's basically a small space, so I recommend checking the app to see if there are any open spaces. It was empty in the evening, so I skipped the 30 minute wait. There is no signboard that lets you see all the waiting times in the park, so you just have to look at the app. Most of the shoes I wear are foot bras, so if you don't want to have to take off your removable shoes every time you ride an attraction, I think sneakers are the way to go. Jurassic Park It's hot, so if it's empty, you should go first and get wet before walking around the park! You can bring your luggage with you, but there are lockers available for a fee. (Coaster-type trains do not force you to bring your luggage, so the coaster-type lockers are basically free. Japanese is OK. Please take your time and read carefully.) Some people brought raincoats or bought raincoats, but with a maximum of 9 people on board, there is a high possibility that 2 of them will get soaked! It's a gamble whether you use a kappa or not! ! I returned to the hotel with wet shoes, so I wish I had gotten on the train earlier. Jurassic leg bra guy Single is early! I got the best view of the scenery! Mommy It's early for singles, but I got lost on the way to the boarding area and was so scared that I almost cried.I hit it off with another child who also got lost and went to the boarding area together...When it's empty, I try not to get lost until I get to the boarding area (maybe it's just me). Personally, it's my favorite vehicle. Human Cylon It's not that scary, and the scenery isn't all that great. It's fun, but it's just a normal coaster. Shrek Zone coaster type I thought it was a trick for children, but it was surprisingly tall and scary! Visuals Donkey Shrek I'm not good at English, so I felt like I couldn't keep up with it... Shrek 4D is quite shaky, so please be careful with your children. (There are also seats that do not shake.) Sesame Street Super safe rides Water World If you don't want to get wet, please go to the back! (Surprisingly, if you look closely, there are empty seats.) I think it's more like the opening act before the show starts, so I think it's fun to go early, but I think some kids got scared because people were falling. Personally, if you don't mind, you should definitely see it! The one on fire there is a possibility of getting wet in the front row on the far right Impressed by the image in the back I've used the Single Rider several times, and every time I've been talked to, I've gotten a pack from a Korean girl I became friends with after getting lost at Mummy, a woman told me "this is my first coaster ride in my life," a Chinese lady told me how beautiful the sky was, and I thought it was the most peaceful uni in the world. The vehicles and souvenirs are completely different from Los Angeles! It was so much fun! ! Minion will also be open from next week, and although the rides may be a bit old-fashioned, I definitely recommend it when you come to Singapore.

A Thrilling Adventure at Universal Studios Singapore! Our recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore was an unforgettable experience! We had an amazing time exploring the park and enjoying the rides. One of the highlights was the newly opened **Minion Land**it was incredibly fun, immersive, and perfect for all ages! From the adorable Minion-themed attractions to the vibrant atmosphere, it truly added a fresh and exciting experience to our visit. Although some outdoor rides were closed due to weather conditions for safety reasons, we still had a fantastic time enjoying the indoor attractions. The wait times were longer than usual, but the rides and experiences were absolutely worth it. The energy of the park, the friendly staff, and the well-designed themed areas made the day extra special. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore continues to be a must-visit destination. Rain or shine, there's always something exciting to do! Can't wait to visit again!

When visiting Singapore, Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute must-see while exploring Sentosa Island. However, dont forget to bring a rain cover even for your shoes! Getting caught in sudden rain or a storm is quite common. You can easily spend long hours here, a couple of hours is definitely not enough, as there are so many attractions to watch and participate in. If theres a special event, they might close early without prior notice, so its best to visit earlier in the day to make the most of your experience. Its not just for kids! The visual shows and theater performances are incredibly vibrant. Even if youre prone to dizziness, you should still experience Sci-Fi City; the rides there felt unbelievably realistic. The film sets and recreations were simply stunning. With seven different themed zones, we only managed to explore a few, but every part of it was absolutely worth it!

This place was opened in January 2010 by Genting Group from Malaysia, it is the first Universal Studios amusement park to be opened in Southeast Asia, and the second in Asia after Universal Studios Japan. This amusement park themed on famous Hollywood films produced by Universal Studios is located on Sentosa Island, Singapore. There are several rides that can be visited, including The Lost World, Far and Away, New York, Sci-Fi City, Hollywood Boulevard, Madagascar, Ancient Egypt. This ride is also equipped with 30 restaurants and food counters, as well as 20 souvenir kiosks. Several hotel facilities, including the Hard Rock Hotel, are available around this world-class tourist location. There are many photo spots that can be taken at this ride

Review for Universal Studios Singapore Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute must-visit for anyone looking for thrill, adventure, and entertainment all in one place. Located on Sentosa Island, the park offers a fantastic mix of rides, shows, and themed attractions inspired by popular movies. The Battlestar Galactica roller coasters are a must for thrill-seekers, while Transformers: The Ride provides an immersive 4D experience. The Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure and transformers are also crowd favorites. For families and kids, Far Far Away interactive experiences. The park is well-organized, clean, and easy to navigate, with plenty of dining options and souvenir shops. Lines for popular rides can be long, so getting an Express Pass is recommended for a smoother experience. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination for all ages, packed with excitement, adventure, and unforgettable memories!

If it's your first trip to Singapore, you should go to Universal! I was looking forward to it. Tickets were about 15,000 yen per person for the Univa and Night Safari pack from the Klook site. No matter how many times I tried, I couldn't get the QR code from the voucher, so I had a hard time, so I asked the hotel front desk to do it for me. It was quite troublesome. Use the MRT to get to UNIVA, and Singapore has a well-developed transportation network that is easy to understand, convenient, and fast. And you can go there safely and securely. And everyone is kind. After arriving at Univa, I was able to easily go around the attractions in about 2 hours and ride the attractions without waiting. Being in a subtropical region, I was physically exhausted from all the hard walking, so I decided to return home after about 3 hours. It's disappointing and expensive compared to Universal in Japan, but it was a great memory of my trip.

Universal Studios is definitely a one of the best attractions in Singapore as such. It is very neat and clean. It is well organized as well. If I remember correctly then it is smaller than the one that is there in Orlando but that is kind of expected. The attractions are nice. 1] There could be queues at some attractions, but they have an app which indicates the queue length at each attraction. 2] There are three huge roller coasters are one of the topmost attractions there. One larger than the other kinds. 3] There are rides like Transformers which are kind of virtual roller coaster rides and it is one of the top most attraction apart from roller coaster. 4] There are many rides like Puss in the boots which are for smaller kids 5] They also have 2-3 shows which are basically live and are arranged for only twice a day and run for 45 mins in each run. Please check the timings of the show as soon as you enter to enjoy them throughly. We had seen a show of Waterworld where they performed a lot of live stunts which was amazing to see. 6] Food options are relatively limited. If you are vegetarian they are only one or two options like Biryani inside. But it is not a big problem as such. 7] There are too many things to see so make sure that you reach there on time. 8] Please check that tickets are in order. I had booked a 3 day pass through Klook or similar site and it turnout that I had to mail them Universal first and then they send the tickets. This process wasted half an hour for me. So make sure you read the passes and conditions for entry.
