I have previously visited Universal Studios in Japan twice, once with the express ticket and once without. US Singapore is like visiting the Japanese one with the express ticket. Wait times are significantly lower for the rides, meaning you can save on the added expense. Some of the "rides" were a little underwhelming, whereas others were a bit much for my stomach. My fiancee enjoyed herself a great deal though.

Really nice, but smaller than the one in LA. One suggestion, is to take the fast track, but if it is expensive, not all, but many attractions have single rider, which is very quick, since not everyone knows about it. So, queues are long. But because of single rider, were able to visit almost all interesting attractions.

This place is huge and hence it is advisable you plan your activity accordingly.. it completely in open and hence it is advisable to carry umbrella, sunglasses etc as per the weather.. if you are going for one time visit do invest in Express pass or else you would spend your maximum time waiting... Overall indeed a experience full of memories...
Nice but small. Slightly overrated rides. Don't forget to buy express pass else you would spend just waiting in the queue.
Its always good but the price and lines made is less then perfect. I understand that you can get an express pass but at half the price of the ticket you are going to pay 100 per person
I went there on Saturday without express pass and could enjoy 7 attractions. Revenge of the Mummy Ride in Ancient Egypt Zone was insanely amazing!
Awesome.....Excellent experience...though the lines are very long....it was totally worth it.. Ticket prices vary in different agency...but direst ticket is 68.. In a word awesome....

Awesome place to visit with family & friends alike, Weekends are pretty crowded but there is VIP/fast line option at extra cost. Immerse yourself in a full day of fun and excitement. Tip : Reach there right at its opening time so as to cover every attraction.

This theme park is huge for a little city. Amazing and clean. Well looked after. I do recommend getting an express pass if you dont want to be waiting in line for hours. Otherwise you will have to spend a whole day here. Arrive early and leave at park closing to see the daily fireworks. Awesome attractions for all ages. An all round great theme park.
The best of fun! We had express passes and went through the park twice! My favourite was far far away land
Perfect place for the annual Halloween Horror Nights. Do invest in express passes so you can save time and disappointment!
Fork out and buy the express pass. Seriously.

Located in sweltering heat with queues that never seem to end. About 90 minutes of queuing for a 3 minute ride. Express passes cost 1.5x the price of an adult ticket. 120 for a single express entry per ride or 160 for unlimited express - per person. Special events require separate tickets - Hollyween about 70 per person for example. Overpriced food prices as well with small servings. Hard to enjoy except if you are willing to spend big and love hot, humid weather.
If you have plan revisit this theme park more in the next six month, you can upgrade your ticket to the season pass. Just pay 22sgd very cheap.
I'd recommend the express pass so you dont need to queue in line for the rides and attractions.
It's good to just pay attention to the timetable and follow it, but it's difficult and annoying to get the timing right. Arent there any discounts on express tickets?

It's good to buy Unlimit Express and play from morning until dusk. However, in the case of express, it is better not to buy it in advance, but to buy it when it looks like there will be a lot of customers that day. It is not as painful as waiting in a hot country... hahahaha It is important to buy it after checking the situation because it is often a waste of money on a free day!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!@@@ Transformers, Cyclone (better than Human), Mummy, Jurassic Boat, and water show are impressive. For lunch, it is better to use restaurants outside because you can leave once. There are a variety of restaurants including Din Tai Fung, Kaya Toast, Bak Kut Teh, and McDonald's, so it's a good idea to try them out!! It is better to come with family rather than friends, and with a lover rather than family. Although it is lower level than Osaka Universal, the advantage of having Unlimit Express is huge!
The fare is a bit expensive, so be sure to buy an express ticket if you can, it will save you a long queue.
Great roller coasters, bit short tho. Advise getting the Express Pass, very expensive, cuts 40 min wait to 10 min
Reach early in morning before opening....

Waterworld will blow your mind, amazing acting. There is few great roller coasters also and plenty to see. If you can affors Express i suggest you buy it. We got express tickets and spent all day there and we had just enough time to see everything.

When there are a lot of people and there are a lot of ups and downs, I definitely recommend buying Express. It's small, but it's worth it. If you take your time, you can play all day. The water show is also fun. If you don't want to get wet, sit far away.

One of the best and super fantastical experience here....do bring along extra cash as they are soooo many shopping you will do ,due to eye-catching souvenirs or products that you may wanna take away...catch them on non-peak days to reduce waiting time...and u might wanna go early morning so that you can visit all rides...Carry a small carrier as you may need to use the lockers in most venues which requires to put in some cash.. If you do not want to wait long, fork out an extra 50 which entails you to really faster access to all rides...which might be worth if you do not wait an hour long for popular rides....wear sun lotion as you may need to wait walk under hot sun and carry a small paper fan to beat the heat on really hot days...
Best place to visit in Sentosa Island. We had to buy express ticket. Even though it is a weekday. If you are willing to buy a express pass buy it asap. Unless you will have to pay more..
Nice experience I recommend taking the annual ticket so you can visit it several times and finish all the games and offers, and also to get discounts in the stores inside it.
Buy Express Pass!
If it's not a holiday, you don't need to buy a quick pass. You can just wait for 20 minutes at most. Closing time is 7pm
Getting an express pass is worth it. You'll be spending half of your time in the park waiting to get to rides if you dont
The queue is long...use express ae

Nice place with a lot of activities, if there is a lot of people it is better to get fast track option( Priority). If not much people don't pay extra. The transformers attraction is one of the best.you should try it.
Fun and good place, but the express ticket so expensive
Nice really but the express is a bit unfair

The park is not large and you can visit it all in one day. Except for Saturdays and consecutive holidays, I personally dont think you need to buy a quick pass. You must play Transformers and Ancient Egypt
It's amazing... but would suggest visitors to buy express entry tickets otherwise waiting time in queue is too long.
Best option to fully enjoy the place are 6 months pass or day ticket with express pass. Totally worth it
We enjoyed many rides here. Hotdogs were so yummy. I highly recommend the express ticket. It helped a lot to shorten the queue. We spent the whole day here. Our favorite one was Mummy!!
Awesome place to spend time with friends and family..... Just prepare extra cash for food, souvenir and drinks.... Get express ticket also to cut the queue.....
Great experience for all ages and rides are fantastic. Tips - Take express pass. Worth all the you spend. Start from Madagascar and end at Jurassic Park.
Amazing place to spend a splendid day . Express ticket essential

FYR : in addition to the 1 day entry fee, express pass costed S110, Unlimited pass costed S140 on Dec 30, 2018. Super crowded even for express pass lanes. 2 roller coasters were out of service for a while. Waste of time and money for us. Can not recommend to visit.
Avoid holidays. Long ques. Up to 2 hours for some rides. Express pass get expensive on crowded days. I had to pay S 120 for express pass in addition to S76 for regular ticket.
Check out the rush and then go for express pass.
Totally reccomend getting the skip the que pass. Expensive but worth it
The second time here was way better than the first especially because of the Express pass.

Many rides and shows. 1 day ticket available to enjoy. Foods bit expensive inside. But outside food also allowed. Some of the rides are with longer queues ,eating up your time. Express pass will help to fix this problem with some extra costs.

A must visit for everyone if you are coming to Singapore. It is based on Universal Studios theme and you can spend your entire day here and that too would look less. Tickets are currently priced around 80 and they provide express pass as well which you will have to take separately if you want to avoid the queues. On weekends, if you want to enjoy then express pass should be preferred else you would spend most of your time standing in the queues. Though everything in this theme park is amazing but below are some that I liked the most. Transformers ride Jurassic world ride Water world Universal movie Pyramid ride Food inside the restaurants are expensive.

Reach here early.There is a limited entry express ticket and unlimited entry express ticket. About 3 rides were exempted in the limited entry ticket and you are allowed to ride only once in a ride with this ticket. We paid about 68 SGD for the entry ticket and another 70 SGD for the limited entry express ticket. Express ticket could be bought inside once you assess the waiting time. So don't buy it before entering the studios. There were about 15 rides as indicated in the limited entry express ride ticket. This was quick enough to let us complete all rides in about 2.5 hours in the park. We skipped 2 rides. Overall the rides were good and enjoyable. The Shrek and Transformers ride were very enjoyable for kids
Great rides but would recommend that you spend a bit more to purchase express pass if you want to maximise your time enjoying the rides instead of queuing
Good enough to spend a full day.need to first decide which all rides to go first.or else will have to deal with long queue.but then if u take the express ticket,no need to wait in queue.
Woo-hoo! If affordable will recommend buying express pass in peak season. One time pass recommend for the first time visit. (info: extra 90)

Once in a life one should visit this place in life time. We have taken express pass so we could able to cover everything on time. But express pass is bit expensive which is 90 additional to day pass of 76. So many people gave me wrong information on upgrading, please be clear in it. Also my best suggestion is start your trip from right which have best rides. Also if you pay 60 you will get all photos soft copies to complete universal studios. Almost all the rides you cannot take pictures inside. So I guess that's best deal.

Another awesome place in Singapore. Best place for kids But buy Universal Express passes or else waiting time is from 30 mint to 90 mint in busy days for normal passses.. Must take a rollercoaster ride (silver track ) Transformers ride. Waterfront rides. (Especially for adults)
Best rides, Great service and awesome experience!

Brilliant infrastructure & some innovative rides. Really enjoyed my trip. Queues were big but we're fast moving. Golden Tip: Go as single rider in all the rides you will get almost instant access to the rides with regular ticket. Even if you have groups & are willing to split up then this is the best way to go!! Guides are really helpful although you don't require any assistance in this park.
Overpriced. We bought fast track pass but its not worth it.

Expensive ! Not worth for the weekend, avoid Saturday Sunday and Singapore public holidays or you will be in Que waiting for long in the scorching sun. Note !! There is something called express pass, better to buy so u can enjoy all the rides ahead of all those with normal tickets must for elderly

No. 1 ride was "Human Vs Cyclon" , No. 2 was Transformer , No. 3 was The Mummy. I would not recommend wasting time on any other ride, if you have bought a "Normal Pass" and not an express pass and you are short on time. These 3 are the Best .
Express ticket or brace yourself for a ridiculous queue.
Must sign up for yearly ticket. Save money and can visit as and when I like.

Was Spielberg also happy? Southeast Asia's first full-fledged theme park I visited the park at the end of the year, and it was crowded... Some attractions take longer than 60 minutes, so the Express Pass comes in handy at times like this For those over 60 years old, get a big discount with a senior ticket. You can get a 10% discount on all purchases within the park with your MasterCard, but be aware that some stores do not accept credit cards. My recommendation is the drink cup. If you carry it with you, you can get an additional drink for 3. It's a sturdy cup, so you can use it at home as wellIf you have an E-ticket, don't forget to print it out using the printer on the right side of the park entrance.

It's also good but not cover in one day it's require maximum 2 to 3 days if any one want to cover in 9ne day then take a express ticket in which no line are stand it's just like vip darsan in India temple .... and it's very enjoyable and loveliest place in Singapore

I love the theme park but the downside is the long queue. Avoid weekends and if you have some cash to spare, get the express or vip pass. Also, riders who are alone can get the same benefit with express pass. But if theres two of you dont expect you will be seated next to each other.

Are you planning on going on the play furniture? How many do you plan on taking? How many hours do you plan to play? There are so many differences depending on it. Popular rides require a wait of at least 3 hours. Be prepared and wait in line. However, if you have money and want to ride the rides without waiting, I recommend purchasing a VIP admission ticket. I remember when I went to Universal in LA, USA, I bought it and rode all the rides all day long.
Good place to get a new experience. All the dry rides we're good. The most amazing ride that I had gone is Cylon. Better to get a Universal Express ticket for fulling all the rides.

One of the must visit places in Singapore. An amazing art and construction done. Not to miss the human and cyclone rides. And next are the mummy and transformers. Look out for show timings. There are mostly only two of each in a day. The one in the water world is a good one. Express pass would be a good option, if you are a tourist here. It will save much of standing in the queues. The food might be a bit expensive. Lots of stores to shop from after each ride. They have a very good locker facility. Had a wonderful experience. Best to book online and sometimes even has offers.
Excellent one. Get express ticket to enjoy all the rides. Transformers and water world is must to see

Great rides, heaps of activities for kids of all ages. From scary rides for teens and adults to simple and cute shows for school going kids. Very organised customer service but oines can get really long with waiting time reaching a whopping 70 mins on one ride we saw. VIP pass is a must and a great value for money to skip lines and get more done in less time. Lots of food and drink stands which helps to keep hydrated. Overall a top notch experience.

Everything thats there is truly larger than life. Amazing experience for the first timers. Pay extra for premium if you want to spend less time on line and then enjoy all the rides. You must give at least a day to this place and enjoy to the fullest. Best experience ever for me and my friends.
Amazing place. Remember to get the express pass if wish you to save on time. We could cover the entire USS in 1 day very confortably.

I strongly recommend buying a season pass or Annual pass if you're a local. Tourist? You should get an express ticket. Its more worth your money considering the difference in waiting times. For a ride that may have a 2 hour waiting line, you can go to the front within 5, 10 minutes.
You can spend all day in USS. Remember to buy express ticket incase you do not want to wait about 30 mins - 1 hours per game.
Express pass is a must or else be ready to wait long queue
Very expensive if you take the express but worth the money if the place is full
Time to renew the rides? No changes since last visit in 2013
Not great but it was good.. always buy Express pass even on week days.. It's must though expensive..
Enter and sprint to the transformer Visit 9 attractions without using an express ticketThe hot weather and limited meal menu need improvement

Very nice all the rides though expensive. Children enjoyed it very much. Cannot finished all rides in a day due to many & long waiting rides for each ride. Either need to buy fast track tickets or season pass for next revisit.

Awesome experience for us in Singapore.. must visit.. Try to reach there as soon as possible,9.30 AM If you want to avoid very long queues take express pass or get the top up by paying extra amount(recommenced) With normal pass waiting time is about 1 hour for some rides Take the maps and decide your rides one day before(best rides can be found on google search) Use locker smartly to avoid paying locker charges, free for some time then chargeable Must visit rides TRANSFORMERS HUMAN vs. CYLON Revenge of the Mummy Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure Etc..
Better than expected..but universal Express card was too expensive...it's normally 30 but we got it for 90
Other than long Q everything is superb .. I suggest to take express pass if you want to visit all the rides

Wonderful experience. If possible buy the express pass, its worth it. Only downside is that some rides are weather dependent. They close some rides if there is lightning nearby so try to go there when the weather is good. The transformers and the mummy ride was exciting!
Excellent place....u can access every single activity with just one entrance ticket
Go with express pass for in time completion of all rides.. hectic waiting for each ride on weekdays too
Worth the full day visit (( BUT PLZ TAKE EXPRESS TICKETS TO VISIT FULL OF UNIVERSAL STUDIOS))
Small, no need to buy express pass like another USS. If you want to exit and re-enter dont forget to asked for stamp on your hand. Recommend to buy food from outside also

where do i begin to describe the fun i had here. nice rides. good food options available. must rides are: 1. transformers(you just cannot miss this at any cost), 2. battle star roller coasters, 3. the mummy. also try to visit the Steven Spielberg studio where they show you how a Hollywood disaster scene is shot. a tip: go for the express pass instead of a normal one, it is almost twice as much, but you dont have to wait in lines and waste most of your time standing in line doing nothing. save your money somewhere else!
I strongly recommend the express pass. That way you will be able to skip most queues.
Take the express pass. This universal is smaller than its American counterparts, so waiting time per ride increases a lot. No point without express pass.
Be sure to quit the express

Smallest of the Universal Studios parks, but it has some neat stuff. Prices inside the park are much more reasonable than at the American ones. Staff was anyways friendly. Some rides get really long lines (BSG, Transformers), so hit those early! Empty your pockets completely before the BSG rides or they won't let you ride. They do check your pockets early, so that is nice!
Be sure to come on a non-holiday basis! Be sure to buy a quick pass during the holidays! Otherwise, you will line up until you faint.
Fun theme park with decent rides, the express pass is worth the money

There are 2 types of the ticket. Reguler & Express. The express ticket is more expensive about 50% higher than the reguler. The benefit is the quee line to the atraction is faster. U need to spend 1 full day in USS coz the tocket is quite expensive, and the attraction is unlimited (1 ticket for all the attraction)
Nice rides. But to complete you should buy express pass very necessary otherwise you will only be able to to 2 or 3 rides in one day.

A Five Star Experience; on Saturday 16 March 2019 at 10 am we had tickets to the VIP Experience at Singapore Universal Studios, our Guide was Mr. Rashid Hamid. This was truly the best day ever from the initial greeting to five full hours of red carpet treatment; this was a belated Birthday trip and it was worth every penny! The highlight of the VIP experience was our guide Mr. Rashid; he was clearly an Ambassador of Hospitality for Singapore Universal Studios, with years of experience and expertise to ensure that your dream comes true. Bypassing lines, navigating the park for maximizing the time, meet and greet with mascots were awesome, but Mr. Rashids expertise included sensing your request even before you; clearly his enthusiasm and love of the park were contagious!
Amazing rides. Must visit. Would recommend Express pass only.
Best place to visit in Singapore. Totally worth it. If you have money please do buy Universal express pass to skip the queues and avoid wait time..

Wonderful place to relive your childhood. This place has got amazing rides and shows. If you are traveling alone then you can get in single rider line(this line is more progressive in comparison to other normal line). Try purchasing the ticket online as you can get in combo discount for both Sentosa Island and Universal Studio Pass or you can purchase the Universal Studio Express ticket from the counter(not available online), the advantage of the Express ticket is that you don't have to wait in long queues for your turn for different rides, Express line moves much faster as compared to the normal line(Beneficial if you are in a group and lot of time is saved and you can cover almost all the rides). That was an amazing experience there and the staff was very helpful with the queries and instructions.
Bought an annual pass unlimited express. Worth the money as it save lots of your time! All the worker inside are friendly. Definitely a place for family.
They don't even give lanyard for 6months season pass anymore. With such exorbitant price that they charged. Disappointed w e stinginess

From Vivo Mall, take the Sentosa Express, pay 4 dollars, you can buy a ticket directly, you can pay using ezlink. get off at the first stop and well come to Universal Studios. Tickets can be purchased on site and can also be purchased at Traveloka to get promotional prices.

We loved every but of our time there.. So when we arrived.. I bought my tickets online.. Not from universal but from agencies online make sure to check reviews.. Next we were there by 9.30 way before it open at 10 am... That's good as you get to analyse the crowd and the situation... But why? Because... You should make the decision to purchase the EXPRESS like we did.. It's no joke, if you're planning to come here with family with kids.. With anyone.. Be prepared to spend a minimum of 100 to 50 per person.. The price for express changes based one the demand for it.. So the earliest bird gets the cheaper but on weekends its pretty standard at 100. Why do you need to spend that amount.. Let me tell you why... If you do not want to que at every ride... Carrying kids in the sun.. While trying to finish as many.. Please buy it. We did not que at any except for one ride.. Which didn't have express... While we got express I saw parents with kids... Crying, restless.. Just waiting for literally hours.. No joke.. They waited for 2 hours for one ride.. And rides that lasted you less than 5 to 8 mins.. Can you imagine.. If you wanted to go again.. You had to line another hour or so.. Or longer.. There are two types of express.. 1 limited to just one time per ride.. And unlimited... As many times.. We got the unlimited but if its your first time that's alright.. If you think you only wanted to do everything once. Its preferences. I went for one ride 4 times as I saw the same people in line. As a couple we finished every ride.. Took us 6 hours... I guess even longer with kids.. And also.. We went to nearly ever show.. Get the map and the showtime pamphlet.. And be ready for all.. You wouldn't want to miss it.
Should give lanyard with a season or annual pass and a pin badge and discount vouchers

We reached at 9.30 in the morning on a Easter Sunday and entered at 9.45 AM. We bought a single entry express pass, however, we only used the express pass post 2 PM to go for the ride second or third time. The wait time was 90 minutes around 2 PM in the normal que. If you're willing to go to universal studios, reach by 9.45 and you will be done with almost all of the rides by 2 PM without an express pass. 3 ratings because as per the entry pass amount, the park isn't as big as the other ones and everything is way too over priced.
Although it is smaller than Japan, the overall feeling is good. It is recommended to buy a quick pass to avoid queuing

Going to USS is easy. You can choose the MRT or Grab Car and just hop on the tram after. We bought our tickets in the airport which is cheaper by 4 (71 vs 75 upfront). The ticket was open dated so we went on a Monday to avoid long lines. If youre not the patient type, will advise to get the fast pass option as you will still need to wait about 60-90mins for rides like Galactica and Jurassic Park. Be sure to come to the park early as you will be lining up half the time. Bring an empty water container and just fill it up inside. Food and beverages are expensive as its a captured market.

Not as big as in US, but pretty good. Would recommend to take universal express, as waiting time is long even during the working days. We took unlimited Express, but one time per ride Express would have been just fine too.
Fun place, make sure you have an express pass. Food is deal but what do we expect
Pretty good rides. Not as scary though. Should definitely get the fast pass. Only took us half a day to get through the whole park. Skipped the queues.

Universal Studios is the ultimate place for a thrilling experience and for having an exuberant experience. It is one of the must visit places in Singapore and one not to be missed by tourists. It is not only for children but people of all ages. The theme park is centralised on various movie characters. The theme park itself is super organised and the staff takes care of everything very well. Even large queues are handled well. Even with thousands visiting it every day, the place is super clean. I recommend you buy the Universal Express Pass if you want to do all the rides in one day. It costs S40. It may seem to be a lot but is integral if you want to finish all the rides as the queues for some rides maybe more than an hour long. There are a number of shows at different timings and one of the best being Water World (right next to Jurassic Park). You can even meet the characters and click pictures with them. My favourite rides include the Grey track rollercoaster, The mummy rollercoaster and the Jurassic Park Boat ride. All in all, it will be a day of fun and one which you will always remember.

I loved it. Games are awesome. You will have a great experience here. I suggest you to buy the express tickets so that you can't waste your time in the queue and you can cover maximum games otherwise you can't cover all the games the games in one day. Mainly don't miss the Transformers game, It is really good and you will get a new experience.
Great place. Recommend to buy express ticket if it has to be completed in a day.

Best place and best park to go to Singapore. But if for tourist visiting on peak hour, I will surely recommend to get some ideas about shows and their timings and get a express ticket. This may be expensive but it will surely be a value of money and will result in a better visit.

Awesome place for people looking for a full day of fun! This park is more compact (and therefore might be a bit less immersive than the other ones like USJ) but it has plenty of rides that you can enjoy. Strongly recommend that you purchase the express pass so that you don't have to spend too much time queuing Mummy-themed ride will help you gauge your tolerance for rides in general

Definitely purchase an express pass unless you want to wait in lines for min 1 hour. Rides also feel rather short, especially if you're waiting in line for over an hour and the ride is over in less than 2 minutes.
Go during the off-peak season! That was you won't need an express pass. Also, eat well before heading there and sneak in snacks if you can because the restaurants are stupidly overpriced
One of must visot places in Singapore but dont forget to buy express entry if you want to enjoy.

We took a taxi from the hotel, which was easy and cheap. I bought my tickets in advance online at a site where I could buy them cheaply. I recommend purchasing in advance because it's a little cheaper online and you don't have to wait in line. There is a ticket purchase counter on the left as you face the entrance, and directly opposite the ticket counter on the right. It's a little hard to see, but if you go to the right side, the staff will be standing there, so look for them. The basic screaming machine will leave all your luggage (including your smartphone) in a locker. You will be checked with a metal detector at the entrance to the vehicle. If you cannot return within the specified time, you will be charged a fee, so it is a good idea to have a credit card or banknotes with you. Even if you get on the train without carrying anything and have to pay, the staff will pay for your locker, so please talk to the staff near your locker. The garden is very compact, so I was able to move around without getting tired. Also, I was prepared for it to be as crowded as USJ, but I was able to ride the ride in about 10 to 30 minutes, and I was able to enjoy it while taking a relaxing break. On the way back, I took the train one stop away and enjoyed shopping as there was a shopping mall at the station.
Good and Expensive explorer
Loved it Price is a bit higher. Should have few options for without full park ride package
Pretty good, lots of new rides
Everything is good and free of cost . Don't take your bags with you because inside locker are payable 5 dollars for an hour.

be pleasant. It's so fun. Express purchase is highly recommended. I laughed so hard that I cried thanks to the Indian people I met in Transformers, and I realized once again that Singapore is a representative tourist destination for people from all over the world.
Amazing experience. Express pass recommended if you want to enjoy everything properly.

Indeed, a very nice place. You'll surely have a wonderful and memorable experience. And the burger we tasted was very delicious, the patty is so juicy. You will also get a chance to have a personalized phone case in a reasonable price. And you should try to visit their souvenir stores, there's a lot of choices to buy for your pasalubong. :)
Thanks a lot Klook! We had a great day. Meeting Optimus prime, Shrek and Gru is awesome. Recommended to ride Transformers and Cyclop&human. Must watch the Water Show. Two thumbs up!

Universal studios never disappoint me! Located in sentosa island, the fastest access to sentosa island is by sentosa express, you can take it from vivo city mall. Came here in Ramadhan season so not much ppl inside USS. best day ever! PS: I bought the ticket from klook. Way more cheaper and good deals.
This place hasn't been updated in a very long time. Queues were ridiculous without an express pass. Definitely avoid.
Good..slightly overrated. Long que to get into the ride..express pass is must required
Must go here if you travel to Singapore. If you have more money you should buy the VIP ticket because some rides can have a queue of 1 hour
Not upgraded in times
I strongly advise buying a fast pass ticket because the queues take a long time
This Universal Studios is quite small and can be completed in three hours, but the queues wont take long. Its pretty good and has all the essentials, but it seems a bit expensive.
If you go on weekends its a bit crowded and if you buy a Express pass for as day it will be much easier but it costs 50 though

You need almost a full day here. It pays to get the Express ticket as with it most rides only took between 2 and 10 minutes to get on, without so.e rides were 60 to 70 minutes waiting. Plenty of shops, food and drink places to keep your energy up. Use the lockers as it can get hot and tiring carrying a bag around.
nice.. was better earlier.. now its just for money making concept

To truly enjoy this... spend that bit extra and get the VIP Experience.. trust me.. nothing comes close.. i've been to so many attractions..this is by far one of the best theme parks around.. and the VIP experience truly makes the experience exceptional. enjoy your awesome day at Universal Singapore!
Loved it. One of kids favourite choice. Use map guide. Great experience with express pass ticket. I got Sesame book merchandise

Myself and my family (all over 18years) had the best day here. Worth purchasing the express pass and spending a minimum of 4 hours. Rollarcoasters for all people (some scary and some not). Recommend getting there early and doing the rides you like the most first to beat the cues. Staff are wonderful and the park was super clean.
Best theme park I've ever been to. Go visit with your friends/family! Takes about a whole day to complete all the attractions without the express pass.
One of the best manmade wonders...apt for people of all ages to have fun...in addition to entrance ticket,do buy the express pass if u want to beat the queue to enjoy all the rides..

What a waste of time. Pay 79 to get in and had to wait 110-150 min for a ride. Decided that was silly so purchased the 140 express ticket to skip the line. What a joke. Still waited 30-40 min for a ride. Managed 5 rides for the day. Highly recommend skipping this unless you want to feel absolutely rotted. Never felt so ripped off in my life.

Divided into 7 parts, USS is amazingly huge. Keep the whole day just for this. Especially if you have kids. Advisable to get the tickets beforehand so you dnt spend time checking in. The ticket includes admission to all rides inside. If you have a VIP ticket, special entrances for you. The passes are valid for a few days since time of booking. So you can get them in advance. Each ride has a counter at the entrance telling you the waiting period for the same. Start your day early in the morning so you have less waiting period for each ride. Eateries inside have mainly non vegetarian food. But right near the Transformers, there is a STAR-BOT Cafe....you will get 100% vegetarian food there. And huge bowls of it. Trust me, you won't leave disappointed. Roadside hawkers are also located every few blocks. Big rides like Battlestar Gallactica will take easily about 1hour to await your turn. Plan your day accordingly. Water rides are also amazing and must do.

Its worth buying an annual pass! If you only come here once Recommended entertainment in the park: No1-mummy! ! ! No2-Transformers No3-Future Water World show (its worth the price after watching it) In the Lost World area No4-Red and Blue Coaster (divided into red pedals and blue suspended legs) "Tips" Take advantage of the "single" entrance, often there is no need to queue. Sometimes the general channel queues for 2 hours, single people only need to queue for 15 minutes. You can put it before playing mummy and red and blue roller coaster Bags are stored in the lockers, which is very convenient! There are free storage hours, and you will be charged if you exceed the time limit (so remember to bring some cash with you) Try not to bring anything with you when you are waiting for the roller coaster, including your mobile phone! Dont bring it! It will fall off the staff will check it for you before queuing up Recommended food in the park: turkey legs (really huge). The gourmet restaurants in the park are all the same, it depends on what style you want to eat. There is a restaurant in Lost World with a giraffe outside. The fried stick legs inside are OK! If you dont like the restaurants in the park, you can go to the exit to get a park stamp, and then come back in to play after youve eaten enough! Recommended parent-child itinerary: No1-Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Station No2-4D Shrek No3-Madagascar No.4-Jurassic River Adventure No5-The Adventures of the Invincible Cat Swordsman No6-Charizard Flight School After leaving the gate, go right to the seawall steps, facing vivo city. There is a 15-minute free crane ballet water dance show at 8:00 every night. You can watch it! Very exciting The light rail express on Vivo city 3F only charges once when you go there. There is no charge from Sentosa to other stations or back to vivo city. By-walking around the world is like walking through the kitchen at home, people who go there every day to play a round

You can buy cola or soft drinks here. If you go underground, there is a vending machine where you can get a taxi, and you will get double the price. And go early in the morning to catch the important rides first. If a group tour comes later, I can't even think about it.

Interesting experience in USS today (26 Nov 2020). We queued for our first ride: Transformer. 30 mins into the queue, the ride broke down (We encounter power failure while in the queue). Turn out a few rides were affected (Transformer, the Mummy, Jurassic Park rapid adventure and Madagascar crate adventure). So the crowd dispersed and concentrate on other rides making the the queue to balloon to 60 mins or more. Due to covid19, most rides have their capacities reduced by half (they kept alternate row empty for social distancing). Again, this contribute to the longer queue. On hindsight, the best decision I made today: I purchased unlimited express pass for myself and my 2 kids. Instead of queuing for 60 mins, I get to ride 3 different rides in 1 hour. Some rides, I get to ride multiple times. Those downed rides went back up after 2 hours or so (Transformer went down again later in the evening). I noticed the crowds were getting lesser after 6pm. Most likely because most people went for dinner or went home. This is the best timing for getting on rides if you dont have express pass. The rides are open from 2pm to 9pm. I would have rated my experience 2 stars without the unlimited express pass. It seriously worth the splurge.
Awesome...but if you are taking regular pass you have to wait for an hour or more for most of the rides..better select single rider option
If you only purchase basic entry ticket, better than don't come. You will only enjoying queue.

Went during the Covid-19 pandemic (Phase 2) and used the SingapoRediscovers Voucher for USS ticket. Paid an additional 60 cash per pax for USS Express Pass. Waiting Time: Those without Express Pass, the normal queue waiting time for the attraction ranges from 30mins - 1hour 15mins. With the express pass, the waiting time for our queue was about 5-10mins. Definitely worth it as we were able to cover more attractions. F&B: Most restaurants and cafes were open with only a few closed. There are at least 2-3 Halal restaurants open during this period. Facilities: Free lockers available to store personal items during the ride. Musollah for Muslim guests is closed during this period, thus remember to bring your own prayer mats. Overall, experience was great and crowd was on par during pre Covid days. Social Distancing Ambassadors are around to advise guests and can be seen almost everywhere. The only disappointment is the temporary closure of shows due to Covid-19 measures.

Smallest of the Universal Studios around the world but a must visit when you are in Singapore. It would take nearly a day to complete if with family would prefer to buy express pass. Making full use of the rediscovers voucher and brought family for a day of fun at the Universal Studios Singapore on a perfect cloudy Saturday. Although was told that they have limited the numbers of people into USS, there are still lots of people there. With social distancing in place, queuing in line to various attractions are long, some as long as 2 hours! We queued for 1 hour for the Madagascar ride. Thereafter we decided to purchase the Express Pass which is priced almost the same as the entry ticket. With the Express tickets, the longest wait is about 20 mins, and the fastest was no queue required for the Express lane at Transformer 4D. Highly recommend to buy the Express Pass to better enjoy the rides you desire. The economic return is definitely worth it!

Had a great time. Took my 18 year old son for the first time while he was visiting. We went on a very busy Good Friday. To help speed things up we did the VIP Tour. It was a bit costly but well worth it. We got included souvenirs, dining credits, and Express Unlimited cards for after the tour. The best part we had a guide take us around the park wherever we wanted to go and he took us too all the rides up from the exits. We went straight in, zero waiting, ahead of the lines including the Express line. This was great. We could pick the front row or wherever we wanted. We could do multiple times, etc. Some lines had an 80 minute wait. We had none. Again expensive but worth it. Additionally our guide scheduled photo opportunity with Transformers and we were first in line and no wait for Megatron. Funny as a decepticon he was complaining to us the whole time. Good fun. All in all it was hot and humid but moving quickly through the park was super helpful and nice.
The amusement park is highly recommended, the extra price for the fast lane is definitely worth it. So you can experience the entire park in one day and drive the attractions you like more often.

Great experience! Yes there are a lot to fix, but overall it still amazing what they do in this time. In my opinion, these are my recomendation for you : 1. Always purchase Express Pass. It will save your time, especially in the weekend. 2. Sentosa Train now is free. I don't know for how long, but now even you have to tap your EZLink card, the price is 0 SGD. 3. Go in early, get out late. Maximize your time. 4. Always purchase the souvenirs for at least at 5 pm (2 hours before closing). There will be a long queue if you go at closing time. You cannot freely choose to buy anything. 5. Buy at the Universal Souvenir Shop (next to HelloKitty Store). It is the only place that contains all of the characters. 6. Take photo in the Alley next to the Mel's Restaurant. It have a lot of unique photo spots. Also check when the lights goes on. You will have a bit different ambience of the photos. 7. There will be some closed/under renovations Attractions. If you purchase the standart Express pass, you will be eligible to ride the same attractions more than 1 time if you choose.

A Beautiful Experience.. Even though covid regulations are maintained. The quality is still top notch. Advise the rides have a line for single person.. Make sure to download the app or keep track on timing during this period as rides, meet & greets, show have a scheduled time.. Of you plan on advance you can definitely do all rides even twice and then some... Same goes to the shows & meet& greets... Also not forgetting to collect the pass for photography, allows you to have your picture taken at multiple locations and then be collected as a group from the Dark Room( that is what universal calls it) And must of course check out the merch shops and momentos.. Or even the food carts for unique packaging such as the dino egg at the Jurrasic section... Which is filled with popcorn and yours to take.. Making it a cute momento..

This is a theme park located on USS Sentosa Island, which is great because there are many other things to do on the island itself. The price is about 70,000 won per day for adults. Approximately 50,000 won for children It's not cheap at all. Express Pass tickets cost 20,000 to 30,000 won on top of the basic price. The line is quite fast. The scale felt the same or smaller than Lotte World. Because it is a franchise, the prices are quite expensive. If you don't go there just to ride the rides, people who like taking pictures or who like the universal world view will likely enjoy it. Even though it was a weekday, there were a lot of people. Depending on popularity without Express Pass, the wait can be as short as 30 minutes or as long as 2 hours. I was the worst because I didn't like waiting in line. The restaurants in the theme park are packed with people trying to order, and the prices are much higher than Singapore prices, so I recommend eating a good meal before entering the USS. For simple food and beverages sold at stands, the waiting line is long and stock runs out early. There is a card reader, but is it broken? There are many places that only accept cash. In conclusion, I think visiting once is enough.

A place to have so much fun in. Definitely set aside a whole day for it. Dont get the express pass as an added extra though as so many other people do which means the ride lines end up being longer than the actual ride lines. Also bring your own food. Food is incredibly expensive.

absolutely amazing rides, attractions & food. extremely crowded during peak periods (weekends/public holidays) to avoid spending too much time in queues, purchasing an express pass is recommended.

Super awesome place with many attractions. Can't do every ride with a normal pass because it takes a lot of time in standing queues. So always try to buy a universal express(VIP) pass where the queues are really very small. All real experiences everyone can do that.

While traveling, there are places to spend money and places to not spend money. Universal Express (tickets that allow you to ride rides faster) are definitely worth using. Universal Studios itself is small, so you can get around quickly.
Ticketing price should be reduced for foreign travellers especially in Express tickets

When coming to Universal Studios, it is recommended to buy priority access tickets. Otherwise, in Singapores weather, you will have to queue for several hours for each item and then the game will end in 1 to 3 minutes. There is really no experience at all. Although priority tickets are expensive, without priority tickets, it is almost impossible to experience most of Universal Studios' projects in one day, especially on weekends and holidays. Relatively speaking, the two types of priority tickets can only be used once for all items (except for a few). The unlimited priority tickets are not necessary unless you particularly love one of the items. The Battlestar Coaster is definitely the flagship of all the roller coaster projects at Universal Studios. If there are no health risks, this project is 100% recommended to experience. Of course, this project is also one of the projects with the largest queues (there is also a project with a large number of people queuing for Jurassic World Ride, which I personally think is very average). There is a sister roller coaster next to this roller coaster (red track), which has a lower difficulty level (no 360-degree rotation). Friends who want to ride a roller coaster but are afraid of it can experience this roller coaster first, and then consider whether to go to the Ace Coaster for fun. There is the only Starbucks not far from the entrance of the park. The other restaurants in the park can only be said to be quite satisfactory. The taste and price are not far different from those outside the scenic area. At least it is enough to satisfy your appetite. Compared with the catering in a certain country's scenic area, it is simply too conscientious. Compared with Universal Studios in other countries, the projects are single and the area is much smaller. It is also unbelievable that some products, including the parks sales stores, are out of stock. However, Universal Studios Singapore is still highly recommended as one of the must-see attractions when traveling to New Zealand. Finally, I reiterate that priority tickets are really worth buying if you want to really play. Finally, I wish you (we) have fun!
Not all available. Depend on weather and situations. Bring own bottle. Lots of waterpoint.

For those who want to go here, you can take the Sentosa Express monorail, it's at the Vivo City Mall on the 3rd floor for free, just tell the officer, or just tap your ez link, for those who want to go for a walk, just enter Universal for free. Waiting time for express pass holders was less than 10 minutes on any given point of the day on any eligible ride. We went on Transformers, Cylon, Human, Mummy and Jurrasic water ride atleast 4 times during whole day. Lunch @ Louis NY pizza was good . They have a combo of Pizza, Drink and dessert which is quite filling for 1 person. Lots of snack options available through out the park Staff is courteous and follows rules.
