Don't waste time on those rides because you'll miss out on other rides. If you are visiting with family then only buy express pass for the most enthusiastic one in the group. Carry extra clothes for the Jusrassic Park ride, or you can dry your clothes by paying 5 dollars in the dryer. You have to be empty-handed because a lot of the rides are roller coasters. There are lockers available on rent. Carry loads of hydrating drinks and food.
If you are a tourist from Indonesia, if you want a cheap price, you should just order an entry ticket from Indonesia at OTA, there are several that sell at a cheaper price.
Lack of rides allow Express Pass and the line up is still too long for some rides with express pass. Too expensive to purchase Express passes for only able to use for less than 5 rides.

Coming from the U.S., this place is definitely a little smaller, but still good nonetheless. Purchased the unlimited express pass, and it was definitely worth it, though towards the end of the day lines are definitely less. Overall, decent. Was a little sad that Waterworld was closed though.

Undoubtedly would put this number 1 attraction in Singapore. Its a excellent day outing and has the offing to satisfy all age groups. Get ready for a good walk and standing in queues. Suggestions: 1. Dont go late, doors open 11 go at least at 10.45am. Purchase the ticket online or through apps like Klook and have voucher ready. Dont buy universal fast pass unless you feel the need of it and youre time constrained. Assess the crowd and you can always buy it inside the park based on crowd. 2. Be first to finish the highlight attractions like transformers and Jurassic world as crowd gets thicker as the day grows. 3. Didnt find much benefit in the Christmas meal voucher, so please avoid it. Buy just a entrance ticket and buy food of choice without getting restricted with voucher. 4. Have entire day planned so that you have the time to enjoy., if you are allocating only half day you might rush and miss few attractions. 5. Try to get the photo time from transformers and jurassaic characters (they have posted the time in front of the attraction) 6. Have fun with the rides and with many photo opportunities.

Good to have one time experience. Food options can be better. Safety is given extreme importance (Rides are not allowed during heavy rain and lightings). Express pass is useful if you are short of time and not a local. River Rapids was great fun!!

Nice theme park in Singapore. Better you buy ticket in advance via OTA. Coz sometimes queue is long. You can access from MRT harbour front and change to mrt resort world. Restaurants available on site. There is a vip ticket add on to skip queue. But add on pricing almost similar to normal ticket. Toiket ia clean.

After visiting this is my thoughts on Universal studios. Gold digger studio. From selling tickets to Express pass & item sold inside, like goodies & item. Normal ticket 80 40-50 extra for express entry for rides only. For some these are used. Just for 9-10 rides. Wait time is increased during early hrs just to create the rush. If it rains all the outdoor rides are closed then only 3 rides are available inside. Rest are show. There are only 4 rides which you must try here is Transformers Battlestar Galactica Human Battlestar Galactica Cyclone. Mummy Ride. No money is refunded if the ride is suspended. Sorry try out next time.

Must visit when you are in Singapore. The rides are super fun, highly recommend Transformers, Mummy, River Adventures and Roller Coasters. Express pass is a must. Do not waste your valuable vacation time without Express pass, waiting in the queues for hours together. Also purchase tickets online, you get some free vouchers to redeem inside.

The best ever. Amazing rides, pricey but tasty food and the experience itself is worth the money that is spent. Would recommend getting an extra set of dress as there are some water based rides as well. Also you can skip most of the queues if you go as a single rider.
Best experience ever. Checkout their showtimes, really realistic and great experience.
Lots of fun for all Please come early as there are huge lines but they move very quick. Highly recommended buying the express pass to by pass the wait lines

Save your money up, and get the Unlimited Express Pass! The pass is super expensive, but with it I covered the whole park, rode all the rides, watched all performances and did not miss any meet-and-greet! Some gifts are only sold at specific gift shops within the park, so you are encouraged to explore everything. Be smart about how you use the lockers, and you get to save a lot of money. But over the past 10 years, the rides generally havent changed much if at all. Definitely enjoyed my visit.
Its basically a money trap, no use of the ticket without express pass which will be sold out quickly due to limited slots
The place is very good. But try to call to check how to get Express Pass is very poor and Bad! Keep on directing! So no answer at all!
If you come with your kids, better you buy express ticket. Average queing 1 hour.
Buy an Express Pass
Went when under renovation 01/23 so everything was a little limited, definitely buy the express pass.
Good but need to buy the express pass

Come at the end of the year, because of the holiday season it gets a bit full ticket prices are quite high. Plus, using an express pass, there's still quite a queue. But not as long as the regular queue.
Overall it's pretty good. Tickets are 88 and VIP fast track is rm100 which seems a bit expensive. There were quite a lot of people when I went there on the third day of the new year. Thank you.
Small but okay to visit. Express pass recommended
Use KLook or Kkday to buy tickets cheaper in advance. The Universal Express Pass is very handy to make your money's worth.
A great experience. Adviced to buy express ticket in advance through USS site. Plan and move accordingly to various rides and shows. A great experience.

Perfect for a day trip with the family if you are visiting Singapore. The Transformers 3D show, the rollercoaster ride, the NYC hurricane simulation are some of the must activities. The VIP experience was worth it, the guide(Rashid) was very knowledgeable and friendly making it a memorable one. Best one to avoid the long queues (min 30 minutes wait time on Sunday) especially if you are spending a day at Universal Studios. Overall a must see.
singapore traveler are come from all parts of the world... recommend to get express ticket:)

Had a great time. There are many activities to do. Went during Christmas 2022 and got the chance to watch Santa's circus, it was delightful. Cylon ride is not for the faint of heart. I enjoyed the curse of the phero ride and the transformers ride. Definitely download the map with the QR code available at the entrace and check the waiting times. There were lot of meal options available at many places. During our visit the water world was closed. The jurasic world water ride was the best of all the jurasic world rides. Watched the 4D shrek movie at far far away. Definitely watch Lights Camera Action by Steven Spilberg. All in all a wonderful experience and worth the money spent.

The rides were awesome and kids of 105 cm can take almost all the rides and multiple times too! Express tickets are recommended to beat the queue especially during peak season. Pricing is very reasonable compared with other places like Kiztopia and Jewel.

Availed the tickets thru Klook. When we arrived by 1030H, we saw a ling queue and decided to buy the Express lane ticket on the spot. Tips: 1. advisable to buy the express ticket to avoid the long queues and dave time. 2. Bring extra shirts. 3. Outside Food and drinks allowed. (Not checked in the express lane) 4. Bring poncho or umbrella. Weather varies.

Great rides - latest technology - if you actually get to ride them, as only 23 of the park is operational at any given time. Cost cutting measures? At least annoying. Express pass does not give access to 3 very popular rides. Super friendly staff. Avoid restaurants inside - there are plenty great restaurants just outside the park.
express vs normal, not big difference
fun place. a bit expensive without annual pass.

This is topmost attraction of Singapore. Will keep it at No.1. Full day entertainment. Buy tickets from Klook. Online tickets are cheaper than physical tickets at studio. It is entirely cashless. After 3:00 pm queues are shorter. You can take most rides again as queue are shorter after 3:00 pm. I do not recommend Express tickets, as u can take most rides without it also in one day.
Quiet a few rides are closed. Do buy express pass. Will save lot of time.

One of the best experiences Ive ever had in my life was visiting Universal studios Singapore. We pre booked the tickets in advance to avoid any delays in the queue and we were glad we did. It saved us quite some time. As soon as we enter, the whole atmosphere changes. It is recommended to buy Universal express pass to avoid the hour long queues for each and every theme ride. There are 2 types of passes one is of 60 and another is of 90. The first pass allows a person take each ride only once but the later allows unlimited rides which I regret that I didnt take. Each and every ride is awesome and gives wonderful experience. Among those rides Transformers theme and Mummy theme rides will give you goosebumps. We have locker services provided before we get on few rides so we dont loose our stuff during the ride. Overall it was a wonderful experience to have.

Express ticket is highly recommended. I spent one whole day here and it was really fun and worth it. My recommendation for Jurassic world fans: Go to the roller coaster first, then come again in the evening before you leave. You dont need to use the express ticket first because the queue is not very long in the morning, you can save the express for later if you would like to ride again. The revenge of mummy looks so different day and night, it is more cinematic at night. Trust me.

I have always loved theme parks and USS is simply one of my favourites! My favourite ride is definitely the Mummy ride. Took family members there and they enjoyed it! Food wise, lots of food available! Favourite snack would be the churros! Good ol theme park churros. I recommend buying tickets earlier, and if youre going during the weekend or school holidays, pls consider buying the express pass!
Omg an amazing day and highly recommend the VIP experience so good

Amazing place to visit. Pro tip: take the express pass. It's worth the extra cost. You won't have to spend time in long queues. Get there early, carry sunscreen and an umbrella if you can. The burgers at Friars at Far Far Away ( Shrek) are fabulous. They also serve great soft serve ice cream on cone.
Didn't enjoy. Don't recommend. Not worth the price or the queueing despite an express pass.
Must buy the express pass to play all attractions or else u re stuck at least 15-30 minutes at each attraction. trust me it worth the money.
Just okish. Not very Big. Wait times are high. Need Express pass for rides. Not recommended.
Book your tickets ahead of time to skip the long queue.

It was a good experience. There were many photogenic sites and a few really good rides (roller coasters). A bit sad that not all themes were open at the time we visited. But had fun. Express pass is required on weekends. On weekdays, one can manage with normal pass.
Nice but should book express tickets

It is a small universal, so in one day you have plenty of time to see it in its entirety. We decided to buy the express pass to avoid the lines and it is really worth it. Still, when we went on a Sunday in February there weren't many people. The express serves all attractions except 4 or so. And we bought the tickets in advance. The park has different themed areas and what has surprised me the most is the quality of many of its attractions due to the effects they have. In addition, its duration is quite long compared to other amusement parks. I recommend it!

Great experience! I was not paying attention to the ticketing booth, but getting USS tickets in advance really helped us getting in easier. I didn't buy the express pass (because I thought it'd be not as crowded since I planned to visit USS on Monday), and I regretted it very much, because most of the attractions were so crowded with super long queue (the longest one was the one with the waiting time of 90 minutes). So, if you want to experience USS fully, I suggest you to buy the express pass. There are 2 kinds of express passes, but for me, Universal Express Day Pass is more than enough. Some attractions were closed when we visited USS. It's a shame, but fortunately we still could enjoy the other attractions.

Must buy the universal express to enjoy all ride. there are 2-3 ride per area. The most extreme one is the hanging roller coaster called cyclone. Most rides are adult oriented better not to bring underage toddler here.

First do buy express pass to save your time waiting in que...Amazing place to spend your day... It will be a great fun if you come with a group of energetic friends or family.. Indian stay tension free you have Indian food outlet opp. To return of mummy..

Such an amazing experience! Worth the ticket price. There are so many rides and experiences to engage in. All rides have some storyline and linked with the Universal Studios characters and films. Absolutely loved the Mummy ride. My absolute favourite. So unexpected and thrilling. Apart from this, the Terminator 4D experience was also out of the box! You can spend the whole day there and still leave energized.
I bought ticket in advanced via KLOOK. Its very easy to enter, just show QR CODE in KLOOK application. Every times I visit Singapore, I always come here and never get bored!!!
For the first timer....go very very very worth it... I play all game 2x... But missed the show...sad hahaha.. Worth every penny
I purchased VIP passes for entry. I looooooved the experience and would love to go to Universal Studios every year. Waiting for Nintendo world to come in Singapore

A very small park with few games for adults, but rather recommended for families with children under 12 years of age approximately... the express pass is a terrible experience. The only thing you get is to be in a separate row and 1 car from the normal row passes by, 1 express car. so it has nothing compared to other parks... for what you pay for the famous express it is not worth it at all... besides seeing that the spaces in the attractions are not used, one sees empty seats and in other parks they ask For example by a person who is alone to take advantage of that unoccupied space A very little park few attractions most of all for kids under 12 years the express pass was a sad disappointment cause of express has nothing compare other parks I've been in universal orlando and the express pass works as clock here the only thing you receive is to be in a different line but at the end to the attraction goes 1 wagon from normal line then 1 wagon of express pass so basically ends up being a joke... besides you see empty seats and instead to ask for a single ride the seat gets lost
Too many renovation cannot play minion and madagaskar and jurassic .. recommend to buy fast or express pass. Dont waste your time compare to the value of the money..

Less than my expectations. Overrated place very expensive. It costs 60 euros for ticket per person 50 euros per person for fast line. Low value with high price Do not buy fast line tickets , you can start backwards (the last world or even far far away) to avoid waiting, and the fast line ticket is useless after 03:00. another disadvantage it can be used only once for game. So if these games are suitable for your kids age and they want to play it again, you have to wait in line because the fast line can be used one time for each game.and this is not fair because there are many games not suitable for your kid age.

The wait for each attraction may be between 30 mins to 2 hours long. Taking a day pass may not be worth it. To avoid the queue it may be useful to buy the express tickets which allows you to go in a separate line. You then have priority over others. The express ticket costs 90 sing dollars over and above the entrance ticket which we paid 82 sing dollars. Lack of low intensity rides! The information about each attraction is lacking. Difficult to understand the intensity of the rides to make a choice.
It was 80 singapore dollars and that gets you the basic pass. For another 80 you get a faster pass. On the basic we waited nearly 1 and half hours for a ride at the start of the day.
Good overall experience but I would recommend getting express lane tickets

It's a fun weekend and the queue time is acceptable, averaging 30 minutes. If you don't want to queue for too long, you can add 40 Singapore dollars to buy a through ticket, which saves a lot of time.
I think travelers should have an express ticket. It's a bit difficult to wait in line in the hot weather, but it's still fun.

Universal Studio Singapore is a bit disappointing in comparison to the parks in the USA. We took the day pass unlimited express. Unfortunately, few attractions were closed (Pussinboots, Waterworld, kids climbing, madagascar ... and other zones in construction). You book online, and they don't tell you about the closure ... I was really looking forward to doing the Waterworld show ... the daily pass shall be pro-rated or refundable in case of fewer attractions. Luckily, the park is very small so you can move quickly in it. I think it is not worth taking the Unlimited Express. Just the regular one will be ok as the parc is only open 11am to 6pm ... you won't have time to do more than 1 time each ride even with express ... The park a s bit aging. Maybe it is a post covid lack of maintenance. Staff is smiling but not super enthusiastic for the majority. Overall, it is ok, but I think it is not worth 550SGD day passes express unlimited (2 adults 1 child) for the day ... I'm giving it a 3 star, but a 2.5 would be more adequate as the experience was very average.

It is recommended to prepare supplies in your bag because the contents are very expensive. But if you're really hungry, we recommend a burger restaurant. Full and delicious in one set (500) Buy the first glass of water for 5, refill for 3 per round. Please take the bag because even if you bring a small one, The rides that they didn't let me take away had to be taken to the locker anyway. Even the telephone, locker zone, human / cylon / mummy, free booth for 45 minutes, while in Jurasic, it costs 4/hour. Went on a Wednesday that coincided with Songkran in Thailand. I thought there weren't many people so I didn't buy express. I was wrong. There were a lot of people. India has a lot of Muslims. Waited for an hour per plane. The weather was very hot and there were a lot of crowded people queuing up. Most of them didn't wear masks but I did, and that's right. 3 days later I got Covid.

Our first time to universal studios and we loved it. Having the option of the express pass was well and truly worth it for my daughter. I am not a ride lover but there is so much to see and do it was amazing. Having it avaible on the go city pass was super handy. The day we went they couldn't scan my pass but guest services was helpful. We were there for opening and didn't have to wait long after the park opened.
Great experience. Most of the rides were awesome. Express pass was worth it

This place is amazing and must go. It has excellent rides like transformer, Cyclone, Mummy, human etc. I would recommend one must buy express line tickets if you are going on weekend. Shows are also good, it has something for everyone. 4D show, action camera was also good. It has some easy rides as well, one should must not miss it.
Great experience. So well managed and the rides were amazing. Kids loved the experience too. Worth visiting. Take the express pass if you want to save time in the queues .. it's worth it.
Great place to go with family, vip pass strongly recommended

If you want to come here, make sure to buy Express pass which costs 80 or 120 sgd, as the wait time for rides is around 90 minutes. Without express pass, you will spend your most of time waiting while with express pass, you pay at least 160 (ticket express pass). Had i known this, i would not come here! Not recommended!
Honestly not worth unless you buy an express pass. Waiting is too long . In few rides it's around 2 hrs. Ques take time. And it's frustrating. My kids only got to do 4 rides.

Do yourself a favour, choose a weekday (not school holidays) book a ticket/s and pick a hotel near a subway hub. Cost us massive to get a one way transfer to Sentosa............went home to our hotel via the free Sentosa train and the Harbour Front station line for about A4.00. Transfers are a total rip off!

Experience here, BTW, from Vivo City you can walk or take the train. Well, apparently you only have to pay once for this train from Vivo City to Universal Studios, but from Universal Studios you don't need to tap again, just get on, wow.
Must visit place..if you can afford then take express pass ..else wait for your turn for hours at every activity inside this studio.

Its better to purchase your ticket beforehand. It saves money and time. Also if your money is not too tight then I suggest you to pay extra for express pass. It was too hot to line up with a bit extra money you can actually save on time and your energy. It was a bit of disappointment that they did not have JP dinosaurs egg popcorn. The operation time is a bit too short. It will be much nicer if they open earlier to avoid the hot weather and we will have more time to eat and get our gifts for love ones
It's too good but too much crowded. Once must purchase express pass if affordable. Otherwise nobody can avail all the must have activities.
Not too big but also not too small. Get VIP Express access if possible- we waited more than two hours to get on the Jurassic Park water ride.
Great place Drawbacks -Pricey especially with express You have to pay 192 on the the contuer Which is so expensive. -Need to get update some games
The ticket of is very valuable cause it can go to many door to look the view.
One of the Best memories in my life Roller coasters were amazingly thrilling Totally worth !!! We had to buy Express passes because of long queues.

Awesome place to have fun, rides are great and the attention to detail is amazing. Recommend not to go during public holidays or weekends as it gets really crowded. Purchase the express pass if you cant make it any other time, it will save you a lot of hassles.

If you really wanna experience all the attractions definitely go for the premium VIP tickets it's totally worth it. Can be crowded during the holiday season. Attractions are well maintained. Plenty of restaurants and shops. Totally worth the money and sweat. Kids will definitely enjoy.
This is my second time that I have been here. It is really fun!! I recommend buying an express ticket to skip the long queue and get more fun!!

I visited early and was in the front row during the open run, so Puss in Boots came and made me shout left and right and gave the express ticket to the person who shouted the best on the winning side. Yes, of course, I took it and wrote it down. I think there will be plenty of time when I arrive at the Universal entrance around 10:30. And I went on Sunday
Not worth the hype, to much crowd, waste of time in long queues, express pass to costly and rate keeps on increasing as day passes. SUGGEST TO BUY EXPRESS PASS IN ADVANCE IF YOU CAN AFFORD.
rotten to death No need to buy express at all
Where is the option of 0 stars whole day I couldn't do a single ride I don't recommend wasting time here
No one can miss this place but be ready to pay extra to save time in long queues like buy express vip pass
For better experience of this place, buy express ticket in advance or else one may have to wait hours to play any rides

Giving 3 stars here, i did not find it so worth for the amount we pay. Head-sup for those who are visiting for first time, reach place in time and use their app (universal studio) for updated events which happens there time to time, so that you can cover all th activities. If you going with children, they going to enjoy it. Buy express ticket, if you are going on public holidays. As crowd will be very high. Approx 2hrs waiting time for each ride. Plan accordingly Hope it helps. Give a thumbs up

Going in peak season in June, so crowded , long queue for any ride . You will feel not good at all after waiting 2hr although some rides is really interesting . 2.5 hr for a ride then you will wanna to go home. These rides must to try: Mummy, Transformer, Capony but long queue so it's better to buy Express ticket in peak season unless you may feel sick on waiting . Another option is always available is 4D film.

When we arrived it was raining, so many rides were closed. We went to look at the Van Gogh exposition during that time. When we came out, many rides were still closed. After 3pm the rides were opening, so we rushed to them. Lucky we had the express pass, so we succeeded in doing many, without it, we would never have succeeded in doing most of them as without the express pass, the lines were sometimes far over 1 hour per ride. The rides itself were really exciting and fun. For many rides, you need to put your bags in lockers, at first I felt uncomfortable putting my phone and money etc in the lockers, but all went well. With the express pass, we also could get out belongings out in time, as after 40 minutes, the locker is payable. Overall we had a good time and my son loved it a lot.
Good rides But limited options. The lines too long on rush days. So take Priority access. Worth the extra buck. Nice. Colourful. Good time spend.
You have to get the express pass or the wait is almost unbearable. Surprisingly, food was good.

Awesome place. Surely expensive, but worth the money you spend for a ticket. You can ride any available ride as many times as you want. And there are two types of queues; a general audience, an express audience. The express tickets allow you to get to the rides faster and henceforth you have to pay an additional amount for each ride. Food is surprisingly not very expensive, and is really good. Definitely a must visit if ever in Singapore.

Awesome experience. I strongly suggest to buy universal express ticket to effectively use all rides without delay. Always go on a weekday preferably Monday or Tuesday for less crowd. Avoid the month of June as you will see huge crowd due to school holidays. Always put your belongings in Locker before going for any ride or else you will be forced to put your belongings in locker or non-rider before taking the ride.
Get best experience in your vacation

Went there recently and would definitely comeback. But if not sure whether to get standard pass or the express pass I highly recommend to get the express pass as the line for standard pass may be long and affect the rest of the time we had there. Would definitely comeback with express pass ticket
We really enjoyed our USS experience better to book your tix ahead of time. I booked thru kkday.

WASTE OF MONEY I bought the ticket and unlimited express pass. I think the unlimited express pass is such a waste because the way I see it, its literally just ANOTHER QUEUE, not prioritazation or anth. Im just able to play some venue but then technical issue was told.
Strongly recommend buying express pass to avoid up to 70 min wait times.
Not recommended if you don't buy the express pass. Insane waits and not that many rides. They don't have a studio tour or Harry Potter world here.

During the time I went there were a lot of people. Waiting in line for each queue is at least 40-70 minutes. Can't play the player completely If you come next time, you will buy the express pass from the beginning.
Waiting line was too long should get express one

Been here. Good to install apps if you guys dont buy express ticket. with apss, can know how long que time for each ride. this will help a lot. as malaysian, the food price is quite pricey. cant complaint much due to our currency rate is bad. we came here on weekday, the staff said if came on weekend got plenty of visitors.

Because the business hours are AM11:00-18:00, it is difficult to play any facilities without buying a quick pass in advance. There are unlimited quick clearances in the whole area. Remember to go to the service center on the left to change your wristband immediately after entering the park. It is much more convenient. (You have to buy it a few days in advance, you probably wont be able to buy it on the day) If you have been to Universal Studios in other countries, this one is indeed smaller.

We went on a Monday, yet it was super crowded. Strongly recommend you to buy the express pass. Get the express pass in advance through look as its cheaper. Buying there directly will cost 70 SGD and higher based on the crowd Rides was fun, it was a good

Smallest Universal we have been to. But also lots of fun for small kid to visit before go to bigger park in Japan or US. Weather is hot they install ceiling fan this time. Wait is usually 90 for popular play and 3040 for less. Half a day should cover most highlight machines without express. Better buy ticket online and show QR code. No wait time.

One of the things to go when coming to Singapore, however you should buy priority tickets when participating in the games, even though you have to pay extra, you don't have to wait. The good thing is that each game records the number of minutes you need to wait. And it's best to buy tickets in advance, if you don't want to have to queue for a long time. KLook is a good place to buy tickets.

Awesome experience. I would strongly suggest to buy Unversal express ticket to effectively use rides without much delay. Always put your belongings in lockers before the ride. The Mummy ride and Transformers ride was my favourite. I would highly recommend going to Unversal Studios Singapore:)
Had best day in Singapore.. Must Visit.. get express pass so no need to wait for rides ..
Amazing , can get really crowded so i would definitely recommend getting the express/vip tickets .
Had a chance to go for the Fourth of July exclusive party. Definitely a great experience. I recommend going on the Cyclone ride as fast as possible. That ride was worth the lines.

You have to go there from the beginning to enjoy in everything, i prefer the express tickets to save time and add more joyful Due to waiting time sometimes could 2 hours Which is make you tired and nervous Overall, everything was excellent
Cheating. You bought the tickets and spent from 1:30h to 2h waiting for each game, while those with Express tickets can enter without waiting

Go for universal express pass else plan it on weekday and cover the galactic roller coaster in a way that you don't kill time standing in que. Go for single rider options to skip the que wherever possible.
Be sure to purchase an express ticket. I regret it

Went on weekend and got the unlimited express pass from the counter. It was totally worth it as the longest time I waited in queue was max around 15 mins only. Tips: - if express pass not available online on your preferred date, you can purchase from guest services at USS - bring your own water bottle and hand fan to stay hydrated and cool (singapore is hot all the time) - free time-limited locker at mummy ride (no bag allowed) and cylon/human ride(no bag and loose items in pockets allowed). other rides, there will be a place to put your stuff or you can carry it with you.

Don't come during peak season. Queued up to 4 hours for Galatica. (And even those who bought express tickets also queued for around 1 hour to almost 2 hours) But if you've already bought it, it's better to play to the very end first, just give it a go.. Yesterday, luckily I was able to play something else... so I didn't lose much.
Decently good rides....but Do book express tickets especially on weekends as rush is quite a lot of people sonheneve waiting time too.

For better deals, purchase your tickets online well in advance. Consider getting an express pass, but be prepared for certain areas to be closed for maintenance or upgrades. Arriving early is recommended and avoid weekends & public holiday.

Enter only if you have an express pass. It does not make any sense if you just get the admission ticket and wait in hourly queues. Ticket prices are premium so even if taken from any sites like Klook etc would not make any difference. For Indians, ticket prices from Klook, with admission express, will be around 9,500 per person which as per Singapore standards is reasonable. Plan to buy tickets in advance. The queues at the spot are very long. Arrive 20 minutes before the starting time and skip long entry queues by showing your express pass at the entry counter. Try to complete either Jurassic ride or Mummy returns first. There will be no queue when the park opens. Later even the express queues get long and would be at least 30 mins of waiting. There are a few rides like Treasure Hunt (Ancient Egypt) and Jurassic Canopy rides that don't have express entrance but are in demand. If you are with a kid, you may want to spend some time during peak afternoon time at Far Far Away land and see some of the shows. Remember to carry Umbrellas and Sunglasses. By 4 30 pm, the queues we saw were less in Express and hence could visit Transformers ride almost with no queue in express. Overall, an okay experience. Nothing great if you have visited the LA Universal Studio. SG Universal Studio is a smaller, compact entertainment park. We didn't see any angry crew. In fact, all the staff were very friendly and helped in answering queries on directions. Tips 1. Do not visit without the Express Pass 2. Carry Sunglasses, umbrellas 3. Jurassic ride you will get wet. 4. Canopy rides in Jurassic, Puss n Boots, enhancement airways can be a bit scary for kids , but is okay for adults. 5. Mummy returns is a must scary ride 6. All rides are about 1 min max 7. Lights Action Camera, New York ride, Shrek 4D are okay for small kids too. 8. Staff are friendly. Ps: photo shows the rush for Mummy returns in the express lane. About 30 mins waiting at around 1 pm.
If you wish to explore the whole park, it is better to buy the express passes. You can wasily beat the queues on most of the rides and shows.
USS is located in Sentosa Island, SG. You can find lots of shops and dine area, you can also find lots of machines to purchase the pass with no long waiting line!

I've been here a couple of times, but this time, I tried their VIP Experience Package instead. The lady who serves us - Ms Huda - was the best guide I could ever ask for. She is very friendly and professional. I have been throwing her a lot of questions, and she is able to answer every one of it. The only feedback that I have is that USS could provide a much better VIP card for us customers. Something like a credit card type of card. Universal Studios Singapore offers a thrilling and entertaining experience with its wide array of amazing rides and attractions. From heart-pounding roller coasters to immersive 3D shows, there's something for everyone. However, on regular admission, be prepared for potentially long wait times, which might limit your ability to enjoy all the attractions. To maximize your visit, consider investing in an express ticket, which allows you to bypass the queues and make the most of your day. The park's attention to detail in creating themed zones is commendable, offering visitors an immersive experience. Additionally, the staff are generally friendly and helpful, enhancing the overall experience. Dining options are varied and cater to different tastes, though they can be a bit pricey. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for fans of theme parks and movie enthusiasts, but be sure to plan ahead to make the most of your visit.

Many people wonder if they can enjoy all the rides without an Express Pass, and the answer is yes. Ensure you visit on a weekday, like Thursday and be right on time before the opening time, and the trick is to avoid entering the rides near the entrance first. Start with those in the back or the ones with high demand, such as the Transformers ride. In the evening, the rides near the entrance are always empty, so that's the perfect time to go there. Use the Universal Studios app to check wait times and navigate accordingly, rather than following a set order. Mark down the meet and greet times and spots to arrive right on time. The roller coasters are worth it, and lockers are free for a duration of around 30-40 minutes. We checked roller coaster wait times, selected lockers, finished the ride, switched lockers, and went to the next ride, so we didn't pay for lockers at all. If you still lack time you can skip the enchanted airways and magic potion spin which looks less exciting after riding the main roller coaster rides. Yes, the food and drinks are expensive, but having a big breakfast outside and the motivation to try all the rides meant we barely felt hungry, so we didn't dine there at all. You can take water inside, so no need to buy their overpriced water and drinks. All the rides and shows were excellent, providing a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Buy the tickets online in a site like Klook which is cheaper.

I enjoyed the day overall, but man it was small. I got an express pass thinking I would like to avoid the queues. I managed to do literally everything twice, only walked 5 miles, and was out by 2.30p...

Amazing time with amazing tour guides! Beautiful park as well. My boyfriend and I purchased the VIP tour and it was sensational. Absolutely worth the price. We had a 1 on 1 experience with another group of tourists who were just as great. We were able to ride all the rides available with no queues and the rollercoasters as many times as we wanted. We also had great food from the free food vouchers! Thank you for your hospitality, USS!

This place is spectacular. Truly a place to get more lifelong memories. I recommend coming to this place. The entertainments vary from the highest adrenaline-seeking to your family-friendly comedy shows. Pictures! Pictures could be taken anywhere especially with the merchandises that you could buy there. Now, on to the critiques and advices. Of course, every place has its flaws and these reviews are here to help build it for the better First of all, the queues. The queues will take you 15-60 minutes for only about 5 minutes of entertainment. That's why I would HIGHLY recommend getting the express ticket. You could upgrade your regular ticket to an express in the ticket booth up front. It is pricy at first sight, but the amount of rides you could experience and the amount of time you save is worth it. But note that not all rides accept express in the way that you need to wait as of the others. I would recommend bringing a change of clothes as it would often get hot, you'd get wet while riding a ride. In my case, I forgot to bring an extra change, so I had to buy one _. Last but not least, bring your family, friends, wife or husband, relatives, and so on. They will make the trip even better. That is all. Enjoy uss

Unforgettable Experience at Universal Studios Singapore! My recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore left me thoroughly impressed and exhilarated. The sheer magnitude of entertainment, thrilling rides, and immersive attractions make it an absolute must-visit destination in Singapore. For those seeking the ultimate experience, I highly recommend investing in the Express Ticket. This proved to be a game-changer, allowing me to bypass long queues and make the most of my time enjoying the rides and shows. The convenience and time savings with the Express Ticket ensured a stress-free and memorable adventure. Beyond the attractions, Universal Studios Singapore boasts a diverse range of food options. From delightful snacks to hearty meals, there's something to satisfy every palate. The variety and quality of culinary offerings add an extra layer of enjoyment to the overall experience. The attention to detail in each themed zone is truly commendable, transporting visitors to different worlds with every step. The well-executed shows and interactive experiences make it a joy for visitors of all ages. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute gem, offering an unparalleled blend of excitement, entertainment, and gastronomic delights. If you're planning a trip to Singapore, make sure to include Universal Studios in your itinerary, and consider upgrading to the Express Ticket for a truly exceptional and hassle-free adventure!

If you're looking for a full day of adventure, this place is a must-visit! They offer two types of tickets: regular and express. The Human and Cyclone rides provide thrilling experiences, while Transformers is a popular attraction loved by many. Don't miss the water showsthey're a must-see! Overall, this place offers an exciting and enjoyable experience for adventure lovers of all ages.

Universal Studios Singapore in Sentosa is a world-class theme park that brings the excitement of Hollywood to life. Packed with thrilling rides, interactive shows, and themed zones featuring iconic movies and television series, it's a place where families and friends can create unforgettable memories. From battling dinosaurs in Jurassic Park to soaring through the skies on the Transformers ride, there's something for everyone. To maximize your experience and avoid long queues, especially during peak seasons, an Express Pass is highly recommended. It allows you to skip the regular lines for most attractions, ensuring you have more time to explore the park and soak in the beautiful atmosphere.
Amazing experience ..!! Would recommend to all visiting this when in Singapore especially the rides are fun Suggest taking express pass to cover maximum rides and have more fun

Universal Studios Singapore offers an exhilarating blend of thrilling rides, captivating shows, and immersive experiences. From the adrenaline-pumping roller coasters like Battlestar Galactica to family-friendly attractions like Madagascar: A Crate Adventure, there's something for everyone. The attention to detail in the themed zones, such as Hollywood, New York, and Ancient Egypt, is impressive. However, crowds can be overwhelming, especially during peak times. Overall, it's a must-visit destination for theme park enthusiasts looking for a fun-filled day of adventure. Purchasing VIP tickets at Universal Studios Singapore is definitely worth considering if you want to skip the queues and enjoy a more exclusive experience. With VIP access, you'll receive priority boarding on rides, reserved seating at shows, and personalized guided tours of the park. It's an excellent option for those who want to make the most out of their visit without spending too much time waiting in lines.
The rides are minimalist and there is almost no need to queue. It is not recommended to spend additional money to buy a quick pass, because it is almost useless!

For Thai people who will come, I recommend you to buy VIP tickets, otherwise you will queue for a very long time to enter the attractions!! Please buy tickets in advance. You won't have to line up to get a ticket.

I thought it was so compact that I might not need it for the whole day. You can check the waiting time on the official app, but it doesn't match the current situation. On Mummy's Ride, it says that you have to put your personal belongings in a coin locker (if you wait 15 minutes, 45 minutes are free), but since the waiting time was much longer than the displayed wait time, we ended up having to pay. What do you do when your wallet is in the coin locker? ? ? It was very crowded and I had to call a staff member to open the paid lockers, which surprised me at how inefficient it was. The guidebook said it was cashless only, but there were some places that didn't accept Amex, so I ended up paying in cash. At restaurants, there are too many people occupying tables and taking breaks without eating, resulting in unnecessary waiting time. It was the worst dining experience because the cast members were unmotivated and didn't pay attention or consideration. For families with children, it can be quite tiring not to have easy rides where you can ride without waiting.

Universal Studios resorts offer one of the best themed rides and experiences imho. And like its bigger sibling Orlando, the Singapore resort did not disappoint. The level of detail is great, and a wow factor to be found for most age groups. Express pass noticeably enhances experience, and the live show worth making time for.

Highly recommend visiting USS. Though, I would go one more step and recommend buying an express pass beforehand in order to use the express lanes once per ride. Can save a lot of time waiting. I used Klook to buy my entry ticket and express pass (need both). My favourite ride would have to be 3D transformers in Sci-Fi City. You can easily spend all day here, so come early.

My fourth time at Universal Studios and it's still one of the best experiences Singapore has to offer. Took my 15 year old and 11 year old. Some key points: To make the the most of your day, you gotta get Universal Express. Trust me, some queues get up to a 90-minute wait. It's steep but worth it. The Universal Express Pass works only once per ride. So best to plan your day before heading to Sentosa (where Universal Studios is). If you're there as soon as gates open at 10am, you could get the first two rides without any queues to worry about, so you save your Universal Express Pass to return to those rides and jump the queue when the wait times are over 40 minutes. I recommend getting in at 10am and going straight to Battlestar Galactica Human and Battlestar Galactica Cylon using regular queue. These rides are really good and you're gonna wanna do these again. By the time you're done with the first two rides, the queues would be getting longer so you can now use your Express Pass for the rest of the day (and be sure to return to those first two rides and enjoy the quick Universal Express access). The best rides for me are Battlestar Galactica: Cylon, Battlestar Galactica: Human, Transformers The Ride and the Mummy Ride. Jurassic Park is good too, but best to do that at the end of your day because you will get wet even with the silly little plastic coat thing they sell there. The Waterworld show is also quite good. There are heaps on eating options at Universal Studios. I didn't like the corn dogs but the hot dogs near Jurassic Park were fantastic. I highly recommend it. The Thai Basil hotdog is divine and the staff member there - Yusri, was great. Staff wise: it's a bit of a mixed bag. Some rude attendants are polite and fun. Others are robotic and often not in the best of moods. Getting there is quite easy. Beware of a bit of surge pricing when taking a taxi from Sentosa to return to your hotel. Enjoy.

We reached Sentosa island from Cable cars. It was a great ride and highly recommended than taking the bus. During weekend the waiting time was so long inside Universal Studios but worth every bit! Its always better to book express tickets in advance to avoid long hours in queues. Our favorites were the transformers ride and the Ancient Egypt.

Premium prices without the premium experience. If you are a foreigner much better to go to a theme park in any other country. Far better rides. Express ticket is more useful. For some reason express ticket was not valid on 2 rides... Unsurprisingly both with a long que

Always enjoyed the rides and also the whole atmosphere in USS! Did not realise some changes until I am here. 1. From 1 June 2024, No re-entry after you exit. Usually when we visit USS, it is also a staycation in RWS, and so we will usually exit during lunch time, maybe go back to the room to rest and escape from the afternoon sun and come back again after 3pm. No re-entry means lunch was inside USS. As it is the school holidays, the place is quite crowded and due to the rain, everyone was indoors. As a gauge, a burger and fries set is 17 and a corn dog is 7, and a scope of ice cream is 7. 2. Universal express pass is limited. If you do not wish to wait in queue for rides (as a gauge, Rapid dash was 50 mins queue, transformer ride was 60 mins and Puss-in-boots ride was 40 mins wait), the express pass is an option. It cost about 90 for a person, but from the beginning of the year, they no longer offer unlimited express pass. The express pass can only be used once at every attraction. For example if you are not intending to use the pass for the enchanted airways ride, it cannot be used for a 2nd express ride for transformer ride. With minion land still under construction, Dino soarin also not available, there were less rides available, we were hoping that we can do a few more rounds with other rides. The forum area at RWS is under renovation and many food options closed due to new development in RWS, perhaps it will be better to come again when all the development is done.
Great place, Guaranteed adventurous and fun filled experience one will have. Buy express tickets to avoid long queues and wait time

Always interesting and theyre expanding their operation by adding new attractions The highlight of our visit was the Water world experience. Amazing show with daredevil acrobatics. Very impressive! Also they have good offers and food vouchers. Definitely on the pricy end

One of the best places on Earth to go to, I was really surprised that 1 ticket meant that we could go on ALL the attractions! They also had many food options we could try and the staff were super friendly overall!! The souvenir store was a bit crowded though, but I did expect that. 10/10 Must go!! (They even gave out cool glasses )

Wonderful experience recommend to visit transformer ride after 3 o clock I made that mistake I went inside and take that ride first lost almost 2 hours there please install universal studios app also before you visit it will help you to show the map

We had a great afternoon at the USS. Just want to mention thanks to Martin from the pick up store, helping us exchange the shirts even tho it was closing time. He went the extra mile to help run back to the store to get the shirt. Everything was great

YMMV but if you are visiting Asia for Universial Studios, USJ in Osaka is a much better choice. Stuff are friendly and all of them can speak English fluently.
Go on a weekday to avoid long waiting queues, buy express pass to save on waiting time. Rides were great but this will be outdated with time. Overall good place.

For those who want to come from Malaysia with their own car, these are tips for you. Apply vep and autopass. Can do two weeks before you enter. Cost 10 sgd. After getting a confirmation email. Can be picked up at two locations provided. We spent the night around danga bay the day before we entered singapore and the uss. Topap auto pass is ready. Myica filling is ready. Individually or in groups. Topap autopass using the Nets application. 50sgd is enough. When it arrives at uss. He parked in the B1 East area. Find one close to the escalator to get to uss. It's easier. For those with small children. Bring a stroller. The parking rate at uss is max at 13.10 sgd only. Boiled water standby. Umbrellas and fans. Payment close in uss easily using paywave/debit card. Activate is ready from Malaysia. So much.

FYI Singapore Tourist Pass cannot be used for monorail. Instead, you can pay using contactless payment methods such as Mastercard or Visa which are accepted for rides on the monorail.

Open at 10am. Ticket buying online can queue directly, no need to change ticket. Show the bar code. You can download the app Universal studio Singapore for queuing the line and the show time table. If you have raincoat for the Jurassic park rapid adventure, you don't need to hire safe box for you bag. Otherwise it cost 4 for one hour.

I visited Universal Studios Singapore on a Tuesday, and while the wait times for attractions ranged from 5 to 20 minutes, Im really glad I purchased the express pass tickets. With the scorching heat in SG, I wouldnt have wanted to stand in line for even 5 minutes. Love the visit. Its my first time here and everything is a breeze. Highly recommend the Universal Express ticket. Will make your visit much more pleasant when you minimize the time to wait in line

When my boss unexpectedly asked me to upgrade all our companys standard passes to express passes, I quickly reached out to the sales team through the website. Siti responded promptly and managed to sort everything out within just an hour. RWS is fortunate to have such a capable and dedicated sales representative. Thank you, Siti Nuriffa! Youre amazing!

I visited Singapore specifically to visit Universal Studios. I spent a whole day there and tried everything there. Do not miss the Waterworld offer, it is very beautiful. had an amazing day at Universal Studios and were there from open to close. We did initially get some incorrect Information from two workers who had us line up in the general admission line before opening despite having the premium express passes. We did realise these ourselves and correct it after a while though. The park wasnt that busy to start with and we were beginning to think the express passes werent worth it but by the end of the day when our kids were hopping off one ride and getting back on within a minute or two it was definitely worth it. The transformers ride was a favourite of ours and my children loved the Water World show. I didnt eat there besides and ice-cream for the kids but food wasnt too expensive.

We had a really good time! Then do not even think about buying it here. 10 bucks for a tiny thing that is filled to 75% because the top is supposed to be able to be folded and closed... well thats a rip off too. When it comes to the rides and over all experience otherwise it was really good and what you expect from a Universal Studios park. Thanks!

Good place but too much time to get the chance , shows were good but don't get without vip pass else you will lose good time 3 Rides were best for adult Good place

Solid experience. Great for something to do in Singapore. Definitely buy express pass! You do not want to wait 1.5 hrs per ride. This should be investigated by Singaporean local government. They are praying on desperate tourists.

Who doesnt love universal studios helpful staff , everyone looked happy here Suggestions, including level of thrill , enjoy : 1. Level of Thrill out of 5 Sesame Street Spaghetti Chase : 1 Special effects show by Spielberg 2 Transformer : 5 Battlestar Galactica 5 Revenge of the mummy 5 (special themed ride for Singapore, locker available next to the ride) Jurassic Park ride : 4 & wet warning , dry machine available at the exit Dinosaur ride : 2 Water world show (performance): 2good show, front seats will get wet as part of the show Puss in boots : 4 Shrek 4D movie : 2 Donkey club (interactive, fun for kids) 1 (Reminder this is level of thrill, I love all activities) 2. Highly recommend to go with the express pass, thank me later for saving your time and no queueing under the Sun with the express pass, was able to go through majority activities 3. Must watch when you are in Singapore. Take the express pass which will save you lots of time and only since I took express pass, I was able to complete all the rides. Exceptional Service by Iskandar in the Dark Room at Universal Studios Singapore I had the absolute pleasure of being assisted by Iskandar during my visit to Universal Studios Singapore, and his service was nothing short of amazing. From the moment I walked into the Dark Room to retrieve my photos, Iskandar went above and beyond to ensure I had a wonderful experience. One of the photos I had taken earlier in the day didnt turn out as nice as I had hoped, and without hesitation, Iskandar kindly offered to help me retake it. He was incredibly patient and meticulous, putting in extra effort to ensure the new photo was perfect. His dedication to ensuring I wouldnt leave with a less-than-stellar memento was genuinely heartwarming. Its rare to encounter someone so committed to delivering top-notch service, and Iskandars attention to detail and willingness to go the extra mile truly made my day. Thanks to him, I left Universal Studios with a photo Im proud to keep as a memory of this special visit. Iskandar is an outstanding team member who embodies excellent customer service, and I hope his efforts are recognized. Thank you, Iskandar, for making my experience so memorable!

A World-Class Experience at Universal Studios Singapore Universal Studios Singapore is an exceptional destination that offers a truly unforgettable experience for visitors of all ages. From the moment you step inside, youre transported into a world of entertainment, with immersive rides, captivating shows, and detailed themed zones inspired by iconic movies and characters. One of the best ways to make the most of your visit is by investing in the Express Pass. This invaluable upgrade allows you to skip the long queues and enjoy VIP access to rides and attractions, saving you hours of waiting time. The pass is especially useful on weekends and during peak seasons when the park is bustling with crowds. It ensures you spend more time enjoying the attractions and less time in line, making your experience smoother and more enjoyable. Some highlights include the adrenaline-pumping Battlestar Galactica roller coasters, the breathtaking Transformers 3D ride, and the magical Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure. Each attraction is designed with meticulous attention to detail, ensuring a world-class experience. The park is also equipped with excellent dining options and souvenir shops, so you can refuel and take home memories of your adventure. For anyone visiting Singapore, Universal Studios is an absolute must-visit, and the Express Pass is highly recommended to make your day truly seamless and unforgettable.

I had an amazing time here while on a layover. I booked the express pass while getting the tickets online and it helped a lot. I was able to do all the rides and then some within 5 hours at a leisurely pace.

A beautiful and fun place with shows and games If you like to play, express tickets are best Be prepared with umbrellas and rain jackets, as the rain comes suddenly It has halal restaurants, a prayer hall, and restrooms everywhere It is best to download the application to see the map and the waiting time

One of the best experiences to live in your lifetime. Such an amazing theme park it is. So meticulously planned, well maintained and absolute fun place to be with your family. The tickets are expensive but absolutely worth it if you spent the whole day and got on to all the rides. My suggestion is buy yourself an express pass if you love rides and do not want to miss any one. I finished all the rides and did some, multiple times. It's an absolutely amazing place, a different world altogether. Do not miss the Transformers, Jurassic world boat ride, the two big rollercoasters, Human and Cylon, and many more. Go find it for yourself! An absolutely immersive experience.

Been to Universal Studios countless times I didn't expect to encounter such a speechless thing today Of course, I arranged for a fast lane because I wanted to go quickly. But the female staff member kept letting people pass through the ordinary passage. They just dont let people in the express lane get on the bus. There are less than ten people in the express lane But we waited at least half an hour People in the regular lane have been on the bus for ten rounds, but she just wont let people in the fast lane get on the bus. Many people were pissed off What is the significance of fast track?

A good day out- Avoid express pass scam. The park had a lot or themed areas and is in good shape for its age with enough food variety to choose from. The park puts a lot of focus on sesame Street, which i found very different, but in a good way. The park runs a wonderful scam called express pass. They really market the product well BUT out of the couple dozen rides at the park available to ride, the express pass provides redeamable express opportunity for approximately 6 or so rides and the price is disgustingly high. A little known fact is that universal singapore is the only universal franchise in the globe. The Singapore universal studios are owned by a private company called resorts world sentosa. This is reflected in the crazy bits and pieces you come across throughout your day - example:, no drink lids available for your drinks, no salt in the food outlets accessible to patrons, no paper copy express passes etc i could go on, however it just reflects and highlights the cost cutting going on, by the private company, at the expense of the customer experience. This in turn, has you worried about the maintenance that is occurring behind the scenes. To that end, as you go around the Jurassic park water ride you tend to see some broken dinosours that haven't been fixed or maybe haven't been noticed. In any case, this was another example of cost cutting at resorts world sentosa. Would I consider going with the family again......not anytime soon. With the exception of mi ions land, the rest of the park has been the same for almost 2 decades and is starting to feel it.
Do take express pass on your visit. Without that you wont be able to experience the real fun. With normal ticket you will exhaust yourself standing in long ques for hour.

I purchased two VIP tour tickets for Universal Studios with no real idea of what was to be involved. On arrival my girlfriend and I tried to enter the main entrance but were directed to a 'VIP' lounge which was a pleasant surprise. Unfortunately my delight abruptly dissolved when we walked into the 'VIP lounge' as it resembled a kindergarten with screaming kids and stressed-looking parents everywhere. We were greeted by staff who looked like they were forcing a smile upon their faces and given a cold drink. I then had a 'terms and conditions' document thrust in front of me to sign, as the staff member used her finger to highlight and verbally describe that it was not a private tour and that we would be with 12 other people with no mention of children. As I looked around the chaotic child-filled room I instantly realised that I'd been had. I calmly pointed out that I did not spend over GBP500 to spend the day with screaming children and that their literature had not indicated such information. I then spent the next 15 minutes speaking to three different members of staff whose seniority went up when the last one failed to appease me. I ended up speaking to a female manager of some sort who essentially accused me of discriminating against children. For a manager or supervisor overseeing a VIP team I was quite shocked to hear the word 'discriminate' in the context of our conversation. It is a very provocative word and to use in these circumstances showed extremely poor judgement and an attitude which suggested that I had somehow committed an offence for expecting a VIP tour to be with adults. Clearly there is an ongoing issue with what the Universal Studios literature and advertising suggests in order to raise your expectations of how the tour will be conducted because if there was not, why are the staff at pains to only point out that you will be with 12 other 'participants' on the VIP tour but not highlight anything else? I think if Universal Studios (US) uses clear advertising to suggest that US is for adults as well as children, which it does, I think it is perfectly reasonable to make it clear that when you take a VIP tour, you are very likely to spend the day with up to 10 children and parents. However according to the VIP Team supervisor, this would be discrimination! I think perhaps Universal Studios should give their staff more training on communication skills and using non-provocative language if in fact the individual knows the true meaning of the word in the first place. After this distasteful experience, our VIP Tour guide for the day was absolutely fabulous and really knew how to salvage the day for us. In conclusion, I would not recommend the VIP tour unless you are happy to spend the day with children. Otherwise we had a good day.

I celebrated my birthday at Universal Studios Singapore, and it turned out to be one of the most memorable experiences of my trip! From the moment I stepped in, the excitement was non-stop and the best part? I managed to enjoy all the major rides without needing an Express Pass. Heres what worked for me: Arrive Early: The park opens at 10:00 AM I reached by 9:30 AM and was among the first to enter. I went straight to the popular rides like Transformers, Revenge of the Mummy, and Jurassic Park Rapids and avoided long queues. Plan Your Route: Cover the thrill rides first before the crowds build up, then move to the family and indoor attractions post-lunch. No Express Pass Needed: With early entry and a bit of planning, I skipped all the long lines and saved money. Collect Your Birthday Gift: Dont forget to stop by the Visitor Centre near the entrance. Just show a valid ID and collect a special birthday badge and a gift voucher (mine included retail discounts and a free souvenir)! Stay Hydrated & Take Breaks: Singapore weather can be humid. Use the shaded areas and indoor shows (like WaterWorld or Shrek 4D) as fun breaks between rides. Use the Official App: It helps with live wait times, show schedules, and maps super handy for staying ahead. Whether it's your birthday or not, Universal Studios Singapore is a blast but with a bit of strategy, it becomes even more enjoyable and stress-free. Highly recommended!

There are three types of Express Passes: 1. Express Pass One-time access to each ride (excludes Minion Land) 2. Express Plus Pass One-time access to each ride including Minion Land 3. VIP Experience Unlimited access, VIP line, and a guided tour (approx. 4x the cost of a regular ticket) Express Passes can cost up to SGD 1,000 more than standard tickets on peak daysbut help skip hours of waiting in queues Highly recommended to buy an Express Pass on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays due to heavy crowds and long wait times Ticket prices are also higher on weekends and public holidaysplan accordingly Accessibility support available: Manual wheelchair: SGD 20 deposit, fully refundable Electric wheelchair: SGD 50 deposit, SGD 5 usage fee (SGD 45 refunded) Many are unaware of this servicevery helpful for elderly or those with mobility issues

as an avid fan of thriller ride, i definitely enjoy my time here at USS. The ticket price is even cheaper than Legoland :( I not managed to play everything here but we finished all of the rollercoaster in USS and that's what make the trips much better. we also watched the Shrek 4D and it was very entertaining. The downside is, i still think we need to purchase the express pass if you're kinda want to finish everything inside the park in one day as the queue of people duirng the time we went is extremely crazy and overwhelming.

Take note if you want to make the most of your visit to Universal Studios Singapore: Go on a weekday, not during weekends or school/public holidays. Its way less crowded and much more enjoyable. Arrive when the park opens. We went on a weekday during a non-peak season , early in the day, wait times were about 1530 minutes, but later in the afternoon, most rides were only 5 minutes. We got to enjoy everything and even did some rides more than once! Avoid peak periods if possible. During busy times, youll end up waiting in long lines under the heat and humidity. Ticket prices for adults start from SGD 62 (depending on the website and promotions). Check the official Resorts World Sentosa website for the most accurate price. Express Pass info: Universal Express: Starts from SGD 90 per person. Lets you skip the queue once per ride. Universal Express Plus: Starts from SGD 120 per person. Lets you skip the queue as many times as you want on each ride. (Both are only valid on the day of your visit) My advice: If youre going on a weekday and outside of peak season, you probably dont need the Express Pass, the lines are short enough, and youll save money!

My sister usually doesnt even watch ghost shows, but now she comes to the "Haunted Mansion Night" which has received many positive reviews. Its really a toilet light With five themed haunted houses and wild ghosts wandering on the road, the entire amusement park is shrouded in an eerie atmosphere. The various screams from time to time make the whole atmosphere even more exciting Fortunately, I have a friend to stand in the way of all this. If there is a ghost, I will just go to him. But I was still so scared that my voice became hoarse. I said it is fun to come to the haunted house if you are afraid of ghosts. If you are not afraid, it is a waste of money. The only drawback is that I keep queuing up and queuing up, its so tiring

The roller coaster here was much more powerful than Univa in Japan! Japanese roller coasters gradually rise and then fall all at once. roller coaster in singapore Accelerate quickly and reach the top It's like saying it's going down all at once. It was quite fun for roller coaster lovers. If you go when it's open, you can ride right away without lining up. Even though I lined up for the second week, my turn came again soon. I feel like there were more roller coasters here than in Japan. Most roller coasters at once It was an accelerating type.

Very suitable for people who like to test their adrenaline! There are lots of Roller Coaster rides there, both indoor and outdoor with various levels of height, speed and track length that are a shame to miss... Apart from that, there is also a 3D museum, an aquarium with various types of sea animals, places to eat, places to buy souvenirs, cafes, and several other games, as well as interesting photo spots for those of you who want selfies or wefies with friends and family. you guys.. Don't worry about your belongings while playing there, because there are several paid storage places in the form of self-service lockers provided, but they have a time limit, so when the time is up, the locker key will automatically open by itself, but you can still extend it by Pay again at the machine, or move to another locker closest to the game you want to try next! Don't forget to provide small money to pay at the locker machine! It's best if you want to visit and try all the rides there, you have to come from the moment they open and spend your time there all day until they close again, because to try just one ride, you still have to queue long according to the time and moment you are at. come there, unless you buy a USS express ticket, you still have to queue, but not as long as the regular queue... For food, it's a good idea to bring your own from outside!! Because there are many food places there that provide food that doesn't suit our taste buds and the prices are quite expensive!!! But again, it depends on individual tastes...Hehe And one more thing, if you are interested in trying all the rides there, it would be better if you bought tickets outside the area or at the travel agent where you come from, because of course, the price will be much cheaper...

Transformers - feel very realistic 3. Lights, Camera, Action show - we will feel there is real tsunami. 4. Jurassic Park - end is a twist 5. Galactica and cylon - these are very adventurous and recommend to the young people with no fear of heights. Overall, it is a good place to visit. Please don't leave Singapore without visiting Universal Studios! It's a huge place with rides that give you extreme adrenaline rushes. (Please don't go for them if you can't handle it .. the rides are safe but might not be enjoyable for everyone) Rides: 1. BattleStar Galactica (human,cylon): This is c.r.a.z.y. Youll get flipped in every possible direction and won't be able to figure out which is sky and which is ground. At some points you'll feel like you're gonna hurtle into the crowd below but be assured that the ride was pretty safe when we were on it. They'll just strap you on and you'll think that you'll get a couple of seconds to prepare yourself but no .. :D you'll start screaming three seconds into the ride and get out of your seats at the end with jelly legs. There are two variations, try the white roller coaster (cylon) if you want a scarier ride. 2. Transformers 3D ride: This concept is so cool. For anyone who is a Transformers fan, this is a treat. Not very scary, but it's like being in visual reality. I really recommend this one, and it's not scary at all. Really enjoyable, rather, in fact I wanted to go twice. 3. Jurassic Park rapids: Low key water ride. No adrenaline rushes, you can just chill and float the whole way in a tube car. 4. Revenge of the Mummy: It's in the Ancient Egypt theme park and not as crazy as the Battlestar Galactica but nevertheless good. There's a steep drop at the end which makes it enjoyable. Other attractions include a BumbleBee danceoff (which is really cute), the Water World show at Jurassic Park The Lost World (interactive - they will get the audience wet so front row viewers beware :D), a few other rides for kids at Far Far Away and Madagascar.

Southeast Asia's first Hollywood movie-themed theme park, Universal Studios Singapore, boasts an exciting selection of attractions, rides and entertainment for families and thrill seekers. A total of 18 of the 24 film-themed rides were designed specifically for the Singapore park. There are seven zones themed around favorite films, each uniquely designed. You will find the famous Hollywood Walk of Fame in the Hollywood zone. As you walk the streets of New York, the landscape around you will be a stunning city skyscraper, complete with a mock subway station entrance. Here, you can step onto a film set and experience the destructive power of a hurricane with special effects produced by Steven Spielberg. Rides that make the heart beat Sci-Fi City boasts the famous TRANSFORMERS ride: On the Ultimate 3D Battle ride, you can battle the forces of evil with heart-pounding 3D battles. Step into Ancient Egypt and face mummies and scarab beetles on an indoor roller coaster in total darknessall guaranteed to trigger your fears. And, in Madagascar, get ready to get wet on the boat rides. Fun water rides The performances at Universal Studios Singapore are no less impressive. Children will have fun with Shrek 4-D Adventure at Far Far Away, a cinematic experience that brings visitors to experience firsthand the excitement of the film. Set in the Lost World zone, The Waterworld staginginspired by the blockbuster filmis packed with death-defying action and thrilling explosions. Once you're tired of having fun, recharge your batteries between attractions and visit the restaurants across the park. If you're visiting on a Friday, Saturday or certain national holidays, you'll be able to join in the park's excitement after dark with Universal After Hours, a series of fun-filled nighttime activities that last until 10 p.m. Dance to the rhythm of the Rhythm Truck, enjoy an array of street snacks, and be amazed by the stars of the Hollywood Dreams Light Up Parade.

Universal Studios Singapore is comparatively smaller than most of the others located across the world but don't let it fool you! The park boasts a number of distinct zones from some of their most popular franchises and offer some really great experiences even just walking around. If you're an adrenaline junkie, you might be slightly disappointed by the number of rides catering more towards kids and families but these are still genuinely fun experiences. The highlight is definitely the twin looping coasters based on the Battlestar Galactica franchise with its high-speed launches and turns, this is one ride you'll definitely want to try at least once. Be prepared to queue for up to 2 hours during peak periods of the year unless you're willing to fork out the unlimited express pass (90) which will get you to the rides in as fast a third of the time.

First, as a Thai person who doesn't like to wait in long lines. I recommend purchasing an Express ticket, as it helps a lot. If you don't purchase an Express ticket, you may have to wait in line for 2-3 hours on some rides. If you're only going to be able to ride a few stations, boredom will replace the fun. And that day will be the day you are not impressed. The most impressive player Egypt looks like a museum at first glance. But once you enter, it becomes an extremely thrilling roller coaster. Adding to the fear of darkness It's a plaything that isn't child friendly at all. Please prepare yourself for the thrill and fear first. Transformers the ride is a simulator that projects 3D images as if we were actually in the vehicle. It is very fun and realistic. Human vs. Cylon, this one is the most brutal, a rollercoaster. Human rides on a train, while Cylon hangs his legs and plays with his hands completely numb. The greatest thrill has to be these two. The three types above are my favorites, but there are many others that I'm also impressed by. But if you don't want to lose your temper and waste all day waiting in line. Don't forget to buy Express tickets before entering. Have a fun trip.

These are the list of activities in Universal Studio Singapore (USS) we managed to cover: 1. Transformer The Ride: The Ultimate 3D Battle (Sci Fi) 2. Battlestar Galactica: Human (Sci Fi) 3. Accelerator (Sci Fi) 4. Revenge of the Mummy (Ancient Egypt) 5. Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure (The Lost World) 6. Shrek 4-D Adventure (Far Far Away) 7. Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase (Hollywood) 8. Lights, Camera, Action! (New York) Are we keen to come back to repeat the excitement? Yes. Definitely.
